Ne ènɔa agbe dzadzɛ la mànɔ vɔvɔ̃m be yeƒe nuwɔnawo ava gblẽ nu le ye ŋu o. Galatiatɔwo 6:7.
When you have praiseworthy conduct, you do not need to be fearful of impulsive acts coming back to haunt you.​ Galatians 6:7.
Bia ɖokuiwò be:
Ask yourself:
Ame ka ƒomevie menye?
What sort of person am I?
Ðe medina be ŋkɔ nyui nanɔ ŋunyea?
Do I care about the reputation of others?
Ðe madi be matsɔ nu si agblẽ nu le amewo ŋu la aɖe modzakaea?
Do I want to be entertained by something that hurts others?
Aleke amewo abum ne wonya be mewɔa nu sia?
How might sexting affect my reputation?
Ðe dzinyelawo agaka ɖe dzinye ne wonya be mewɔa nu sia?
How might sexting damage the trust my parents have in me?
NUDZƆDZƆ ŊUTƆŊUTƆ:
TRUE STORY
"Nyɔnuvi aɖe si nye xɔ̃nye kple ŋutsuvi aɖe wonɔ zɔzɔm gake eɣlae ɖem.
"I have a friend who kept her relationship with a boy a secret.
Eɖo eƒe foto si me wòle amama le ɖee eye eya hã ɖo etɔ ɖee.
Then she sent a nude photo of herself to him, and he sent one of himself to her.
Mede ŋkeke eve gɔ̃ hã o, xɔ̃nyea fofo va tsa le eƒe asitelefon dzi.
Not even 48 hours later, her dad decided to check her phone.
Ekpɔ nu siwo xɔ̃nye kple ŋutsuvia ɖo ɖe wo nɔewo, eye eƒe dzi gbã.
He discovered the texts, and he was devastated.
Esi fofoa biae la, eʋu nya sia nya me nɛ.
He confronted her, and she admitted to everything.
Menya be eve xɔ̃nyea be yewɔ nu ma, gake nua te ɖe edzilawo dzi ale gbegbe be ɖeko woƒe dzi fla!
I know she’s sorry for the way she acted, but her parents were truly in shock and were so upset!
Womenya ne yewoagate ŋu aka ɖe xɔ̃nyea dzi o. "
They’re not even sure if they can trust her anymore. "
Nyateƒenya: Amamaɖenuwo ɖoɖo ɖa to asitelefon dzi ɖia gbɔ ame si ɖoe ɖa kple ame si xɔe siaa.
Fact of life: Sexting degrades both the sender and the viewer.
Sɔhɛ aɖe si xɔlɔ̃a zi edzi wòle amama ɖe foto ɖo ɖee la gblɔ be: "Nuwɔna sia na menyɔa ŋu ɖokuinye eye mebua fɔ ɖokuinye vevie. "
"It makes me feel so disgusted and disappointed with myself, " says one teenager whose boyfriend pressured her into sexting him.
Esi wònye be nuwɔna ma mesɔ ɖe Biblia nu o, menye agbe dzadzɛ nɔnɔ eye wòate ŋu ana woadze dziɖuɖu ƒe se me hã ta la, anyo be nàwɔ ɖe Bibia ƒe aɖaŋuɖoɖo siwo gbɔna dzi:
In view of the moral, ethical, and possible legal consequences of sexting, you would do well to follow the Bible’s advice:
"Si le sɔhɛmenɔɣi ƒe nudzodzrowo nu. " 2 Timoteo 2:22.
"Flee from the desires incidental to youth. "​ 2 Timothy 2:22.
"Ðe nye ŋku ɖa le nu dzodzrowo kpɔkpɔ ŋu. " Psalmo 119:37.
"Make my eyes pass on from seeing what is worthless. "​ Psalm 119:37.
Nu kae nàwɔ?
What would you do?
Wɔ Biblia ƒe aɖaŋuɖoɖowo dzi le wò agbenɔnɔ me.
Apply the Bible’s advice in a real-life situation.
Xlẽ Janet ƒe nya siawo eye nàkpɔe ɖa be tiatia kae asɔ wu be yeawɔ hã.
Read Janet’s statement, and then choose which option you think is best.
"Medo go ŋutsuvi aɖe gbe ɖeka eye míexɔ mía nɔewo ƒe kaƒodzesi.
"One time I met a boy, and we exchanged numbers.
Mede kwasiɖa ɖeka o ebia be manɔ godi kple noléwu me aɖe foto aɖo ɖe ye. "​ ⁠Janet.
Within a week he was asking me to send him pictures of me in a bikini. "​ Janet.
Nu kae nèsusu be esɔ be Janet nawɔ?
What do you think Janet should have done?
Nu kae nàwɔ?
What would you do?
TIATIA 1 Àte ŋu asusui be: ‘Naneke megblẽ le eŋu o.
OPTION A You could reason: ‘There’s nothing wrong with that.
Ne míeyi tsileƒe le ƒuta la, manɔ godi kple noléwu me wòakpɔ godoo ɖe.’
After all, if we went to the beach, he would see me in a bathing suit anyway.’
TIATIA 2 Àte ŋu asusui be: ‘Nyemenya susu si le esi o.
OPTION B You could reason: ‘I’m not sure what he’s up to.
Maɖo foto aɖe si me nye ametia dze le vie ko ɖee makpɔ eƒe susu ɖa.’
Let me send a photo that’s less revealing and see what happens after that.’
TIATIA 3 Àte ŋu asusui be: ‘Gbɔdɔdɔ ko minyam ŋutsuvi sia le.
OPTION C You could reason: ‘This boy is out for only one thing.
Matutu eƒe nyawo ɖa.’
I’m going to delete his message.’
Ðe màlɔ̃ ɖe edzi be tiatia 3 liae nye nyuitɔ oa?
Option C seems best, doesn’t it?
Gawu la, Biblia gblɔ be: "Nunyala kpɔa dzɔgbevɔ̃e, eye wòɣlaa eɖokui; ke ame bebewu dea ta eme, eye akpɔ etɔnua. " Lododowo 22:3.
After all, the Bible says: "Sensible people will see trouble coming and avoid it, but an unthinking person will walk right into it and regret it later. "​ Proverbs 22:3, Good News Translation.
Dodokpɔ sia ɖe nane si kplɔa ame dea nuwɔna sia kple nu tovo bubuwo wɔwɔ me la ɖe go: Ðe nèɖɔa ŋu ɖo le ame siwo nàdze xɔ̃e gomea?
This exercise points to an issue that is often at the root of sexting as well as other forms of misconduct: Are you selective in your choice of friends?
(Lododowo 13:20)
(Proverbs 13:20)
Nyɔnuvi aɖe si woyɔna be Sarah gblɔ be: "De ha kple ame siwo nènya be womedina be yewoakpɔ gbegblẽnuwɔnawo kple ŋku o. "
"Associate with people you know will not tolerate inappropriate behavior, " says a young woman named Sarah.
Ðetugbui si ŋkɔe nye Delia da asi ɖe eƒe nya dzi.
A young woman named Delia would agree.
Egblɔ be: "Ame siwo gblɔna be xɔ̃wòwoe yewonye dometɔ aɖewo dina be yewoana nàdzudzɔ agbe dzadzɛ nɔnɔ ke menye be yewoade eƒe dzi ƒo na wò o.
"Some so-called friends are trying, not to help you keep your morals, but to break them, " she says.
Ne woƒe nuwɔnawo mewɔ ɖeka kple Mawu ƒe sewo o la, ekema ɖe wole dzi dem ƒo na wò be nawɔ nu gbegblẽ.
"If their conduct is contrary to God’s laws, they are encouraging you to break your moral integrity.
Nu sia tututue nèdi be yeawɔa? "
Do you really want that? "
ÐƆ ŊU ÐO LE WÒ FOTOWO ÐOÐO ÐE AMEWO ME
BE CYBER-SAVVY!
Mègaɖo wò foto alo axɔ foto aɖe si màdi be ye dzilaawo nakpɔ gbeɖe o.
Never take or send a photo of yourself that you wouldn’t want your parents to see.
Nyae be foto ɖe sia ɖe si yeaɖo ɖe ame aɖe la, ame bubuwo hã akpɔe godoo, èlɔ̃ alo mèlɔ̃ o.
Assume that any picture you send will be seen by others, with or without your permission.
Hafi natutu gbegblẽfoto aɖe si woɖo ɖe wò la, gblɔe na ame tsitsi aɖe​ ɖewohĩ dziwòlawo, nufiala alo sukuɖaŋuɖola.
Before deleting any explicit photo you receive, report it to an adult​ perhaps a parent, a teacher, or a school counselor.
Nu Kae Wòle Be Manya Tso Gbɔdɔnuwɔwɔ Ðe Ame Ŋuti Ŋu?​ Akpa 1: Nu Siwo Ŋu Nànɔ Ŋudzɔ Ðo
What Should I Know About Sexual Assault?​ Part 1: Precautions
Nu kae nye gbɔdɔnuwɔwɔ ɖe ame ŋu?
What is sexual assault?
Nu si wòle be nànya
What you should know
Nu siwo nàte ŋu awɔ
What you can do
Nu kae nye gbɔdɔnuwɔwɔ ɖe ame ŋu?
What is sexual assault?

Togbɔ be nu si setɔwo yɔna be "gbɔdɔnuwɔwɔ ɖe ame ŋu " toa vovo tso dukɔ me yi dukɔ me hã la, nya la ate ŋu afia be woto mɔ aɖe dzi de asi amea ŋu evɔ amea melɔ̃ hafi o, eye ɣeaɖewoɣi hã elɔa ameléle sesẽe adɔ egbɔ alo avudodo nɛ ɖe eme.
Though legal definitions differ from one place to another, the general term "sexual assault " can refer to unwanted sexual contact, sometimes involving physical force.

Etea ŋu nyea gbɔdɔnuwo wɔwɔ ɖe ɖeviwo alo sɔhɛwo ŋu, ƒometɔ kpamkpam gbɔ dɔdɔ, ameléle sesẽe agblẽe, kple "kpekpeɖeŋunalawo " abe ɖɔktawo, nufialawo kple subɔsubɔhakplɔlawo ƒe ayemɔ dzi toto adɔ ame gbɔ hã ene.
It can involve such things as child or teen sexual abuse, incest, rape, and sexual exploitation by a "helping professional "​ perhaps a doctor, a teacher, or a member of the clergy.
Wodoa ŋɔdzi na ame siwo ŋuti wowɔ nu sia ɖo la dometɔ aɖewo (eɖanye gbegblẽnyae wogblɔ ɖe wo ŋu alo ɖe wodɔ wo gbɔ sesẽe o) be yewoawɔ nu vevi wo ne woke atse gblɔe na ame aɖe.
Some victims, whether assaulted verbally or physically, are threatened with harm if they report what happened.
Numekuku aɖe ɖee fia be ƒe sia ƒe la, ame akpe alafa eve blaatɔ̃ kloe gblɔna be wowɔ gbɔdɔnuwo ɖe yewo ŋu le United States (États-Unis) ɖeɖe dzaa.
According to one survey, each year in the United States alone, almost a quarter of a million people report being sexually assaulted.
Eye ame siawo ƒe afã kloe nye ame siwo xɔ tso ƒe 12 va ɖo 18.
Nearly half of them are between the ages of 12 and 18.
Nu si wòle be nànya
What you should know
Biblia meda asi ɖe gbɔdɔnuwo wɔwɔ ɖe ame ŋu dzi o.
The Bible condemns sexual assault.
Biblia ƒo nu tso ŋutsuwo ƒe ha aɖe si gbɔdɔdɔ xɔ susu me na ale gbegbe la ŋu. Ŋutsu mawo nɔ du si woyɔna be Sodom la me anɔ ƒe 4,000 aɖewoe nye esi va yi.
The Bible tells of a sex-crazed mob that sought to rape two males visiting the city of Sodom approximately 4,000 years ago​ an incident that highlighted why Jehovah destroyed that city.
(Genesis 19:4-​13)

Gakpe ɖe eŋu la, wode se na Israel-viwo le Se si Mawu tsɔ na Mose anɔ ƒe 3,500 aɖewoe nye esia la me be woatsri ƒometɔ kpamkpam gbɔ dɔdɔ, esia lɔ gbɔdɔnuwo wɔwɔ ɖe ame ƒe ƒometɔwo ŋu hã ɖe eme.​ 3 Mose 18:6.
Additionally, the Law given to Moses some 3,500 years ago prohibited incest, including the sexual assault of a family member.​ Leviticus 18:6.
Ame nyanyɛwoe wɔ gbɔdɔnuwo ɖe ame akpa gãtɔ ŋu.
Most assaults are carried out by an acquaintance.
Menye ame manyamanya aɖewoe va dze wo dzi le vo me o. "​ Talking Sex With Your Kids.
"In two out of three rapes, the victim knows her attacker, " says the book Talking Sex With Your Kids.
Wowɔa gbɔdɔnuwo ɖe ŋutsuwo kple nyɔnuwo siaa ŋu.
"He isn’t some stranger who jumped out from behind a dumpster. "
Le United States la, ame siwo ŋu wowɔ gbɔdɔnuwo ɖo la dometɔ 10 le alafa me nye ŋutsuwo.
Sexual assault happens to both genders. In the United States, about 10 percent of victims are males.
Agbalẽ aɖe gblɔ be ŋutsu siwo ŋu wowɔ nu siawo ɖo la "vɔ̃na be nu si wowɔ ɖe yewo ŋu ana be yewoazu ŋutsugbɔdɔlawo alo ‘yewomeganye ŋutsu tututu o.’ "​ Rape, Abuse & Incest National Network (RAINN).
According to the Rape, Abuse & Incest National Network (RAINN), male victims "may experience a fear that the assault will make them gay " or that "they are ‘less of a man.’ "
Ale si gbɔdɔnuwo wɔwɔ ɖe ame ŋu va bɔ egbea la mewɔ nuku kura o.
The prevalence of sexual assault is hardly surprising.
Biblia gblɔe ɖi be le "ŋkeke mamlɛawo me la, " ame geɖewo anye "ame siwo melɔ̃a ame ƒe nya o, " "ame wɔadãwo " kple "ame siwo meɖua wo ɖokuiwo dzi o. " (2 Timoteo 3:1-3)
The Bible foretold that in "the last days " many people would have "no natural affection " and would be "fierce " and "without self-control. " (2 Timothy 3:​1-3)
Nɔnɔme siawo dzena kɔtɛe le ame siwo wɔa gbɔdɔnuwo ɖe amewo ŋu la ŋu.
Those traits are clearly manifest in people who try to take advantage of others sexually.
Menye ame siwo ŋu wowɔ gbɔdɔnuawo ɖo la ƒe agɔdzedzee o.
Sexual assault is not the victim’s fault.
Mesɔ be woawɔ gbɔdɔnuwo ɖe ame aɖeke ŋuti o.
No one deserves to be taken advantage of sexually.
Nuwɔna ƒe fɔbubua katã le nua wɔlawo ɖeɖe dzi.
The offender alone is responsible for his or her actions.
Ke hã àte ŋu aɖe afɔ aɖewo atsɔ akpɔ ɖokuiwò ta va se ɖe afi aɖe ya teti.
Nevertheless, you can take measures to reduce the likelihood of sexual assault.
Nu siwo nàte ŋu awɔ
What you can do
Dzra ɖo.
Be prepared.
Dzra ɖo do ŋgɔ ɖe nu si nàwɔ ne ame aɖe di be yeawɔ gbɔdɔnu ɖe ŋuwò, eɖanye wò ŋugbetɔ alo dɔwɔhati ye gɔ̃ hã o la ŋu.
Know in advance what you will do if someone​ even a dating partner or relative​ tries to pressure you into sexual contact.

Ðetugbui aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Erin ɖo aɖaŋu be ne èdi be yeadzra ɖo ɖe ale si nàwɔ anɔ te ɖe gbɔdɔnuwɔwɔ ɖe ame ŋu ƒomevi aɖe nu ŋu la, wò ŋutɔ wɔ ale si nɔnɔmea ate ŋu do mo ɖa la le ɖokuiwò si eye nàdzra ɖo ɖe ale si nàwɔ nui hã ŋu.
A young woman named Erin recommends that to prepare for any type of peer-pressure situation, you could play out potential scenarios and prepare how you would react.
Egblɔ be: "Adze bometsinya na ame aɖewo ya, gake ne ète ŋu wɔ esia la, asesẽ ŋutɔ be nu siawo nadzɔ ɖe dziwò. "
"It may seem hokey, " she says, "but in a real-life situation, you’ll be less likely to become a victim. "
Biblia gblɔ be: "Mikpɔ nyuie be ale si miezɔna la naganye abe numanyalawo ene o, ke boŋ abe nunyalawo ene, . . . elabena ŋkekeawo nye vɔ̃. "​ Efesotɔwo 5:15, 16.
The Bible says: "Keep strict watch that how you walk is not as unwise but as wise persons, . . . because the days are wicked. "​ Ephesians 5:​15, 16.
Bia ɖokuiwò be: ‘Nu kae mawɔ ne ame aɖe lé teƒe aɖe nam eye wòɖe fu nam?’
Ask yourself: ‘What would I do if someone touched me in a way that made me feel uneasy?’
Dzra ɖo ɖe ale si nàsi le nɔnɔmea nu la ŋu.
Have an exit plan.
Agbalẽ si nye RAINN la gaɖo aɖaŋu be "nàɖo nya nyanyɛ aɖe ɖi si anɔ nyanya na xɔwòwo kple wò ƒometɔwo ale be ne èɖo xaxa me eye nègblɔe ko la woanya evɔ ame si le gbɔwò ya mase naneke gɔme o.

RAINN recommends that you "have a code word with your friends or family so that if you don’t feel comfortable you can call them and communicate your discomfort without the person you are with knowing.
Esia ate ŋu ana be xɔ̃wòwo alo wò ƒometɔwo nava kplɔ wò dzoe. "
Your friends or family can then come to get you or make up an excuse for you to leave. "
Gake àte ŋu aƒo asa na dzigbagbã geɖe ne èƒo asa na teƒe siwo nàte ŋu aɖo nɔnɔme sia me le.
You can spare yourself much grief by avoiding risky situations in the first place.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Aɖaŋudzela kpɔa afɔku gbɔna eye wòɣlaa eɖokui, ke ame makpɔnuteƒe yina ɖadea ta eme, eye wòkpɔa emetsonua. "​ Lododowo 22:3.
The Bible says: "The shrewd one sees the danger and conceals himself, but the inexperienced keep right on going and suffer the consequences. "​ Proverbs 22:3.
Bia ɖokuiwò be: ‘Ðoɖo kae mewɔ ale be ne meɖo nɔnɔme sia me la, mate ŋu asi le enu?’
Ask yourself: ‘What exit plan do I have in place?’
Nyɔnuvi aɖe yɔ ame be woava kɔ ye yi aƒe me
A teenage girl calls someone for a ride home
Ale si nàwɔ asi le nɔnɔmea nu ƒe ɖoɖo aɖe nenɔ asiwò ɣesiaɣi
Always have an exit plan
Ðo seɖoƒewo eye nàlé wo me ɖe asi.
Set boundaries​ and stick to them.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, ne wò kple ame aɖe miele ɖoɖo wɔm ɖe srɔ̃ɖeɖe ŋu la, wò kple wò ŋugbetɔa miɖo dze tso nu siwo miate ŋu awɔ ɖe mia nɔewo ŋu kple esiwo masɔ be miawɔ o la ŋu.
For example, if you’re dating, you and your friend should discuss what type of conduct is and is not appropriate.
Ne amea ya be ema mehiã kura o la, ke ehiã be nàdi ame bubu, ame si ade bubu wò dzidzenu siwo nu nènɔa agbe ɖo la ŋu.
If the person you are dating thinks setting boundaries is silly, you need a different dating partner​ one who respects your values.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Lɔlɔ̃ . . . mewɔa nu si medze o, media eya ŋutɔ tɔ o. "​ 1 Korintotɔwo 13:4, 5.
The Bible says: "Love . . . does not behave indecently, does not look for its own interests. "​ 1 Corinthians 13:​4, 5.
Bia ɖokuiwò be: ‘Dzidzenu kawo nue menɔa agbe ɖo?
Ask yourself: ‘What are my values?
Nuwɔna kawoe mabu be womesɔ o?’
What type of conduct crosses the line of decency?’
Nu Kae Wòle Be Manya Tso Gbɔdɔnuwɔwɔ Ðe Ame Ŋuti Ŋu?​ Akpa 2: Ale Si Nàwɔ Ahaya
What Should I Know About Sexual Assault?​ Part 2: Recovery
Tenɔnɔ ɖe fɔbubu ame ɖokui nu
Dealing with guilt
Viɖe si le dzeɖoɖo tso eŋu na ame aɖe me
The value of confiding in someone
"Gbedaɣi "
"A time to heal "
Tenɔnɔ ɖe fɔbubu ame ɖokui nu
Dealing with guilt
Ŋu kpea ame siwo ŋu wowɔ gbɔdɔnuwo ɖo la dometɔ geɖe vevie.
Many victims of sexual abuse are deeply ashamed about what happened.
Wobua fɔ wo ɖokuiwo gɔ̃ hã.
They may even feel responsible for it.
Bu Karen, si xɔ ƒe 19 fifia eye wowɔ gbɔdɔnuwo ɖe eŋu esime wòxɔ ƒe 6 va se ɖe ƒe 13 la ŋu kpɔ.
Consider Karen, now 19, who was sexually abused between the ages of 6 and 13.
Egblɔ be: "Nu si ɖe fu nam wue nye fɔbubu ɖokuinye.
"The worst thing I deal with is the guilt, " she says.
Mebiaa ɖokuinye be, ‘Aleke meɖe asi le ɖokuinye ŋu nu sia yi edzi alea gbegbe?’ "
"I think to myself, ‘How could I have let the abuse go on for so long?’ "
Ne èsena le ɖokuiwò me alea la, bu nya siwo gbɔna ŋu:
If you feel that way about your situation, consider the following:
Ðevi ƒe ametia kple eƒe seselelãme mesu te hena gomekpɔkpɔ le gbɔdɔdɔ me o.
Children are neither physically nor emotionally prepared to have sex.
Ðeviwo menyaa naneke tso nuwɔna mawo ŋu o, eya ta womate ŋu agblɔe wòasɔ be woawo ŋutɔwoe lɔ̃ ɖe edzi hafi wodɔ wo gbɔ o.
They do not know what such activity implies and are thus incapable of consenting to it in any meaningful way.
Esia fia be menye ɖeviwo ƒe vodadae wònye ne wowɔ gbɔdɔnuwo ɖe wo ŋu o.
This means that child abuse is not the child’s fault.
Ðeviwo xɔa ame tsitsiwo dzi sena, eye womenɔa ŋudzɔ ɖe ame gbegblẽwo ƒe aɖaŋu vɔ̃wo ŋu o, eye esia tea ŋu nana be ɖeviwo blena tsia wo si me.
Children tend to trust adults and to be naive about the tactics of corrupt people, which can make a child vulnerable.
Agbalẽ aɖe gblɔ be: "Ðevigbɔdɔlawo nye aɖeŋanɛtɔwo, eye ɖeviwo mate ŋu akpe woƒe numevivinyawo dzi o. "​ The Right to Innocence.
"Molesters are very good ‘con men,’ and a child is no match for their clever manipulation, " says the book The Right to Innocence.
Gbɔdɔdɔ ate ŋu anyɔ ɖe ɖevi me ne wowɔ gbɔdɔnuwo ɖe eŋu.
A child may experience sexual arousal while being abused.
Ne esia dzɔ ɖe dziwò la, ka ɖe edzi be nenemae wowɔ míaƒe ametia be wòawɔ dɔ ne wolé teƒeteƒewo na mí.
If that happened to you, be assured that this is the body’s automatic physical response to being touched in a certain way.
Esia mefia be esi nènɔ ɖevime la ŋutete nɔ asiwò be nàlɔ̃ ɖe edzi be woadɔ ye gbɔ o, mesɔ hã be woabu fɔ wò be wò ŋutɔe lɔ̃ wodɔ gbɔwò o.
It does not mean that you were capable of consenting to the abuse or that you bear any blame for it.
Aɖaŋuɖoɖo: Bu ɖevi aɖe si xɔ ƒe si nèxɔ ɣemaɣi hafi wowɔ gbɔdɔnuwo ɖe ŋuwò la ŋu.
Suggestion: Think of a child you know who is now at the age you were when you were abused.
Bia ɖokuiwò be, ‘Ðe wòasɔ be woabu fɔ ɖevi ma ne wowɔ gbɔdɔnuwo ɖe eŋua?’
Ask yourself, ‘Would it be fair to hold that child responsible if he or she were abused?’
Karen bu nuwo ŋu alea esi wònɔ ɖevi etɔ̃ aɖewo dzi kpɔm, wo dometɔ ɖeka axɔ abe ƒe ade ene​ ƒe mae Karen xɔ esime wote gbɔdɔnuwo wɔwɔ ɖe eŋu.
Karen reasoned on that last point when she babysat three children, one of whom was almost six years old​ the age Karen was when her abuse started.
Karen gblɔ be, "Mekpɔ ale si gbegbe ɖeviwo tsi asii, ale si wɔna aɖeke menɔ ŋunye ɣemaɣi o la dze sii. "
Karen says, "I realized just how vulnerable a child that age really is​ how vulnerable I was at that age. "
Nyateƒenya: Ame siwo wɔ gbɔdɔnua ɖe ŋuwòe wòle be woabu fɔe.
Fact: The perpetrator bears responsibility for your abuse.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Woabu ame vɔ̃ɖi ƒe vɔ̃ɖinyenye na eya ŋutɔ ɖeɖe ko. "​ Ezekiel 18:20.
The Bible says: "The wickedness of the wicked one will be accounted to [that person] alone. "​ Ezekiel 18:20.
Viɖe si le dzeɖoɖo tso eŋu na ame aɖe me
The value of confiding in someone
Dzeɖoɖo tso nu siwo wowɔ ɖe ŋuwò la ŋu na ame tsitsi aɖe si dzi nèka ɖo la ate ŋu ana nàkpɔ gbɔdzɔe.
Talking to a trusted adult about the abuse can help you get relief.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Xɔlɔ̃ vavã lɔ̃a ame ɣeawokatãɣi, eye ame nɔvi wònye wodzi ɖe xaxagbe ŋu. "​ Lododowo 17:17.
The Bible says: "A true friend shows love at all times, and is a brother who is born for times of distress. "​ Proverbs 17:17.
Anɔ eme be àsusui be ne yemegblɔe na ame aɖeke o la ade ye dzi wu.
Understandably, you might feel a measure of safety in not talking about what happened.
Ðeko wòva le abe numakɔmakɔ le nyaa dzi va zu gli aɖe si kpɔa tawò tso dzigbagbã bubuwo si me ene.
Perhaps silence has become like a wall that you have built to protect yourself from further hurt.
Gake nyae be gli ma si le tawò kpɔm la kee le mɔ xem na kpekpeɖeŋu si ame bubuwo ate ŋu ana wò.
Consider, though, that the wall of silence that protects you from getting hurt might also prevent you from getting help.
Gli aɖe tso nyɔnuvi aɖe kple ame siwo ate ŋu akpe ɖe eŋu la dome
A wall blocking a teenage girl from the people who can help her
Gli ma si le tawò kpɔm la kee le mɔ xem na kpekpeɖeŋu si ame bubuwo ate ŋu ana wò
The wall of silence that protects you from getting hurt might also prevent you from getting help
Ðetugbui aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Janet va kpɔe be yeƒe dzi dze eme ŋutɔ esi yeɖo dze tso gbɔdɔnu siwo wowɔ ɖe ye ŋu la ŋu na ame aɖe.
A young woman named Janet found that talking about her abuse was a great relief for her.
Egblɔ be: "Nye ame nyanyɛ si dzi meka ɖoe dɔ gbɔnye le nye ɖevime, eye nyemekɔ nu le edzi na ame aɖeke o ƒe geɖe.
"I was molested at a very young age by someone I knew and trusted, and I held it in for years, " she says.
Gake esi menya ƒo nu tso eŋu na danye ko la, ɖeko wòwɔ abe ɖe wokɔ agba kpekpe aɖe le ta nam ene. "
"But once I was able to talk to my mom about it, it was as if a huge weight had been taken off my shoulders. "
Esi Janet bu nu si dzɔ ɖe edzi va yi ŋu la, ese nu si tae wòsesẽna na amewo be woaƒo nu tso gbɔdɔnu siwo wowɔ ɖe wo ŋuti ŋu la gɔme.
Looking back, Janet can understand why some might be reluctant to speak up.
Egblɔ be: "Enye ŋukpe gã aɖe be ame nagblɔ gbɔdɔnu siwo wowɔ ɖe eŋu la na ame bubu.
"Abuse is such an uncomfortable topic, " she says.
Gake le gonyeme la, veve si gbegbe mesena esi nyemekɔ nu le nyaa dzi o la wu tsɔtsɔ nam.
"But in my case, the hurt that came from living with it was not good.
Ede dzinye wu be megblɔe na ame aɖe kaba. "
It was better for me to confront it sooner rather than later. "
"Gbedaɣi "
"A time to heal "

Gbɔdɔnu siwo wowɔ ɖe ŋuwò la ate ŋu ana be nànɔ susu tramatramawo bum ɖe ɖokuiwò ŋu​ le kpɔɖeŋu me, àte ŋu asusui be ye dome gblẽ eye yemele bo aɖeke nu o, ɖeko yeli be ame bubuwo nanɔ gbɔdɔnuwo wɔm ɖe ye ŋu.
Abuse may have left you with hurtful misconceptions about yourself​ for example, that you are damaged and worthless or that you exist only for the sexual gratification of others.
Mɔnukpɔkpɔ su asiwò azɔ be nàvo tso susu totro mawo si me, eye nàwɔ "gbedaɣi " sia ŋu dɔ wòaɖe vi na wò.
You now have the opportunity to recover from such lies, to benefit from "a time to heal. "
(Nyagblɔla 3:3)
(Ecclesiastes 3:3)
Nu kawoe ate ŋu akpe ɖe ŋuwò?
What can help you in this endeavor?
Srɔ̃ Biblia.
Study of the Bible.
Mawu ƒe susuwo le Biblia me, eye ŋusẽ le wo ŋu be woamu "nu siwo li ke sesĩe la aƒu anyi, " esiawo dometɔ ɖekae nye susu totro bubu ɖe ame ɖokui ŋu.
The Bible contains God’s thoughts, which are "powerful . . . for overturning strongly entrenched things "​ including false reasonings about your worth.
(2 Korintotɔwo 10:4, 5)
(2 Corinthians 10:​4, 5)
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, xlẽ mawunyakpukpui siwo gbɔna eye nàde ŋugble le wo ŋu: Yesaya 41:10; Yeremiya 31:3; Malaki 3:16, 17; Luka 12:6, 7; 1 Yohanes 3:19, 20.
For example, read and think about the following scriptures: Isaiah 41:10; Jeremiah 31:3; Malachi 3:​16, 17; Luke 12:​6, 7; 1 John 3:​19, 20.
Do gbe ɖa.
Prayer.
Ne èle sesem le ɖokuiwò me be yemele bo aɖeke nu o alo nèle fɔ bum ɖokuiwò atraɖii la, "dro wò agba ɖe Yehowa dzi " le gbedodoɖa me.
When feelings of worthlessness or guilt overwhelm you, "throw your burden on Jehovah " in prayer.
(Psalmo 55:22)
(Psalm 55:22) You are never alone!
Magblẽ wò ɖi gbeɖe o!
Congregation elders.
Na hamemetsitsiwo nakpe ɖe ŋuwò. Wona hehe ŋutsu Kristotɔ siawo wole "abe sitsoƒe tso ya nu kple bebeƒe tso tsidzadza gã nu ene. "
These Christian men are trained to be "like a hiding place from the wind, a place of concealment from the rainstorm. "
(Yesaya 32:2)
(Isaiah 32:2)
Woate ŋu akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàbu susu nyuiwo ɖe ɖokuiwò ŋu eye nàkpɔ ŋgɔ tẽe.
They can help you to gain a balanced view of yourself and to move on with your life.
De ha kple kpɔɖeŋu nyui ɖolawo.
Good association.
Lé ŋku ɖe ame siwo ɖoa kpɔɖeŋu nyuiwo le Kristotɔwo ƒe agbenɔnɔ me ŋu.
Observe men and women who are exemplary in Christian living.
Lé ŋku ɖe ale si wowɔa nu ɖe wo nɔewo ŋu la ŋu.
Take note of how they treat one another.
Àva kpɔe be menye ame nyanyɛwo katãe gblẽa nu le ame siwo wogblɔna be yewolɔ̃ la ŋu o.
In time, you will come to realize that not all people use their influence to abuse those whom they claim to love.
Ðetugbui aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Tanya la kpɔ nu vevi sia dze sii.
A young woman named Tanya is learning that vital lesson.
Tso eƒe ɖevime kee ŋutsu geɖewo dɔa egbɔ.
From early childhood, she was treated as a sexual object by a number of men.
Egblɔ be "Ŋutsu siwo nye nye ame nyanyɛwo la de asi ŋunye. "
"The only men I was ever close to hurt me, " she says.
Gake Tanya va kpɔe dze sii be ŋutsu aɖewo li siwo lɔ̃a ame vavã.
In time, though, Tanya has come to realize that there are men who do show genuine love.
Aleke wòwɔ kpɔ esia dze sii?
How has she seen this?
Esi Tanya va de ha kple atsu kple asi aɖe siwo nye Kristotɔwo la, eƒe susu trɔ.
As she associated with a husband and wife who were exemplary in Christian living, Tanya’s viewpoint changed.
Egblɔ be: "Mekpɔe dze sii le ŋutsua ƒe nuwɔnawo me be menye ŋutsuwo katãe gblẽa ŋu le ame ŋu o.
"I could see from the husband’s actions that not all men are abusive, " she says.
Ŋutsua kpɔa srɔ̃a ta, eye nenemae Mawu di be wòanɔ hã. " ​ Efesotɔwo 5:28, 29.
"The husband protected his wife, and that is how God intended it to be. " ​ Ephesians 5:​28, 29.
Nu Kae Mawɔ Ne Wotsɔa Gbɔdɔnyawo Ðea Fu Nam?
How Can I Deal With Sexual Harassment?
Nu kae nye gbɔdɔnyawo tsɔtsɔ ɖe fu na ame?
What is sexual harassment?
Ke ne wotsɔa gbɔdɔnyawo ɖea fu nam ɖe?
What if I’m being sexually harassed?
Nu kae mawɔ?
What would I do?
Nu kae nye gbɔdɔnyawo tsɔtsɔ ɖe fu na ame?
What is sexual harassment?
Gbɔdɔnyawo tsɔtsɔ ɖe fu na ame lɔ gbɔdɔnuwɔwɔ ɖe ame ŋu ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi ɖe eme. Wo dometɔ aɖewoe nye asilili ame ŋu kple gbegblẽnyawo gbɔgblɔ na ame.
Sexual harassment includes any unwanted sexual behavior​ including touching or even making comments of a sexual nature.
Gake ɣeaɖewoɣi la, menɔa bɔbɔe be woade vovototo fewuɖuɖu le ame ŋu, ahiãmoɖoɖo na ame kple gbɔdɔnyawo tsɔtsɔ ɖe fu na ame dome o.
But sometimes the line can be blurred between teasing, flirting, and sexually harassing.
Ènya vovototo si le wo mea?
Do you know the difference between them?
Wɔ míaƒe gbɔdɔnyawo tsɔtsɔ ɖe fu na ame ŋuti dodokpɔ sia be nàkpɔ vovototoa!
Take our sexual harassment quiz and find out!
Nublanuitɔe la, amewo medzudzɔa gbɔdɔnyawo tsɔtsɔ ɖe fu na ame ne edo le suku gɔ̃ hã o.
Sadly, sexual harassment doesn’t always stop when you graduate from school.
Ke hã ne èna kakaɖedzi kple aɖaŋu si nàtsɔ anɔ te ɖe gbɔdɔnyawo tsɔtsɔ ɖe fu na ame nu su asiwò fifia la, awɔe be nàsu te nyuie anɔ te ɖe nuwɔna sia nu le dɔwɔƒe.
However, if you develop the confidence and skills you need to deal with sexual harassment now, you’ll be prepared to deal with it when you enter the workforce.
Eye àte ŋu ana hã be ame si wɔa nu sia la magawɔe ɖe ame aɖeke ŋu o!
And you might even stop a harasser from hurting others!
Olivia
Olivia
"Ehiã be nàtɔ afɔ to sesiẽ.
"You really have to stand up for yourself.
Zi geɖe la, fuɖenamelawo medzudzɔna o ke dzaa ɖe nèna eme kɔ na wo ƒãa be yemedi o.
People usually don’t back off unless you give them a clear message.
Gbee na amea, eye nàgblɔ nɛ be nedzudzɔ.
Just stand up and say, ‘No!’
Ne medzudzɔ o la, gblɔe na ame bubu aɖe! "
If that doesn’t work, tell someone! "
Tanisha
Tanisha
"Ne wole gbegblẽnya ɖikokoewo gblɔm la mègako nu o eye mègade nu eme o.
"Don’t laugh at jokes with sexual innuendo or get involved in sexually charged conversations.
Ne ède nu eme alo nèkpɔtɔ le ŋutsuvi siwo dina be nyɔnuviwo nakpɔ yewo dome la, woasusui be ele nuwò vivim. "
If you do, or if you hang around people who enjoy a lot of attention from the opposite sex, others will assume that you want that attention too. "
Ke ne wotsɔ gbɔdɔnyawo ɖea fu nam ɖe?
What if I’m being sexually harassed?
Ne ènya nu si gbɔdɔnyawo tsɔtsɔ ɖe fu na ame nye ko hafi nàte ŋu agbe nya na fuɖenamelaa!
Sexual harassment is more likely to stop if you know what it is and how to react to it!
Kpɔ nɔnɔme etɔ̃ siawo kple ale si nàte ŋu akpɔ wo gbɔe la ɖa.
Consider three situations and how you might deal with each one.
NƆNƆME:
SITUATION:
"Le míaƒe dɔwɔƒe la, ŋutsu aɖewo siwo tsi wum sãsãsã la gblɔna nam be medze tugbe ŋutɔ eye be ɖe wòanyo ŋutɔ ne ɖe yewoate ŋu ayi megbe ƒe 30 azu ɖekakpuiwo.
"At work, some guys who were much older than I am kept telling me that I was beautiful and that they wished they were 30 years younger.
Wo dometɔ ɖeka gɔ̃ hã zɔ to megbenye ɖaʋẽ nye ɖa kpɔ! "​ Tabitha, exɔ ƒe 20.
One of them even walked up behind me and sniffed my hair! "​ Tabitha, 20.
Tabitha ate ŋu abui be: "Ne medo tokui hele dzi dom ko la, ava dzudzɔ. "
Tabitha could think: ‘If I just ignore it and tough it out, maybe he will stop.’
Nu si tae ewɔwɔ alea maɖe vi o: Numekulawo gblɔ be, zi geɖe la ne ame siwo wotsɔ gbɔdɔnyawo le fu ɖem na ŋe aɖaba ƒu edzi la, ɖeko wòyia edzi hedoa gã ɖe edzi.
Why that probably won’t help: Experts say that when victims ignore sexual harassment, it often continues and even escalates.
Te esia boŋ kpɔ: Mègazi kpi o, ke boŋ tsɔ tufafa nàgbe nya na amea eme nakɔ nɛ nyuie be yemedi be wòagagblɔ nya ma na ye alo awɔ nu ma ɖe ye ŋu azɔ o.
Try this instead: Speak up and calmly but clearly tell your harasser that you won’t tolerate his speech or behavior.
Taryn si xɔ ƒe 22 gblɔ be: "Ne ame aɖe ka asi teƒe si mesɔ o nam la, metrɔna gblɔna nɛ be mègaka asi ŋunye azɔ gbeɖe o.
"If anyone touches me inappropriately, " says 22-year-old Taryn, "I turn around and tell him not to touch me ever again.
Zi geɖe la, ɖeko ŋutsuvi si wɔ nua tɔtɔna. "
That usually catches the guy off guard. "
Ne ame si le fua ɖem na wò sẽ dzi me la, mègana ta o.
If your harasser persists, be firm and don’t give up.
Biblia gblɔ tso agbeŋutise kɔkɔwo me léle ɖe asi ŋu be: "Mianɔ tsitre bliboe, eye miakpɔ kakaɖedzi sẽŋu. " Kolosetɔwo 4:12.
When it comes to maintaining high moral standards, the Bible’s advice is: "Stand firm, mature and confident. "​ Colossians 4:​12, The New Testament in Contemporary Language.
Ke ne fuɖenamela be yeawɔ nu vevi wò ya ɖe?
What if the harasser threatens to harm you?
Le go ma me la, mègakpe akɔ kplii o.
In that case, don’t confront him.
Si dzo le teƒea kaba, eye nàgblɔe na ame tsitsi aɖe.
Escape the situation as quickly as possible, and seek the help of a trusted adult.
NƆNƆME:
SITUATION:
"Esi mele xɔ ade me la, nyɔnuvi eve aɖewo lém le sukuxɔwo dome mɔ dzi.
"When I was in the sixth grade, two girls grabbed me in the hallway.
Wo dometɔ ɖeka dɔa nyɔnuviwo gbɔ, eye wòdi be nye kpli ye míado.
One of them was a lesbian, and she wanted me to go out with her.
Togbɔ be megbe hã, woɖea fu nam gbe sia gbe le ɖiɖiɖemeɣi.
Although I refused, they continued to harass me every day between classes.
Womimim ɖe gli ŋu gbe ɖeka gɔ̃ hã! "​ Victoria, exɔ ƒe 18.
Once, they even pushed me up against a wall! "​ Victoria, 18.
Victoria ate ŋu asusui be: ‘Ne megblɔe na ame aɖe la, woava yɔm be ɖɔɖɔetɔ, eye ɖewohĩ ame aɖeke maxɔ dzinye ase o.’
Victoria could have thought: ‘If I tell anyone about this, I will be labeled as weak, and maybe no one will believe me.’
Nu si tae nuŋububu alea maɖe vi o: Ne mègblɔe na ame aɖeke o la, fuɖenamelaa ayi edzi anɔ fu ɖem na wò eye wòawɔe ɖe ame bubuwo gɔ̃ hã ŋu.​ Nyagblɔla 8:11.
Why that thinking probably would not have helped: If you hold back from telling someone, the harasser may continue and even go on to harass others.​ Ecclesiastes 8:11.
Te esia boŋ kpɔ: Di kpekpeɖeŋu.
Try this instead: Get help.
Dziwòlawo kple wò nufialawo ate ŋu akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàtsi nya ɖe fuɖenamelaa nu.
Parents and teachers can give you the support you need to deal with your harasser.
Gake ne ame siwo nègblɔ nya na meka ɖe dziwò o ya ɖe?
But what if the people you tell don’t take your complaint seriously?
Te esia kpɔ: Ɣesiaɣi si amea gaɖe fu na wò la, ŋlɔ ale si nuwo yi ɖi tsitotsito.
Try this: Every time you are harassed, write down the details.
Ŋlɔ ŋkekea, gamea, teƒe si nua dzɔ le kple nya siwo fuɖenamelaa gblɔ na wò ɖi.
Include the date, time, and location of each incident, along with what the harasser said.
Azɔ tsɔ wò nuŋlɔɖia ƒe kɔpi ɖeka na dziwòlawo alo wò nufiala.
Then give a copy of it to your parent or teacher.
Ame geɖe tsɔa nya siwo woŋlɔ ɖi la vevie wu numegbe.
Many people treat a written complaint more seriously than a verbal one.
NƆNƆME:
SITUATION:
"Mevɔ̃na na ŋutsuvi sia si ƒoa rugby la ŋutɔ.
"I was really afraid of this one boy who was on the rugby team.
Eƒe kɔkɔme ade meta eve kloe, eye eƒe kpekpeme nye kilogram 135!
He was almost two meters (6.5 ft) tall, and he weighed about 135 kilograms (300 lb)!
Eɖoe ɖe tame be ‘yeƒe asi asu dzinye godoo.’
He got it into his head that he was going to ‘have me.’
Eɖea fu nam gbe sia gbe kloe ƒe ɖeka sɔŋ.
He pestered me almost every day​ for a whole year.
Gbe ɖeka nye kplii koe susɔ le sukuxɔa me eye wònɔ tetem ɖe ŋunye.
One day, we were the only people in the classroom, and he started closing in on me.
Metso kpla ƒu du to mɔa nu do go. "​ Julieta, exɔ ƒe 18.
I jumped up and ran out the door. "​ Julieta, 18.
Julieta ate ŋu asusui be: ‘Nenema ko ŋutsuviwo le.’
Julieta could think: ‘That’s just the way boys are.’
Nu si tae nuŋububu alea maɖe vi o: Ne ame sia ame susui be naneke megblẽ le fuɖenamelaa ƒe nuwɔna ŋu o la, madzudzɔ ewɔwɔ o.
Why that probably won’t help: Your harasser is unlikely to change his behavior if everyone thinks it’s acceptable.
Te esia boŋ kpɔ: Mègatsɔ eƒe nuwɔnawo wɔ hatsekaka alo anɔ alɔgbɔnu kom ne ele fu ɖem na wò o.
Try this instead: Resist the temptation to laugh it off or to respond with a smile.
Ke boŋ na wò nuwɔna kple wò moɖoɖo nana amea nanya nu siwo ŋu nàɖe mɔ le kple nu siwo ŋu màɖe mɔ le gbeɖe o.
Rather, make sure that your reaction​ including your facial expression​ makes it clear to your harasser what you will and will not tolerate.
Nu kae mawɔ?
What would I do?
NUDZƆDZƆ ŊUTƆŊUTƆ 1:
TRUE STORY 1:
"Nyemedina be amewo nabui be nye nya me sẽ o.
"I don’t like being rude to people at all.
Eya ŋuti ne ŋutsuviwo le fu ɖem nam la, ɖeko megblɔna na wo be woadzudzɔ, gake nyemegbenɛ na wo moveviɖoɖotɔe o.
So even when guys kept harassing me, I would tell them to stop​ but I wasn’t very firm, and I often smiled as I spoke to them.
Esia na wosusunɛ be ɖe mele ahiãmoe ɖom na yewo. "
They thought I was flirting. "
Tabitha.
Tabitha.
Nenye wòe nye Tabitha ɖe, nu kae nàwɔ na ŋutsuvi mawo?
If you were Tabitha, how would you have dealt with those harassers?
Nu ka tae?
Why?
Nu kae ate ŋu ana fuɖenamela nasusui boŋ be ɖe nèle ahiãmo ɖom na ye?
What may cause a harasser to think that you are flirting with him or her?
NUDZƆDZƆ ŊUTƆŊUTƆ 2:
TRUE STORY 2:
"Nu sia dze egɔme esime ŋutsuvi aɖe gblɔ nya vloe aɖe ɖe ŋunye esi míele kame dem le suku.

Medo toku woƒe nyawo kwasiɖa ʋɛ aɖewo, gake ɖeko nɔnɔmea nɔ gbegblẽm ɖe edzi.
I ignored what they said for a few weeks, but it just got worse and worse.
Azɔ ŋutsuviawo va nɔa xanye hekplaa asi kɔ nam.
Then the boys started to sit beside me and put their arms around me.
Metutua wo ɖa, gake womedzudzɔ o.
I pushed them away, but they kept it up.
Mlɔeba wo dometɔ ɖeka ŋlɔ gbegblẽnya aɖe ɖe agbalẽ kakɛ dzi tsɔ nam.
Finally, one of the guys handed me a piece of paper with a derogatory message.
Metsɔe na nye nufiala.
I gave it to my teacher.
Wohe to na ŋutsuvia be megava sukua o ŋkeke aɖewo.
The boy was suspended from school.
Mekpɔe be ɖe wòle be mayi nufiala gbɔ xoxo hafi! "
I realized that I should have gone to the teacher at the beginning! "

Nu kae atamkaka sia lɔ ɖe eme?
What is a virginity pledge?
Nuwɔna sia va xɔ ŋkɔ ŋutɔ le ƒe 1990-awo me esime Anyiehe Baptist-ha si le Amerika de ɖoɖo si nye "Lɔlɔ̃ Vavã Lalana " to me.
A virginity pledge is a written or oral promise to maintain sexual abstinence until marriage.

Le ɖoɖo sia nu la, wowɔa Biblia me nyawo kple hatiwo ƒe ŋusẽkpɔɖeamedzi nyuiwo ŋu dɔ tsɔ dea dzi ƒo na sɔhɛwo be woaƒo asa na gomekpɔkpɔ le gbɔdɔdɔ me do ŋgɔ na srɔ̃ɖeɖe. Wodze ɖoɖo sia tɔgbi bubu aɖe hã gɔme le esia emegbe.

Virginity pledges became popular in the 1990’s when the Southern Baptist Convention in the United States launched "True Love Waits "​ a program that combined Biblical values with positive peer pressure to encourage young people to say no to sex before marriage.
Le ɖoɖo yeye sia nu la, wona klosalosigɛ vavala siwo ka atam la be woatsɔ aɖo kpe edzi (ahatsɔ nɔ ŋku ɖom edzi) be yewomadɔ kple ame aɖeke o va se ɖe esime yewoɖe srɔ̃ hafi.
A similar program, started soon afterward, featured events where attendees who took the pledge were given a silver ring to symbolize (and remind them of) their no-sex-before-marriage commitment.
Ðe atamkaka sia le eƒe taɖodzinu gbɔ ɖoma?
Do virginity pledges work?
Ŋuɖoɖoa anɔ te ɖe ame si nèbia dzi.
The answer depends on whom you ask.

Le numekula siwo ŋkɔe nye Christine C. Kim kple Robert Rector ƒe nya nu la, "numekuku geɖewo ɖee fia be atamkaka be yemadɔ kple ame aɖeke o va se ɖe esime yeɖe srɔ̃ hafi na be sɔhɛ geɖewo he gbɔdɔdɔ ɖe megbe eye wòɖe sɔhɛwo ƒe gbɔdɔdɔ dzi kpɔtɔ. "
According to researchers Christine C. Kim and Robert Rector, "several studies have found that adolescent virginity pledging was associated with delayed or reduced levels of teen sexual activity. "
Le Guttmacher Numekuhabɔbɔ ƒe nyatakaka aɖe si wòɖe ɖe go nu la, "sɔhɛ siwo ‘ka atam sia’ hã kpɔa gome le gbɔdɔdɔ me ko abe ame siwo meka atam la o ene. "
According to research published by the Guttmacher Institute, studies indicate that "teens who take ‘virginity pledges’ are just as likely to have sex as those who do not. "
Nu ka tae nyatakakawo meto mɔ ɖeka o?
Why the conflicting results?
Numekula aɖewo tsɔ atamkalawo sɔ kple ame siwo meka atam la o, eye hatsotso eve siawo ƒe susu ku ɖe gbɔdɔdɔ ŋu to vovo.
Some studies compare pledgers with non-pledgers who do not share similar beliefs about sex.
Numekula bubuwo hã tsɔ atamkalawo sɔ kple ame siwo meka atam la o, gake le ame siawo gome la, hatsotso eveawo ƒe susu le gbɔdɔdɔ ŋu wɔ ɖeka.
Other studies compare pledgers with non-pledgers who share similar beliefs about sex.
Nu kae numekuku mamlɛtɔ sia ɖe ɖe go?

Ðɔkita Janet Rosenbaum, si nye sɔhɛwo ƒe lãmesẽnyawo ŋuti nunyala gblɔ be, le ƒe atɔ̃ megbe la, "vovototo aɖeke megava le atamkalawo kple ame siwo meka atam la o dome le gbɔdɔnyawo me o. "
Dr. Janet Rosenbaum, a specialist in adolescent health issues, says that after five years, "pledgers and non-pledgers don’t differ at all in their sexual behavior. "

The problem is, they don’t necessarily instill the values needed for follow-through.
Ðɔkita Rosenbaum gblɔ tso ame geɖe siwo kaa atam be yewomadɔ kple ame aɖeke o va se ɖe esime yewoɖe srɔ̃ la ŋuti be womeɖoe "le dzi me be yewoawɔ ɖe atamkaka la dzi o.

Calvin srɔ̃ ale si wòaɖu gbɔdɔdɔnuwɔnawo kpɔkpɔ dzi.
Calvin has learned to reject pornography.
Egblɔ be: "Gbɔdɔdɔnuwɔnawo kpɔkpɔe nye vodada gã aɖe si mewɔ, megakpɔtɔ le eƒe fu kpem, elabe nu siwo mekpɔ va yi la gavaa susu me nam ɣeaɖewoɣi.
He says: "Getting involved with pornography was a big mistake that I’m still paying for because the images replay in my mind.
Ɣeaɖewoɣi la, ewɔna nam be mabu nu siwo manya nɔ kpɔkpɔm ɖaa ne ɖe mele gbɔdɔdɔnuwɔnawo kpɔm la ŋu.
And at times I’m still tempted to think about what I could see if I were to look at things that I shouldn’t.
Gake ɣeyiɣi ma tututu me la, mebua ale si dzi adzɔm, ale si manɔ dzadzɛe eye etsɔme nyui aɖe asu asinye ne mewɔ nu abe ale si Yehowa dii ene la ŋu. "
But then I think about how happy, how clean, and how bright my future is when I do things Jehovah’s way. "
Nu Kae Wòle Be Manya Tso Kamedefefe Ŋu?
What Should I Know About Sports?
Kamedefefe ate ŋu aɖe vi na wò eye ate ŋu agblẽ nu le ŋuwò hã.
Sports can be good for you​ or bad for you.
Enɔ te ɖe kamedefefe si ƒomevi si wònye, ale si nèkpɔa gome le eme kple ɣeyiɣi si nèzãna ɖe eŋu la dzi.
It all depends on what you play, how you play, and how much you play.
Vi kawoe wòate ŋu aɖe na wò?
What are the benefits?
Nu kawoe wòate ŋu agblẽ le ŋuwò?
What are the pitfalls?
Nya siwo hawòtiwo gblɔ
What your peers say
Vi kawoe wòate ŋu aɖe na wò?
What are the benefits?
Kamedede dea ame ƒe lãmesẽ dzi.
Playing sports can contribute to good health.
Biblia gɔ̃ hã gblɔ be "kamedede nyo. " (1 Timoteo 4:8, etenuŋɔŋlɔ)
The Bible acknowledges that "physical exercise is beneficial. " (1 Timothy 4:8, footnote)
Ŋutsuvi aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Ryan gblɔ be: "Kamedede nana ame nɔa afɔte.
"Playing sports is a great way to stay active, " says a young man named Ryan.
Eɖea vi na ame wu videofefewo. "
"It’s a lot better than staying inside playing video games. "
Kamedefefe tea ŋu nana ame srɔ̃a nuwɔwɔ le ha me kpakple ɖokuidziɖuɖu.
Playing sports can promote teamwork and self-discipline.
Wowɔ kamedefefe ƒe kpɔɖeŋu aɖe le Biblia me tsɔ fia nu vevi aɖe mí.
The Bible uses an illustration based on a sport to teach a positive point.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Duƒula siwo le ho ʋlim la katãe ƒua dua, gake ame ɖeka koe xɔa dziɖuɖufetu la. "
It says: "The runners in a race all run, but only one receives the prize. "
Eye wògblɔ kpee be: "Ame sia ame si le gome kpɔm le hoʋiʋli me la ɖua eɖokui dzi le nuwo katã me. " (1 Korintotɔwo 9:24, 25)
It then states: "Everyone competing in a contest exercises self-control in all things. " (1 Corinthians 9:​24, 25)
Nufiame kae le eme?
The point?
Ebia ɖokuidziɖuɖu kple nuwɔwɔ aduadu hafi ame nate ŋu awɔ ɖe kamedefefea ƒe sewo dzi.
It takes self-control and cooperation to play by the rules of a sport.
Ðetugbui aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Abigail lɔ̃ ɖe nya sia dzi.
A teenager named Abigail agrees.
Egblɔ be: "Kamedefefe kpe ɖe ŋunye menya ale si mawɔ nu aduadu kple amewo kple ale si maɖo dze kple amewo. "
She says, "Playing sports has taught me how to cooperate and communicate with others. "
Kamedefefe nana xɔlɔ̃wɔwɔ me sẽna.
Playing sports can build friendships.
Fefe ɖekae tea amewo ƒoa ƒu.
A game brings people together.
Ŋutsuvi aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Jordan gblɔ be: "Hoʋiʋli aɖe si nu nɔa fefe ɖe sia ɖe kloe me, gake nenye dzidzɔdoname ta koe míefe fefe ma la, enye mɔ nyui aɖe si dzi míetona dzea xɔlɔ̃wo. "
"Nearly all games involve some type of competition, " says a young man named Jordan, "but if you keep it about having fun, playing sports is a great way to connect with friends. "
Nu kawoe wòate ŋu agblẽ le ŋuwò?
What are the pitfalls?
Fefe si ƒomevi nèfena.
What you play.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Yehowa doa ame dzɔdzɔe kple ame vɔ̃ɖi siaa kpɔna; eléa fu ame sia ame si lɔ̃a ŋutasẽnuwɔwɔ. " Psalmo 11:5.
The Bible says: "Jehovah examines the righteous one as well as the wicked one; He hates anyone who loves violence. "​ Psalm 11:5.
Ŋutasẽnuwo sɔŋ koe wowɔna le kamedefefe aɖewo me.
Some sports are clearly violent.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, ɖetugbui aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Lauren gblɔ be: "Kɔdada ƒe taɖodzinu koŋ ye nye be woaƒo ame aɖe.
For example, a young woman named Lauren observes: "The whole point of boxing is to beat up the other guy.
Gake esi míenye Kristotɔwo ta la, míeƒoa asa na kɔdada, ke nu ka tae míakpɔ kɔdada atsɔ aɖe modzakae? "
As Christians, we refrain from fighting, so why would we allow ourselves to be entertained by watching others get knocked around? "
Bu eŋu kpɔ: Ðe nèfea fefe siwo me adã le alo kpɔa wo evɔ gblɔna be mana yeawɔ ŋutasẽnu aɖeke oa?
To think about: Have you allowed yourself to justify playing or watching violent sports, thinking it will not make you commit violent acts?
Nenye nenemae la, ke ɖo ŋku nya si Psalmo 11:5 gblɔ la dzi. Egblɔ be Yehowa léa fu ame si "lɔ̃a ŋutasẽnuwɔwɔ " ke menye ame si le ewɔm ɖeɖe ko o.
If so, remember that Psalm 11:5 says that Jehovah disapproves of the person who "loves violence, " not just the person who practices it.
Ale si nèfenae.
How you play.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Migawɔ naneke le dzrehehe alo bubu dzodzro didi ta o, ke boŋ mitsɔ ɖokuibɔbɔ bu ame bubuwo be wonye gã wu mi. " Filipitɔwo 2:3.
The Bible says: "Do nothing out of contentiousness or out of egotism, but with humility consider others superior to you. "​ Philippians 2:3.
Enye nyateƒe be hoʋiʋli aɖe si nu nɔa fefe ɖe sia ɖe si me ame hatsotso eve le gome kpɔm le la me godoo ya.
Of course, any activity involving opposing teams will include a degree of competition.
Gake maɖu-dzi-godoo ƒe nɔnɔme menana fefe la vivina o.
But a win-at-all-costs attitude will only take the fun out of the game.
Sɔhɛ aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Brian gblɔ be: "Hoʋiʋli ate ŋu aɖo mewò.
"A competitive spirit can quickly overtake you, " says a teenager named Brian.
Ne èbi ɖe fefe aɖe me la, ke ele be nànɔ dɔ wɔm tso ɖokuibɔbɔ hã ŋu. "
"The better you are at sports, the more you have to work on humility. "
Bu eŋu kpɔ: Ðekakpui aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Chris gblɔ be, "Míeƒoa bɔl kwasiɖa sia kwasiɖa, eye nu vevi wɔa mía dometɔ aɖewo. "
To think about: A young man named Chris admits, "We play soccer each week, and there have been injuries. "
Eya ta bia ɖokuiwò be, ‘Nu kawoe nana be nu vevi wɔa amewo?
So ask yourself, ‘What factors can make injuries more likely to occur?
Nu kae mate ŋu awɔ aɖe esia dzi akpɔtɔ?’
What can I do to minimize the risk of injury?’
Ɣeyiɣi si nèzãna ɖe eŋu.
How much you play.
Biblia gblɔ be míakpɔ "nu siwo le vevie wu " la adze sii. Filipitɔwo 1:10.
The Bible says: "Make sure of the more important things. "​ Philippians 1:​10.
Ele be nàɖo nu vevitɔwo nɔƒe gbãtɔ; nu siwo ku ɖe mawusubɔsubɔ ŋu naxɔ nɔƒe gbãtɔ.
You need to set your priorities; spiritual things should come first.
Fefe aɖewo xɔa gaƒoƒo geɖe, wò ŋutɔ èɖale fefea fem loo alo ènɔ anyi le ekpɔm o.
Most games can last several hours, whether you are playing or just watching.
Ðetugbui aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Daria gblɔ be: "Nye kple nɔnye míehea nya le ɣeyiɣi gbogbo si mezãna tsɔ kpɔa kamedefefewo le television dzi evɔ wònye be mate ŋu azã ɣeyiɣi ma ɖe nu bubu ŋu hafi la ta.
"I used to have conflicts with my mom over how much time I spent watching games on TV when that time could have been better spent, " says a young woman named Daria.
me aɖe kɔ dze gbogbo aɖe ɖe nuɖuɖu me
Someone pours a huge amount of salt on a plate of food
Dzitsitsi ɖe kamedefefe ŋu akpa le ko abe dzedede nuɖuɖu me wòaƒo dzeve ene
Putting too much emphasis on sports is like putting too much salt on your food
Bu eŋu kpɔ: Ðe nèɖoa to dziwòlawo ne woɖo aɖaŋu na wò ku ɖe nu siwo le vevie na wò wu ŋua?
To think about: Do you listen when your parents offer advice about your priorities?
Ðetugbui aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Trina gblɔ be: "Ne nye kple nɔvinyewo míele kamedefefe aɖe kpɔm la, nɔnye ɖoa ŋku edzi na mí be, ne míekpɔ fefea loo alo mímekpɔe o, woaxe fe na fefea wɔlawo ya godoo.
A young woman named Trina says: "When my siblings and I used to watch sports and neglect important duties, my mom would remind us that the players were getting paid whether we watched them or not.
Eye wòbiaa mí be, ‘Gake ame kae axe fe na miawo ya?’
‘But who’s paying you?’ she would ask us.
Nu si gblɔm wòlee nye be: Fefewɔlaawo ya ƒe dɔwɔɖui ye nye ema.
What she meant was this: The players already have a job.
Gake ne míedo kpo míaƒe sukudɔdeasiwo kple aƒemedɔwo wɔwɔ la, agbea made mía dzi le etsɔme o.
But if we were to slack off on our homework and other responsibilities, we wouldn’t be able to support ourselves in the future.
Nya si ko gblɔm dada le na míe nye be mele be televisionkpɔkpɔ alo fefe nanye nu vevitɔ na mí le agbe me o. "
Basically, mom was telling us that watching or playing sports should not be the most important thing in our life. "
NYA SIWO HAWÒTIWO GBLƆ
WHAT YOUR PEERS SAY
Abigail
Abigail
"Kamedede nye fefe, enana míekpɔa dzidzɔ eye wòdea ameti bliboa dzi.
"Besides providing exercise, playing sports contributes to your happiness and overall well-being.
Ekpena ɖe ame ŋu wòsrɔ̃a ale si wòabɔbɔ eɖokui ne eɖu dzi eye wòalé dzi ɖe ƒo nenye be meɖu dzi o. "​ Abigail.
It helps you learn how to win with humility and lose with dignity. "​ Abigail.
Deven
Deven
"Kamedede dzɔa dzi nam, gake mele vevie de nu bubu siwo wòhiã be mawɔ la nu o.
"I love sports, but they are not as important as other things I need to do.
Nye ya, ne mewɔ nye dɔ veviwo vɔ ko hafi mekpɔa kamedefefe tsɔ ɖea modzaka.
To me, watching a game is a reward for taking care of my responsibilities.
Edea agbe menye eye wòkpena ɖe ŋunye metsɔa nu vevitɔwo ɖoa nɔƒe gbãtɔ. "​ Deven.
That gives me incentive and helps me to prioritize. "​ Deven.
Nu Kae Wòle Be Manya Tso Ahamuame Ŋu?
What Should I Know About Alcohol?
Biblia metsi tsitre ɖe ahanono le ŋuɖɔɖo me ŋu ne ame tsi le se nu anoe o.
The Bible doesn’t condemn drinking alcohol in moderation when it is legal to do so.
Gake ede se ɖe ahamumu ŋu.​ Psalmo 104:15; 1 Korintotɔwo 6:10.
It does, however, prohibit drunkenness.​ Psalm 104:15; 1 Corinthians 6:​10.
Ke ne woƒoe ɖe nuwò be nàno aha le nɔnɔme aɖewo me, si anye dziwòlawo alo dukɔa ƒe se dzi dada ya ɖe?
But what if you feel pressured to drink in circumstances that the law or your parents do not allow?
Bu nuwo ŋu yi ŋgɔe
Think past the drink
Ðo tame kplikpaa
Make a resolve
Nya siwo hawòtiwo gblɔ
What your peers say
Bu nuwo ŋu yi ŋgɔe
Think past the drink
Hawòti aɖewo asusu be ele kokoko be ame nano aha hafi ate ŋu akpɔ dzidzɔ.
Some of your peers may feel that drinking is essential to having a good time.
Ke nu kawoe ate ŋu adzɔ le ahaa nono vɔ megbe?
But what can happen after the drink?
Ame aɖe le gaxɔ me
A person in jail
Ame ate ŋu adze se me.
Legal trouble.

Le teƒe aɖewo la, ne se meɖe mɔ na ame be wòano aha o evɔ wònoe la, woate ŋu ado fe nɛ, woabu fɔe be enye nu vlo wɔla, woaxɔ ʋukugbalẽ le esi, woaɖo dɔ sesẽ nɛ atsɔ ahe to nɛ, alo woadee mɔ́ gɔ̃ hã.​ Romatɔwo 13:3.

Depending on where you live, if you drink alcohol when it is not legal to do so, you could be fined, be charged with a crime, lose your driver’s license, be required to perform community service, or even serve jail time.​ Romans 13:3.
Asitelefon
A mobile device
Bubu klona le ame ŋu.
Damaged reputation.
Ahanono nana ame megatea ŋu ɖɔa ŋu ɖo o.
Alcohol lowers inhibitions.
Ne èmu aha la, àte ŋu agblɔ nya alo awɔ nane si ava ve wò emegbe.
Under its influence you could say or do things that you would later regret.
(Lododowo 23:31-33)
(Proverbs 23:31-​33)
Esi nyakakamɔnuwo va bɔ fifia ŋutɔ ta la, wò nuwɔnawo ate ŋu akaka kaba eye wòana bubu naklo le ŋuwò tegbee.
In this age of social media, your actions could have a lasting impact on your reputation.
Wotsɔ gbɔdɔnyawo le fu ɖem na nyɔnu aɖe
A woman is harassed
Ate ŋu ana ame naɖe ŋu ɖi.
Weakened defenses.
Ne èmu aha la, ele bɔbɔe ŋutɔ be woawɔ ŋutasẽnu alo gbɔdɔnuwo ɖe ŋuwò.
Alcohol can leave you easy prey to physical or sexual assault.
Ate ŋu ana ame bubuwo nakpɔ ŋusẽ ɖe dziwò bɔbɔe hã, si awɔe be nàva ƒo ɖokuiwò ɖe nuwɔna manɔsenu bubuwo alo esiwo ate ŋu ade wò afɔku me la me.
It can also make you susceptible to the influence of others, which can lead to further risky or illegal behavior.
Ahatukpa gbɔlo
An empty bottle of alcohol
Ate ŋu azu numame na ame.
Addiction.
Numekukuwo ɖee fia be ne ame metsi o hafi dze ahanono gɔme la, enɔa bɔbɔe wu be ahanono nava zu numame nɛ.
Some research indicates that the younger you start drinking, the greater your likelihood of developing a dependency.
Ahanono be yeatsɔ alé nuteɖeamedzi alo akogotsitsi nu, alo atsɔ aɖe modzaka ate ŋu ava zu numame na ame eye edzi ɖuɖu nasesẽ.
Drinking to cope with stress, loneliness, or boredom creates a cycle that can get harder and harder to break.
Ametakoli kple ƒu eve siwo wotsɔ tso ga
A skull and crossbones
Ate ŋu ana ame naku.
Death.
Le ƒe aɖe me nyitsɔ laa la, ame ɖeka kuna le miniti 52 ɖe sia ɖe me le United States, le ame siwo no aha henɔ ʋu kum ta.
In a recent year, alcohol-impaired driving caused one fatality every 52 minutes in the United States.
Le ƒe atɔ̃ aɖe ko me la, ame siwo wu 1,500 siwo mekpɔ xɔ ƒe 21 o ye ku le ʋufɔku siwo me ʋukulawo no aha hafi le ʋua kum ta.
During one five-year period, over 1,500 people under the age of 21 died per year in alcohol-related motor vehicle crashes.
Ne wò ŋutɔ meno aha o, evɔ nèɖo ame aɖe si no aha ƒe ʋu la, ele bɔbɔe ŋutɔ be nàdze afɔku.
Even if you haven’t had alcohol, you take a big risk if you accept a ride from someone who has been drinking.
Ðo tame kplikpaa
Make a resolve
Àte ŋu aƒo asa na ahanono madzemadzee me tsonu vɔ̃ɖiwo ne ètso nya me do ŋgɔ le nu si nàwɔ ŋu.
You can avoid the dangerous and costly consequences of improper drinking if you decide in advance what you will do.
Biblia Ƒe Gɔmeɖose: "Aɖaŋudzela kpɔa afɔku gbɔna eye wòɣlaa eɖokui. "
Bible Principle: "The shrewd one sees the danger and conceals himself. "
(Lododowo 22:3)
(Proverbs 22:3)
Nunya manɔ eme be ame nano aha hafi aku ʋu alo awɔ nu bubu aɖe si bia susuŋudɔwɔwɔ bliboe o.
It is unwise to drink before driving or engaging in any other activity that requires full concentration.
Tameɖoɖo kplikpaa: ‘Ne matiae be mano aha la, ke makpɔ egbɔ be esɔ le se nu eye nɔnɔme si me manoe le hã sɔ hafi.’
Resolve: ‘If I choose to drink alcohol, it will not be until it is legal and the circumstances are right.’
Biblia Ƒe Gɔmeɖose: "Miezu ame si mieɖoa toe la ƒe kluviwo. "
Bible Principle: "You are slaves of the one you obey. "
(Romatɔwo 6:16)
(Romans 6:​16)
Ne ènoa aha le esi hawòtiwo le enom ko ta la, ke èle mɔ ɖem na wo be woakpɔ ŋusẽ ɖe dziwò.
If you drink just because your peers are doing it, you are allowing others to control you.
Ne ènoa aha be yeatsɔ aɖe nuteɖeamedzi alo tamebubu dzi kpɔtɔ la, ke mèle nɔnɔme nyui siwo akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàkpɔ kuxiwo gbɔ la tum ɖo o.
If you drink to ease boredom or to cope with stress, you are not developing the skills you need to deal with your problems.
Tameɖoɖo kplikpaa: ‘Nyemaɖe mɔ hanyetiwo nazi dzinye mano aha o.’
Resolve: ‘I will not let my peers pressure me into drinking.’
Biblia Ƒe Gɔmeɖose: "Mèganɔ aha tsu nolawo . . . dome o. "
Bible principle: "Do not be among those who drink too much. "
(Lododowo 23:20)
(Proverbs 23:20)
Ne xɔlɔ̃ gbegblẽwo le asiwò la, ate ŋu ana nàda wò tameɖoɖo kplikpaa dzi.
The wrong type of associates can undermine your resolve.
Ne ènɔa ame siwo noa aha madzemadzee dome la, ke èle ɖokuiwò dem afɔku me.
You put yourself at risk when you are with others who misuse alcohol.
Tameɖoɖo kplikpaa: ‘Nyemade ha kplikplikpli kple ame siwo noa aha madzemadzee o.’
Resolve: ‘I will not be a close associate of those who misuse alcohol.’
Nya siwo hawòtiwo gblɔ
What your peers say
Jordan
Jordan
"Esime menɔ suku la, amewo dzea agbagba ɣesiaɣi be yewoazi dzinye mano aha.
"When I was in school, people tried all the time to get me to drink.
Ehiã be madze agbagba ɣesiaɣi be nya si le 1 Korintotɔwo 15:33 nanɔ susu me nam be: ‘Hadede vɔ̃wo gblẽa nɔnɔme nyuiwo.’ "​ Jordan.
I constantly had to remind myself of the scripture at 1 Corinthians 15:33, which says: ‘Bad associations spoil useful habits.’ "​ Jordan.
Jenna
Jenna
"Medzea agbagba be maƒo asa na nɔnɔme alo ame siwo menya be woate ŋu aƒoe ɖe nunye be mano aha.
"I try to avoid any people or situations that I know will pressure me.
Dzi dzɔam be xɔlɔ̃ siwo wɔa tiatia nyuiwo le ahanono gome la le asinye. "​ Jenna.
Thankfully, I have friends who make good choices when it comes to alcohol. "​ Jenna.
Nu Kae Mawɔ Be Mía Kple Nye Nufiala Dome Nanɔ Nyui?
How Can I Get Along With My Teacher?
Tɔ nabu eŋu kpɔ!
Stop and think!
Bu nu si me Rachel to la ŋu kpɔ.
Consider Rachel’s experience.
Ne wowɔ dodokpɔ la, Rachel xɔa dzeside nyui siwo nye A alo B.
Rachel had been receiving A’s and B’s on her report cards.
Esi wòva ɖo xɔ 7 lia me la, nuwo va trɔ.
Then, when she reached grade 7, things changed.
Rachel gblɔ be: "Míaƒe nufiala wɔ nu sia nu si wòate ŋui be magakpɔ dzidzedze le dodokpɔ me o. "
"My teacher did everything he could to make me fail his class, " says Rachel.
Nu ka tae?
What was the problem?
Nufiala na Rachel kple dadaa wonya be yemelɔ̃ subɔsubɔha si me wole la o.
The teacher made it obvious to both Rachel and her mother that he did not like their religion.
Ŋutsuvi aɖe le tɔmekpewo dzi tom bene yeatso tɔ
A boy walking over water using stepping stones
Nufialawo le ko abe tɔmekpe siwo akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàsi le numanyamanya nu ahadze si nunya, gake wòe wòle be nàwɔ afɔɖeɖea
Teachers are like stepping-stones that can help you cross from ignorance to understanding, but you must do the walking
Nu kae va dzɔ?
What happened?
Rachel gblɔ be: "Ɣesiaɣi si wòdze ƒãa be nufialaa ɖe mɔ eƒe susu gbegblẽ bubu kpɔ ŋusẽ ɖe dzesi si wònam le dodokpɔ me dzi la, Dada kplɔam ɖo vaa sukua va ƒoa nu tso eŋu kple nufialaa.
Rachel says: "Each time it seemed clear that the teacher allowed his prejudice to affect the way he graded my work, Mom would come with me to discuss the matter with him.
Mlɔeba la, nufiala dzudzɔ fuɖeɖe nam. "
Eventually, he stopped giving me a hard time. "
Ne nuwo le na wò hã alea la, dzi nenɔ ƒowò nàgblɔe na dziwòlawo.
If you experience a similar challenge, have the courage to speak to your parents about it.
Ðikeke mele eme o be woadi be yewoaƒo nu tso eŋu kple wò nufiala, eye ɖewohĩ woana sukutatɔwo nanya nu tso eŋu be woakpɔ nyaa gbɔ.
No doubt, they will be interested in speaking to the teacher and possibly the school administration to work out a solution.
Ele eme baa be, menye ɣesiaɣie agbagbadzedze be woaɖɔ nuwo ɖo kpɔa dzidzedze o.
Admittedly, not all tangled affairs have neat endings.
Ɣeaɖewoɣi la, ɖeko wòle be nàyi edzi ado dzi.
At times, you just have to endure.
(Romatɔwo 12:17, 18)
Ðetugbui si ŋkɔe nye Tanya gblɔ be: "Dzi kua míaƒe nufialawo dometɔ ɖeka ɖe sukuviwo ŋu.
"One of my teachers had a bad attitude toward his students, " says Tanya.
Zi geɖe la, edzua mí be míenye tagbɔkukutɔwo.
"He often insulted us, calling us stupid.
Le gɔmedzedzea me la, esia tena ɖe dzinye mefaa avi, gake nyemegava ɖea mɔ eƒe dzugbewo kpɔa ŋusẽ ɖe dzinye o.
At first he made me cry, but I learned not to take his insults personally.
Metsɔ nye susu ɖo nye sukudɔwo ŋu eye mebia ŋku ɖe eƒe sukudɔdeasiwo ŋu.
I focused on my work and kept myself busy in his class.
Nu si do tso emee nye, megaɖea fu nam azɔ abe tsã ene o, eye menye sukuvi ʋɛ siwo kpɔa dzidzedze le eƒe dodokpɔwo me la dometɔ ɖeka.
As a result, he didn’t bother me much, and I was one of the few who received decent grades.
Le ƒe eve megbe la, wonya nufiala ma le sukua. "
After two years, that teacher was fired. "
Nya vevitɔ: Srɔ̃ ale si nàwɔ nu kple nufiala siwo ƒe nya me sẽ, eye esia ana nàtu ŋutete nyuiwo, siwo akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàsrɔ̃ ale si nàwɔ nu kple dɔtɔ si ƒe nya me sẽ ɖo.
The bottom line: Learn how to cope with a difficult teacher, and you’ll gain a valuable life skill one that will serve you well when you have a difficult boss to deal with.
(1 Petro 2:18)
(1 Peter 2:18)
Ana nàde asixɔxɔ nufiala nyuiwo hã ŋu.
You’ll also learn to treasure good teachers when they come along.
Aleke Mawɔ Aɖu Dzimaɖitsitsi Dzi?
How Can I Deal With Anxiety?
Nu kae nana nètsia dzimaɖi?

Ðe wògblẽ ɣesiaɣi be woatsi dzimaɖia?

Nu si nàte ŋu awɔ

Nya siwo hawòtiwo gblɔ
What your peers say
Nu kae nana nètsia dzimaɖi?
What makes you anxious?
Ðe nya siwo gbɔna sɔ kple ale si nèsena le ɖokuiwò me ɣeaɖewoɣia?
Do the following statements describe how you feel at times?
"Mebiaa ɖokuinye ɣesiaɣi be: ‘Ke ne . . . ?’
"I’m constantly thinking: ‘What if . . . ?’
‘Ke ne míedze ʋufɔku ɖe?’
‘What if we get in a car accident?’
‘Ke ne míaƒe yameʋua ge ɖe?’
‘What if our plane goes down?’
Metsia dzimaɖi le nu siwo ŋu ame akpa gãtɔ matsi dzi ɖo boo o la ŋu. "​ ⁠Charles.
I’m anxious about things that a more rational person wouldn’t worry so much about. "​ Charles.
"Metsia dzodzodzoe ɣeawokatãɣi, ɖeko wòle abe kusie metsɔ le tɔme dem ene.
"I feel anxious all the time, as though I were a hamster on a wheel running around but never getting anywhere.
Metsɔ ta ƒo ati kple kpe, gake gbeɖegbeɖea koe! "​ ⁠Anna.
I’m working myself to death but not really accomplishing anything! "​ Anna.
"Ne amewo gblɔ nam be gbɔnye nyo ŋutɔ be megakpɔtɔ le suku dem la, megblɔna na ɖokuinye be, ‘Womenya ale si gbegbe sukudede tim o tae!’ "​ ⁠Daniel.
"When people tell me that I’m fortunate that I’m still in school, I say to myself, ‘They have no idea how stressful school is!’ "​ Daniel.
"Ewɔna nam ɣesiaɣi be agba kpekpe aɖe le ta nam.
"I’m like a pressure cooker.
Metsia dzodzodzoe ɖe nu si agadzɔ kplɔe ɖo alo nu bubu si wògahiã be mawɔ la ŋu ɣesiaɣi. "​ ⁠Laura.
I’m always worried about the next thing that will happen or the next thing I need to do. "​ Laura.
Nyateƒenya: Míele ɣeyiɣi siwo Biblia yɔ be "ɣeyiɣi sesẽ siwo me nɔnɔ asesẽ " la me.
Fact of life: We live in what the Bible calls "critical times hard to deal with. " (2 Timothy 3:1)
(2 Timoteo 3:1) Le ema ta sɔhɛwo hã ate ŋu atsi dzimaɖi abe ame tsitsiwo ke ene.
Because of that, anxiety can affect young people as much as it affects adults.
Ðe wògblẽ ɣesiaɣi be woatsi dzimaɖia?
Is anxiety always bad?
Ŋuɖoɖoae nye, ao.
The answer is no.
Le nyateƒe me la, Biblia gblɔ be esɔ be míatsi dzi ɖe ale si míawɔ adze míaƒe ame veviwo ŋu la ŋuti.​ ⁠1 Korintotɔwo 7:32-34; 2 Korintotɔwo 11:28.
In fact, the Bible says that it is right for people to be anxious to please the ones they love.​ 1 Corinthians 7:​32-34; 2 Corinthians 11:28.
Eye le go bubu me hã la, dzimaɖitsitsi tea ŋu ʋãa ame wòtsona ɖe dɔ ŋu.
Also, let’s face it​ anxiety can be a powerful motivator.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, tsɔe be èle dodokpɔ aɖe wɔ ge le kwasiɖa si gbɔna me.
For example, suppose you will be taking a test at school next week.
Dzimaɖitsitsi ate ŋu aʋã wò nàsrɔ̃ nu le kwasiɖa sia me​ ⁠eye esia ate ŋu akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàwɔ dɔ nyuie le dodokpɔa me!
Anxiety might compel you to study this week​ and that might help you get a better grade!
Dzimaɖitsitsi aɖe si nu ate ŋu akpe ɖe ŋuwò nànɔ ŋudzɔ ɖe afɔku ŋu.
A degree of anxiety can also alert you to danger.
Sɔhɛ aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Serena gblɔ be: "Àte ŋu atsi dzimaɖi vevie, elabena ènyae be nu si wɔ ge yeyina la menyo o eye ehiã be yeatrɔ ale be yeƒe dzitsinya magaɖe fu na ye o.​ ⁠Tsɔe sɔ kple Yakobo 5:14.

"You might feel anxious because you know that you’re taking a wrong course of action and that you need to make changes for your conscience to be at rest, " says a teenager named Serena.​ Compare James 5:14.
Nyateƒenya: Dzimaɖitsitsi ate ŋu aɖe vi na wò​ ⁠ne eʋã wò nèwɔ nu nyui.
Fact of life: Anxiety can work for you​ as long as it moves you to the right kind of action.
Gake ne dzimaɖitsitsi na be nu madeamedziwo ŋu ko nèbuna ya ɖe?
But what if anxiety traps you in a maze of negative thinking?
Ŋutsu aɖe le mɔ fiam ŋutsuvi aɖe
A man helps a teenage boy find his way out of a maze
Dzimaɖitsitsi ate ŋu ana nàse le ɖokuiwò me abe ame si bu mɔ ene, gake ame aɖe si bua nuwo ŋu nyuie ate ŋu akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàɖu kuxi sia dzi
Anxiety might make you feel as if you were trapped in a maze, but someone with a different perspective can help you find a way out
Kpɔɖeŋu: Richard si xɔ ƒe 19 la gblɔ be: "Metsia dzodzodzoe ne mebu ale si nɔnɔme madeamedziwo ate ŋu anyra ɖe edzi la ŋu.
Example: "My mind races when I think about the different ways a stressful situation could turn out, " says 19-year-old Richard.
Menɔa nɔnɔmea ŋu bum ʋuu kaka ɖeko wònana meva tsia dzimaɖi vevie. "
"I play the situation over and over in my mind to the point that it makes me very anxious. "
Biblia gblɔ be: "Dzi fatu naa agbe ametia. "
The Bible says that "a calm heart gives life to the body. "
(Lododowo 14:30)
(Proverbs 14:30)
Le go aɖewo me la, dzimaɖitsitsi ate ŋu ahe lãmesẽkuxiwo ava ame dzi. Lãmesẽkuxi siawo dometɔ aɖewo ate ŋu anye taɖuame, motrɔame, dɔmeɖui kple dzi ƒe tsotso kabakaba.
On the other hand, anxiety can bring on a number of unpleasant physical symptoms, including headaches, dizziness, upset stomach, and heart palpitations.
Nu kae nàte ŋu awɔ ne edze abe dzimaɖitsitsi le nu gblẽm le ŋuwò ene?
What can you do if anxiety seems to be working against you rather than for you?
Nu si nàte ŋu awɔ
What you can do
Bu eŋu kpɔ nenye be wò dzimaɖitsitsia sɔ mahã.
Question the reasonableness of your anxiety.
"Esɔ be ame natsi dzi ɖe eƒe dɔwo ŋu ya, gake dzimaɖitsitsi fũu menyo o.
"Being concerned about your responsibilities is one thing; being overly anxious is another.
Dzimaɖitsitsi ɖoa ŋku nya si amewo gblɔna be, Ðeko dzimaɖitsitsi le abe zikpui si trona le teƒe ɖeka la dzi nɔnɔ ene, dzi nam.
It reminds me of the saying, Anxiety is like a rocking chair.
Ana nàtsi dzodzodzoe gake maɖe vi aɖeke na wò o. "​ ⁠Katherine.
It gives you something to do, but it doesn’t get you anywhere. "​ Katherine.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Mia dometɔ kae li, si ne ele dzimaɖi tsim la, wòate ŋu atsɔ abɔklugui ɖeka akpe ɖe eƒe agbenɔƒe ŋu? "​ Mateo 6:27.
The Bible says: "Who of you by being anxious can add one cubit to his life span? "​ Matthew 6:27.
Nu si nya sia fia: Ne dzimaɖitsitsi mena nèkpɔ ta na wò kuxiwo o la, ke ɖeko wòana wò kuxiwo nado gã ɖe edzi alo eya ŋutɔ hã nazu kuxi na wò.
What this means: Unless anxiety leads you toward a solution, it will only add to your problem​ or become your problem.
Tsi dzi ɖe ŋkeke ɖe sia ɖe ƒe kuxiwo ko ŋu.
Take things one day at a time.
"Bu nuwo ŋu nyuie.
"Think it through.
Ðe nu si ŋu nètsi dzi ɖo la aganɔ vevie na wò nenema le etsɔ si gbɔna, ɣleti si gbɔna, ƒe si gbɔna alo ƒe atɔ̃ siwo gbɔna mea? "​ ⁠Anthony.
Will what you are anxious about matter tomorrow? in a month? in a year? in five years? "​ Anthony.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Migatsi dzimaɖi gbeɖe le etsɔ si gbɔna ŋu o, elabena etsɔ si gbɔna la kple eya ŋutɔ ƒe dzimaɖitsitsiwoe.
The Bible says: "Never be anxious about the next day, for the next day will have its own anxieties.
Ŋkeke ɖe sia ɖe ƒe kuxiwo sɔ gbɔ nɛ. "​ Mateo 6:34.
Each day has enough of its own troubles. "​ Matthew 6:34.
Nu si nya sia fia: Masɔ be nàtsɔ etsɔ si gbɔna la ƒe kuxiwo ado agba na ɖokuiwò egbea o; ɖewohĩ nu siawo dometɔ aɖewo kura gɔ̃ hã madzɔ o.
What this means: It makes little sense to take on tomorrow’s problems​ some of which may never even become a reality.
Srɔ̃ ale si nànɔ te ɖe nɔnɔme siwo ŋu màte ŋu awɔ naneke le o la nu.
Learn to live with what you cannot change.
"Nu nyuitɔ si nàte ŋu awɔe nye be nàdzra ɖo ɖe nɔnɔmeawo ŋu do ŋgɔ ale si wòanya wɔe, gake lɔ̃ ɖe edzi be nanewo li siwo ŋu yemate ŋu awɔ naneke le o. "​ ⁠Robert.
"The best you can do is prepare for situations to the extent possible, but accept the fact that some situations are out of your control. "​ Robert.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Dziɖuɖu le duɖimekeke me mele afɔ ɖeablɛ me ɣesiaɣi o, . . . eye dzidzedzekpɔkpɔ mele sidzedze me ɣesiaɣi o, elabena azãgbe kple nuɖiɖeame li na wo katã. "​ Nyagblɔla 9:11.
The Bible says: "The swift do not always win the race, . . . nor do those with knowledge always have success, because time and unexpected events overtake them all. "​ Ecclesiastes 9:11.
Nu si nya sia fia: Ɣeaɖewoɣi la, màte ŋu atrɔ nɔnɔme si me nèle la o, gake àte ŋu atrɔ ale si nèbua nɔnɔmea ya.
What this means: Sometimes you cannot change your circumstances, but you can change the way you view them.
Da sɔ le ale si nèbua wò nɔnɔmea me.
Put your situation in perspective.
"Meva de dzesii be ele be mabu nɔnɔme bliboa ŋu ke menye be maɖe mɔ nu suesue siwo ku ɖe eŋu la nana matsi dzimaɖi o.
"I find that I have to focus on the big picture and not stress over the details.
Ele be manya nu siwo hiã vevie wu, eye mazã nye ŋusẽ ɖe nu siawo boŋ ŋu. "​ ⁠Alexis.
I have to choose my battles and channel my energy into taking care of priorities. "​ Alexis.
Biblia gblɔ be: ‘Mikpɔ nu siwo le vevie wu la adze sii.’​ Filipitɔwo 1:10.
The Bible says: "Make sure of the more important things. "​ Philippians 1:​10.
Nu si nya sia fia: Menɔa bɔbɔe be dzimaɖitsitsi naɖu ame siwo si susu nyui nɔna ku ɖe woƒe dzimaɖitsitsiwo ŋu la dzi o.
What this means: People who put their anxieties in perspective are less likely to be overwhelmed by them.
Ƒo nu tso eŋu na ame aɖe.
Talk to someone.
"Esi mexɔ abe ƒe wuiɖekɛ ene la, metsia dzi vevie hafi gbɔna tso suku, eye menɔa vɔvɔ̃m le ale si nuwo anɔ le suku le ŋufɔke la ŋu.
"When I was in the sixth grade, I would come home from school very anxious, dreading the next day.
Papa kple dada ɖoa tom vevie ne mele nye dzimenyawo gblɔm na wo.
My mother and father would just listen to me as I expressed myself.
Dzi dzɔm ŋutɔ be papa kple dada li nam.
It was so good to have them there.
Mate ŋu aka ɖe wo dzi ahagblɔ nye dzimenyawo na wo faa.
I could trust them and speak freely to them.
Enana menɔa te ɖe ŋkeke si kplɔe ɖo la ƒe nɔnɔmewo nu. "​ ⁠Marilyn.
It helped me to face the next day. "​ Marilyn.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Nuxaxa le dzi me ɖe wòtea ame ƒe dzi ɖe anyi, ke nya nyui nana dzi kpɔa dzidzɔ. "​ Lododowo 12:25.
The Bible says: "Anxiety in a man’s heart weighs it down, but a good word cheers it up. "​ Proverbs 12:25.
Nu si nya sia fia: Dziwòla alo xɔ̃wò aɖe ate ŋu aɖo aɖaŋu siwo akpe ɖe ŋuwò be wò dzimaɖitsitsiwo dzi naɖe akpɔtɔ la na wò.
What this means: A parent or a friend might be able to give you practical suggestions on how to reduce your anxiety.
Do gbe ɖa.
Pray.
"Ne mekɔ gbe dzi do gbe ɖa eye nye ŋutɔ mele nye gbe sem la, ekpena ɖe ŋunye.
"Praying​ and doing so aloud so I can hear my voice​ helps me.
Enana meɖea nu si ŋu metsi dzimaɖi ɖo la gblɔna le esi wòanɔ susu me nam teƒe.
It allows me to vocalize what I am anxious about instead of keeping it in my head.
Enana mekpɔnɛ hã be Yehowa lolo wu nye dzimaɖitsitsiwo. "​ ⁠Laura.
It also helps me to realize that Jehovah is greater than my anxiety. "​ Laura.
Biblia gblɔ be: ‘Midro miaƒe dzimaɖitsitsiwo katã ɖe Mawu dzi, elabena eléa be na mi.’​ 1 Petro 5:7.
The Bible says: "Throw all your anxiety on [God], because he cares for you. "​ 1 Peter 5:7.
Nu si nya sia fia: Menye mɔ si dzi nàto akpɔ wò kuxiwo gbɔ koe gbedodoɖa nye o.
What this means: Prayer is not a mental trick.
Enye dzeɖoɖo ŋutɔŋutɔ kple Yehowa Mawu si do ŋugbe be: "Mègatsi dzi o, elabena nyee nye wò Mawu.
It is real communication with Jehovah God, who promises: "Do not be anxious, for I am your God.
Mado ŋusẽ wò; makpe ɖe ŋuwò. "​ Yesaya 41:10.
I will fortify you, yes, I will help you. "​ Isaiah 41:10.
Ne Wò Dzimaɖitsitsia Nu Sẽ
When Anxiety Is Severe
Sɔhɛ aɖewo tsia dzimaɖi atraɖii.
Some young people suffer from chronic anxiety.

Le kpɔɖeŋu me, sɔhɛ aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Jenna gblɔ be: "Dzimaɖitsitsi wɔe be ta ɖuam enuenu, nye susu meganɔa nu ŋu o, medɔa alɔ̃ ɣeaɖewoɣi ŋkeke geɖe eye ɣebubuɣiwo hã nyemetea ŋu dɔa alɔ̃ o ŋkeke geɖe, ɣeaɖewoɣia nyemetea ŋu ɖua nu kura o, eye ɣebubuɣiwo hã meɖua nu zã​ ⁠metsia dzodzodzoe ɣesiaɣi.

For example, a teenager named Jenna says: "As a result of anxiety, I had a constant headache, I couldn’t focus, I would sleep for days or not sleep for days, I wouldn’t eat, or I would eat too much​ I was wired all the time.
Kuxi suewo dzena nam abe kuxi gãwoe wonye ene. "
Very small problems seemed like mountains. "
Ne wò dzimaɖitsitsia nu sẽ alo enu gbe tsotso la, anyo be nàkpɔ ɖɔkta.
When anxiety is prolonged or excessive, it might be good for you to get a medical checkup.
Nu sia tututue Jenna wɔ.
That’s what Jenna did.
Egblɔ be: "Esi mekpɔ ɖɔkta vɔ megbe la, mete ŋu va le ta kpɔm na ɖokuinye eye metea ɖua nye dzimaɖitsitsia dzi. "
"After receiving treatment, I can handle things better and I have control over my anxiety, " she says.
