Biblia gblɔ na mí be mele be ame nabu "eɖokui ŋu wu ale si dze o. "
The Bible tells us not to think more of ourselves "than it is necessary to think. "
(Romatɔwo 12:3)
(Romans 12:3)
Eya ta esɔ be míabu mía ɖokuiwo ŋu va se ɖe afi aɖe ya teti.
So it’s proper​ even necessary​ to think about yourself to a degree.
Eƒe kpɔɖeŋu aɖewoe nye ale si nèklɔa nu me gbe sia gbe eye nèlea tsi hedzraa ɖokuiwò ɖo nyuie.
That’s why, for example, you brush your teeth and give attention to your hygiene.
Gake ne wò dzedzeme nana be dzi ɖena le ƒowò, eye ɖewohĩ wòna gɔ̃ hã be nèva le dzi tsim ɖe wò dzedzeme ŋu fũu akpa ya ɖe?
What, though, if you frequently get discouraged over your body image​ perhaps to the point of being obsessed about it?
Nenye nenemae la, ke àte ŋu abia ɖokuiwò be . . .
If that’s the case, you might wonder . . .
‘Nu ka tae nyemekpɔa ŋudzedze ɖe nye dzedzeme ŋu o?’
‘Why do I have a negative body image?’
Ate ŋu anye susu geɖewo tae.
There could be several reasons.
Wo dometɔ aɖewoe nye:
These include:
Nyakakadɔwɔlawo ƒe ŋusẽkpɔɖeamedzi.
Influence of the media.
"Nyakakadɔwɔlawo ɖea nu gbogbo aɖewo fia mí sɔhɛwo si wɔnɛ be míedina be míanɔ tsralɛ ahanya kpɔ ɣesiaɣi.
"Young people are bombarded with images that make us feel that we have to be superskinny and gorgeous at all times.
Eya ta ne míete ŋu le nenema tututu o la, míekpɔa ŋudzedze ɖe mía ɖokui ŋu o! "​ Kellie.
As a result, if we’re anything less than perfect, we feel disgusting! "​ Kellie.
Dzilawo ƒe ŋusẽkpɔɖeamedzi.
Influence of parents.
"Mede dzesii be zi geɖe la, ne vidada aɖe tsia dzi ɖe eƒe dzedzeme ŋu fũu akpa la, via nyɔnuvi hã va wɔa nenema.
"I’ve noticed that if a mother is obsessed with her body image, often the daughter views herself the same way.
Esia ate ŋu adzɔ le vifofo kple via ŋutsuvi hã gome. "​ Rita.
It can be the same with fathers and sons. "​ Rita.
Ameɖokuibubu be yemele ɖeke me o.
Low self-esteem.
"Ame siwo tsia dzi ɖe woƒe dzedzeme ŋu fũu akpa la dina ɣesiaɣi be amewo nanɔ nu nyui ƒom tso yewoƒe dzedzeme ŋu.
"People who are obsessed with their body image constantly demand positive reinforcement from others about how they look.
Ame siawo tɔgbi gbɔ nɔnɔ tia ame! "​ Jeanne.
It gets tiring to be around that! "​ Jeanne.
Eɖanye nu ka gbɔe wòtso o, ànya nɔ ɖokuiwò biam be . .
Regardless of the cause, you might be asking . . .
‘Ðe wòle be matrɔ nye dzedzemea?’
‘Should I change the way I look?’
Kpɔ nya siwo hawòti aɖewo gblɔ ɖa.
Consider what some of your peers say.
"Mate ŋu atrɔ nu siwo medzɔa dzi na wò le ɖokuiwò ŋu la ɣesiaɣi o, eya ta lɔ̃ ɖe nu siwo medzea ŋuwò le wò dzedzeme ŋu la dzi.
"You can’t always change the things you don’t like about yourself, so it’s best to accept your flaws.
Ne èwɔe nenema la, manɔ bɔbɔe be ame bubuwo nade dzesi wo o. "​ Rori.
If you do, other people are less likely to notice them. "​ Rori.
"Wɔ nu siwo nàte ŋui be nànɔ lãmesẽ me.
"Do what you can to be healthy.
Ne èle lãmesẽ me la, wò dzedzeme anɔ abe ale si wòle be wòanɔ.
If you’re healthy, you’ll look the way you’re supposed to look.
Ne ame aɖe mate ŋu akpɔ ŋudzedze ɖe ŋuwò le wò nɔnɔme nyuiwo ta o (ke boŋ ɖe wò dzedzeme ta la), ekema menye xɔlɔ̃ nyui o. "​ Olivia.
And if someone can’t appreciate you for who you are (rather than what you look like), that person isn’t your friend. "​ Olivia.
Nya vevitɔ: Wɔ nu si nàte ŋui be nànya kpɔ.
The bottom line: Do what you can to look your best.
Gake mègatsi dzi ɖe susɔeawo ŋu o.
But don’t worry about the rest.
Afɔku le dzitsitsi fũu akpa ɖe ame ƒe dzedzeme ŋu me.
Being overly concerned about how you look can be dangerous.
(Xlẽ " Julia Ƒe Ŋutinya. ")
(See " Julia’s Story. ")
Ne èkpɔa ŋudzedze ɖe wò dzedzeme ŋu la, ana nàda sɔ le ale si nèbua ɖokuiwòe me, abe ale si ɖetugbui aɖe si woyɔna be Erin gblɔe ene.
On the other hand, a balanced attitude will help you view yourself realistically, as a young woman named Erin learned.
"Enye nyateƒe be vɔvɔ̃ nɔa menye, gake meva de dzesii be ne mele nu siwo mesɔ o ŋu bum koe nu sia dzɔna ɖe dzinye.
"Sure, I have insecurities, " she says, "but I notice that I feel bad only when I focus on the wrong things.
Fifia ɖeko medea kame edziedzi eye meɖua nu nyuie.
Now I just exercise regularly and eat right.
Nu susɔeawo ŋutɔ va le wo ɖokui si. "
The rest falls into place naturally. "
Ðɔɖɔɖo nyuitɔ kekeake si nàte ŋu awɔ!
The best makeover ever!
Ne èda sɔ le ale si nèbua wò dzedzemee gome la, wò dzi adze me ŋutɔ (eye wò dzedzeme gɔ̃ hã adze ŋuwò).
When you have a balanced view of your body image, you will feel (and even look) your best.
Biblia ate ŋu akpe ɖe ŋuwò.
The Bible can help.
Ede dzi ƒo na wò be nàtu nɔnɔme siawo ɖo:
It encourages you to cultivate the following:
Ŋudzedzekpɔkpɔ ɖe nu ŋu.
Contentment.
"Nukpɔkpɔ kple ŋku nyo wu nudzodzro ƒe tsa glalã tsatsa. Esia hã tofloko kple dagbadagba ɖe ya me wònye. " Nyagblɔla 6:9.
"It’s better to enjoy what we have than to want something else, because that makes no more sense than chasing the wind. "​ Ecclesiastes 6:9, Contemporary English Version.
Da sɔ le modzakaɖeɖe gome.
A balanced approach to exercise.
‘Ŋutilãmekamedede nyo na nu vi aɖe ko.’ 1 Timoteo 4:8.
"Bodily training is beneficial for a little. "​ 1 Timothy 4:8.
Ememe ƒe nyonyo.
Inner beauty.
"Menye ale si amegbetɔ kpɔa nui o; elabena amegbetɔ kpɔa ŋkunu, ke Yehowa kpɔa keke dzi me ke. " 1 Samuel 16:7, 8.
"Man sees what appears to the eyes; but as for Jehovah, he sees what the heart is. "​ 1 Samuel 16:7.
"Míaƒe moɖoɖo ɖea ale si míesena le mía ɖokui ŋu la fiana.
"Our face shows how we feel about ourself.
Ne ame aɖe kpɔa dzidzɔ ɖe eɖokui ŋu la, ame bubuwo kpɔnɛ dzea sii, eye esia tea wo ɖe amea ŋu. "​ Sarah.
If a person is content, others can see that and they are automatically drawn to that person. "​ Sarah.
"Wò nyonyo ate ŋu ahe amewo ƒe susu kaba ya.
"Prettiness can get quick attention.
Gake ame si nènye le ememe kple wò nɔnɔme nyuiwo dzie amewo aɖo ŋkui wu. "​ Phylicia.
But who you are on the inside and your good qualities are what people will remember about you the most. "​ Phylicia.
Kpɔ Lododowo 11:22; Kolosetɔwo 3:10, 12; 1 Petro 3:3, 4 hã.
See also Proverbs 11:22; Colossians 3:​10, 12; 1 Peter 3:​3, 4.
Julia Ƒe Ŋutinya
Julia’s Story
Esi mexɔ ƒe 16 la, metsi dzi ɖe nye dzedzeme ŋu ŋutɔ.
When I was 16, I had major issues with my weight. I
Nyemelolo akpa o, eye nyemele tsralɛ hã o.
’ve never been overweight, but I’m not naturally skinny either.
Lãme le asinye nyuie.
I was curvy.
Mesusui be ɖewohĩ ne mele tsralɛ la, nunye alé dzi na ɖekakpuiwo wu.
I thought that just maybe, if I were slender, guys would like me.
Eya ta megbea nuɖuɖu ale be mazu tsralɛ.
So I almost starved myself in order to achieve the body I wanted.
Meva zu tsralɛ, gake esia he lãmesẽkuxiwo hã vɛ nam.
I got skinny, but I ended up with health problems as a result.
Meva kpɔ lãmesẽkuxi mawo gbɔ ya, gake nɔnɔmea gatena ɖe dzinye kokoko.
These were addressed, but the emotional effects are still there.
Va se ɖe egbe la, avu kple kɔe nuɖuɖu nyena nam.
To this day, I have issues with food.
Vivivi meva lɔ̃ ɖe ale si nye dzedzeme le dzi.
I’ve slowly come to terms with my body.
Meɖua nu nyuie eye medea kame hã.
I eat right and exercise.
Gake ne mekpɔ dziku ɖe ɖokuinye ŋu la, nu gbãtɔ si mewɔna tsɔ hea to na ɖokuinyee nye be megbea nuɖuɖu.
But when I’m upset with myself about something, my automatic reaction is to punish myself by not eating.
Nenye ɖe wòanya awɔ la, maɖo aɖaŋu na sɔhɛwo katã be wonenyae be ame sia ame kple ale si wòbua nuwo ŋue.
If I could, I would tell other young people to remember that everyone has a different perspective.
Aleke kee wò dzedzeme le o, godogodoa ànya kpɔ na ame aɖewo, gake ame aɖe agblɔ be mènya kpɔ o.
No matter what you look like, there will always be some people who think you’re attractive and others who don’t.
Nu vevitɔae nye be èle lãmesẽ me.
The important thing is that you’re healthy.
Esiae le vevie na ame siwo tsɔ ɖe le eme na wò ŋutɔŋutɔ.
That’s what matters to those who truly care about you.
Aleke Mawɔ Aɖu Nu Siwo Me Nunyiame Le?
How Can I Have a Balanced Diet?
Anɔ eme be ènya be ne yemeɖu nu siwo me nunyiame le o la, ate ŋu agblẽ nu le wò lãmesẽ ŋu.
You probably know that an unbalanced diet can damage your health.
Zi geɖe la, ame siwo mele lãmesẽ me le woƒe sɔhɛme o la meva nɔa lãmesẽ me le woƒe tsitsime hã o, eya ta ade dziwò wu ne èsrɔ̃ ale si nànɔ nu ɖum nyuie fifia.
Unhealthy youths often become unhealthy adults, so it’s good for you to develop healthy eating habits now.
Nu kae nye nuɖuɖu si me nunyiame le?
What is a balanced diet?
Aleke mawɔ anɔ nuɖuɖu siwo me nunyiame le la ɖum?
How can I stick to a balanced diet?
Nya siwo hawòtiwo gblɔ
What your peers say
Nu kae nye nuɖuɖu si me nunyiame le?
What is a balanced diet?
Biblia gblɔ na mí be ‘míada asɔ le nuwɔna me,’ eye esia bia be míada asɔ le míaƒe nuɖuɖu me hã.
The Bible tells us to be "moderate in habits, " and that includes our eating habits.
(1 Timoteo 3:11)
(1 Timothy 3:11) With this principle in mind, it’s good to know that . . .
Ne esia le susu me na mí la, ke anyo be míanya be . . .
A balanced diet includes all food groups.
Nuɖuɖu si me nunyiame le nye esi me nuɖuɖu ƒe hatsotsoawo katã le.
The five food groups include dairy products, proteins, fruits, vegetables, and grains.
Nuɖuɖu ƒe hatsotso atɔ̃awoe nye nu siwo me nyinotsi le, nuɖuɖu siwo me protein le, atikutsetsewo, amagbewo kple nukuwo.
Some people eliminate one or more food groups from their diet, thinking that doing so will help them lose weight.
Gake esia wɔwɔ ate ŋu ana nàte nunyiame vevi siwo wò ŋutilã hiã lae.
But that approach can deprive your body of the very nutrients it needs.
Te mɔnu sia kpɔ: Ku nu me alo bia gbe wò ɖɔkta be nànya nu si tae wònyo be nàɖu nuɖuɖu ƒe hatsotso vovovoawo.
Try this: Do research or consult your doctor to learn about the benefits of the various substances found in foods.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me:
For example:
Nunyiame siwo míekpɔna tso nuɖuɖuwo abe bli kple agbeli ene me (Carbohydrates alo hydrates de carbone) ate ŋu ado ŋusẽ wò ŋutilã.
Carbohydrates can give you energy. Proteins can help your body fight infection and also build and repair tissues.
Nuɖuɖu siwo me protein le ate ŋu akpe ɖe wò ŋutilã ŋu wòakpe akɔ kple dɔlékuiwo eye wòaɖɔ ŋutilãa ɖo.
Certain fats in the right amount can lower your risk of heart disease and keep you feeling your best.
Ami aɖewo ɖuɖu le agbɔsɔsɔ nyuitɔ me ate ŋu awɔe be màxɔ dzidɔ kaba o eye wòana ŋusẽ nanɔ ŋuwò.
"I try to have balanced meals from all food groups.
Azɔ hã, nyemekpɔe be egblẽ be maɖu vemevivinu alo ɖaƒlee aɖe zi ɖeka ya teti ɣeaɖewoɣi o.
Also, I don’t think it’s wrong occasionally to have a candy bar or eat fast food.
Gake menye emawo ɖeɖe koe wòle be ame nanɔ ɖuɖum o.
But that shouldn’t be all a person’s diet consists of.
Anyo be míada asɔ ɣesiaɣi. "
Moderation is always a good rule to follow. "
Brenda.
Brenda.
Ðekakpui aɖe le anyi dzem esi wòte kpɔ be yeanɔ anyi ɖe zikpui aɖe si te afɔti etɔ̃ pɛ ko le la dzi
A young man tipping over in a chair with three legs
Nuɖuɖu si me nunyiame veviwo mele o la, le abe zikpui aɖe si afɔti ɖeka meli na o ene
A diet that is missing vital nutrients is like a chair that is missing a leg
Nu siwo me nunyiame le ɖuɖu bia be ame nada asɔ.
A balanced diet avoids extremes.
Esia fia be nàƒo asa na nu sue aɖe ko ɖuɖu alo nuɖuɖu zã zi ɖeka, eye be nàgate nuɖuɖu aɖe si doa dzidzɔ na wò la ɖokuiwò keŋkeŋ o.
These might include not eating enough, binge eating, or denying yourself an occasional treat.
Te esia kpɔ: Le ɣleti ɖeka me la, lé ŋku ɖe nu siwo nèɖuna ŋu.
Try this: For a month, keep track of your eating habits.
Zi nenie nèwɔ nu siwo ŋu míeƒo nu tsoe fifia be nàƒo asa na la dometɔ ɖeka?
How often do you go to one of the extremes described above?
Asitɔtrɔ kawoe nàte ŋu awɔ be nànɔ nu siwo me nunyiame le ɖum?
What adjustments can you make to have a balanced diet?
"Tsã la, meɖua nu siwo me ŋutilãnyinu (calories) le fũu la zã zi ɖeka eye ɣebubuɣiwo la, meɖua nu siwo me ŋutilãnyinu mele tututu o.
"I had extremes of very-high-calorie binge days and very-low-calorie strict days.
Mlɔeba, metso nya me be nyemagatsi dzi ɖe ŋutilãnyinu ƒe agbɔsɔsɔ si le nye nuɖuɖu me ŋu o, maɖɔ ŋu ɖo be nyemagaɖu nu tsu o, eye matɔ te nu si ɖum mele ne menya ɖi ƒo ko.
Finally, I decided to stop counting calories, to be careful not to overeat, and to stop eating when I was full.
Exɔ ɣeyiɣi, gake fifia meɖua nu siwo me nunyiame le le agbɔsɔsɔ nyuitɔ me. "
It took time, but now I have a balanced diet. "
Hailey.
Hailey.
Aleke mawɔ anɔ nuɖuɖu siwo me nunyiame le la ɖum?
How can I stick to a balanced diet?
Wɔ ɖoɖo ɖe nu si nàɖu ŋu do ŋgɔ.
Think ahead.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Veviedola ƒe ɖoɖowo hea dzidzedzekpɔkpɔ vanɛ. "
The Bible says: "The plans of the diligent surely lead to success. "
(Lododowo 21:5)
(Proverbs 21:5)
Hafi nu siwo me nunyiame le ɖuɖu nama mí la, ele be míawɔ ɖoɖo nyui ɖe nu siwo míanɔ ɖuɖum ŋu.
To succeed in having healthy eating habits takes forethought.
"Ebia ɖoɖowɔwɔ be nàɖu siwo me nunyiame le, eye zi geɖe la, ehiã be wò ŋutɔ nàɖae le aƒe me.
"It takes planning to eat healthier, and oftentimes healthy food has to be prepared at home.
Togbɔ be ema wɔwɔ mele bɔbɔe o hã la, mlɔeba eɖea vi wu, eye ate ŋu aɖe ga si nàzã dzi akpɔtɔ. "
But it’s worth the effort in the long run, and it can also save you money. "
Thomas.
Thomas.
Ðu nu siwo me nunyiame le ɖe esiwo me nunyiame mele o la teƒe.
Replace unhealthy choices.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Lé nunya vavãtɔ me ɖe asi. "
The Bible says: "Safeguard practical wisdom. "
(Lododowo 3:21)
(Proverbs 3:21)
Nunya vavãtɔ akpe ɖe ŋuwò be nàbu mɔ siwo dzi nàto aɖu nu siwo me nunyiame le ŋu eye nànɔ nu siwo aɖe vi na wò la ɖum.
Practical wisdom will help you to get creative and find methods that work best for you.
"Medzea agbagba be maɖu nu siwo me nunyiame le ɖe esiwo me nunyiame mele o teƒe zi ɖeka gbe sia gbe.
"I started to make healthy swaps, one per day.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, le esi teƒe be maɖu kpetike la, meɖua apple (pomme) boŋ.
For example, instead of eating a candy bar, I ate an apple.
Kaka makpɔa, meva nɔ nu siwo me nunyiame le la ɖum geɖe wu! "
Before long I was making many healthy swaps each day! "
Kia.
Kia.
Mègatsi dzi fũu akpa o.
Have reasonable expectations.
Biblia gblɔ be: ‘Ðu wò abolo kple dzidzɔ.’
The Bible says: "Eat your food with rejoicing. "
(Nyagblɔla 9:7)
(Ecclesiastes 9:7)
Be nàɖu nu siwo me nunyiame le mefia be màse vivi na wò nuɖuɖu o, eye mefia hã be nàtsi dzi ɖe nu sia nu si nàɖu la ŋu o.
Having a balanced diet shouldn’t take the joy out of eating, nor does it require that you obsess about every morsel of food you take into your body.
Ne ehiã be nàɖe wò lolome dzi akpɔtɔ gɔ̃ hã la, ɖo ŋku edzi be wò taɖodzinue nye be nànɔ lamesẽ me.
Even if you need to lose weight, remember that your goal is to be healthy.
Mègatsi dzi fũu akpa ɖe nu siwo nèdina tso ɖokuiwò si la ŋu o.
Be reasonable about what you expect of yourself.
"Nyitsɔ laa la, medze agbagba be maɖi ku vie gake le esia wɔwɔ me la, nyemewɔ dɔfu ɖokuinye alo te nuɖuɖu aɖewo ɖokuinye o, eye nyemebua fɔ ɖokuinye ne meɖu vemevivinu aɖe hã o.
"I recently lost 30 pounds, and through this journey I never starved myself, cut out a food group, or beat myself up for eating a dessert.
Melɔ̃ ɖe edzi be esia wɔwɔ manɔ bɔbɔe nam o eye be ehiã be mawɔ asitɔtrɔwo le nu siwo meɖuna ŋu gbe sia gbe. "
I accepted the fact that this wasn’t going to be a quick process and that it truly is a lifestyle change. "
Melanie.
Melanie.
Nya siwo hawòtiwo gblɔ
What your peers say
Delayna
Delayna
"Ne nyemele aƒe me o eye dɔ le wuyem la, nyemeɖua nu gbagbe aɖeke o.
"When I’m out and let myself go hungry, I tend to make poor food choices.
Esia tae medina be maɖa nu ɖe asi alo nuɖuɖu aɖe nanɔ ŋunye.
That’s why I like to pack my lunch or take a snack with me.
Ne mewɔe alea la, enɔa bɔbɔe nam be maɖu nu nyui. "
That way, I have a lot more control over what I eat. "
Delayna.
Delayna.
Andrew
Andrew
"Dzi ate ŋu aɖe le ƒowò ne èkpɔ be ame aɖewo ɖua nu sia nu si wodi evɔ meɖea fu na wo o.
"You can get discouraged when you see others who seem to eat whatever they want yet suffer no ill effects.
Gake mègatsɔ ɖokuiwò sɔ kple wo o.
Don’t compare yourself to them.
Dze agbagba nànya nuɖuɖu siwo nyo na wò eye nànɔ wo ɖum. "
Find out what works for you and focus on that. "
Andrew.
Andrew.
Numetoto: Aleke Mawɔ Aɖu Nu Siwo Me Nunyiame Le?
Review: How can I have a balanced diet?
Wɔ ɖoɖo ɖe nu si nàɖu ŋu do ŋgɔ.
Think ahead.
Wò ŋutɔ ɖa nuɖuɖu si nàɖu tsɔ wu be nànɔ ɖaƒlee ɖe sia ɖe si nèkpɔ la ƒlem.
Make your own meals instead of relying on whatever is available when you are outside the home.
Ðu nu siwo me nunyiame le ɖe esiwo me nunyiame mele o la teƒe.
Replace unhealthy choices.
Na numeɖenu nyuiwo nanɔ alɔ dzi na wò tsɔ wu be nàƒle akpɔnɔ vivi aɖu kple aha vivi.
Keep healthy snacks available instead of just grabbing a bag of potato chips with a soft drink.
Mègatsi dzi fũu akpa o.
Have reasonable expectations.
Mègatsɔ ɖokuiwò sɔ kple ame bubuwo o.
Don’t compare yourself to other people.
Nu Kae Mawɔ Ne Wowɔa Anyra Le Ŋunye?
What if I’m Being Bullied?
Nu kae nye anyrawɔwɔ le ame ŋu?
What is bullying?
Nu ka tae amewo wɔa anyra le wo haviwo ŋu?
Why do people bully others?
Ame kawo ŋue wowɔa anyra le wu?
Who is most likely to be a target?
Nu kae nàte ŋu awɔ ne wowɔa anyra le ŋuwò?
What can you do if you’re bullied?
Xlẽ aɖaŋu siwo hawòtiwo ɖo kple nya si nufiala aɖe gblɔ tso anyrawɔwɔ le ame ŋu ŋu eye nàwɔ dodokpɔ si le nyati sia ƒe nuwuwu.
Also, read tips from your peers and a teacher’s comments about bullying, and take our bullying quiz.
Anyrawɔwɔ le ame ŋu menye fefenya kura o.
Bullying is no trivial matter.
Eŋlisiawo ƒe numekuku aɖe ɖee fia be sɔhɛ siwo wu wo ɖokuiwo siwo ŋu woƒo nu tsoe le nyadzɔdzɔwo me la dometɔ 40 le alafa me tso anyrawɔwɔ le ame ŋu gbɔ.
A British study found that more than 40 percent of the youth suicides reported in the national media appeared to involve bullying as a contributing factor.
Nu kae nye anyrawɔwɔ le ame ŋu?
What is bullying?
Anyrawɔwɔ le ame ŋu yi ŋgɔ wu nu vevi wɔwɔ ame ko.
Bullying includes more than physical assaults.
Nu siwo gbɔna hã le eme.
It can also involve the following.
Nya veamewo gbɔgblɔ ɖe ame ŋu.
Verbal attacks.
Celine si xɔ ƒe 20 gblɔ be: "Nyɔnuviwo ƒe nyawo vena wu abi.
"Girls can be brutal with their words, " says 20-​year-old Celine.
Nyemaŋlɔ fewuɖuŋkɔ siwo woyɔ nam kple fewuɖunya siwo wogblɔ ɖe ŋunye la be gbeɖe o.
"I’ll never forget the names they called me or the things they said.
Wona mese le ɖokuinye me be nyemele ɖeke me o, womelɔ̃ nye nya o, eye be nyemele bo aɖeke nu o.
They made me feel worthless, unwanted, and good-for-nothing.
Ne ɖe woƒo nye ŋku dzi wòdo ʋusrã la anyo nam wu. "
I’d rather have been given a black eye. "
Ameɖeɖe le ha me.
Social isolation.
Haley si xɔ ƒe 18 gblɔ be: "Nye sukuhatiwo medina be mate ɖe yewo ŋu o.
"My schoolmates started to avoid me, " says 18-​year-​old Haley.
Wowɔna abe ɖe mɔ vɔ le míaƒe ŋdɔnuɖuxɔ me ene ale be nyemagava nɔ anyi ɖe yewo gbɔ o.
"They would make it seem that there was no room at the lunch table so I couldn’t sit with them.
Ƒe ɖeka sɔŋ, mefaa avi eye nye ɖeka koe ɖua nu. "
For the whole year, I cried and ate alone. "
Anyrawɔwɔ le ame ŋu to Internet dzi.
Cyberbullying.
Daniel si xɔ ƒe 14 gblɔ be: "Àte ŋu aŋlɔ nya ʋɛ aɖewo le kɔmpiuta dzi atsɔ agblẽ ame aɖe ƒe ŋkɔ alo eƒe agbe dome gɔ̃ hã.
"With just a few keystrokes on a computer, " says 14-​year-​old Daniel, "you can ruin someone’s reputation​ or even his life.
Adze amiɖeɖe ɖe nya, gake ate ŋu adzɔ! "
It sounds like an overstatement, but it can happen! "
Internet dzi anyrawɔwɔ ɖe ame ŋu lɔ foto ɖigbɔwo kple nya ƒaƒãwo ŋɔŋlɔ ɖo ɖe ame to asitelefon dzi.
Cyberbullying also includes sending harmful photos or text messages using a cell phone.
Nu ka tae amewo wɔa anyra le wo haviwo ŋu?
Why do people bully others?
Zi geɖe la susu siwo gbɔna tae.
These are some common reasons.
Wowɔa anyra ɖe woawo ŋutɔwo hã ŋu.
They themselves have been bullied.
Sɔhɛ aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Antonio gblɔ be: "Ale si hanyetiwo wɔa anyra ɖe ŋunye va glom eye etsɔtsɔ va wum ale gbegbe be nye hã mede asi anyrawɔwɔ ɖe amewo ŋu me be hanyetiwo nalɔ̃ nye nya gbɔ.
"I was so sick and tired of being mistreated by my peers that I began to bully others just to fit in, " admits a young man named Antonio.
Esi meva bu nye nuwɔna ma ŋu emegbe la, mekpɔe be bometsinue wònye mewɔ! "
"Later I looked back and realized how wrong it was to do that! "
Womeɖoa kpɔɖeŋu nyui ɖi na wo be woasrɔ̃ o.
They have poor role models.

Jay McGraw gblɔ le agbalẽ aɖe si wòŋlɔ (Life Strategies for Dealing With Bullies) me be: "Zi geɖe la sɔhɛ anyrawɔlawo wɔa nu ɖe amewo ŋu . . . abe ale si wokpɔa wo dzilawo, wo fowo, wo dawo kple woƒe ƒometɔ bubuwo wɔa nu ɖe ame ŋui ene. "

"Many times young bullies treat other people . . . the way they see their parents, older brothers and sisters, or other family members treat others, " writes Jay McGraw in his book Life Strategies for Dealing With Bullies.
Wodina be amewo nabu yewo kalẽtɔwoe, evɔ̃ wònye be vɔvɔ̃nɔtɔ wònye.
They act as if they are superior​ and yet they’re insecure.

Barbara Coloroso ŋlɔ le eƒe agbalẽ (The Bully, the Bullied, and the Bystander) me be: "Zi geɖe la, sɔhɛ anyrawɔlawo wɔa nu be woakpɔ be yewoe sesẽ wu ale be amewo naganya be nu te ɖe yewo dzi eye yewodo kpo nu o. "
"Kids who bully have an air of superiority that is often a mask to cover up deep hurt and a feeling of inadequacy, " notes Barbara Coloroso in her book The Bully, the Bullied, and the Bystander.
Ame kawo ŋue wowɔa anyra le wu?
Who is most likely to be a target?
Ame siwo ɖe wo ɖokuiwo ɖe aga.
Loners.
Sɔhɛ siwo menya ale si woanɔ anyi kple ame bubuwo o la ɖea wo ɖokuiwo ɖe aga eye wozua nulelé na anyrawɔlawo bɔbɔe.
Some young people who lack social skills isolate themselves from others and become easy marks for bullies.
Sɔhɛ siwo wobuna be woto vovo.
Youths who are perceived as being different.
Anyrawɔlawo nɔa te ɖe nu sia nu dzi wɔa anyra le sɔhɛwo ŋu, eɖanye woƒe dzedzeme, woƒe ŋutigbalẽ, subɔsubɔha si me wole alo nue wɔ afi aɖe na wo gɔ̃ hã.
Some youths are targeted by bullies because of their appearance, race, or religion or even because they have a disability​ anything the bully can pick on.
Sɔhɛ siwo mekana ɖe wo ɖokuiwo dzi o.
Youths who lack self-confidence.
Anyrawɔlawo tea ŋu dea dzesi sɔhɛ siwo meka ɖe wo ɖokuiwo dzi o.
Bullies can detect those who think negatively of themselves.
Woawo ŋue wolɔ̃a anyrawɔwɔ le bɔbɔe, elabe wonya be womake fĩ o.
These are often the easiest targets, since they’re not likely to fight back.
Nu kae nàte ŋu awɔ ne wowɔa anyra le ŋuwò?
What can you do if you’re bullied?
Mègake nu de eme o.
Don’t react.
Ðetugbui aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Kylie gblɔ be: "Anyrawɔlawo dina be yewoakpɔe be yewona wò nu le nublanui wɔm na ɖokuiwò.
"Bullies want to know that they’ve succeeded in making you feel bad about yourself, " says a young woman named Kylie.
Ne meke nu de eme na wo o la, woadzudzɔ. "
"If you don’t react, they lose interest. "
Biblia gblɔ be: "Nunyala ɖua eɖokui dzi. " Lododowo 29:11, Agbenya La.
The Bible says: "He that is wise keeps it calm to the last. "​ Proverbs 29:11.
Mègawɔ wɔɖenui o.
Don’t retaliate.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Migatsɔ vɔ̃ ɖo vɔ̃ teƒe na ame aɖeke o. "
Revenge will add to the problem, not solve it.
Romatɔwo 12:17; Lododowo 24:19.
The Bible says: "Return evil for evil to no one. "​ Romans 12:17; Proverbs 24:19.
Mègatsɔ ɖokuiwò de eme o.
Don’t walk into trouble.
Ne anya wɔ la, ƒo asa na ame siwo ate ŋu awɔ anyra le ŋuwò kple nɔnɔme siwo me esia ate ŋu ado mo ɖa le keŋkeŋ. Lododowo 22:3.
To the extent possible, avoid people and situations where bullying may occur.​ Proverbs 22:3.
Ðo nya ŋu nɛ le mɔ si makpɔ mɔ na o nu.
Try an unexpected response.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Nyaŋuɖoɖo fafɛ tsia dziku nu. "
The Bible says: "An answer, when mild, turns away rage. "​ Proverbs 15:1.
Lododowo 15:1.
Use humor.
Tsɔ eƒe nyawo nukonyae. Le kpɔɖeŋu me, ne amea gblɔ na wò be èlolo akpa la, àte ŋu akɔ abɔta dzi ko agblɔ be, "Ðe madi be maɖi ku vie hafi. "
For example, if a bully asserts that you’re overweight, you could simply shrug your shoulders and say, "I guess I could lose a few pounds! "
Dzo.
Walk away.
Nora si xɔ ƒe 19 gblɔ be: "Ne èzi ɖoɖoea àɖee fia be yetsi le susu me eye yesesẽ wu anyrawɔlaa.
"Silence shows that you are mature and that you are stronger than the person harassing you, " says 19-year-old Nora.
Aɖee fia be èɖua ɖokuiwò dzi, si nye nu si anyrawɔlaa mete ŋu le wɔwɔm o. "
"It demonstrates self-control​ something the bully doesn’t have. "
Tu kakaɖedzinɔamesi ɖo.
Work on your self-confidence.
Nyɔnuvi si ŋkɔe nye Rita gblɔ be: "Ne mèvo le ɖokuiwò me o la, anyrawɔlawo akpɔe adze sii, eye woate ŋu azã esia atsɔ agblẽ kakaɖedzi ɖe sia ɖe si le mewò la dome. "
"Bullies notice when you aren’t relaxed, " says a girl named Rita, "and they might use that to destroy whatever self-​confidence you have. "
Gblɔe na ame aɖe.
Tell someone.
Le numekuku aɖe nu la, ame siwo ŋu wowɔ anyra le le Internet dzi ƒe agbɔsɔsɔme si wu afã mekɔa nu le edzi o, ɖewohĩ ŋukpe (vevietɔ le ŋutsuviwo gome) alo vɔvɔ̃ be amea ava tu nu kpli ye tae.
According to one survey, more than half of all victims who are bullied online don’t report what’s going on, possibly because of shame (especially for boys) or fear of retaliation.
Gake ɖo ŋkui be ne mèkɔ nu le nyaa dzi o la, ɖeko anyrawɔwɔa gasẽna ɖe edzi.
But remember, bullies thrive on secrecy.
Egbɔgblɔ na ame aɖe ate ŋu anye afɔ gbãtɔ si wòhiã be nàɖe ado go le agba kpekpe ma te.
Speaking up can be the first step to ending the nightmare.
Aɖaŋu siwo hawòtiwo ɖo
Tips from your peers
"Ƒo asa na teƒe alo nɔnɔme siwo me woate ŋu awɔ anyra le ŋuwò bɔbɔe.
"Avoid places or situations that will make you an easy target for a bully.
Ðo ŋkui be kuxiwo le anyrawɔlawo ŋutɔ hã ŋu.
Remember, too, that bullies are going through their own issues.
Ne ède dzesi esia la, woƒe nyawo magave wò tututu o. "​ Antonio.
When you know that, it takes some of the sting out of their words. "​ Antonio.
"Ka ɖe ɖokuiwò dzi.
"Be confident in yourself.
Dzi nenɔ ƒowò nàgblɔ wò susuwo.
Don’t be afraid to stand up for what you believe.
Anyrawɔla geɖewo ana ta ne wokpɔe be yewomete ŋu le dziwò kpem o alo mèle vɔvɔ̃m o. "​ Jessica.
Many bullies back off when they see that you aren’t giving them any power over you and that you aren’t afraid. "​ Jessica.
Nya si nufiala aɖe gblɔ
A teacher’s comments
"Kuxi gã aɖee anyrawɔwɔ le ame ŋu nye.
"Bullying is a serious problem.
Le suku si me mefiaa nu le la, kɔ bia dzo le sukuviwo dome ne mele nu fiam, xɔ ẽtɔviwo gɔ̃ hã daa kɔ!
Where I taught school, fights broke out right inside the classroom​ even among third graders!
Anyrawɔwɔ dzɔa dzi na ame aɖewo elabena enana wosena le wo ɖokuiwo me be yewoxɔ ŋkɔ eye yewoɖo asi ame sia ame dzi.
Some kids thrive on bullying because it makes them feel that they’re popular and in control.
"Zi geɖe la, ame siwo ŋu wole anyra wɔm le la mekɔa nu le nyaa dzi o elabena wovɔ̃na be anyrawɔlaa ava tu nu kpli yewo loo alo yewo tɔwo abu yewo be yewonye sakplitɔwo.
"Often, victims hesitate to report bullying because they’re scared that the bully will retaliate or that their classmates will view them as a snitch.
Wovɔ̃na hã be womawɔ naneke tso nyaa ŋu be anyrawɔla nadzudzɔ o.
They may also be skeptical about whether anything will be done about the bullying.
Ke hã made dzi ƒo na ame sia ame si ŋu wole anyra wɔm le la be wòakɔ nu le edzi.
Still, I would urge anyone who is being bullied to speak up.
Esiae nye nu nyuitɔ, eye ate ŋu awɔe hã be amea magawɔ nu sia ɖe ame bubuwo hã ŋu o. "​ Jenilee , ame si nye sukunufiala tsã le United States.
It’s the right thing to do, and it can prevent someone else from being bullied. "​ Jenilee, a former schoolteacher in the United States.
Dodokpɔ
Bullying quiz
Nyateƒee alo aʋatsoe
True or False
Anyrawɔwɔ li tso keke blema ke.
Bullying has been around for thousands of years.
Fewuɖuɖu le ame ŋu dzro ko anyrawɔwɔ nye.
Bullying is just harmless teasing.
Mɔ nyuitɔ si dzi nàto ana anyrawɔlaa nadzudzɔe nye be wò hã nàkɔe kpee nɛ.
It’s not that serious. The best way to stop a bully is to fight back.
Ne wowɔ anyra le ŋuwò la, wò ŋutɔ gbɔwòe wòtso.
If you’re being bullied, it’s your fault.
Ame siwo ŋu wowɔ anyra le la dometɔ aɖewo hã va zua anyrawɔlawo.
Some people who are bullied become bullies.
Ne wole anyra wɔm le ame aɖe ŋu nèkpɔ la, nyuitɔae nye be nàɖe kɔ ɖa le eŋu.
If you witness bullying, it’s best to ignore it.
Zi geɖe la, anyrawɔlawo vɔ̃na togbɔ be wonɔa adegbe ƒom hã.
Beneath the boastful talk, bullies are often insecure.
Anyrawɔlawo ate ŋu atrɔ.
Bullies can change.
ŊUÐOÐOAWO
ANSWERS
Nyateƒee.
True.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me Biblia ƒo nu tso Nefilimwo ŋu​ ame siawo ƒe ŋkɔa gɔmee nye "Ameƒuanyilawo. "​ 1 Mose 6:4, NW .
For example, the Bible tells of the Nephilim​ a group whose name means "Those Who Cause Others to Fall Down. "​ Genesis 6:4.
Aʋatsoe.
False.
Woate ŋu awɔ anyra le ame ŋu wòaku.
Bullying can be a life-and-death issue.
Nublanuitɔe la, ame siwo ŋu wowɔ anyra le kutɔkutɔe la dometɔ aɖewo wu wo ɖokuiwo.
Sadly, some who have been relentlessly bullied commit suicide.
Aʋatsoe.
False.
Zi geɖe la, ŋusẽ nɔa anyrawɔlawo ŋu wu ame siwo ŋu wowɔa anyraa le, si wɔnɛ be ne èke atse pɛ be yeawɔ nane la ɖeko woagatu nu kpli ɖe edzi.
Bullies are often physically stronger than their victims, making attempts at retaliation futile.
Aʋatsoe.
False.
Mesɔ be wòawɔ anyra le ame aɖeke ŋu o!
No one deserves to be bullied!
Fɔbubua katã le anyrawɔlaa dzi.
The bully is fully responsible for his or her actions.
Nyateƒee.
True.
Nublanuitɔe la, ame siwo ŋu wowɔ anyra le la dometɔ aɖewo ɖea woƒe dzikua ɖe ame bubuwo ŋu henɔa anyra wɔm ɖe wo ŋu.
Sadly, some take their own frustration out on others by treating them the way that they have been treated.
Aʋatsoe.
False.
Ame aɖeke mate ŋu akpɔ anyrawɔwɔ le ame ŋu teƒe agblɔ be meka ye o.
There’s no such thing as an innocent bystander.
Ne èkpɔ wole anyra wɔm le ame aɖe ŋu gake megblɔ nya aɖeke o la, ekema ède edzi na amea be negayi eƒe nuwɔna dzi le esi nàwɔ tɔwò si nua be amea nadzudzɔ nu ma wɔwɔ teƒe.
If you see bullying and don’t say anything, you may become part of the problem rather than part of the solution.
Nyateƒee.
True.
Togbɔ be dzi nɔa anyrawɔla aɖewo ƒo ŋutɔ hã la, wo dometɔ geɖe vɔ̃na eye wodina be yewoado dzivee na amewo be yewoƒe dzi nadze eme.
Although some bullies have a big ego, many are insecure and put others down to make themselves feel better.
Nyateƒee.
True.
Ne wokpe ɖe anyrawɔlawo ŋu la, woate ŋu atrɔ woƒe tamebubu kple nɔnɔme siaa.​ Efesotɔwo 4:23, 24.
With intervention and help, bullies can change their thinking​ and their behavior.​ Ephesians 4:​23, 24.

If so, don’t hastily conclude that there’s something wrong with you.
Nya lae nye be, ame sia ame léa blanui tso ɣeyiɣi yi ɣeyiɣi.
The fact is, everyone gets sad now and then.

In some cases, you may know why you are sad; in other cases, you may not.

"It can come on at any time, even if your life is trouble free.

Regardless of the cause​ or even if there doesn’t seem to be one what can you do when sadness holds you in its grip?

Ƒo nu tso eŋu.
Talk about it.

Pray about it.

Ne naneke medzɔ o ko melé blanui la, etena ɖe dzinye vevie.
I was sick of being sad when I had no reason to be.
Mlɔeba la, meva ɖu blanuiléle sia dzi.
I finally broke the cycle.
Mègabu vi si gbedodoɖa ɖena la nu tsɛ kura o!
Never underestimate the power of prayer!
Kpekpeɖeŋu si woana wò kple ale si nàdo vevie nu la ate ŋu ana nàvo tso ale si nèléa blanuiléle vevie la si me
With assistance and effort, you can get out of a deep pit of sadness
Aɖaŋuɖoɖo: Srɔ̃ ale si nàdo gbe ɖa na Yehowa to ŋugbledede le Psalmo 139:23, 24 me nyawo ŋu me.
Suggestion: Use Psalm 139:23, 24 as a pattern for your own prayer to Jehovah.
Gblɔ wò dzimenyawo nɛ eye nàbiae be wòakpe ɖe ŋuwò nàde dzesi nu si nana nèléa blanui.
Pour out your heart, and ask him to help you identify the root of your sadness.
Tsɔ kpe ɖe eŋu la, nu xɔasiwo le Mawu ƒe Nya, Biblia me siwo akpe ɖe ŋuwò.
In addition to the suggestions mentioned earlier, you have a valuable resource in God’s Word, the Bible.
Ne èna nya tuameɖo siwo le Biblia me la xɔ susu me na wò la, akpɔ ŋusẽ nyui ɖe wò seselelãme dzi. Psalmo 1:1-3.
Filling your mind with upbuilding thoughts that can be gleaned from Bible accounts can have a positive effect on your feelings.​ Psalm 1:​1-3.
Ne blanuilélea xɔ zikpui ɖe gbɔwò
When sadness won’t go away
Aƒetɔvi aɖe si woyɔ be Ryan gblɔ be: "Mesena le ɖokuinye me be anyo nam be mayi edzi anɔ anyimlɔƒe wu be mafɔ le aba dzi agadze ŋgɔ ŋkeke manyataleŋu bubu. "
"On some mornings, " says Ryan, "I feel that it would be easier just to stay in bed and avoid having to get up and face another pointless day. "
Blanuiléle si gbɔ ɖɔktawo ko ate ŋu akpɔ ye nɔ fu ɖem na Ryan, eye menye eya ɖeka koe le nɔnɔme sia me o.
Ryan suffers from clinical depression, and he’s not alone.
Numekukuwo ɖee fia be blanuiléle si nu sẽ alo esi nu mesẽ o ɖea fu na sɔhɛ ɖeka le ene ɖe sia ɖe me hafi wòva zua ame tsitsi.
Studies suggest that about 1 in 4 youths suffers from some type of major or minor depression before reaching adulthood.
Aleke nàwɔ anya be blanuiléledɔ lém ye le?
How can you find out if you suffer from depression?

Dzesi siwo nàkpɔ la dometɔ aɖewoe nye ne wò seselelãme alo nuwɔna trɔna zi ɖeka kpata, èɖea ɖokuiwò ɖe aga, ne nuwɔna ɖe sia ɖe kloe megale fu tsɔm le lã me na wò o, nu meganya le ɖuɖum na wò alo mègate ŋu le alɔ̃ dɔm o, èsena le ɖokuiwò me be yemele ɖeke me o alo èbua fɔ ɖokuiwò madzemadzee.

Some symptoms include a pronounced change in mood and behavior, social isolation, diminished interest in almost all activities, a significant change in eating habits and sleeping patterns, and intense feelings of worthlessness or unwarranted guilt.
Nyateƒee, seselelãme siawo dometɔ ɖeka alo esi wu nenema ɖe fu na mía dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe kloe kpɔ.
Of course, nearly everyone has one or more of those symptoms at some time or another.
Gake ne seselelãme sia nu gbe tsotso kwasiɖa geɖe la, ɖe manyo be nàƒo nu tso eŋu na dziwòlawo be woakplɔ wò ayi kɔdzi ne woado wò kpɔ oa?
But if symptoms persist for more than a couple of weeks, why not talk to your parents about getting a checkup?
Ðɔktawo ate ŋu ade dzesii nenye blanuiléledɔ lém nèle.
A physician can help determine if your sadness has a medical cause.
Ne blanuiléledɔ lém nèle la, mehiã be ŋu nakpe wò o.
If you do suffer from clinical depression, it is nothing to be ashamed of.
Eɖanye blanuilélee na nèle sesem le ɖokuiwò me nenema alo nu bubu aɖee o, ɖo ŋku nya fakɔname siwo le Psalmo 34:19 la dzi.
With treatment, many sufferers have begun to feel better​ perhaps the best they have felt in a long time.
Afi ma gblɔ be: "Yehowa tsɔ ɖe ame siwo ƒe dzi gbã gudugudu la gbɔ, eye wòxɔna na ame siwo ƒe gbɔgbɔ woƒo ƒu anyi. "
Whether your sadness is caused by depression or not, remember the comforting words of Psalm 34:18: "Jehovah is near to those that are broken at heart; and those who are crushed in spirit he saves. "

Nu si ta wòle vevie
Why it matters
Wò lãmesẽ.
Your well-being.
Lododowo 14:30 gblɔ be: "Dzi fatu naa agbe ametia. "
Proverbs 14:30 says: "A calm heart gives life to the body. "
Agbalẽ aɖe gblɔ be: "Dzikudodo ate ŋu ana ame nakpɔ dzi kple ʋuka me dɔwo. " Journal of Medicine and Life.
In contrast, the Journal of Medicine and Life says that "anger can have a direct impact upon cardiovascular diseases. "
Xɔ̃wòwo.
Your friends.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Mègade ha kple dɔmedzoetɔ o, eye mègado ka kple dzikutɔ o. "
The Bible says: "Do not keep company with a hot-tempered man or get involved with one disposed to rage. "
(Lododowo 22:24) Eya ta ne èdoa dziku kabakaba la, megawɔ nuku na wò ne amewo melɔ̃na dea ha kple wò o.
(Proverbs 22:24) So if you have anger issues, don’t be surprised if people avoid you.
Ðetugbui aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Jasmine gblɔ be: "Ne mèɖua wò dziku dzi o la, xɔlɔ̃ nyuiwo manɔ asiwò o. "
"If you don’t learn to control your temper, " says a young woman named Jasmine, "you will lose out on rewarding friendships. "
Ale si wonya wòe.
Your reputation.
Ethan si xɔ ƒe 17 gblɔ be: "Ne èdoa dziku kabakaba la, amewo ava nyae na wò eye woanɔ buwòm dzikumee. "
"If you lose your temper, " says 17-year-old Ethan, "it will become known to others and it will shape their opinion of you. "
Bia ɖokuiwò be, ‘Aleke medi be amewo nabum ŋutifafame loo alo ame si dudua eƒe dziku kɔna ɖi bababa?’
Ask yourself, ‘How do I want to be known​ as a coolheaded peacemaker or as a ticking time bomb?’
Biblia gblɔ be: "Ame si medoa dziku kabakaba o la, nugɔmesese bɔ ɖe esi, ke ame si megbɔa dzi ɖi o la ɖea eƒe bometsitsi fiana. " Lododowo 14:29.
The Bible says: "The one who is slow to anger has great discernment, but the impatient one displays his foolishness. "​ Proverbs 14:29.
Ŋutsuvi aɖe si do dziku la ƒe xɔlɔ̃wo he ɖa le eŋu
A teenage boy’s friends back away as he loses his temper
Ame aɖeke medina be yeade ha kple ame si ɖea eƒe dziku ƒona ɖi bababa o
No one wants to be around someone with an explosive temper

What you can do
Kpɔ mawunyakpukpui siawo kple nya siwo amewo gblɔ la ɖa eye nàbia nya siwo le afi sia la ɖokuiwò.
Consider the following scriptures and comments, and ask yourself the accompanying questions.
Lododowo 29:22: "Dɔmedzoetɔ hea dzre vɛ; eye dzikutɔ daa vo geɖe. "
Proverbs 29:22: "A man prone to anger stirs up strife; anyone disposed to rage commits many transgressions. "
"Esi menye sɔhɛ dzaa la, esesẽna nam ŋutɔ be maɖu nye dziku dzi.
"In my early teen years, I had the hardest time controlling my temper.
Kuxi sia ke le fofonye ƒe ƒometɔwo hã ŋu.
My relatives on my dad’s side have the same problem.
Míeyɔnɛ be ƒomenu.
We call it the family gene.
Esesẽna na mí ŋutɔ be míaɖu míaƒe dziku dzi! "​ Kerri.
Our tempers are very hard to control! "​ Kerri.
Ðe medoa dziku veviea?
Am I prone to anger?
Ne evivia nunye ne wokafum ɖe nye nɔnɔme nyuiwo ta ɖe, ɖe wòanyo be maɖe ɖokuinye nu be nye nɔnɔme gbegblẽwo ya la ƒomenue wonye nama?
If I accept credit for my good qualities, is it reasonable to blame genetics for this bad quality?
Lododowo 15:1: "Nyaŋuɖoɖo fafɛ tsia dziku nu, ke gbedaɖeamegbɔ nana dɔmedzoe flana. "
Proverbs 15:1: "A mild answer turns away rage, but a harsh word stirs up anger. "
"Nu vevitɔe nye be nàsrɔ̃ ale si nàɖu ɖokuiwò dzi.
"The key is to learn to control your emotions.
Ne ètu nɔnɔme fatuwo ɖo eye wò susu nɔa nu nyuiwo ŋu la, masesẽ na wò be nàɖu dzikudodo dzi o. "​ Daryl.
If you cultivate a mild personality and focus on the positive, losing your temper won’t be an option​ or an issue. "​ Daryl.
Ne medo dziku la, nu ka tae wòle vevie be malé ŋku ɖe afɔ gbãtɔ si maɖe ŋu?
When provoked, why is my first response crucial?
Lododowo 26:20: "Ne nake meli o la, dzo tsina. "
Proverbs 26:20: "Where there is no wood, the fire goes out. "
"Ne meɖo nya ŋu nyuie la, enana ame kemɛa ƒe dzi fana eye míetea ŋu ɖoa dze le dziɖeɖi me. "​ Jasmine.
"When I respond kindly, it usually calms the other person down and we’re both able to communicate without our emotions spiraling out of control. "​ Jasmine.
Aleke nye nuƒoƒo alo nye nuwɔna ate ŋu ana dziku nafla?
How might my speech or actions only add fuel to the fire?
Lododowo 22:3: "Aɖaŋudzela kpɔa afɔku gbɔna eye wòɣlaa eɖokui, ke ame makpɔnuteƒe yina ɖadea ta eme, eye wòkpɔa emetsonua. "
Proverbs 22:3: "The shrewd one sees the danger and conceals himself, but the inexperienced keep right on going and suffer the consequences. "
"Ɣeaɖewoɣi la, ɖeko medzona le teƒea eye menaa ɣeyiɣi ɖokuinye be mabu nu si dzɔa ŋu ale be mate ŋu akpɔ nyaa gbɔ nyuie. "​ Gary.
"Sometimes I just need to walk away and give myself time to think about what happened, and then I can deal with it later when I’m calm. "​ Gary.
Ɣekaɣie wòanyo be nàdzo ne ame aɖe na wò dzi ho, evɔ mana wòadze be èdo lãtɔ amea o?
When might it be best to walk away from a tense situation without giving the impression that you are turning your back on the other person?
Yakobo 3:2: "Mí katã míedaa vo zi geɖe. "
James 3:2: "We all stumble many times. "
"Ele be míase veve ɖe vo siwo míeda ta eye ele be míasrɔ̃ nu tso wo me hã.

Ele be míaɖɔ vo siwo míeda la ɖo kaba eye míaɖoe be míawɔ nu si nyo wu ɣebubuɣi. "​ Kerri.
We need to get right back up when we fall and resolve to do better next time. "​ Kerri.
Aɖaŋuɖoɖo: Ðo taɖodzinu na ɖokuiwò.
Tip: Set a goal.
Ðoe kplikpaa be yeaɖu ye ɖokui dzi hena ɣeyiɣi aɖe ɖewohĩ hena ɣleti ɖeka.
Resolve that you will remain coolheaded for a certain period of time​ perhaps a month.
Nɔ ale si nuwo le yiyim la ŋlɔm ɖi eye nàde dzesi wò ŋgɔyiyiwo.
Keep a diary and track your progress.

Ðe Xexea Dzɔ Le Eɖokui Sia?​ Akpa 1: Nu Ka Tae Wòle Be Nàxɔ Mawu Dzi Ase?
Creation or Evolution?​ Part 1: Why Believe in God?
Ðe wowɔ xexea alo eya ŋutɔ koe dzɔ le eɖokui sia?
Creation or evolution?
Nu ka tae mexɔ Mawu dzi se?
Why do I believe in God?
Ale si maɖe nye dzixɔsea me
Explaining my belief
Ðe wowɔ xexea alo eya ŋutɔ koe dzɔ le eɖokui sia?
Creation or evolution?
Èxɔe se be Mawue wɔ nuwo katã?
Do you believe that God created all things?
Ne èxɔe se la, ke menye wò ɖeka koe o, sɔhɛ (kple ame tsitsi) gbogbo aɖewo hã xɔe se nenema.
If so, you’re not alone; many young people (and adults) share your view.
Gake ame bubuwo ya be ɖeko nu gbagbewo kple xexea dzɔ le wo ɖokui si, menye "Ŋusẽkatãtɔ " aɖekee na wodzɔ o.
But others say that life and the universe evolved​ without the help of a "Supreme Being. "
Ènyaa?
Did you know?
Ame siwo xɔe se be ɖe wowɔ nuwo kple ame siwo gblɔna be ɖe nuwo dzɔ le wo ɖokuiwo si la siaa tea tɔ ɖe woƒe susuwo dzi evɔ wometea ŋu ɖoa kpe woƒe nyawo dzi o.
People on both sides of the debate are often quick to state what they believe without really knowing why they believe it.
Ame aɖewo xɔe se be ɖe wowɔ xexea kple emenuwo, elabe nenemae wofia wo le tsɔtsi.
Some people believe in creation simply because that’s what they’ve been taught at church.
Ame geɖewo hã xɔe se be ɖeko xexea kple emenuwo dzɔ le wo ɖokui si elabe nenemae wofia wo le suku.
Many people believe in evolution simply because that’s what they’ve been taught at school.
Nyati vovovo siawo akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàgaxɔe se geɖe wu be Mawue wɔ xexea kple nu gbagbewo eye àsu te nyuie aɖe wò dzixɔsea me na amewo.
This series of articles will help you to reinforce and explain your belief in creation.
Gake gbã la, ehiã be nàbia nya bɔbɔe sia ɖokuiwò:
First, though, you need to ask yourself an even more basic question:
Nu ka tae mexɔ Mawu dzi se?
Why do I believe in God?
Nu ka tae biabia sia le vevie?
Why is that question important?
Elabe Biblia de dzi ƒo na wò be nàzã wò "tamebubuŋutete. "
Because the Bible encourages you to use your mind, "your power of reason. "
(Romatɔwo 12:1) Esia fia be wò mawudzixɔse manɔ te ɖe
(Romans 12:1) That means your belief in God should not be based merely on
seselelãme dzro ko dzi o (Efia be menye esi nèse le ɖokuiwò me be ele be ŋusẽtɔ aɖe nanɔ anyi ta koe nèxɔ Mawu dzi se ɖo o)
emotion (I just feel that there must be a higher power)
ame bubuwo ƒe susu dzi o (Menye esi nutoa me tɔwo nye mawusubɔlawo tae wò hã nàgblɔ be yexɔ Mawu dzi se o)
the influence of others (I live in a religious community)
ŋusẽkpɔɖeamedzi dzi o (Efia be menye esi dziwòlawo fia wò be ele be nàxɔ Mawu dzi se alo susu mawo tɔgbi aɖe ko tae o)
pressure (My parents raised me to believe in God​ or else)
Ke boŋ ele be wò ŋutɔ nàka ɖe edzi be Mawu li eye ele be nu siwo tae nèxɔe se nenema ƒe kpeɖodziwo nanɔ asiwò.
Instead, you should be personally convinced that God exists and should have sound reasons for your belief.
Ke nu kae na nèka ɖe edzi be Mawu li?
So, what convinces you that God exists?
Dɔwɔgbalẽvi si nye "Nu Ka Tae Mexɔ Mawu Dzi Se? " akpe ɖe ŋuwò kakaɖedzi ma nasu asiwò.
The worksheet "Why Do I Believe in God? " will build your conviction.
Anyo hã be nàkpɔ ale si sɔhɛ bubuwo ɖo nyabiase sia ŋui.
You might also find it helpful to consider how other young people have answered that question.
"Ne mele sukuxɔ me le to ɖom nufiala wòle ale si míaƒe ametia wɔa dɔe me ɖem la, ɖeko megakana ɖe edzi bliboe be Mawu li.
"When I’m in class listening to the teacher explain how our bodies function, there’s no doubt in my mind that God exists.
Míaƒe ŋutinu ɖe sia ɖe, nyaŋuitɔ kekeake gɔ̃ hã, wɔa dɔ aɖe. Zi geɖe la, míenyana gɔ̃ hã be wole dɔ wɔm o.
Each part of the body has its own function, down to the smallest detail, and these functions are often carried out without our awareness.
Nyateƒee, míaƒe ametia gɔme sese ɖu ta! "​ Teresa.
The human body truly is mind-boggling! "​ Teresa.
"Ne mekpɔ xɔ kɔkɔ, meli alo ʋu aɖe la, mebiaa ɖokuinye be, ‘Ame kae wɔe?’
"When I see a skyscraper, a cruise ship, or a car, I ask myself, ‘Who built this?’
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, ehiã be aɖaŋu nanɔ tagbɔ na ame hafi wòate ŋu awɔ ʋu, elabe ele be ʋuŋutinu suesue geɖeawo nawɔ dɔ pɛpɛpɛ hafi ʋu blibo la nawɔ dɔ nyuie.
It takes intelligent people to build a car, for example, because so many small components have to work just right for the whole thing to function.
Nenye be ʋu mate ŋu adzɔ le eɖokui si o ele be ame aɖe kokoko nawɔe la, ke ele be ame aɖe nawɔ mí amegbetɔwo hã. "​ Richard.
And if cars have to be designed by someone, then so do we humans. "​ Richard.

"Ne ède dzesii be ehiãna be amegbetɔ tagbɔɖaɖɛtɔwo kekeake gɔ̃ hã nasrɔ̃ nu tso xexemenuwo ŋu ƒe agbogbo aɖewo hafi wotea ŋu esea eƒe akpa suetɔ kekeake gɔ̃ hã gɔme la, ke susu aɖeke manɔ eme be woagblɔ be menye nunyala aɖekee wɔ xexe sia o! "​ Karen.

"When you realize that it’s taken the most intelligent human minds hundreds of years to understand even the smallest fraction of the universe, then thinking that it took no intelligence to bring that universe into existence seems completely unreasonable! "​ Karen.
"Zi ale si meyi edzi le dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunya srɔ̃m la, zi nenemae mekpɔnɛ be kpeɖodzi aɖeke mele nufiafia si nye be ɖeko xexea kple emenuwo dzɔ le wo ɖokui si la ŋu o.
"The more I studied science, the less credible evolution seemed.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, mede ŋugble tso ale si xexemenuwo le ɖoɖo nu pɛpɛpɛ, ale si amegbetɔwo le etɔxɛe, ale si mí amegbetɔwo míedina be míanya afi si míetso kple afi si míeɖo tae la ŋu.
For example, I thought about the mathematical precision in nature and the uniqueness of humans, including our need to know who we are, where we came from, and where we are going.
Nɔnɔmetɔtrɔfialawo dzea agbagba be yewoazã nu siwo do ƒome kple lãwo atsɔ aɖe nya siawo mee, gake wometea ŋu ɖea nu si tae amegbetɔwo ya le etɔxɛe la me o.
Evolution aims to explain all these things in terms associated with animals, but it has never been able to explain why humans are unique.
Le gonyeme la, ebia be xɔse ŋkuagbã geɖe nanɔ ame si hafi wòaxɔe se be nuwo ŋutɔ koe dzɔ le wo ɖokuiwo si, wu be ame naxɔe se be Wɔla aɖe li. "​ Anthony.
To me, it takes more ‘faith’ to believe in evolution than to believe in a Creator. "​ Anthony.
Ale si maɖe nye dzixɔsea me
Explaining my belief
Ke ne wò sukuxɔmeviwo koa wò be èxɔ nane si mekpɔna o dzi se ya ɖe?
What if classmates ridicule you for believing in something you can’t see?
Alo be dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunyalawo "ɖo kpe " edzi be ɖeko nuwo dzɔ le wo ɖokui si ya ɖe?
What if they say that science has "proved " evolution?
Gbã la, ka ɖe nu si dzi nèxɔ se la dzi.
First, be confident in what you believe.
Vɔvɔ̃ megaɖo wò o eye ŋu hã megakpe wò o.
Do not be intimidated or ashamed.
(Romatɔwo 1:16) Ðo ŋku edzi be:
(Romans 1:​16) After all, remember:
Menye wò ɖeka koe xɔ Mawu dzi se o; ame geɖewo xɔ edzi se.
You are not alone; many people still believe in God.
Ame siawo dometɔ aɖewo gɔ̃ hã nye nunyala gãwo.
That includes highly intelligent, professional people.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunyala aɖewo gɔ̃ hã xɔe se be Mawu li.
For example, there are scientists who believe there is a God.
Ɣeaɖewoɣi la, ne amewo gblɔ be yewomexɔ Mawu dzi se o la, nu si wowɔnae nye be yewomesea Mawu ƒe nuwɔnawo gɔme o.
When people say that they don’t believe in God, sometimes what they really mean is that they don’t understand God.
Le esi woaɖo kpe woƒe nyawo dzi teƒe la, nyawo ko wonɔa biabiam. Wotea ŋu biana be, "Ne Mawu li ŋutɔŋutɔ la, ke nu ka tae wòɖe mɔ fukpekpe li? "
Rather than offer evidence to support their view, they raise questions such as, "If God exists, why does he allow suffering? "
Le nyateƒe me la, wotrɔ nya aɖe si hiã tamebubu wɔ seselelãmenyae.
In effect, they turn an intellectual issue into an emotional one.
"Gbɔgbɔmenuwo hiã " amegbetɔwo.
Humans have a "spiritual need. "
(Mateo 5:3) Esia lɔ Mawu dzi xɔxɔ se ɖe eme.
(Matthew 5:3) This includes a need to believe in God.
Eya ta ne ame aɖe gblɔ be Mawu meli o la, eya dzie agba le be wòaɖe nu si tae wòƒo nya ta nenema ɖo la me, ke menye wò agbae o.​ Romatɔwo 1:18-20.
So if someone says there is no God, that person​ not you​ has the responsibility to explain how he or she could reach such a conclusion.​ Romans 1:​18-​20.
Esɔ le goawo katã me be míaxɔ Mawu dzi se.
Belief in God is entirely reasonable.
Esia wɔ ɖeka kple nyateƒenya aɖe si dzi woɖo kpee, si nye be nu gbagbe mate ŋu adzɔ le eɖokui si o.
It conforms to the proven fact that life cannot come into existence by itself.
Kpeɖodzi aɖeke meli be nu gbagbe ate ŋu adzɔ le eɖokui si tso nu si me agbe mele o me o.
No evidence exists to support the idea that life could spontaneously come from nonliving matter.
Ekema nya kae nàte ŋu agblɔ ne ame aɖe tsɔ nya ɖe ŋuwò be mesɔ be nàxɔ Mawu dzi ase o?
What, then, could you say if someone questions your belief in God?
Kpɔ nu siwo nàte ŋu awɔ dometɔ ʋɛ aɖewo ɖa.
Consider a few possibilities.
Ne ame aɖe gblɔ be: "Ame manyagbalẽwo koe xɔa Mawu dzi se. "
If someone says: "Only uneducated people believe in God. "
Àte ŋu aɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Èda asi ɖe susu totro ma dzi ŋutɔŋutɔa?
You could respond: "Do you really accept that stereotype?
Nye ya nyemeda asi ɖe edzi o.
I don’t.

Le nyateƒe me la, esi wobia gbe nufialagã 1,600 siwo tso yunivɛsiti xɔŋkɔ vovovowo me la, ne woma wo me ɖe akpa etɔ̃ la, akpa ɖeka gblɔ be yewomenye mawudzimaxɔselawo loo alo ame siwo bunɛ be womate ŋu anya ne Mawu li o.
In fact, in a survey in which more than 1,600 science professors from various elite universities took part, a third did not claim to be atheist or agnostic.
Àyɔ nufialagã mawo be wonye ame manyanuwo le esi woxɔ Mawu dzi se ta? "
Would you call those professors unintelligent just because they believe in God? "
Ne ame aɖe gblɔ be: "Ne Mawu li la, ke nu ka tae fukpekpe li alea gbegbe? "
If someone says: "If God exists, why is there so much suffering in the world? "
Àte ŋu aɖo eŋu nɛ be: "Ewɔ nam be èdi be yeagblɔ be yemesea Mawu ƒe nuwɔnawo gɔme o​ alo le go sia me la, ewɔ na wò abe mele naneke wɔm tso nɔnɔmeawo ŋu o ene.
You could respond: "Perhaps what you mean is that you don’t understand how God acts​ or in this case, doesn’t seem to act.
Alo menye nenemae oa?
Is that right?
[Ðe mɔ wòaɖo eŋu.]
[Allow for response.]
Meva ke ɖe nu si tae fukpekpewo li alea gbegbe ɖo la ƒe ŋuɖoɖo fakɔnamewo ŋu.
I’ve found a satisfying answer to the question about why there is so much suffering.
Gake ehiã be nàdzro Biblia ƒe nufiafia geɖewo me hafi nàte ŋu ase nya sia gɔme.
But understanding it takes an examination of several Bible teachings.
Àdzɔ dzi na wò be yeasrɔ̃ nu geɖe wua? "
Would you be interested in learning more? "
Ðe Xexea Dzɔ Le Eɖokui Sia?

Akpa 2: Nu Ka Tae Mele Be Nàxɔ Nɔnɔmetɔtrɔ Ƒe Nufiafia Dzi Ase O?
Creation or Evolution?​ Part 2: Why Question Evolution?
Alex tɔtɔ kura.
Alex is confused.
Exɔ Mawu dzi se tso gbe aɖe gbe ke eye wòxɔe se hã be ɖe wowɔ xexea.
He has always believed in God and in creation.
Gake egbea woƒe nugbagbeŋutinunyafiala gblɔe gbeteɖedzitɔe be dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunya vavã dzie wotu nu gbagbewo ƒe nɔnɔmetɔtrɔ ƒe nufiafia ɖo.
But today his biology teacher forcefully claimed that evolution is a fact, that it is based on credible scientific research.
Alex medi be woabu ye bometsilae o.
Alex doesn’t want to appear to be foolish.
Egblɔ na eɖokui be: ‘Ne dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunyalawo ɖo kpe nɔnɔmetɔtrɔ ƒe nufiafia dzia, ame kae menye atɔ gbe wo?’
‘After all,’ he says to himself, ‘if scientists have proved evolution to be true, who am I to question them?’
Èse le ɖokuiwò me alea kpɔa?
Can you identify with this scenario?
Ðewohĩ èxɔ nya si Biblia gblɔ be "le gɔmedzedzea me Mawu wɔ dziƒo kple anyigba " la dzi se le wò agbe me katã.
Perhaps for all your life, you’ve believed what the Bible says: "God created the heavens and the earth. "
(1 Mose 1:1) Gake nyitsɔ laa la, amewo va le agbagba dzem be yewoana nàxɔe ase be nyakpakpae nya siwo wogblɔna be ɖe wowɔ xexea la nye eye be nɔnɔmetɔtrɔ ƒe nufiafia boŋue nye nyateƒea.
(Genesis 1:1) Yet, recently people have been trying to convince you that creation is a myth and that evolution is a fact.
Ðe wòle be nàxɔ wo dzi asea?
Should you believe them?
Nu ka tae mele be nàxɔ nɔnɔmetɔtrɔ ƒe nufiafia dzi ase o?
Why question evolution?

Susu eve siwo tae mele be nàxɔ nɔnɔmetɔtrɔ ƒe nufiafia dzi ase o
Two reasons to question evolution
Dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunyalawo ƒe susuwo to vovo le ale si nu gbagbewo wɔ trɔ la ŋu.
Scientists don’t agree on evolution.
Togbɔ be dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunyalawo ku me geɖe tso nu gbagbewo ƒe nɔnɔmetɔtrɔ ŋu hã la, woƒe susu mewɔ ɖeka o.
Despite decades of research, scientists have yet to come up with an explanation for evolution that they all can agree on.

Bu nya sia ŋu: Ne dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunyala siwo wòle be woaɖu tu na nya siwo ku ɖe nɔnɔmetɔtrɔ ƒe nufiafia ŋu ŋutɔ hã mete ŋu le ta kpɔm na nya sia o la, ɖe wòanye nu gbegblẽ ne mèxɔ woƒe nufiafia ma dzi se oa?​ Psalmo 10:4.
To think about: If scientists can’t agree on evolution​ and they’re supposed to be the experts​ are you wrong to question the theory?​ Psalm 10:4.
Nu si dzi nèxɔ se le vevie.
It matters what you believe.
Ŋutsuvi si ŋkɔe nye Zachary gblɔ be: "Ne ɖeko nu gbagbewo dzɔ le wo ɖokuiwo si la, ke viɖe aɖeke mele míaƒe agbe kple xexea blibo la katã ŋu o. "
"If life came about by accident, then our lives​ and all the things in our universe​ are meaningless, " says a boy named Zachary.
Susu le eƒe nyaa me.
He has a point.
Nya lae nye be nenye be ɖeko nuwo dzɔ le wo ɖokui si la, ke efia be tameɖoɖo gobi aɖeke mele míaƒe agbe ŋu.
After all, if evolution were true, life would not seem to have any lasting purpose.
(1 Korintotɔwo 15:32) Evɔ nenye nyateƒe be ɖe wowɔ xexea kple emenuwo la, míate ŋu akpɔ ŋuɖoɖo fakɔnamewo na nyabiase siwo ku ɖe tameɖoɖo si le agbe ŋu kple ale si etsɔme anɔ ŋu.​ Yeremiya 29:11.
(1 Corinthians 15:32) On the other hand, if creation is true, we can find satisfying answers to questions about the purpose of life and what the future holds.​ Jeremiah 29:11.
Bu nya sia ŋu: Vi kae nyateƒe si ku ɖe nɔnɔmetɔtrɔ ƒe nufiafia kple xexemewɔwɔ ŋu nyanya aɖe na wò?​ Hebritɔwo 11:1.
To think about: How would knowing the truth about evolution and creation make a difference in your life?​ Hebrews 11:1.

Questions to consider
NYA SI AMEWO GBLƆNA: ‘Nu siwo katã le xexea me la dzɔ tso nane si wò kpoyi le vo me la gbɔ.’
CLAIM: ‘Everything in the universe came as a result of a random big bang.’
Ame kae na nua wò alo nu kae na wòwò?
Who or what caused the big bang?
Eka mee susu le wu, be woaxɔe se be nu siwo katã le xexea me metso naneke gbɔ o loo alo be woaxɔe se be nane alo ame aɖe gbɔe nu siwo katã le xexea me tso?
Which makes more sense​ that everything came from nothing or that everything came from something or someone?
NYA SI AMEWO GBLƆNA: ‘Lãwoe nɔ tɔtrɔm ʋuu va zu amegbetɔwo.’
CLAIM: ‘Humans evolved from animals.’
Nenye lãwo, abe kesewo ene mee amegbetɔwo dzɔ tso ɖe, ke nu ka tae amegbetɔwo nya nu sãsãsã wu kesewo?
If humans evolved from animals​ from apes, for example​ why is there such a huge gap between the intellectual abilities of humans and those of apes?
Nu ka tae nu gbagbe "kpokploetɔ " kekeake gɔ̃ hã ƒe wɔwɔme de ŋgɔ ŋutɔ?
Why are even the most "basic " forms of life so incredibly complex?
NYA SI AMEWO GBLƆNA: ‘Kpeɖodziwo li be ɖeko nu gbagbewo dzɔ le wo ɖokuiwo si.’
CLAIM: ‘Evolution is a proven fact.’
Ðe ame si gblɔ nya sia ŋutɔ ku nu me hekpɔ kpeɖodziwoa?
Has the person making this claim investigated the evidence for himself?
Ðe ame gbogbo mawo xɔ nɔnɔmetɔtrɔ ƒe nufiafia dzi se le esi wogblɔ na wo be nunyalawo katã hã xɔ edzi se ta?
How many people believe in evolution simply because they have been told that all intelligent people believe in it?

Creation or Evolution?​ Part 3: Why Believe in Creation?
"Ne èxɔe se be ɖe wowɔ xexea kple emenuwo la, amewo abu wò movitɔe, woagblɔ be èle ɖevinu wɔm, nu siwo dziwòlawo fia wò me ko nèlé ɖe asi, alo subɔsubɔhawo flu tagbɔ na wò. "​ Jeanette.

"Nye nufiala gblɔ be ame siwo ɖɔe ale gbegbe be womate ŋu aɖe ale si xexemenuwo wɔa dɔe gɔme o lae xɔnɛ sena be ɖe wowɔ xexea kple emenuwo "​ Maria.

What you should know: Those who make such claims are not aware of the facts.
Dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunyala xɔŋkɔwo abe Galileo kple Isaac Newton ene gɔ̃ hã xɔe se be Wɔla aɖe li.
Famous scientists such as Galileo and Isaac Newton believed in a Creator.
Woƒe dzixɔse sia mewɔe be womegalɔ̃ dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunya o.
Their belief did not conflict with their love for science.
Nenema kee, dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunyala siwo li egbea dometɔ aɖewo lɔ̃ dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunya vevie eye wogaxɔe se hã be ɖe wowɔ xexemenuwo.
Likewise, some scientists today find no conflict between science and belief in creation.

The bottom line: Belief in creation doesn’t make you antiscience.
Le nyateƒe me la, nusɔsrɔ̃ tso dzɔdzɔmenuwo ŋu ana nàkpɔ kpeɖodzi geɖe be ɖe wowɔ xexea kple emenuwo.​ Romatɔwo 1:​20.
In fact, learning more about the natural world can strengthen your belief in creation.​ Romans 1:​20.
Ne èxɔe se be ɖe wowɔ xexea abe ale si Biblia gblɔe ene la, ke amewo abu be mawudzixɔsela zazɛ̃nyahelae nènye.
If you believe in the Bible’s account of creation, people will think you’re a religious fanatic.
"Ame geɖewo bua ame siwo xɔe se be ɖe wowɔ xexea be womele ɖeke me nyam o.
"A lot of people consider belief in creation to be a joke.
Wobua nya siwo le Mose Ƒe Agbalẽ Gbãtɔ me la nyakpakpawo. "​ Jasmine.
They feel that the Genesis account is just a story. "​ Jasmine.
Nu si wòle be nànya: Ame geɖe mesea nya si Biblia gblɔ tso xexemewɔwɔ ŋu la gɔme o.
What you should know: People often have misconceptions about the Bible’s account of creation.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, mawudzixɔsela aɖewo hã gblɔna be nyitsɔ laa koe wowɔ anyigba eye ŋkeke ade siwo wotsɔ wɔ anyigbadzinuwo la dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe nye gaƒoƒo 24.
For example, some creationists claim that the earth was recently created or that life was created in six 24-hour days.
Biblia meda asi ɖe nya siawo dometɔ aɖeke dzi o.
The Bible does not support either viewpoint.
Ðeko 1 Mose 1:1 gblɔ be: "Le gɔmedzedzea me Mawu wɔ dziƒo kple anyigba. "
Genesis 1:1 simply states: "In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth. "
Esia metsi tsitre ɖe kpeɖodzi si ŋu dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunyalawo ke ɖo be anyigba li ƒe miliɔn akpe geɖee nye esia la ŋu o.
This does not conflict with scientific evidence that the earth is billions of years old.
Nya "ŋkeke " si wozã le Mose Ƒe Agbalẽ Gbãtɔ me la ate ŋu afia ɣeyiɣi didi aɖe.
The word "day " as used in Genesis can refer to long periods of time.
Le nyateƒe me la, woyɔ ŋkeke ade siwo katã wotsɔ wɔ anyigba kple edzinuwo be "ŋkeke " le 1 Mose 2:4, Xexe Yeye Gɔmeɖeɖe Biblia.
In fact, at Genesis 2:4, the word "day " is used to describe all six days of creation.
Nya vevitɔ: Nya si Biblia gblɔ tso xexea kple emenuwo wɔwɔ ŋu wɔ ɖeka kple kpeɖodzi siwo ŋu dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunyalawo ke ɖo.
The bottom line: The Bible’s account of creation is in harmony with scientific facts.
De ŋugble tso wò dzixɔsewo ŋu
Think about your beliefs
Nyae be ne wobe nàxɔe ase be ɖe wowɔ xexea la, menye ɖe wobe nàxɔe se tamemabumabui o.
Belief in creation does not require "blind faith. "
Ke boŋ ebia be nàde ŋugble tso kpeɖodziawo ŋu.
Rather, it rests on sound reasoning.
Bu esia ŋu kpɔ:
Consider this:
Le xexe sia me la, ne èkpɔ aɖaŋunu aɖe ko la, ènyana be aɖaŋuwɔla aɖee wɔe.
Everything you experience in life teaches you that where there is design, there is a designer.
Ne èkpɔ fotoɖemɔ̃, yameʋu alo aƒe aɖe la, èƒoa nya ta enumake be ame aɖee wɔe alo tsoe.
When you see a camera, a plane, or a house, you rightly conclude that someone designed it.
Ðe susu manɔ eme wu be nàƒo nya ta nenema ke ne èkpɔ amegbetɔ ƒe ŋku, xeviwo le yame alo míaƒe anyigba la oa?
Why should you abandon that logic when you consider the human eye, a bird in the sky, or our planet Earth?
Bu nya sia ŋu: Aɖaŋuwɔlawo kpɔa anyigbadzinuwo ƒe nɔnɔme tsɔ trɔa si le woƒe aɖaŋudɔwo ŋu woganyona wu eye wokpɔa mɔ be amewo nade dzesii be yewoe nye nuawo wɔlawo.
To think about: Engineers often copy traits that they observe in nature so that they can improve their own inventions, and they rightly want others to acknowledge their work.
Ðe susu le eme be míalɔ̃ ɖe amegbetɔwo ƒe agbagbadzedzewo dzi evɔ míagbe dzesidede Wɔla la kple eƒe nuwɔwɔ siwo de ŋgɔ sãsãsã la?
Is it logical to recognize the human inventor and his work and yet fail to acknowledge the Creator and His far superior designs?
Yameʋu kple xevi aɖe le dzodzom
An airplane and a bird in flight
Ðe susu anɔ eme be woagblɔ be ame aɖee wɔ yameʋu gake menye ame aɖekee wɔ xevi ya oa?
Is it reasonable to think that an airplane was designed but a bird was not?
Nu siwo akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàdzro kpeɖodziawo me

You can strengthen your conviction in creation by inspecting the evidence found in nature.

Was Life Created?
Anyigba le afi si sɔ pɛpɛpɛ le yame ale be agbe nanya nɔ le edzi.​ Kpɔ axa 4-​10.
The earth is perfectly located and equipped to support life.​ See pages 4-​10.
Nu siwo ɖee fia be ɖe wowɔ nuwo.​ Kpɔ axa 11-​17.
Examples of design are found in nature.​ See pages 11-​17.
Nya si Biblia gblɔ tso xexemewɔwɔ ŋu le Mose Ƒe Agbalẽ Gbãtɔa me wɔ ɖeka kple dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunya.​ Kpɔ axa 24-​28.
The Bible’s account of creation in Genesis is in harmony with science.​ See pages 24-​28.
The Origin of Life​ Five Questions Worth Asking alo Cinq questions à se poser sur l’origine de la vie
The Origin of Life​ Five Questions Worth Asking
Agbe mate ŋu adzɔ tso nu siwo me agbe mele o me le eɖokui si o.​ Kpɔ axa 4-7.
Life could not have begun spontaneously from nonliving matter.​ See pages 4-7.
Nu gbagbewo ƒe wɔwɔme de ŋgɔ ale gbegbe be womate ŋu adzɔ le wo ɖokui si o.​ Kpɔ axa 8-​12.
Living organisms are too complex to have developed through undirected, spontaneous events.​ See pages 8-​12.
Dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunyala siwo li egbea mete ŋu wɔ naneke si tea ŋu xɔa nyatakaka gbogbowo abe domenyiŋusẽfianuwo ene o.​ Kpɔ axa 13-​21.
The information capacity within the genetic code surpasses modern technology.​ See pages 13-​21.
Nu gbagbewo katã medzɔ tso nu gbagbe ɖeka me o.
All life did not descend from a common ancestor.
Lãwo ƒe ŋutinu siwo ŋu woke ɖo le tomenukuku me la, ɖo kpe edzi be lãwo ƒe hatsotso gãgãwo dzɔ le ɣeyiɣi ɖeka me, ke menye nu gbagbe sue aɖee nɔ tɔtrɔm vivivi ʋuu va zu lã gãwo o.​ Kpɔ axa 22-​29.
The fossil record supports the sudden appearance of major animal groups, not their gradual development.​ See pages 22-​29.
"Xexemenuwɔwɔwo, tso anyigbadzilãwo dzi va ke ɖe xexe gbahooa kple ɖoɖo si nu nuwo le le xexea me dzi, na meka ɖe edzi keŋ be Mawu li. "​ Thomas.
"The natural world convinces me most about God’s existence, from the animals here on earth to the universe and the order that exists in it. "​ Thomas.

Ðe Xexea Dzɔ Le Eɖokui Sia? Akpa 4: Aleke Maɖe Nu Si Tae Mexɔe Se Be Ðe Wowɔ Xexea La Me?
Creation or Evolution?​ Part 4: How Can I Explain My Belief in Creation?
Èxɔe se be ɖe wowɔ xexea kple emenuwo, gake èvɔ̃na na nuƒoƒo tso wò dzixɔsewo ŋu na wò sukuhatiwo.
You believe in creation, but you’re reluctant to say so openly at school.
Ðewohĩ wogblɔ le sukugbalẽ siwo miezãna le suku la me be ɖeko nuwɔwɔwo dzɔ le wo ɖokui si eye nèvɔ̃na be wò nufialawo kple sukuhatiwo ako ye.
Maybe your textbooks endorse evolution and you worry that teachers and classmates might make fun of you.
Aleke nàwɔ be dzi nanɔ ƒowò nàɖe nu si tae nèxɔe se be ɖe wowɔ xexea me nuwo la me na amewo?
How can you speak up confidently and explain your belief in creation?

You can do it!

What your peers say
Àte ŋui!
You can do it!
Ðewohĩ àgblɔ be: ‘Nye tagbɔ meɖa nenema gbegbe be mava yi nu me ɖe ge tso dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunya kple nɔnɔmetɔtrɔ ƒe nufiafia ŋu o.’
You might think: ‘I’m not smart enough to discuss science and debate evolution.’
Nenemae Danielle se le eɖokui me ɣeaɖeɣi.
That’s how Danielle felt at one time.
Egblɔ be: "Dzi menɔa ƒonye kura be maʋli nya kple nye nufiala kple nye sukuhatiwo o. "
"I hated feeling that I had to contradict my teacher and my classmates, " she says.
Diana hã gblɔ nya ma ke, "Metɔtɔna ne wòva hiã be maɖe nu me ku ɖe dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunya ŋu. "
Diana agrees, "I got confused when they argued using scientific terms. "
Ke hã, menye ale si nàɖu dzi le nya la mee le vevie o.
However, your goal is not to win arguments.
Eye mele be nànye tagbɔɖaɖɛtɔ le dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunya gome hafi nàte ŋu aɖe nu si tae nèxɔe se be susu le eme be woagblɔ be ɖe wowɔ xexea me nuwo la me o.
And the good news is that you don’t need to be a genius at science to explain why you find creation to be a rational explanation for the natural world.
Kpekpeɖeŋu: Zã nya si me susu le si dze le Hebritɔwo 3:4 nàtsɔ aɖe nu mee. Afi ma gblɔ be: "Aƒe sia aƒe la, ame aɖee tsonɛ, gake ame si wɔ nuwo katã lae nye Mawu. "
Tip: Use the simple logic found in the Bible at Hebrews 3:4: "Every house is constructed by someone, but the one who constructed all things is God. "
Ðetugbui aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Carol zã Hebritɔwo 3:4 tsɔ de ŋugble kple ame aɖe ale: "Tsɔe be èle zɔzɔm le ave dodo aɖe me.
A young woman named Carol reasons on the principle of Hebrews 3:4 this way: "Imagine that you’re walking through a dense forest.
Mèkpɔ ame ƒe nuwɔna aɖeke le afi ma o.
Every evidence of a human being is miles away.
Kaka nàkpɔ la, aɖutomeɖeti aɖee nye ema le anyigba.
You then look down and see a toothpick on the ground.
Aleke nàƒo nya tae?
What is your conclusion?
Ame akpa gãtɔ agblɔ be, ‘Ame aɖe va afi sia kpɔ.’
Most people would say, ‘Someone else has been here.’
Ne aɖutomeɖeti si meɖi naneke o gɔ̃ hã te ŋu ɖo kpe edzi be amegbetɔ aɖe nɔ afi ma kpɔ la, ke ɖe xexe gbahoo sia kple emenuwo meɖo kpe edzi geɖe wu be ame aɖe si si nunya le lae wɔ wo oa! "
If something as small and insignificant as a toothpick is evidence of intelligent life, how much more so is the universe and all that’s in it! "
Ne ame aɖe gblɔ be: "Ne nyateƒee wònye be Wɔla aɖee wɔ xexea la, ke ame kae wɔ Wɔla la ŋutɔ? "
If someone says: "If creation is true, then who created the Creator? "
Àte ŋu aɖo eŋu be: "Mímate ŋu aƒo nya ta be Wɔlaa meli o le esi mímenya nu tso eŋu tsitotsito o ta o.
You could respond: "Just because we don’t understand everything about the Creator doesn’t mean he doesn’t exist.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, anɔ eme be mènya ame si wɔ wò asitelefon la o, gake ɖe maxɔe ase be ame aɖe kokokoe wɔe oa?
For example, you may not know the history of the person who designed your cell phone, but you still believe it was designed by somebody, right?
[Ðe mɔ wòaɖo eŋu.]
[Allow for response.]
Nu geɖewo li míate ŋu asrɔ̃ tso Wɔlaa ŋu.
There’s so much we can know about the Creator.
Ne èdi be yeanya la, adzɔ dzi nam be magblɔ nu si mesrɔ̃ tso eŋu la na wò. "
If you’re curious, I’d be happy to share what I’ve learned about him. "
Dzra ɖo
Be ready

Biblia gblɔ na mí be "minɔ dzadzraɖoɖi ɣesiaɣi be miaʋli mɔkpɔkpɔ si le mia si la ta le ame sia ame si abia nya mi tso eŋu la ŋkume, gake mitsɔ tufafa kple bubu deto wɔ esiae. " (1 Petro 3:15) Eya ta, nu vevi eve siawo nenɔ susu me na wò​ nya si nàgblɔ kple ale si nàgblɔe.

The Bible says that you should be "ready to make a defense before everyone who demands of you a reason for the hope you have, but doing so with a mild temper and deep respect. " (1 Peter 3:​15) Therefore, give attention to two factors​ what you say and how you say it.
Nya si nàgblɔ.
What you say.
Lɔlɔ̃ si le asiwò na Mawu ate ŋu aʋa wò nàƒo nu tso eŋu.
Your love of God is important and can motivate you to speak up.
Gake egbɔgblɔ na amewo be yelɔ̃ Mawu ɖeɖe dzaa mate ŋu ana woaka ɖe edzi be Mawu ye wɔ nuwo katã o.
But just telling others how much you love God may not be enough to convince them that God created all things.
Anyo ŋutɔ ne èzã dzɔdzɔmenuwo tsɔ wɔ kpɔɖeŋuwo na wo ale be woakpɔe be susu le eme be yewoaxɔe ase be ɖe wowɔ xexemenuwo.
It might be best to use examples from nature to show why it is rational to believe in creation.
Ale si nàgblɔe.
How you say it.
Dzi nenɔ ƒowò, gake mègado vlo amewo alo ada wo ɖe anyi o.
Be confident, but don’t be rude or condescending.
Woate ŋu alɔ̃ aɖo to wò numeɖeɖewo ne mèdaa woƒe dzixɔsewo ɖe anyi o eye nèlɔ̃na ɖe edzi be gome le woawo ŋutɔ si be woatso nya me le nya siawo ŋu.
People are likely to consider your viewpoint if you speak respectfully about their beliefs and acknowledge their right to come to their own conclusions.
"Mebui be ele vevie be míaƒo asa na vlododo amewo alo nye-koe-nyae wɔwɔ.
"I think it’s important never to come across as insulting or as a know-it-all.
Maɖe vi aɖeke ne míeƒoa nu na amewo gbedaɖeamegbɔtɔe o. "​ Elaine.
It would be counterproductive to speak in a condescending tone. "​ Elaine.
Nu siwo akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàɖe wò dzixɔsewo me

As Alicia points out, preparation is vital to success.
Jenna gblɔ be, "Ne medzra ɖo ɖe kpɔɖeŋu nyui aɖe ŋu do ŋgɔ be matsɔ aɖo kpe nye nyawo dzi la, dzi nɔa ƒonye be maɖe nu me na amewo tso xexea me wɔwɔ ŋu. "
Jenna states, "I feel much more comfortable discussing creation when I have a simple yet well-thought-out example to back up my belief. "

Those qualities make you think of others rather than yourself.
Susu manɔ eme be míagblɔ be ɖeko nɔnɔme nyui mawo le mía si le wo ɖokuiwo si o. "​ Brittany.
It doesn’t make sense to me to say that those qualities evolved. "​ Brittany.

Breanna
"Esi menɔ nugbagbeŋutinunya srɔ̃m la, mesrɔ̃ nu ku ɖe míaƒe lãmenugbagbeviwo ƒe wɔwɔme kple woƒe dɔwɔwɔ ŋu.

Why it matters
Ðe nèbua amedzudzu be enye ŋkubiãnya?
Do you view cursing as a serious matter?
Ðewohĩ àgblɔ be: ‘Menye nenema gbegbe o.
‘Not really,’ you might say.
Agbemenya sesẽwo li wu esia siwo ŋu wòle be míatsi dzi ɖo.
‘After all, there are bigger problems in the world to worry about.
Gawu la, ame sia ame dzua ame!’
Besides, everybody curses!’
Nyateƒeea?
Is that really true?
Togbɔ be ate ŋu asesẽ na wò be nàxɔe se hã la, ame geɖewo li siwo melɔ̃a amedzudzu o.
Believe it or not, there are many people who refrain from using bad language.
Eye wonya nanewo tso nuwɔna sia ŋu siwo ame bubuwo ya menya o.
And they know a few things that others don’t know.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me:
For example:
Amedzudzu ɖea ha ame si tɔgbi nènye.
Cursing isn’t just about words.
Wò nyagbɔgblɔwo ɖea ame si tututu nènye le ememe la fiana.
Your speech reveals what is going on inside you.
Eya ta ne ègblɔa nya veamewo na amewo la, aɖee fia be mètsɔa ɖeke le amewo ƒe seselelãmewo me o.
Using foul language, then, could indicate that you are insensitive to the feelings of others.
Nenema tututue nèlea?
Is that the kind of person you really are?
Biblia gblɔ be: "Nu siwo doa go tso nu me la tsoa dzi la me. "​ Mateo 15:18.
The Bible says: "Whatever comes out of the mouth comes from the heart. "​ Matthew 15:18.
Sɔhɛ aɖewo mekpɔ dzidzɔ ɖe ŋutsuvi aɖe ƒe amedzudzu ŋu kura o
A group of teenagers shrink back in disgust as a teenage boy curses
Nya madzetowo gbɔgblɔ ƒoa ɖi ame ƒe susu me.
Profanity is verbal pollution.
Nu ka tae nàdi be yeana nya siawo naƒo ɖi ye ŋutɔ loo alo ame bubuwo ƒe susu me?
Why subject others​ or yourself​ to it?
Amedzudzu ate ŋu ana be amewo mabu susu nyui ɖe ŋuwò o.
Cursing can cause others to think negatively of you.

Agbalẽ aɖe gblɔ be: "Ale si míeƒoa nui la kpɔa ŋusẽ ɖe ame siwo míadze xɔlɔ̃e, bubu si tɔgbi míaƒe ƒometɔwo kple dɔwɔhatiwo ade mía ŋu, ale si mí kple ame bubuwo dome anɔ, ale si amewo abu míaƒe nyawoe, míaƒe dɔkpɔkpɔ alo dodoɖeŋgɔ le dɔ me kple ale si ame manyamanyawo awɔ nu ɖe mía ŋui la dzi. "

The book Cuss Control says: "The way we speak can determine who our friends will be, the amount of respect we will get from our families and coworkers, the quality of our relationships, how influential we will be, whether we get the job or the promotion, and how strangers respond to us. "
(Cuss Control) Egagblɔ be: "Bia ɖokuiwò be, ɖe wòate ŋu adzɔ be ye kple amewo dome nava nɔ nyuie wu nenye be yemedzua ame o mahã. "
It also says: "Ask yourself if your relationships could, perchance, be even better if you didn’t swear. "
Biblia gblɔ be: "Miɖe . . . nya veame ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi ɖa. "​ Efesotɔwo 4:31.
The Bible says: "Put away . . . abusive speech. "​ Ephesians 4:31.
Amedzudzu mana amewo nabu wò be wò nu me bi abe ale si wò ŋutɔ nàsusui ene o.
Swearing doesn’t make you sound as cool as you might think. In his book How Rude!
Agbalẽnyalagã Alex Packer gblɔ le eƒe agbalẽ aɖe me be: "Ame siwo dzua ame ɣesiaɣi la ƒe nu ɖe wòtia ame. "
Dr. Alex Packer states: "People who swear all the time are tiresome to listen to. "
(How Rude!) Egblɔ kpee be nya veamewo gbɔgblɔ menana be "nunya, sidzedze, nugɔmesese kple veveseɖeamenu dzena le ame ƒe nyawo me o.
He adds that a profanity-filled vocabulary "doesn’t allow for the expression of much insight, wit, intelligence, or empathy.
Ne wò nyawo nɔa yrɔ, wometua ame ɖo o, eye mèbua wo ŋu nyuie hafi gblɔna o la, akpɔ ŋusẽ ɖe ale si nèbua tamee dzi godoo. "
If your speech is lazy, vague, and unimaginative, your mind is sure to follow. "
Biblia gblɔ be: "Migana nya ƒaƒã aɖeke nado tso miaƒe nu me o. "​ Efesotɔwo 4:29.
The Bible says: "Let a rotten word not come out of your mouth. "​ Ephesians 4:​29.
Nu si nàte ŋu awɔ
What you can do
Ðo taɖodzinu.
Set a goal.
Ðe manyo be nàtso nya me be yeadzudzɔ nya veamewo gbɔgblɔ le ɣleti ɖeka alo esi mede nenema o mea?
Why not try to eliminate bad language in one month or less?
Àte ŋu anɔ dzesi dem ŋgɔyiyi siwo wɔm nèle ɖe agbalẽ alo ɣletigbalẽ dzi.
You could track your progress on a chart or a calendar.
Gake ehiã be nàgawɔ nu bubu aɖewo hã hafi nàte ŋu alé wò nyametsotso sia me ɖe asi.
To stick to your resolve, however, you may need to take further steps.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me:
For example:
Ƒo asa na modzakaɖeɖe siwo ana be nya madzetowo nava xɔ susu me na wò.
Avoid entertainment that floods your brain with bad language.

Biblia gblɔ be: "Hadede vɔ̃wo gblẽa nɔnɔme nyuiwo. " (1 Korintotɔwo 15:33) Nya "Hadede " si wozã le afi sia lɔ hadede kple amewo ŋutɔŋutɔ kpakple modzakaɖeɖewo abe video siwo nèkpɔna, videodzifefe siwo nèƒona kple ha siwo nèsena ene hã ɖe eme.

The Bible says: "Bad associations corrupt good morals. " (1 Corinthians 15:33, footnote) "Associations " include not only people but entertainment​ the movies you watch, the video games you play, and the music you listen to.

Kenneth, si xɔ ƒe 17, gblɔ be: "Ele bɔbɔe be nànɔ ha si doa dzidzɔ na wò la sem ahanɔ edzim evɔ wò susu nàdzo ɖa le nya ƒaƒã siwo gblɔm wole le eme ya dzi kura, le esi haƒoƒoa alo ha ƒe ɖiɖime le vivim na wò ta. "
Kenneth, 17, says: "It’s easy to sing along with a song you like and totally ignore the fact that it has cursing​ just because it has a good beat. "
Na amewo nàkpɔe be ètsi le susu me.
Show yourself to be mature.
Ame aɖewo gblɔa nya madzetowo, elabe wosusunɛ be ana amewo nabu yewo be yewotsi le susu me.
Some people use profanity because they think it makes them sound like an adult.
Gake esia wɔwɔ menana wobua wo nenema o.
Really, the opposite is true.
Biblia gblɔ be ŋutete le ame tsitsiwo si be "woate ŋu ade vovo nyui kple vɔ̃ dome. "
Mature people "have their powers of discernment trained to distinguish both right and wrong, " says the Bible.
(Hebritɔwo 5:14) Womegblɔa nya madzetowo kple susu be yewoƒe nu "nawɔ dɔ " ɖe amewo dzi o.
(Hebrews 5:​14) They don’t lower their standards just to "impress " others.
Le nyateƒe me la, ɖeko nya madzetowo gbɔgblɔ nana be nu manyomanyowo xɔa susu me na egblɔla kple ame bubuwo siaa.
Really, bad language only pollutes the mind (and the air) with indecent thoughts.
Nu manyomanyowo xɔ susu me na ame geɖe le xexea me xoxo!
There are too many of those in the world already!
Agbalẽ si me nyawo míeyɔ va yi la ɖo aɖaŋu be, "Mègatsɔ tɔwòa kpee o, ke boŋ kpe asi ɖe eŋu be amewo ƒe susu me nadza.
"Don’t add to the slop, " recommends Cuss Control. "Do your part to clean up the verbal environment.
Esia ana wò ŋutɔ nàkpɔ dzidzɔ ɖe ɖokuiwò ŋu eye ame bubuwo hã akpɔ ŋudzedze ɖe ŋuwò. "
You will feel better about yourself, and other people will feel better about you, too. "
NYA SIWO HAWÒTIWO GBLƆ
WHAT YOUR PEERS SAY
Jared
Jared
"Nya veamewo gbɔgblɔ meƒoa nu nyui tso ame ŋu o.
"Bad language doesn’t represent you well.
Ne màte ŋu agblɔ nya ɖeka pɛ nya veamewo magblɔmagblɔe o la, ɖeko wòana ame bubuwo nakpɔe be nya nyui aɖeke mele asiwò nàgblɔ o. "​ Jared.
If you can’t form sentences without using profanity, it just shows others that you have a limited vocabulary. "​ Jared.
Jennifer
Jennifer
"Ame sia ame ŋutɔ ate ŋu atia nya siwo tɔgbi wòadi be woanɔ dodom le ye nu.
"People are faced with a choice as to how they will speak.
Ehiã be míabu nyawo ŋu nyuie hafi agblɔ togbɔ be menɔa bɔbɔe ɣesiaɣi o hã.
It’s not always easy, but we have to think before we talk.
Amedzudzu nye nɔnɔme si ŋu woate ŋu aɖe asi le. "​ Jennifer.
Cursing is a habit that can be stopped. "​ Jennifer.
