Aleke Mawɔ Nye Ɣeyiɣi Ŋu Dɔ Nyuie?
How Can I Manage My Time?
Nu ka tae wòle be nàwɔ wò ɣeyiɣi ŋu dɔ nyuie?
Why manage your time?
Nu si nàte ŋu awɔ
What you can do
Nya siwo hawòtiwo gblɔ
What your peers say
Nu ka tae wòle be nàwɔ wò ɣeyiɣi ŋu dɔ nyuie?
Why manage your time?
Ɣeyiɣi le abe ga ene.
Time is like money.
Ne mèzãe nyuie o la, maganɔ asiwò ne èhiãe o.
If you waste it, you won’t have it when you need it.
Gake ne èwɔ ɖoɖo nyui ɖe ale si nàzã wò ɣeyiɣi ŋu la, ɣeyiɣia ƒe ɖe agasusɔ nàtsɔ awɔ nu siwo doa dzidzɔ na wò!
On the other hand, if you budget your time, you will have some left over to do the things you enjoy!
Biblia ƒe mɔfiame: "Nu dzroa kuviatɔ vevie, gake makpɔ naneke o, ke veviedola aɖi ƒo nyuie. " Lododowo 13:4.
Bible principle: "The lazy person has his cravings, yet he has nothing, but the diligent one will be fully satisfied. "​ Proverbs 13:4.
Nya vevitɔ: Ne èwɔ wò ɣeyiɣi ŋu dɔ nyuie la, àkpɔ vovo geɖe wu, ke menye be nàxaxa o.
The bottom line: Managing your time will give you more freedom, not less.
Ne èsrɔ̃ ale si nàwɔ wò ɣeyiɣi ŋu dɔ nyuie la, esia aɖe vi na wò le wò tsitsime gɔ̃ hã.
Time management is a valuable skill that will serve you well in adulthood.
Ate ŋu awɔe be wò dɔwɔɖui nagakpɔtɔ anɔ asiwò loo alo woanya wò le dɔ me.
It can even make the difference between your holding down a job and being fired.
Tsɔe be èɖo dɔwɔƒe. Ðe nàna dɔwɔvi si tsia megbe ɣesiaɣi la nakpɔtɔ anɔ dɔ wɔm na wòa?
After all, if you ran a business, would you keep an employee who repeatedly showed up late for work?
Biblia ƒe mɔfiame: "Ame si wɔa nuteƒe le nu suetɔ me la, wɔa nuteƒe le nu geɖewo hã me. "
Bible principle: "The person faithful in what is least is faithful also in much. "​ Luke 16:10.
Luka 16:10. Nya vevitɔ: Ale si nèwɔa wò ɣeyiɣi ŋu dɔe la ɖea ame si ƒomevi nènye fiana.
The bottom line: The ability to manage time says something about the kind of person you are.
Ele eme be ɣeyiɣi ŋu dɔ wɔwɔ nyuie mele bɔbɔe ya o.
Admittedly, though, time management isn’t easy.
Kplamatsɛdonu siwo wɔnɛ be wòsesẽna la dometɔ ʋɛ aɖewoe nye esiawo.
Consider just a few obstacles.
Kplamatsɛdonu #1: Xɔlɔ̃wo
Obstacle #1: Friends
"Ɣesiaɣi kloe si xɔ̃nyewo kpem be míayi afi aɖe la, melɔ̃na be mayi kpli wo ne vovo mele ŋunye kura hafi o gɔ̃ hã.
"If friends ask me to go out with them, I almost always make it happen even if I really don’t have the time.
Megblɔna na ɖokuinye be, ‘Oo, ne megbɔ va aƒe me ko la, mawɔ dɔ si le dzinye la kpatakpata.’
I think, ‘Oh, I can do a rush job when I get home.’
Gake ɣeaɖewoɣi la, esia menya wɔna o, si wɔe be nanewo meva yi nyuie kura o. " Cynthia.
It doesn’t always work, and things have gone very wrong as a result. "​ Cynthia.
Kplamatsɛdonu #2: Susuhenuwo
Obstacle #2: Distractions
"Televisionkpɔkpɔ tea ŋu dzroa ame vevie.
"TV is like a vacuum cleaner.
Esesẽna ŋutɔ be nàɖu ɖokuiwò dzi be nàgakpɔ television dzi wɔna aɖewo o. " Ivy.
It sucks you in with its shows and movies, which are hard to resist. "​ Ivy.
"Mezãa gaƒoƒo geɖe ɖe nye tablɛt ŋu.
"I can waste hours on my tablet.
Ne batria fa eye mɔ̃a tsi hafi meɖe asi le ezazã ŋu la, nye dzitsinya bua fɔm. " Marie.
I feel guilty when the only thing that stops me is if the battery dies. "​ Marie.
Kplamatsɛdonu #3: Megbelelehehe
Obstacle #3: Procrastination
"Menɔa megbelele hem ne sukudɔdeasi alo dɔ bubu aɖe le dzinye be mawɔ.
"I procrastinate on my school assignments and on anything else I need to get done.
Mezãa nye ɣeyiɣia ɖe nu manyatalenu aɖe wɔwɔ ŋu va se ɖe esime gamea lilim na dɔdeasia wɔwɔ esia nye ɣeyiɣi ŋu dɔ wɔwɔ le mɔ gbegblẽ nu vavã. "
I’ll waste my time doing something stupid until I absolutely have to get my assignment finished​ not exactly the best time management. "​ Beth.
Beth. Ðekakpui aɖe kpɔ dzidzɔ be yewɔ yeƒe ɣeyiɣia ŋu dɔ nyuie gbã la, exlẽ nu, eyome ewɔ eƒe sukudɔdeasi, eye wògakpɔ ɣeyiɣi ɖe bɔlƒoƒo hã ŋu
A teenage boy is happy with the way he managed his time first he read, then did homework, and still had time to play soccer
Ne èwɔ wò ɣeyiɣi ŋu dɔ nyuie la, àkpɔ vovo geɖe wu, ke menye be nàxaxa o
Managing your time will give you more freedom, not less
Nu si nàte ŋu awɔ
What you can do
Ŋlɔ dɔ siwo wòhiã be nàwɔ la ɖi.
List your required tasks.
Esia ƒe kpɔɖeŋuwoe nye wò aƒemedɔwo kple sukudɔdeasiwo.
Examples include your household chores and homework.
Ŋlɔ ɣeyiɣi agbɔsɔsɔme si hiã be nàtsɔ awɔ dɔawo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe le kwasiɖa ɖeka me la ɖi.
Write down how much time you need to complete each task in a typical week.
Biblia ƒe mɔfiame: "Miakpɔ nu siwo le vevie wu la adze sii. " Filipitɔwo 1:10.
Bible principle: "Make sure of the more important things. "​ Philippians 1:​10.
Ŋlɔ nu siwo nèdina be yeawɔ le wò vovoɣiwo la ɖi.
List the activities you like to do in your free time.
Esia ƒe kpɔɖeŋuwoe nye Internet dzi hahoo kadodo kple televisionkpɔkpɔ.
This could include such activities as social networking and watching TV.
Azɔ ŋlɔ gaƒoƒo ale si nu nèzãna ɖe nu mawo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe ŋu le kwasiɖa ɖeka me la hã ɖi.
Again, write down how many hours you spend on each activity in a typical week.
Biblia ƒe mɔfiame: "Miyi edzi miazɔ le nunya me . . . , eye miwɔ miaƒe ɣeyiɣi ŋu dɔ le mɔ nyuitɔ nu. "
Bible principle: "Go on walking in wisdom . . . , making the best use of your time. "​ Colossians 4:5.
Kolosetɔwo 4:5.
Create a plan.
Wɔ ɖoɖowɔɖi.
Look back at the two lists you created.
Galé ŋku ɖe nuŋlɔɖi eve siwo nèwɔ la ŋu.
Is enough time allocated for the important tasks?
Ðe ɣeyiɣi si nèɖo na dɔ veviawo la sɔ gbɔ na woa?
Do you need to buy out time from your leisure activities?
Ðe wòhiã be nàɖe ɣeyiɣi si nèzãna ɖe nu siwo nèwɔna le wò vovoɣiwo ŋu la dzi akpɔtɔa?
Tip: Make a daily to-do list, checking off each item as it is finished.
Biblia ƒe mɔfiame: "Veviedola ƒe ɖoɖowo hea dzidzedzekpɔkpɔ vanɛ. "
Bible principle: "The plans of the diligent surely lead to success. "​ Proverbs 21:5.
Lododowo 21:5.
Follow through.
Ele eme be ahiã be nàgbe gomekpɔkpɔ le hadomewɔnawo me ɖe dɔ veviwo wɔwɔ ta ɣeaɖewoɣi ya.
True, you might have to turn down a social invitation now and then to get the important things done.
Gake àva kpɔe be vovoɣi geɖe wu va su asiwò eye àse vivi na nu si nàzãe na la wu.
Overall, however, you will find that you have more free time​ and you will enjoy it more.
Biblia ƒe mɔfiame: "Mitsɔ dzo ɖe dɔ ŋu, migawɔ kuvia o. " Romatɔwo 12:11.
Bible principle: "Be industrious, do not loiter at your business. "​ Romans 12:11, footnote.
Ðo eteƒe na ɖokuiwò, gake gbɔ dzi ɖi.
Reward yourself​ but not too soon.
Ðetugbui aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Tara gblɔ be: "Ɣeaɖewoɣi la, mawɔ dɔ eve le nu siwo meŋlɔ ɖi be mawɔ la dome eye magblɔ na ɖokuinye be, ‘Azɔ makpɔ television miniti 15, eyome matrɔ ayi nye dɔawo dzi.’
"Sometimes I will complete two things on my to-do list, " says a young woman named Tara, "and then I’ll think, ‘OK, I can watch TV for 15 minutes and then I’ll get back to work.’
Kasia, miniti 15 la va zu miniti 30, eye miniti 30 va zua gaƒoƒo ɖeka, eye kaka makpɔ la, megblẽ gaƒoƒo eve sɔŋ ɖe televisionkpɔkpɔ ŋu! "
Well, 15 minutes turns into 30, and 30 minutes turns into an hour, and before I know it, I’ve wasted two hours on TV! "
Nu kae nye kuxi ma gbɔkpɔnu?
The solution?
Bu modzakaɖeɖe be enye nu si nàtsɔ aɖo eteƒe na ɖokuiwò ne èwɔ wò dɔwo katã vɔ, ke menye be enye nu si hiã kokoko le ŋkekea me o.
View recreation as a reward for completing your tasks​ not as an automatic part of your day.
Biblia ƒe mɔfiame: "Naneke menyo na amegbetɔ wu be . . . wòakpɔ dzidzɔ le dɔ sesẽ siwo wòwɔna la ta o. "
Bible principle: "There is nothing better for a man than to . . . find enjoyment in his hard work. "​ Ecclesiastes 2:​24.
Nyagblɔla 2:24.

Mewɔa ɖoɖo ɖe ɖiɖiɖeme gɔ̃ hã ŋu, ale be ŋusẽ yeye nagaɖo ŋunye.

But sometimes that extra hour of sleep or time spent exercising increases my productivity and happiness the next day.
Ele vevie be nàkpɔ egbɔ be yele lãmesẽ me. " Brooklyn.
Taking care of your health is important. "​ Brooklyn.
Ðe Nɔnɔme Nyui Ðeɖe Fia Le Veviea?
Do Manners Really Matter?
‘Ne megbɔna la, amewo meʋua ʋɔtru nam o, ke nu ka tae nye ya maʋui na wo?’
‘People don’t open the door for me; why should I do it for them?’
‘Nu veviwo meli míawɔ wu be míatsi dzi ɖe "meɖe kuku, " "akpe, " kple "taflatsɛ " gbɔgblɔ ŋu oa?’
‘Aren’t there more important things to worry about than saying "please, " "thank you, " and "excuse me "?’
‘Mehiã be maɖe nɔnɔme nyui afia nɔvinyewo o, nye ƒometɔwoe.’
‘I don’t need to show manners to my siblings.
Ðe wò nyagbɔgblɔwo ɖi nya siawo dometɔ aɖea?
We’re family.’
Nenye nenemae la, ke yayra siwo dona tso nɔnɔme nyuiwo ɖeɖe fia me la le ŋuwò tom!
Do any of those statements sound like something you would say?
Nu si wòle be nànya tso nɔnɔme nyuiwo ɖeɖe fia ŋu
If so, you could be missing out on the benefits of showing good manners!
Ale si nàna wòaganyo ɖe edzi
What you should know about manners
Nya siwo hawòtiwo gblɔ
How to improve
Nu si wòle be nànya tso nɔnɔme nyuiwo ɖeɖe fia ŋu
What your peers say What you should know about manners
Nɔnɔme nyuiwo ɖeɖe fia ate ŋu ade dziwò le go etɔ̃ siawo me:
Good manners can improve the following three areas of your life:
Ŋkɔ si le ŋuwò.
Your reputation.
Ale si nèwɔa nu ɖe amewo ŋu akpɔ ŋusẽ ɖe ŋkɔ si le ŋuwò la dzi.
How you treat people makes an impression, for good or for bad.
Ne èwɔa nu ɖe amewo ŋu nyuie la, amewo abu wò be ènye ame si tsi kple ame si le bo nu, eye anɔ eme be woawo hã woawɔ nu ɖe ŋuwò nenema!
If you are mannerly, people will likely view you as mature and responsible​ and they’ll treat you accordingly!
Gake ne mèbua ame o la, amewo abui be ɖokuitɔdilae nènye, eye esia awɔe be womalɔ̃ axɔ wò ɖe dɔ me alo ana mɔnukpɔkpɔ bubuwo wò o.
If you are rude, however, people will conclude that you are interested only in yourself, and you could end up being bypassed for employment and other opportunities.
Biblia gblɔ be, "Ŋutasẽla hea ŋukpe vaa eya ŋutɔ ɖokui dzi. "​ Lododowo 11:17; etenuŋɔŋlɔ.
As the Bible says, "the cruel person brings disgrace on himself. "​ Proverbs 11:17; footnote.
Wò hadomegbenɔnɔ.
Your social life.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Mido lɔlɔ̃, elabena enye ɖekawɔwɔ ƒe nublanu deblibo. "
The Bible says: "Clothe yourselves with love, for it is a perfect bond of union. "
(Kolosetɔwo 3:14) Esia nye nyateƒe le xɔlɔ̃dzedze gome.

How to improve
De ŋugble tso nɔnɔme siwo nèɖena fiana ŋu.

For a month, track your speech or conduct in the areas in which you want to improve.

Gaɖo taɖodzinu bubuwo le nu siwo nède dzesii la nu.

Read what happened to Karina, and imagine that it’s happening to you.
Nu kae nàwɔ le nɔnɔme ma me?

Karina: "Menɔ ʋu kum sesĩe akpa esi meɖo ta suku, eye kpovitɔ aɖe lém eye wòna tikitim tsɔ do fe nam.
Karina: "I was driving too fast on my way to school, and a policeman pulled me over and gave me a ticket.

What would you do?
Tiatia Gbãtɔ: Àzi kpi ɖe nya dzi kple susu be ye tɔ masee gbeɖe o.
Option A: Keep it quiet, and hope that Dad never finds out.
Tiatia Evelia: Àgblɔ nu si dzɔ la na Tɔwò.
Option B: Tell Dad exactly what happened.

Susu etɔ̃ siwo ta wòle be nàlɔ̃ ɖe wò vodadawo dzi
Three reasons to admit your mistakes
Elabena esiae nye nu nyuitɔ si wòle be nàwɔ.
Because it’s the right thing to do.
Biblia gblɔ dzidzenu si nu wòle be Kristotɔwo nanɔ agbe ɖo ale: "Míedina be míaɖi anukware le nuwo katã me. " Hebritɔwo 13:18.
Describing the standard for Christians, the Bible says: "We wish to conduct ourselves honestly in all things. "​ Hebrews 13:18.
"Medzea agbagba vevie be maɖi anukware, matsɔ nye nuwɔnawo me tsonuwo, eye maʋu go nye vodadawo enumake. "​ Alexis.
"I have worked really hard to be honest and to take responsibility for my actions​ and to own up to a mistake as soon as I make one. "​ Alexis.
Amewo alɔ̃ atsɔ ame siwo lɔ̃na ɖe woƒe vodadawo dzi la ƒe agɔdzedze ake wo bɔbɔe.
Because people are more likely to forgive those who admit their mistakes.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Ame si tsyɔa nu eƒe dzidadawo dzi la, madze edzi nɛ o, ke ame si ʋua eme, eye wòɖea asi le wo ŋu la, woakpɔ nublanui nɛ. " Lododowo 28:13.
The Bible says: "The one covering over his transgressions will not succeed, but whoever confesses and abandons them will be shown mercy. "​ Proverbs 28:13.
"Ehiã be dzi nanɔ ame ƒo hafi wòaɖe eƒe vodadawo agblɔ, gake esia wɔwɔe nana amewo kana ɖe ame dzi.
"It takes courage to admit a mistake, but that’s how you gain peoples’ trust.
Woakpɔe be ènye anukwareɖila.
They see that you’re honest.
Ne èlɔ̃na ɖe wò vodadawo dzi la, àtrɔ nɔnɔme si made dziwò o la wòazu nɔnɔme deamedzi. "​ Richard.
By admitting a mistake, you turn something bad into something good. "​ Richard.
Vevietɔ wu la, edzea Yehowa Mawu ŋu.
Most important, because it pleases Jehovah God.

"Esi meda vo gã aɖe la, mede dzesii be ele be nye ŋutɔ mayi aɖaʋu nye agɔdzedzea me.

Ne nyemewɔa nu si Yehowa di o la, mate ŋu ayram gbeɖe o. "​ Rachel.

So how did Karina handle her mistake?
Eɣla tikiti si wotsɔ nɛ be wòaxe fe ɖe ʋukuku sesĩe akpa ta la ɖe tɔa.
She tried to keep the speeding ticket a secret from her dad.
Gake mete ŋu ɣlae ɖee tegbee o.
But she couldn’t keep it hidden forever.

"About a year later, " Karina says, "my dad was looking at our insurance records and he noticed a speeding ticket under my name.
Mede ɖokuinye nya gã aɖe me​ nɔnye gɔ̃ hã do dziku ɖe ŋunye be nyemewɔ ɖe aɖaŋu si yeɖo nam la dzi o! "
I got in so much trouble​ even my mom was angry that I hadn’t done what she told me to do! "
Nu kae wòsrɔ̃ tso eme: Karina gblɔ be: "Ðeko vodadawo ɣaɣla gblẽa nyaa ɖe edzi boŋ.
Lesson learned: Karina says: "Keeping mistakes a secret only makes things worse.
Àva nɔ enu emegbe godoo! "
You still pay for them later on! "
Ale si nàsrɔ̃ nu tso wò vodadawo me
How to learn from your mistakes
Ame sia ame daa vo.
Everyone makes mistakes.
(Romatɔwo 3:23; 1 Yohanes 1:8) Eye abe ale si míekpɔe ene la, ne míeʋua míaƒe vodadawo me, eye míeɖea wo gblɔna enumake la, eɖenɛ fiana be míebɔbɔ mía ɖokuiwo eye míenye nunyalawo.

Nu bubu si hiãe nye be nàsrɔ̃ nu tso wò vodadawo me.
The next step is to learn from your mistakes.
Gake nublanuitɔe la, sɔhɛ aɖewo doa kpo nu le go sia me!
Unfortunately, some young people miss out on that opportunity!
Wosena le wo ɖokuiwo me abe ale si sɔhɛ si ŋkɔe nye Priscilla se le eɖokui me ɣeaɖeɣi ene.
They might feel the way a teenager named Priscilla once did.

She says: "I used to get overly discouraged about my mistakes.

I had a low opinion of myself, so my mistakes seemed like a gigantic burden that I couldn’t carry.
Nu tena ɖe dzinye eye mebua ɖokuinye ame dokponu. "

Nyɔnuvi aɖe le ʋu kum eye wòle eɖokui kpɔm le ʋua ƒe megbekpɔhuhɔ̃e me
A girl driving a car and looking at herself in the rearview mirror

Do you feel that way at times?
Ne èsena le ɖokuiwò me nenema la, ke ɖo ŋku nya sia dzi: Ne èbua vodada siwo nèwɔ va yi la ŋu fũu akpa la, ɖeko wòanɔ abe ale si nànɔ ʋu kum, evɔ ànɔ ʋua ƒe megbekpɔhuhɔ̃e ɖeɖe ko me kpɔm ene.
If so, remember this: Dwelling on past mistakes is like staring in the rearview mirror while driving a car.
Ne ènɔa vo siwo nèda va yi ŋu bum fũu akpa la ɖeko wòana nàse le ɖokuiwò me be yemele bo aɖeke nu o, eye esia awɔe be ŋusẽ manɔ ŋuwò nàtsɔ akpe akɔ kple kuxi siwo ava le etsɔme o.
Focusing on the past will only leave you feeling worthless and make you powerless to face the challenges ahead.
Ðe manyo boŋ be nàda asɔ oa?
Instead, why not take a more balanced view?
"De ŋugble tso wò vodadawo ŋu ale be màgawɔ wo azɔ o, gake megatsɔ wò susu katã ɖo wo ŋu ale gbegbe be woana dzi naɖe le ƒowò o. "​ Elliot.
"Look back at your mistakes, and learn from them so that you don’t repeat them. But don’t dwell on them so much that they pull you down. "​ Elliot.

"Medzea agbagba be mabu nye vodadawo be wonye nuteƒekpɔkpɔ nam, be masrɔ̃ nu le wo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe me ale be wòakpe ɖe ŋunye manye ame ɖɔʋu wu eye ne megaɖo nɔnɔme ma tɔgbi me ake la, makpɔ nyawo gbɔ le mɔ nyuitɔ nu.
"I try to view mistakes as a learning experience by taking away from each mistake a lesson that will help me to be a better person and handle the situation differently the next time.
Esiae nye afɔɖeɖe nyuitɔ, elabena akpe ɖe ŋuwò nuteƒekpɔkpɔ nasu asiwò. "​ Vera.

Is the Occult Harmless Fun?

What do you think?

Is there any harm in consulting horoscopes, Ouija boards, or psychics?
Ðe ŋutinya siwo ku ɖe vivimeŋusẽwo ŋu la nye kpɔɖeŋu ƒe avuwɔwɔ dzro aɖe ko le nyui kple vɔ̃ domea, alo wogayi ŋgɔ wu ema?
Are stories of the occult merely allegories​ a symbolic battle between good and evil​ or are they something more?
Nyati sia adzro nu si tae gbɔgbɔyɔyɔ dzena abe nu nyui ye wònye ene kpakple nu si tae wòle be míakpɔ nyuie le eŋu la me.
This article will examine why spiritism can seem appealing and why you need to be cautious.
Nu ka tae wòdzena abe nu nyui ene?
What’s the appeal?

Nu si nàte ŋu awɔ
What you can do

What your peers say
Nu ka tae wòdzena abe nu nyui ene?
What’s the appeal?
Adzɔha siwo wɔa modzakaɖenuwo la wɔa nu siwo ku ɖe vivimeŋusẽwo ŋu la ŋu dɔ ale gbegbe. Esia wɔe be nu mawo va xɔ aƒe ɖe filmwo, television dzi wɔnawo, videofefewo kple agbalẽwo me.
The entertainment industry has capitalized on occult themes, making them a prominent part of movies, TV shows, video games, and books.
Esia wɔe be sɔhɛ geɖe va le ŋku kem ɖe nu siwo ku ɖe ɣletivimefakaka, gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo, vampire-wo kple adzewɔwɔ ŋu me.
As a result, many young people have developed an interest in such things as astrology, demons, vampires, and witchcraft.
Nu ka tae?
Why?
Susuawo dometɔ aɖewoe nye esiawo:
The reasons include:
Ŋkukekeɖenume: Wodina be yewoanya nenye be gbɔgbɔwo li vavã
Curiosity: To find out if a spirit realm really exists
Dzitsitsi ɖe etsɔme ŋu: Wodina be yewoanya nu si adzɔ le etsɔme
Concern: To try to find out what the future holds
Kadodo: Wodina be woate kpɔ be yewoaƒo nu kple yewoƒe ame vevi aɖe si ku
Connection: To attempt communication with a loved one who has died
Susu mawo megblẽ kokoko ya o.
Those reasons may not be wrong in themselves.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, le dzɔdzɔme nu la, míedina be míanya ale si etsɔme anɔ eye míesusua míaƒe ame vevi siwo ku.
For example, it’s only natural to wonder about the future or to miss a loved one who has died.
Gake afɔku aɖewo li siwo ŋu wòle be nànɔ ŋudzɔ ɖo.
But there are dangers that you should be aware of.
Nu ka tae wòle be nàkpɔ nyuie le eŋu?
Why be cautious?
Biblia xlɔ̃ nu mí vevie be míaƒo asa na nu sia nu si do ƒome kple gbɔgbɔyɔyɔ.
The Bible contains strong warnings against anything connected with spiritism.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, egblɔ be:
For example, it states:
"Woagakpɔ ame aɖeke le dowòme, si [nye] bokɔnɔ, akunyawɔla, nutabiala, dzotɔ, ame si saa gbe dea ame, nukala, afakala alo ŋɔliyɔla . . . o.

"There should not be found in you . . . anyone who employs divination, anyone practicing magic, anyone who looks for omens, a sorcerer, anyone binding others with a spell, anyone who consults a spirit medium or a fortune-teller, or anyone who inquires of the dead.
Elabena ame sia ame si le nu siawo wɔm la, ŋunyɔnu wònye na Yehowa. " 5 Mose 18:10-12.
For whoever does these things is detestable to Jehovah. "​ Deuteronomy 18:10-​12.
Nu ka tae Biblia ƒo nu tsi tre ɖe gbɔgbɔyɔyɔ ŋu vevie nenema?
Why does the Bible strongly condemn spiritism?
Gbɔgbɔyɔyɔ nana ame va nɔa kadodo me kple gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo.
Spiritism promotes alliance with demons.
Biblia na míenya be mawudɔla aɖewo dze aglã ɖe Mawu ŋu, si wɔe be wova zu eƒe futɔwo.
The Bible teaches that some angels rebelled against God and made themselves his enemies.
(1 Mose 6:2; Yuda 6) Mawudɔla vɔ̃ɖi mawo, siwo woyɔna be gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo la, toa ŋɔliyɔlawo, afakalawo, bokɔnɔwo kple ɣletivimefakalawo dzi blea amewo.
(Genesis 6:2; Jude 6) These wicked angels, called demons, mislead people through spirit mediums, fortune-tellers, and those who practice divination and astrology.
Ne míeƒo mía ɖokui ɖe gbɔgbɔyɔyɔ ƒe nuwɔna mawo me la, ekema míeva le xɔlɔ̃ dzem Mawu ƒe futɔwo.
Practicing these things would align us with enemies of God.
Gbɔgbɔyɔyɔ dea alakpadzixɔse si nye be amegbetɔ aɖewo ate ŋu agblɔ etsɔme ɖi la dzi.
Spiritism promotes the false belief that certain humans can predict the future.
Ke hã, Mawu koe ate ŋu agblɔ nya sia be: "[Megblɔa] nu si ava dzɔ la tso gɔmedzedzea me ke, kple nu siwo womewɔ haɖe o la fiana tso gbe aɖe gbe ke. " Yesaya 46:10; Yakobo 4:13, 14.
However, only God can say: "From the beginning I foretell the outcome, and from long ago the things that have not yet been done. "​ Isaiah 46:10; James 4:13, 14.
Gbɔgbɔyɔyɔ doa alakpadzixɔse si nye be kukuawo ate ŋu aƒo nu kple agbagbeawo la ɖe ŋgɔ.
Spiritism promotes the false belief that the dead can communicate with the living.
Gake Biblia gblɔ be: "Kukuawo meganya naneke kura o . . .
However, the Bible says: "The dead know nothing at all . . .
Dɔwɔwɔ alo ɖoɖowɔwɔ alo sidzedze alo nunya mele Tsiẽƒe, afi si yi ge nàla o. " Nyagblɔla 9:5, 10.
There is no work nor planning nor knowledge nor wisdom in the Grave. "​ Ecclesiastes 9:​5, 10.
Le susu mawo ta la, Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒoa asa na nuwɔna siwo do ƒome kple gbɔgbɔyɔyɔ.
For those reasons, Jehovah’s Witnesses shun practices that are associated with spiritism.

Azɔ hã, woƒoa asa na modzakaɖeɖe siwo me woɖea nuwo abe zombie-wo (alo ame kuku siwo wobe wotrɔna zua amegbetɔwo), vampire-wo (alo ame kuku siwo wobe wodona le zã me va noa ʋu le lãme na ame) kple vivimeŋusẽ ƒe nuwɔna bubuwo ene le.
They also avoid entertainment that features such things as zombies, vampires, and the paranormal.
Ðetugbui aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Maria gblɔ be: "Ne gbɔgbɔyɔyɔ ƒe nuwɔnawo dze le modzakaɖeɖea me la, ke mele be makpɔe o. "
"If it contains spiritistic elements, " says a young woman named Maria, "then I shouldn’t be watching it. "
Ðekakpui ƒewuivi aɖe susu be ame ɖɔʋu aɖee ƒo ka na ye, evɔ nu vlo wɔla aɖe boŋue yɔe
A teenage boy thinks he has received a legitimate phone call, but in reality a criminal has called him
Abe ale si ko nu vlo wɔla aɖe adze agbagba be yeaflu wò nàsusu be ame bubu aɖee yenye ene la, nenema kee gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃wo wɔa wo ɖokuiwo abe wò ame vevi siwo ku ene
Just as a criminal tries to trick you into thinking he is someone else, the demons pretend to be your dead loved ones
Nu si nàte ŋu awɔ
What you can do
Ðoe kplikpaa be nàna "dzitsinya nyui nanɔ " asiwo le Yehowa gbɔ to ale si nàƒo asa na nuwɔna alo modzakaɖeɖe ɖe sia ɖe si do ƒome kple gbɔgbɔyɔyɔ la dzi. Dɔwɔwɔwo 24:16.
Make it your determination to "maintain a clear conscience " before Jehovah by avoiding any practice or entertainment that involves the occult.​ Acts 24:16.
Gblẽ nu sia nu si le asiwò si do ƒome kple gbɔgbɔyɔyɔ la dome.
Discard anything you own that is connected with the occult.
Xlẽ Dɔwɔwɔwo 19:19, 20, eye nàde dzesi kpɔɖeŋu nyui si Kristotɔ gbãtɔwo ɖo le go sia me.
Read Acts 19:19, 20, and note the good example set by first-century Christians in this regard.
Ðo ŋku nya sia dzi: Ne èƒoa asa na nuwɔna kple modzakaɖeɖe siwo do ƒome kple gbɔgbɔyɔyɔ la, ke èle eɖem fia kɔte be èle Yehowa ƒe akpa dzi.
Remember: When you shun occult practices and entertainment, you take a stand on the side of Jehovah.
Eye esia doa dzidzɔ na eƒe dzi! Lododowo 27:11.
And that makes his heart glad!​ Proverbs 27:11.

Gake 5 Mose 18:10 gblɔ be ame siwo wɔa nu mawo la naganɔ mía dome o.
But Deuteronomy 18:10 says that those who practice such things should not be found among us.
Esia fia be mele be ame siwo wɔa nu mawo la nadze le míaƒe modzakaɖeɖewo hã me o. " Brandon.

Dzitsinya nyui si anɔ asiwò la nyo wu television dzi wɔna alo film ɖe sia ɖe. " Rose.
A clean conscience is better than any TV show or movie. "​ Rose.
Nu Ka Tae Wòle Be Mado Gbe Ða?
Why Should I Pray?
Numekuku aɖe si wowɔ ɖee fia be, sɔhɛ siwo le Amerika 80 le 100 me doa gbe ɖa, gake 40 le 100 me koe doa gbe ɖa gbe sia gbe.
According to one poll, 80 percent of adolescents in America pray, but only half of those who pray do so daily.
Ðikeke mele eme o be wo dometɔ aɖewo anɔ susum be: ‘Nuwɔna dzro aɖe si nana ame ƒe dzi dzea eme koe gbedodoɖa nyea, alo eyi ŋgɔ ema?’
No doubt, some of them wonder: ‘Is prayer just a psychological crutch, or is it something more?’
Nu kae nye gbedodoɖa?
What is prayer?
Ðe Mawu ɖoa toa?
Is God listening?
Nu kawo ŋue mate ŋu ado gbe ɖa tsoe?
What can I pray about?
Nya siwo hawòtiwo gblɔ
What your peers say
Nu kae nye gbedodoɖa?
What is prayer?
Gbedodoɖae nye dzeɖoɖo ŋutɔŋutɔ kple nuwo katã Wɔla la.
Prayer is real communication with the Creator of all things.
Bu nu si esia fia ŋu kpɔ!
Just think of what that means!
Yehowa de ŋgɔ wu amegbetɔwo le go ɖe sia ɖe me, ke hã "mele adzɔge tso mía dometɔ aɖeke gbɔ . . . o. "
Jehovah is superior to mankind in every way, yet "he is not far off from each one of us. "
(Dɔwɔwɔwo 17:27) Le nyateƒe me la, amekpekpe wɔnuku sia le Biblia me be: "Mite ɖe Mawu ŋu, eye ate ɖe mia ŋu. "​ Yakobo 4:8.
(Acts 17:27) In fact, the Bible contains this amazing invitation: "Draw close to God, and he will draw close to you. "​ James 4:8.
Aleke nàwɔ ate ɖe Mawu ŋu?
How can you draw close to God?
Mɔ ɖeka si dzi nàtoe nye gbedodoɖa​ mɔ sia dzie nàto aɖo dze kple Mawu.
One way is through prayer​ that’s how you talk to God.
Mɔ bubue nye Biblia sɔsrɔ̃​ mɔ ma dzie Mawu tona ƒoa nu na wò.
Another way is through study of the Bible​ that’s how God "talks " to you.
Kadodo sia tɔgbi​ gbedodoɖa kple Biblia sɔsrɔ̃​ ye akpe ɖe ŋuwò be xɔlɔ̃wɔwɔ kplikplikpli nanɔ wò kple Mawu dome.
Such back-and-forth communication​ prayer and study of the Bible​ will help you build a strong friendship with God.
"Nuƒoƒo kple Yehowa, si fia dzeɖoɖo kple Dziƒoʋĩtɔ la, ye nye mɔnukpɔkpɔ gãtɔ siwo su amegbetɔwo si la dometɔ ɖeka. "​ Jeremy.
"Talking to Jehovah​ communicating with the Most High​ is one of the greatest privileges humans can have. "​ Jeremy.
"Ale si mele sesẽm le ɖokuinye me ŋutɔŋutɔ gbɔgblɔ na Yehowa nana mesena le ɖokuinye me be mete ɖe eŋu wu. "​ Miranda.
"Sharing my deep feelings with Jehovah through prayer makes me feel closer to him. "​ Miranda.
Ðe Mawu ɖoa toa?
Is God listening?
Ne èxɔ Mawu dzi se gɔ̃ hã​ eye nèdoa gbe ɖa nɛ gɔ̃ hã la​ ate ŋu asesẽ ɣeaɖewoɣi be nàka ɖe edzi be eɖoa to mí vavã.
Even if you believe in God​ and even if you pray to him​ it may be difficult to accept the idea that he’s really listening.
Ke hã, Biblia yɔ Yehowa be "Gbedodoɖasela. "
Nevertheless, the Bible calls Jehovah the "Hearer of prayer. "
(Psalmo 65:2) Ekpe mí gɔ̃ hã be ‘míadro míaƒe dzimaɖitsitsiwo katã ɖe ye dzi.’
(Psalm 65:2) It even invites you to "throw all your anxiety on him. "
Nu ka ta?
Why?
‘Elabena eléa be na mí.’​ 1 Petro 5:7.
"Because he cares for you. "​ 1 Peter 5:7.
Bu nya sia ŋu: Ðe nèdia ɣeyiɣi ɖoa dze kple xɔwò veviwo edziedzia?
To think about: Do you take the time to talk to your close friends on a regular basis?
Àte ŋu aɖo dze kple Mawu hã nenema.
You can do the same with God.
Nɔ gbe dom ɖa nɛ edziedzi eye nànɔ eƒe ŋkɔ Yehowa zãm.
Call on him regularly in prayer, and do so using his name, Jehovah.
(Psalmo 86:5-7; 88:9) Nyateƒee, Biblia kpe wò be, ‘nɔ gbedodoɖa dzi ɣeawokatãɣi.’​ 1 Tesalonikatɔwo 5:17.
(Psalm 86:​5-7; 88:9) Indeed, the Bible invites you to "pray constantly. "​ 1 Thessalonians 5:​17.
"Gbedodoɖa nye dzeɖoɖo le nye kple Fofonye si le dziƒo la dome, si me megblɔa nye dzimenyawo katã nɛ le. "​ Moises.
"Prayer is a conversation between me and my heavenly Father, one in which I pour out my entire heart. "​ Moises.
"Megblɔa nye dzimenya veviwo na Yehowa abe ale si ko magblɔ wo na nɔnye alo xɔ̃nye vevi ene. "​ Karen.
"I talk to Jehovah about things in depth, just as I would with my mom or with a very close friend. "​ Karen.
Nu kawo ŋue mate ŋu ado gbe ɖa tsoe?
What can I pray about?
Biblia gblɔ be: "Le nu sia nu me la, mito gbedodoɖa kple kokoƒoƒo kpakple akpedada dzi miana Mawu nanya miaƒe dzimedidiwo. "​ Filipitɔwo 4:6.
The Bible says: "In everything by prayer and supplication along with thanksgiving, let your petitions be made known to God. "​ Philippians 4:6.
Ðe ema fia be esɔ be nàdo gbe ɖa tso wò kuxiwo ŋua?
Does that mean it’s OK to pray about your problems?
Yes!
Le nyateƒe me la, Biblia gblɔ be: "Dro wò agba ɖe Yehowa dzi, ekema alé wò ɖe te. "​ Psalmo 55:22.
In fact, the Bible says: "Throw your burden on Jehovah, and he will sustain you. "​ Psalm 55:22.
Gake wò gbedodoɖawo meganye wò kuxiwo ɖeɖe ko gbɔgblɔ na Mawu o.
Of course, in your prayers to God, you should talk about more than just your problems.
Ðetugbi aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Chantelle gblɔ be: "Nye kple Yehowa dome xɔlɔ̃wɔwɔ manye nyuitɔ ne kpekpeɖeŋu ko biam manɔ tso egbɔ ɣesiaɣi o.
"It wouldn’t be a very good friendship if I only asked Jehovah for help, " says a young woman named Chantelle.
Mekpɔe be ele be mada akpe nɛ gbã, eye ele be nu siwo ta mada akpe nɛ ɖo la nasɔ gbɔ. "
"I feel that expressing thanks should come first, and the list of things I’m thankful for should be a long one. "
Bu nya sia ŋu: Nu kawo tae nèdaa akpe ɖo le wò agbe me?
To think about: What things in your life are you thankful for?
Ðe nàte ŋu abu nu etɔ̃ aɖewo siwo tae nàda akpe na Yehowa ɖo egbea?
Can you think of three things to thank Jehovah for today?
"Àte ŋu ado gbe ɖa ada akpe na Yehowa ɖe nu suetɔ, abe ne èkpɔ seƒoƒo aɖe wònya kpɔ na wò ene, gɔ̃ hã ta. "​ Anita.
"Even something simple, like admiring a beautiful flower, can prompt us to offer a prayer of thanks to Jehovah. "​ Anita.
"De ŋugble le Mawu ƒe nuwɔwɔ aɖe si wɔa nuku na wò alo mawunyakpukpui aɖe si wɔa dɔ ɖe dziwò ŋu eye nàda akpe na Yehowa ɖe eta. "​ Brian.
"Meditate on something in creation that impresses you or on a Bible verse that really touches you, and then thank Jehovah for it. "​ Brian.

Yehowa di be yeakpe ɖe mía ŋu, eye togbɔ be enya nu siwo míehiã hafi míabiae gɔ̃ hã la, míate ŋu ato míaƒe gbedodoɖawo ƒe nyonyome dzi aɖe ale si gbegbe míeka ɖe edzii la afiae. "​ Moises.

But by thanking Jehovah, we come to appreciate the many things he has given us and we focus our prayers on something more than just ourselves. "​ Jeremy.

"The more we thank Jehovah, the more grateful we become.

Thanking Jehovah in prayer helps us focus on the blessings we receive rather than on all the troubles we face. "​ Shelby.
Aleke mawɔ adzudzɔ nye dɔdeasiwo wɔwɔ hehe ɖe megbe?
How Can I Stop Procrastinating?
Ðe wòsesẽna na wò be nàwu wò aƒemedɔwo kple sukudɔdeasiwo nua?
Tired of always finishing your chores and homework assignments late?
Ke ahiã be nàdzudzɔ wò dɔdeasiwo wɔwɔ hehe ɖe megbe!
You really need to stop putting things off!
Nyati sia akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàtso ɖe wò dɔdeasiwo ŋu kaba
This article will help you to stop procrastinating, even when
ne edze abe ɖe dɔa sesẽ na wò akpa ene gɔ̃ hã.
the task seems overwhelming.
ne dɔa wɔwɔ medzɔa dzi na wò o gɔ̃ hã.
you just don’t feel motivated.
ne dɔ geɖe le dziwò xoxo gɔ̃ hã.
you’re already too busy.
Eye wɔ dodokpɔ si le nyati sia ƒe nuwuwu.
After reading this article, take our procrastination quiz.
Biblia ƒo nu tso nu si nuwo wɔwɔ hehe ɖe megbe gblẽna le ame ŋu la ŋu.
The Bible describes a sad consequence of procrastination.
Egblɔ be: "Ame si le to lém ɖe ya ŋu la, maƒã nuku o, eye ame si le ŋku lém ɖe alilikpo ŋu la, maŋe nu o. " Nyagblɔla 11:4.
It states: "He that is watching the wind will not sow seed; and he that is looking at the clouds will not reap. "​ Ecclesiastes 11:4.
Kpɔ nu siwo ate ŋu ana nànɔ megbelele hem kple ale si nàwɔ aɖu kuxi sia dzi la ɖa.
Consider some factors that might contribute to the problem and what you can do to stop procrastinating.
Ne edze abe ɖe dɔa sesẽ na wò akpa ene.
The task seems overwhelming.
Nyateƒee, dɔ aɖewo dzena nu sesẽ ale gbegbe be ele bɔbɔe be míahe wo wɔwɔ ɖe megbe.
Let’s face it​ some tasks are so daunting that it’s easier just to put them off.
Aɖaŋuɖoɖo nyui ʋɛ aɖewoe nye esi.
Here are a few better ideas.
Ma dɔa ɖe akpa suesuewo me.
Break up the project into smaller segments.
Nyɔnuvi si ŋkɔe nye Melissa gblɔ be: "Ne mekpɔe be dɔ tsi dzinye gɔ̃ hã la, medzea agbagba be mawɔ wo vivivi. "
"Even if I know that I’m way behind, I try to catch up by doing one thing at a time, " says a girl named Melissa.
Dze egɔme enumake.
Begin immediately.
"Ne dɔ aɖe kpɔ ŋkuwòme koa, dze egɔme enumake, ɖewohĩ nu gbãtɔ si ko nàte ŋu awɔ gbɔe nye be nàŋlɔe kpe ɖe dɔ siwo nèɖo be yeawɔ ŋu alo aŋlɔ nanewo tso eŋu da ɖi be màgaŋlɔe be o. "​ Vera.
"Start as soon as you get the task, even if that means simply adding it to your to-​do list or jotting down a couple of ideas before you forget them. "​ Vera.
Bia kpekpeɖeŋu.
Ask for help.
Dziwòlawo kple wò nufialawo anya to kuxi mawo ke me kpɔ.
Your parents and teachers likely have faced a similar challenge.
Ðe manyo be nàsrɔ̃ nu tso wo gbɔ oa?
Why not tap into their experience?
Woate ŋu akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàwɔ ɖoɖo nyuie.
They may help you to organize your ideas and make a plan.
Aɖaŋuɖoɖo "Wɔ ɖoɖo.
Tip "Make a schedule.
Enye nyateƒe be esia abia be nàwɔ ɖoɖo ɖe nuwo ŋu eye nàɖoe kplikpaa awɔ ɖe ɖoɖoa dzi ya, gake eɖea vi, ana nàwu nu sia nu nu ɖe game dzi. "​ Abbey.
True, that means you have to be organized and determined to follow through, but it works​ you get everything done when it needs to be done. "​ Abbey.
Ne dɔa wɔwɔ medzɔa dzi na wò o.
You just don’t feel motivated.
Tsɔe be zi geɖe la, nu siwo wòhiãna be nàwɔ la dometɔ aɖewo medoa dzidzɔ na wò o.
Too often, the assignments you have to tackle involve the things that bore you the most.
Ekema nu kae nàte ŋu awɔ?
So what can you do if the project at hand just doesn’t appeal to you?
Te esiawo kpɔ.
Try the following.
Dze agbagba nàkpɔ susu aɖe si tae wòahiã be nàwɔe kaba.
Think of a reason to do it early.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, kpɔ ale si dzi adzɔ wò ne èwu enu la le susu me.
For example, imagine how great you’ll feel when you’re done.
Nyɔnuvi si ŋkɔe nye Amy gblɔ be: "Ale si mesena le ɖokuinye me ne mewu dɔ aɖe nu, alo mewu enu hafi eƒe game de si wɔe be mete ŋu ɖi ɖe eme la dzɔa dzi nam. "

What is puberty?
Míagblɔe kpuie ko be sɔhɛmeɖoɖo alo liɔliɔ̃ nye ɣeyiɣi si me tɔtrɔwo vaa wò ametia me kple seselelãme gome eye tɔtrɔ siawo dzraa wò ɖo na ame tsitsi zuzu.
Simply put, puberty is a stage of life that puts you on a physical and emotional fast-track to adulthood.
Le ɣeyiɣi mawo me la, tɔtrɔ geɖewo ava wò ŋutilã kple lãmetsiwo gome kabakaba siwo adzra wò ɖo na vidzidzi.
During this stage, your body goes through rapid physical and hormonal changes that prepare you for reproduction and childbirth.
Gake ema mefia be èsu te anye dzila o.
No, that doesn’t mean you’re ready to be a parent.
Sɔhɛmeɖoɖo ɖenɛ fiana be èle dodom le ɖevime, eye esia ate ŋu ana nàkpɔ dzidzɔ ahalé blanui siaa.
But puberty is a sign that you are leaving your childhood behind​ a fact that may bring you feelings of both anticipation and sadness.
Dodokpɔ: Ƒe siwo gbɔna la dometɔ kae nàgblɔ be esɔ be ame nadze sɔhɛmeɖoɖo?
Quiz: Which of the following ages would you say are normal for puberty to begin?
Ŋuɖoɖoa: Wogblɔ be ƒe siawo katã dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe sɔ ame nate ŋu aɖo sɔhɛme.
Answer: All those ages are considered to be within the normal range for the onset of puberty.
Esia fia be mele be nàtsi dzi fũu nenye be ègogo ƒe wuiatɔ̃ gake mèkpɔ te dzesidede naneke o alo nète sɔhɛmeɖoɖo ƒe dzesiwo kpɔkpɔ evɔ mèkpɔ xɔ ƒe ewo haɖe o.
That means there’s no need to be overly concerned if you’re nearing your mid-teens and you haven’t yet started the process​ or if you’re under ten and you have started.
Sɔhɛmeɖoɖo ƒe gɔmedzedze le eɖokui si, eye màte ŋu akpɔ ŋusẽ aɖeke ɖe edzi o.
Puberty has its own biological timetable that is largely out of your control.
Sɔhɛwo le fefem le fefenu aɖe dzi; ɖeka lé blanui, ɖeka le vɔvɔ̃m, eye ɖeka hã le dzidzɔ kpɔm
Young people ride a roller-coaster; one is sad, one is scared, and one is excited

Like a roller-coaster ride, puberty can be both exciting and scary​ but you can learn to deal with the ups and downs
Tɔtrɔ siwo vaa ametia ŋu
Physical changes
Ðewohĩ nu si ɖea dzesi wu be ame le sɔhɛme ɖomee nye ale si nu geɖewo nɔa tsitsim le ametia ŋu kabakaba.
Perhaps the most obvious change that comes with puberty is a growth spurt.
Gake ŋutinuwo katã ƒe tsitsi mele ɖeka o.
The problem is, not all your body parts grow at the same rate.
Eya ta megawɔ nuku na wò ne wò nuwɔnawo medi be yewoadze ga dzi tututu o.
So don’t be surprised if you’re a bit clumsy in your movements.
Ka ɖe edzi be le ɣeyiɣi aɖe megbe la, nuwo ava ɖɔ ɖo.
Be assured that in time, things will balance out.
Tɔtrɔ siwo vaa ametia ŋu ne ele sɔhɛme ɖom.
A number of other physical changes come with puberty.
Le ŋutsuviwo gome:
Puberty in boys:
Eƒe aʋa dea asi lolo me
Growth of the sex organs
Etoa axatomefu, aŋɔmefu kple ge
Underarm, pubic, and facial hair growth
Eƒe gbe trɔna
Voice change
Eƒe aʋa lĩna le eɖokui si eye wònyea tsi le zã me
Involuntary erections and nocturnal emissions
Le nyɔnuviwo gome:
Puberty in girls:
Etea no
Breast development
Etoa axatomefu kple aŋɔmefu
Underarm and pubic hair growth
Edzea asiɖoɖo anyi gɔme
Menarche (the onset of menstruation)
Le ŋutsuviwo kple nyɔnuviwo siaa gome:
Puberty in both genders:
Fifia kple nugbagbevi suesuesuewo nana be woɖea ya alo ʋẽna.
Body odor, caused by a combination of sweat and bacteria.
Kpekpeɖeŋu: Àte ŋu alé ʋeʋẽ sia nu ne èlea tsi edziedzi hezãa axatomemi.
Tip: You can control body odor by washing frequently and by using a deodorant or an antiperspirant.
Nyatsu, esia tsoa nugbagbevi suesuesue siwo xaxa ɖe lãmenu siwo wɔa ami la me gbɔ.
Acne, caused by bacteria trapped in oil glands.
Kpekpeɖeŋu: Togbɔ be nyatsu mesea nu o hã la, ne èklɔa ŋkume edziedzi hezãa mofudzalẽwo la, aka ɖe eme.
Tip: Although acne is not easy to control, washing your face often and using skin cleansers can help.
Tɔtrɔ siwo vana le seselelãme gome
Emotional changes
Lãmetsi siwo nana be tɔtrɔwo vaa wò ametia ŋu la ate ŋu akpɔ ŋusẽ gã aɖe ɖe wò seselelãme dzi.
The hormonal surge that causes the physical changes of puberty can take a toll on your emotions.
Enu ate ŋu asẽ gɔ̃ hã.
You might even experience powerful mood swings.
"Egbea ànɔ avi fam, kaka etsɔ nàɖoa wòe nye ema le dzidzɔ kpɔm.
"One day you’re crying, and the next day you’re fine.
Sẽe ko nèdo dziku, sẽe ko nu te ɖe dziwò nètu ɖokuiwò ɖe xɔ me. "​ Oksana.
One minute you’re angry, and the next minute you’re holed up in your room depressed. "​ Oksana.
Le sɔhɛ geɖewo gome la, ne wole sɔhɛme ɖom la, ŋu kpea wo vevie, abe ɖe ame sia ame fɔ ŋku ɖe wo dzi gãa hele ʋɔnu drɔ̃m wo ene.
While going through puberty, many young people also feel extremely self-conscious, as if they were being watched and judged by everyone.
Eye ale si ametia trɔna kpatae hã gagblẽa nyaa ɖe edzi!
And the fact that your appearance is changing so dramatically doesn’t help!
"Esi mete ɖetugbuimeɖoɖo la, mexaa dzime gobaa hedoa awu gblotowo.
"When I started growing, I would purposely slouch and wear big shirts.
Togbɔ be menya nu si tae nye ametia le tɔtrɔm hã la, nyemevona le ɖokuinye me o eye ŋu kpeam. "​ Janice.
Even though I knew why my body was changing, I was so uncomfortable and embarrassed. It felt unnatural. "​ Janice.
Gake seselelãme ƒe tɔtrɔ gãtɔe nyea ale si nèbua ŋutsuviwoe nenye be nyɔnuvie nènye, alo ale si nèbua nyɔnuviwoe nenye be ŋutsuvie nènye.
Perhaps the biggest emotional change you will experience is acquiring a whole new outlook on the opposite sex.
"Tsã la, ŋutsuviwo katã ƒe nu kua dzi nam.
"I stopped thinking that all boys were annoying.

Now some were actually attractive, and the idea of falling in love wasn’t such a bad thing after all.
Le nyateƒe me la, ‘ame si lɔ̃ ame kemɛ’ ye va nye nu si ŋu míenɔa dze ɖom tsoe vevie. "​ Alexis.
In fact, ‘who likes whom’ became a popular topic of conversation. "​ Alexis.
Le ŋutsuvi aɖewo gome la, ne wole sɔhɛme ɖom la, ŋutsuviwo ƒe nu vanɔa dzi lém na wo, eye wòle alea le nyɔnuviwo hã gome.
While going through puberty, some young people find themselves attracted to members of the same sex.
Ne esia dzɔ ɖe dziwò la, mègaƒo nya ta be ŋutsu ŋutsugbɔdɔla alo nyɔnu nyɔnugbɔdɔlae yenye o.
If this happens to you, do not conclude that you are gay.
Le ame geɖe gome la, seselelãme ma nu tsina le ɣeyiɣi aɖe megbe.
In many cases, such feelings subside with time.
"Esi wònye be metsɔa ɖokuinye sɔna kple ŋutsuvi bubuwo akpa ta la, woƒe nu va te dziléle nam.
"Because of my obsessively comparing myself with other boys, I started feeling attracted to them.
Esia yi edzi ʋuu va se ɖe esime meyina dodo ge ɖe le sɔhɛme hafi nyɔnuviwo ƒe nu va le dzi lém nam.
It wasn’t until later in my youth that I developed an attraction to females.
Ale si ŋutsuviwo ƒe nu léa dzi nam tsã la nu yi gbe aɖe agbe ke. "​ Alan.
Homosexual feelings are now just a part of my past. "​ Alan.
Nu si nàte ŋu awɔ
What you can do
Na susu nyui nanɔ asiwò ɖe nɔnɔmea ŋu.
Try to adopt a positive view.
Ehiã be nàto sɔhɛmeɖoɖo ƒe ɣeyiɣia me azu ame tsitsi.
Really, puberty is a physical and emotional makeover that you need.
Hakpala David ƒe nya siwo wògblɔ la ate ŋu ade dzi ƒo na wò, egblɔ be: "Ale si nèwɔm la dzi ŋɔ eye wòwɔ nuku. " Psalmo 139:14.
You can even draw confidence from the words of the psalmist David, who said: "In an awe-inspiring way I am wonderfully made. "​ Psalm 139:14.
Mègatsɔ ɖokuiwò nɔ sɔsɔm kple ame bubuwo o, eye mègatsɔ susu ɖo wò dzedzeme hã ŋu akpa o.
Avoid comparisons, and resist the urge to focus on your body image.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Nu si le dzedzem koe amegbetɔ kpɔna, ke Yehowa ya kpɔa keke dzi me ke. " 1 Samuel 16:7.
The Bible says: "Man sees what appears to the eyes, but Jehovah sees into the heart. "​ 1 Samuel 16:7.
Te kame eye nàɖi ɖe eme nyuie.
Get sufficient exercise and rest.
Ne èdɔa alɔ̃ nyuie la, màganɔ dziku dom kabakaba, nu nate ɖe dziwò alo nàlé blanui o.
Enough sleep will help you be less irritable, stressed, and depressed while you’re awake.
Mègaxɔ susu gbegblẽ siwo katã wò ŋutɔ nèbuna ɖe ɖokuiwò ŋu la dzi se o.
Challenge your ‘inner critic.’
Ðe ame sia ame fɔ ŋku ɖe dziwò nyateƒea?
Is everyone really watching you that closely?
Ne amewo gblɔ nya aɖewo tso wò tsitsi ŋu hã la, mègatsɔe vevie akpa o.
Even if people make remarks about your growth, put things in perspective.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Mègatsɔ wò dzi ɖo nya sia nya si amewo gblɔna la ŋu o. " Nyagblɔla 7:21.
The Bible says: "Do not take to heart every word that people say. "​ Ecclesiastes 7:​21.
Srɔ̃ ale si nàɖu gbɔdɔdɔ ƒe dzodzrowo dzi ale be esia magana nàva kpɔ gome le gbɔdɔdɔ me o.
Learn how to control your sexual urges so that you do not act on them.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Misi le gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu nu! . . .
The Bible says: "Flee from sexual immorality! . . .
Ame si ƒoa eɖokui ɖe gbɔdɔdɔ manɔsenu me la le nu vɔ̃ wɔm ɖe eya ŋutɔ ƒe ŋutilã ŋu. " 1 Korintotɔwo 6:18.
Whoever practices sexual immorality is sinning against his own body. "​ 1 Corinthians 6:18.
Ðo dze tso nɔnɔmea ŋu kple dziwòlawo alo ame tsitsi aɖe.
Talk to one of your parents or a trusted adult.
Enye nyateƒe be awɔ ŋukpe na wò gbã ya.
True, it might be awkward at first.
Gake ale si gbegbe woakpe ɖe ŋuwò ana nàkpɔe be enyo be yeɖe afɔ sia.​ Lododowo 17:17.
But the help you can get will make your effort worthwhile.​ Proverbs 17:17.

Sukudede ate ŋu aɖe wò ŋutete siwo ŋu menya nu tsoe tsã o la ɖe go.
A positive view of your abilities. School can reveal your hidden talents.
Paulo ŋlɔ na Timoteo bena: ‘De dzo Mawu ƒe nunana si le mewò la me.’ (2 Timoteo 1:6) Edze ƒãa be Timoteo xɔ gbɔgbɔ kɔkɔea ƒe nunana aɖewo.
Paul wrote to Timothy: "Stir up like a fire the gift of God which is in you. " (2 Timothy 1:6) Evidently, Timothy had been given some gift of the holy spirit.
Gake ehiã be wòatu "nunana " ma ɖo be wòadzi ɖe edzi alo wòagagu o.
But his "gift " needed to be cultivated so that it would not lie dormant or go to waste.
Ele eme be Mawu menaa sukuŋutetewo mí tẽe o.
Of course, your scholastic abilities are not directly bestowed upon you by God.
Ke hã ŋutete siwo le asiwò la wò ɖeka si ko wole.
Nevertheless, the talents you have are unique to you.
Sukudede ate ŋu akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàva kpɔ wò ŋutete siwo mede dzesii tsã o la adze sii ahana nàtu wo ɖo ɖe edzi.
School can help you to discover and nurture abilities that you never knew you had.
Nu Ka Tae Wòle Be Nàtsri Film-memewo Sɔsrɔ̃? Akpa 2: Na Ŋutsuviwo
Why Reject the Media Stereotype?​ Part 2: For Boys

Nya siawo dometɔ kawoe sɔ kple ŋutsuvi siwo dzena le filmwo, televisionwo dzi kple boblododowo me?
Which words describe teenage boys as you see them depicted in the media (including movies, TV, and advertising)?
Nya siawo dometɔ kae nàdi be woagblɔ tso ye ŋu?
Which words describe how you would like to be known?
Anɔ eme be àyɔ nɔnɔme siwo dze le akpa gbãtɔ la atsɔ aɖo nyabiase gbãtɔa ŋu eye àyɔ nɔnɔme siwo dze le akpa evelia atsɔ aɖo nyabiase evelia ŋu.
Likely, your answers to the first question came from column 1 and your answers to the second question came from column 2.
Ne nenemae la, ke enyo ŋutɔ.
If so, that’s good.
Nu ka tae?
Why?
Elabe anɔ eme be ale si woɖɔa ŋutsuviwo le filmwo kple boblododowo me la mesɔ kple ame si tututu nènye alo ame si ƒomevi nàdi be yeava nye la o.
Because the media’s portrayal of males probably doesn’t reflect who you really are​ or the kind of person you should become.
Bu nu si tae la ŋu kpɔ.
Consider why.
Zi geɖe la, ŋutsuviwo nyea ŋutasẽnuwɔlawo kple aglãdzelawo le filmwo me.
The media often portrays males as violent and rebellious.
Agbalẽ aɖe gblɔ be ŋutsuvi siwo xɔ ŋkɔ le filmwo, televisiondziwɔnawo kple kamedefefewo me la dometɔ akpa gãtɔ nyea "ŋusẽtɔ siwo wɔa ŋutasẽnuwo. . . .
The book Why Boys Don’t Talk​ and Why It Matters notes that the most popular male characters on TV, in movies, and in sports are "those with great physical strength who exhibit aggression. . . .
Woƒe nyae nye be ele be ŋutsuviwo ƒe nya me nasẽ eye woanye ame wɔadãwo hafi woate ŋu awɔ woƒe didiwo dzi na wo. "​ Why Boys Don’t Talk​ and Why It Matters
The message is that cool is defined by being tough and rebellious. "
Bu nya sia ŋu: Ðe adãwɔwɔ awɔe be nànye xɔlɔ̃, dɔwɔhati alo srɔ̃ŋutsu nyuia?
To think about: Will an aggressive disposition help you become a better friend, coworker, or husband?
Ne wodo dziku na wò la, nu eve siawo dometɔ ka wɔwɔe asesẽ na wò wu, be nàɖe wò dziku aƒo ɖi bababa alo nàɖu dzikua dzi?
When provoked, which takes greater strength​ to vent your anger or to control it?
Esiawo dometɔ ka wɔwɔe aɖee fia be ŋutsu ŋutɔŋutɔe nènye?
Which would give evidence that you are a real man?
Biblia gblɔ be: "Dzigbɔɖitɔ nyo wu kalẽtɔ, eye ame si ɖua eɖokui dzi la, nyo wu duwo xɔla. " Lododowo 16:32.
The Bible says: "The one slow to anger is better than a mighty man, and the one controlling his temper than one conquering a city. "​ Proverbs 16:32.
Ne èɖua wò dziku dzi la, ke èsẽ ŋu wu aʋakalẽtɔ
If you control your temper, you’re stronger than a warrior
Woɖea ŋutsuviwo fiana le filmwo me be wonye ame siwo gbɔdɔnuwo xɔ susu me na.
The media portrays males as obsessed with sex.
Chris si xɔ ƒe 17 gblɔ be: "Le filmwo kple televisiondziwɔnawo me la, ŋutsuviwo ɖɔlia nyɔnuviwo wu woƒe awudodowo. "
"In movies and on TV, boys change girlfriends more often than they change their clothes, " says 17-year-old Chris.
Gary si xɔ ƒe 18 gblɔ kpee be: "Gbɔdɔnuwɔnawo koe xɔa susu me na ŋutsuvi siwo nɔa filmwo me. "
Gary, 18, takes it further. "The typical boy in the media is sex-obsessed, " he says.
Edzena le film aɖewo me be dɔ si dze ŋgɔ ŋutsuviwo le agbe me katã koe nye be woayi kplɔ̃ɖoƒewo, ano aha alo adɔ kple nyɔnuviwo.
Some movies, for example, make it seem as if a boy’s only goals in life are to party, drink, and have sex.
Bu nya sia ŋu: Ðe nàdi be woabu ye abe ŋutsuvi siwo nɔa filmwo me la enea?
To think about: Does that stereotype reflect the kind of reputation you want to have?
Ðe ŋutsu ɖɔʋu bua nyɔnuwo be wonye nu siwo woatsɔ aɖi kɔ na gbɔdɔdɔ dzro koa?
Does a real man treat women as sex objects, or does he treat them with respect?

Alo ɖe wòdea bubu wo ŋua? Biblia gblɔ be: "Mia dome ame sia ame nanya ale si wòawɔ aɖu ye ŋutɔ ƒe ŋutilã dzi le kɔkɔenyenye kple bubu me, menye le gbɔdɔdɔ ƒe dzodzro ƒe ŋubiabiã me . . . o. " 1 Tesalonikatɔwo 4:4, 5.
The Bible says: "Each one of you should know how to control his own body in holiness and honor, not with greedy, uncontrolled sexual passion. "​ 1 Thessalonians 4:​4, 5.
Woɖea ŋutsuviwo fiana le filmwo me be wonye ame maɖɔʋuwo.
The media portrays boys as irresponsible.
Ŋutsuvi siwo woɖena fiana le filmwo me kple television dzi la nyea kuviatɔwo kple ame maɖɔʋuwo.
In many popular movies and TV shows, teenage boys are often shown as lazy and incompetent.
Ðewohĩ esia tae ame tsitsi aɖewo mekana ɖe ŋutsuviwo dzi tututu o.
Perhaps that’s why some adults have little confidence in the potential of boys.
Gary si ƒe nya míegblɔ va yi la gblɔ be: "Esi mexɔ ƒe 16 la, dɔkpɔkpɔ sesẽ nam, elabena nyɔnuwo koe dɔtɔ siwo le míaƒe nutoa me la dina be yewoaxɔ.
Gary, quoted earlier, says: "When I turned 16, I found it difficult to get a job because business owners in my area wanted to hire only women.
Wobua ŋutsuviwo katã be wonye ame maɖɔʋuwo eye womate ŋu aka ɖe wo dzi o! "
They felt that all teenage boys were irresponsible or untrustworthy! "
Bu nya sia ŋu: Ðe wòsɔ be woabu ŋutsuviwo katã be wonye ame maɖɔʋuwo eye womate ŋu aka ɖe wo dzi o abe ale si wòdzena le filmwo me enea?
To think about: Is the stereotype of the irresponsible and untrustworthy teenage boy fair?
Aleke nàɖee afia be ye ya yemele nenema o?
How can you show that you are different?
Biblia gblɔ be: "Mègana ame aɖeke nado vlo wò ɖekakpuinyenye o.
The Bible says: "Never let anyone look down on your youth.
Ke boŋ nànye kpɔɖeŋu na nuteƒewɔlawo le nuƒoƒo me, le agbenɔnɔ me, le lɔlɔ̃ me, le xɔse me, le agbe dzadzɛ nɔnɔ me. " 1 Timoteo 4:12.
Instead, become an example to the faithful ones in speaking, in conduct, in love, in faith, in purity. "​ 1 Timothy 4:​12; footnote.
Nu si wòle be nànya
What you should know
Nu siwo dzena le filmwo kple boblododowo me la tea ŋu kpɔa ŋusẽ gã aɖe ɖe ame dzi.
The media can have a powerful effect on you.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, nu siwo dzena le filmwo alo boblododowo me ate ŋu ana nàsusui be ehiã be ye hã yeasrɔ̃ atsyã siwo le tsia dzi hafi woabu ye ɖe ame me.
For example, the media can make you feel that you need to adopt the current fashion trend to be popular.
Colin, ŋutsuvi si xɔ ƒe 17 gblɔ be: "Woɖea ale si wòle be ŋutsuviwo nado awui la fiana le boblododowo me eye nyɔnuviwo nɔa kukum ɖe wo dzi.
"Ads show what guys should dress like and show the girls hanging all over them, " says 17-year-old Colin.
Adzro wò vevie be ye hã yeayi aɖaƒle awu mawo tɔgbi.
"It makes a person want to go out and buy those clothes.
Mɔ̃ sia ɖem zi ɖeka zi eve aɖewo! "
I’ve done that a few times! "
Bu nya sia ŋu: Ðe ale si nèdoa awui la ɖea ame si tututu nènye la fiana alo ɖe wòɖenɛ fiana be amewo yome ko nèdzea?
To think about: Does the way you dress reflect who you really are, or have you become a follower?
Biblia gblɔ be: "Midzudzɔ agbenɔnɔ ɖe nuɖoanyi sia ƒe nɔnɔme nu. "
Who really profits when you spend money to keep up with the latest trends in fashion?
Romatɔwo 12:2.
The Bible says: "Stop being molded by this system of things. "​ Romans 12:2.
Ŋutsuvi siwo woɖena fiana le filmwo alo boblododowo me ƒe nuwɔnawo sɔsrɔ̃ mana nuwò nadzɔ dzi na nyɔnuviwo o.
Copying the stereotype could actually make you less appealing to girls.
Bu nya siwo nyɔnuvi aɖewo gblɔ la ŋu kpɔ:
Consider what some of them have said:
"Malɔ̃ ŋutsuvi siwo ɖea woƒe amenyenye ŋutɔŋutɔ fiana wu ŋutsuvi siwo wɔa ameŋkumenu be yewoatsɔ adze amewo ŋu.
"I would prefer a guy who is true to himself over one who is insecure and puts on a show to try to prove himself.
Le nyateƒe me la, ŋutsuvi siwo dzea agbagba be yewoadze amewo ŋu la ƒe nu va ɖia kokoe! "​ Anna.
Really, a boy who tries too hard only ends up looking ridiculous! "​ Anna.
"Woɖenɛ fiana le boblododowo me wòdzena be ele be mɔ̃ɖaŋunu aɖewo koŋ nanɔ ŋutsuviwo si alo woadzra ɖo le mɔ aɖe nu hafi woƒe nu nadze nyɔnuviwo ŋu.
"Advertisers make boys feel as if they need to have certain gadgets or a certain look to appeal to girls.
Gake ne nyɔnuviwo va tsi la, menye nu siawo ŋue wogava tsia dzi ɖo le ŋutsuwo ŋu o.
As girls get older, though, they look beyond those things.
Ke boŋ woléa ŋku ɖe ŋutsuawo ƒe nɔnɔme nyuiwo kple ale si wòwɔa nu ɖe amewo ŋui la ŋu.
Instead, they see a man’s inner qualities and observe how he treats people.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, ŋutsuvi siwo ɖia anukware eye wowɔa nuteƒe la ƒe nue léa dzi na nyɔnuviwo. "​ Danielle.
For example, girls like it when guys are honest and loyal. "​ Danielle.
"Zi geɖe la, ŋutsuvi si dze ɖeka wu gbɔgblɔ la, ɖe wònɔa eɖokui kpɔm, eye nyemedina be made ha kple ame ma tɔgbi o.
"Often, the ‘perfect-looking guy’ is haughty, and I don’t want to be around anyone like that.
Ne èdze ɖeka wu adɔ̃ evɔ wò agbenɔnɔ menyo o la, wò nu malé dzi nam gbeɖe o. "​ Diana.
You could be the best-looking guy in the world, but you would be ugly if your personality didn’t match those looks. "​ Diana.

Bu nya sia ŋu: Biblia gblɔ tso ŋutsuvi Samuel ŋu be "ɖevi la le tsitsim, eye eƒe nu nyo Yehowa kple amegbetɔwo siaa ŋu. " (1 Samuel 2:​26) Nɔnɔme nyui kawoe wòle be wòasu asiwò ale be woaƒo nu nyui ma tso wò hã ŋutiwò?

To think about: Describing the boy Samuel, the Scriptures say that he "kept growing in stature and in favor both with Jehovah and with the people. " (1 Samuel 2:​26) What qualities do you need to work on to have that kind of reputation?
Biblia gblɔ be: "Miwɔ ŋutsu. " 1 Korintotɔwo 16:13.
The Bible says: "Carry on in a manly way. "​ 1 Corinthians 16:13.
Nu si nàte ŋu awɔ
What you can do
Da nu siwo woɖena fiana le filmwo me la kpɔ.
Question the stereotype.

De dzesi Biblia ƒe nya siawo: "Nu sia nu si le xexea me ŋutilã ƒe nudzodzro kple ŋkuwo ƒe nudzodzro kple ame ƒe nunɔamesiwo fiafia adegbeƒoƒotɔe la metso Fofo la gbɔ o, ke boŋ xexea me wotso. " 1 Yohanes 2:16.

Note this statement in the Bible: "Everything in the world​ the desire of the flesh and the desire of the eyes and the showy display of one’s means of life​ does not originate with the Father, but originates with the world. "​ 1 John 2:16.
Nu siawo tututue wodoa bobloe le filmwo me, eye wonana wòdzena abe ɖe naneke megblẽ le wo ŋu o ene.
The media capitalizes on those very things and portrays them as normal.
Eya ta dze agbagba nàda nu siwo nèkpɔna la kpɔ be wonyo mahã.
So learn to question what you see.
Zi geɖe la, ɖeko boblodolawo doa boblo nu mawo be amewo naƒle wo ne yewoakpɔ ga geɖe.
It’s often no more than the creation of marketers who are out to make money.
Nye ame si nèdi be yeanye.
Carve out your own path.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Mido amenyenye yeye la, si wɔm wole yeyee to sidzedze vavãtɔ me le Ame si wɔe la ƒe nɔnɔme nu, " ke menye le ale si woɖɔa amewo le filmwo me la nu o. Kolosetɔwo 3:10.

The Bible says: "Clothe yourselves with the new personality, which through accurate knowledge is being made new according to the image of the One who created it "​ not according to the image promoted by the media.​ Colossians 3:​10.
Nu si akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàwɔ ɖe aɖaŋuɖoɖo sia dzie nye be nàde ŋugble tso nɔnɔme nyui siwo nàdi be woanya na ye, siwo nètia le nyati sia ƒe gɔmedzedze la ŋu.
To help you follow that advice, think back to the qualities you identified at the beginning of this article​ the qualities for which you would like to be known.
Ðe manyo be nàdze egɔme fifia atu nɔnɔme siawo ɖo alo adze agbagba be woaganyo ɖe edzi oa?
Why not start working now either to acquire them or to improve in them?
Srɔ̃ ame siwo ɖoa kpɔɖeŋu nyuiwo.
Find positive role models.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Ame si zɔna kple nunyalawo la, adze nunya. "
"The one walking with the wise will become wise, " states the Bible.
(Lododowo 13:20) Wò ame nyanyɛ kawoe ɖee fia le woƒe agbenɔnɔ me be yewodze nunya?
(Proverbs 13:20) Which men in your life have shown themselves to be wise?
Wo dometɔ aɖewo ate ŋu anye nyruiwò alo tɔwò.
Some might be in your family, such as your father or your uncle.
Ðewo hã ate ŋu anye xɔ̃wòwo alo wò ame nyanyɛ bubuwo.
Others could be mature male friends or acquaintances.
Ŋutsu kpɔɖeŋu nyui ɖola geɖewo le Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe hamewo me.
Jehovah’s Witnesses have many exemplary men in the Christian congregation.
Kpɔɖeŋu nyui ɖola geɖewo le Biblia hã me. Wo dometɔ ɖekae nye Tito, ame si ɖo kpɔɖeŋu nyui ɖi na sɔhɛwo.​ Tito 2:6-8.
The Bible itself contains role models, including Titus, who set a good example for young people to follow.​ Titus 2:​6-8.
Aɖaŋuɖoɖo: Zã agbalẽ si nye Srɔ̃ Woƒe Xɔse nàtsɔ asrɔ̃ nu tso bibliameme siwo ɖo kpɔɖeŋu nyui ɖi na ŋutsuwo la ŋu, wo dometɔ aɖewoe nye Habel, Noa, Abram, Samuel, Eliya, Yona, Yosef kple Petro.
Suggestion: Use the book Imitate Their Faith to learn about Bible examples of outstanding role models for men, including Abel, Noah, Abram, Samuel, Elijah, Jonah, Joseph, and Peter.
Ènyaa?
Did you know?
Le United States (États-Unis) la, nya "teenager " (sɔhɛ) va xɔ ŋkɔ le ƒe 1940 me esi boblodolawo va nɔ amewo mam ɖe hatsotsowo me le woƒe nuƒeƒle nu.
In the United States, the word "teenager " became popular in the 1940’s when marketers began grouping people according to their buying characteristics.

Esia wɔe be ele bɔbɔe be woadzra nu na wo. " The Rise and Fall of the American Teenager. Nyitsɔ laa la, Eŋlisigbe me nya "tween, " si wotsɔ ɖɔa ŋutsuvi kple nyɔnuvi siwo xɔ ƒe 10 va se ɖe 13 va xɔ ŋkɔ le asitsalawo dome ŋutɔ.
Teenagers "were largely in the same place​ high school​ sharing a common experience, and they were young and open to new things, " says the book The Rise and Fall of the American Teenager.
"Nya sia mebɔ nenema gbegbe tsã o va se ɖe esime nudzralawo va na wòzu ha le nu na ame geɖewo.
"They were, in short, easy to sell to. "
Asitsalawo de ŋugble tso nu siwo alé dzi na sɔhɛwo ƒe hatsotso sia koŋ la ŋu eye woto nu yeyewo vɛ. "
The English word "tween, " which describes boys and girls between the ages of 10 and 13, recently came into vogue in marketing circles.
Talk to Me First.
"There had been no such thing as a ‘tween identity’ until marketers made it up, " says the book Talk to Me First.

Nya siawo dometɔ kawoe sɔ kple nyɔnuvi siwo dzena le filmwo, televisionwo dzi kple magazinewo me?
Which words describe teenage girls as you usually see them depicted in the movies, on TV, or in magazines?
Nya siawo dometɔ kae nàdi be woagblɔ tso ye ŋu?

Anɔ eme be àyɔ nɔnɔme siwo dze le akpa gbãtɔ la atsɔ aɖo nyabiase gbãtɔa ŋu eye àyɔ nɔnɔme siwo dze le akpa evelia atsɔ aɖo nyabiase evelia ŋu.
Likely, your answers to the first question came from column 1 and your answers to the second question came from column 2.
Ne nenemae la, ke efia be èdi be yeƒe nɔnɔme naɖɔ ʋu wu sɔhɛ akpa gãtɔ siwo woɖena fiana le filmwo me la ƒe nɔnɔme, eye menye wò ɖeka koe dinae alea o!
If so, that means you aspire to be better than the "typical " teenager portrayed by the media​ and you’re not alone!
Bu nu si tae la ŋu kpɔ.
Consider why.
"Nyɔnuvi siwo woɖena fiana le filmwo me nyea nyɔnuvi dzeaglã siwo si agbe aɖeke mele o.
"Movies portray the typical teenage girl as a rebel with an attitude problem.
Ðeko esia nana wòwɔna na amewo be mí nyɔnuviwo katã míenye ame maɖianukwarewo, ame siwo dina vevie be amewo nakpɔ yewo kple apasatɔwo. "​ Erin.
It makes it seem as if all of us are untrustworthy, image-focused drama queens. "​ Erin.
"Nyɔnuvi siwo woɖena fiana le filmwo me kple televisionwo dzi la dina vevie be amewo nakpɔ yewo, wotsia dzi ɖe woƒe dzedzeme, awudodo, ŋkɔxɔxɔ kple ŋutsuviwo ŋu. "​ Natalie.
"The teenage girls in movies and on TV are attention-hungry and obsessed with their looks, clothes, popularity, and boys. "​ Natalie.
"Ƒãa hafi nàkpɔ film aɖe, eye nyɔnuvi si ‘xɔ ŋkɔ’ le film ma me la, mele aha nom, ŋutsuviwo dɔ gbɔ, alo dze aglã ɖe edzilawo ŋu o.
"Rarely do you see the ‘fun’ girl not drinking, not sleeping with guys, and not rebelling against her parents.
Ne nyɔnuvi aɖe mele nu sia wɔm o la, wobunɛ be enye mawusubɔla zazɛ̃nyahela alo nyɔnuvi siwo melɔ̃a ŋutsu ƒe nya gbɔ o. "​ Maria.
When a girl isn’t shown doing those things, she’s depicted as either a religious fanatic or some kind of prude. "​ Maria.
Bia nya sia ɖokuiwò: ‘Ðe ale si medoa awu, ƒoa nu alo wɔa nu la ɖea ame si menye ŋutɔŋutɔ fiana, alo ame aɖe si mekpɔ le film me ƒe nuwɔna ko srɔ̃m melea?’
Ask yourself: ‘Does the way I dress, act, and speak really reflect who I am, or am I merely mimicking the stereotype I see depicted in the media?’
Nu si wòle be nànya
What you should know
Nyɔnuvi aɖewo nɔa ame siwo woɖena fiana le filmwo me ƒe nuwɔnawo srɔ̃m hesusuna be nenemae yewo ŋutɔ yewole.
Many who think they’re carving out their own identity are merely conforming to an identity that’s been handed to them.
Ðetugbui aɖe si ŋkɔe Karen gblɔ be: "Mede dzesi nu sia le nɔvinye nyɔnu suetɔ ŋu.
"I see it in my little sister, " says a young woman named Karen.
Ewɔa nu abe awudodo kple ŋutsuviwo koe nɔa vevie nɛ ene.
"She pretends not to care about anything but clothes and boys.
Menya be enyaa nu, eye etsɔa ɖe le nu bubuwo hã me, gake enɔa nu wɔm abe bometsila ene, elabe esusui be mɔ ma ko dzie yeato anɔ abe ‘nyɔnuvi bubuawo katã’ ene.
She’s smart, and I know that she has other interests, but she plays dumb because she thinks that’s the only way she can be like ‘all the other girls.’
Ƒe 12 ko wòxɔ! "
And she’s only 12! "
Biblia gblɔ be: "Midzudzɔ agbenɔnɔ ɖe nuɖoanyi sia ƒe nɔnɔme nu. "
The Bible says: "Stop being molded by this system of things. "​ Romans 12:2.
Romatɔwo 12:2. Menye nyɔnuviwo katãe dina be yewoawɔ nu abe ale si nyɔnuvi siwo woɖena fiana le filmwo me la wɔa nu ene o.
The stereotype does not reflect what all teenage girls want to be.

Nyɔnuvi si ŋkɔe nye Alexis si xɔ ƒe 15 gblɔ be: "Nyɔnuvi siwo woɖena fiana le filmwo me la tsia dzi ɖe woƒe dzedzeme ŋu fũu akpa, wonyea yakamewo kple ame siwo mebua tame nyuie hafi wɔa nu o, gake meka ɖe edzi be mía dometɔ akpa gãtɔ bua nuwo ŋu nyuie.
"In the media, girls are shown as self-obsessed, ditzy, and prone to do immature things, but I think most of us have fairly good judgment, " says 15-year-old Alexis.
Menye drɔ̃ekuku ŋutsuvi dzeɖekɛwoe nye nu vevitɔ na mí le agbe me o, nu bubuwo li zã míewɔna. "
"We have other things in our lives besides daydreaming about some cute guy. "
Biblia gblɔ be: "Ame tsitsiwo . . . na hehe woƒe nugɔmeseseŋutetewo to wo zazã me, be woate ŋu ade vovo nyui kple vɔ̃ dome. " Hebritɔwo 5:14.
The Bible says: "Mature people . . . have their powers of discernment trained to distinguish both right and wrong. "​ Hebrews 5:14.
Adzɔhawo ŋutɔ ƒe viɖekpɔkpɔ ko tae woɖea sɔhɛ nyɔnuvi mawo fiana le filmwo me ɖo, menye nyɔnuviawo ƒe nyonyo tae o.
Stereotyping serves the interests of marketers​ not those of teen girls.

Esi adzɔha gãwo, siwo ƒe ɖewoe nye dɔwɔƒe siwo wɔa hadzidziwo, videowo kple agbalẽwo, atsyɔ̃nuwo, elektrɔnik-nuwo kple modzakaɖenuwo nyae be yewoate ŋu ato nudzadzra na sɔhɛwo dzi akpɔ ga geɖe ta la, wotɔa ŋku ɖeviwo hafi wova ɖoa sɔhɛme gɔ̃ hã.
Recognizing the potential for profit, powerful industries​ including publishing, fashion, technology, and entertainment​ start targeting young people before they reach their teens.
Agbalẽ aɖe (12 Going on 29) gblɔ be: "Boblodolawo ƒe nyawo fiana be ne sɔhɛwo meƒle awu, sikanu, atsyɔ̃ɖonu, elektrɔnik-nu yeyetɔwo o la womanye ame xɔŋkɔwo o.
"Advertisers suggest tweens who don’t have the latest clothes, jewelry, makeup, and electronic products won’t be popular, " says the book 12 Going on 29.
Sɔhɛwo kpɔa boblododowo ɣesiaɣi, wotea wo kpɔkpɔ gɔ̃ hã hafi va dzea nunya ahayi nu si wonye la gɔme se ge. "
"Tweens see seductive commercials on a constant basis, even before they understand what the seduction is about. "
Biblia gblɔ be: "Nu sia nu si le xexea me ŋutilã ƒe nudzodzro kple ŋkuwo ƒe nudzodzro kple ame ƒe nunɔamesiwo fiafia adegbeƒoƒotɔe la metso Fofo la gbɔ o, ke boŋ xexea me wotso. " 1 Yohanes 2:16.

The Bible says: "Everything in the world​ the desire of the flesh and the desire of the eyes and the showy display of one’s means of life​ does not originate with the Father, but originates with the world. "​ 1 John 2:​16.
Nyɔnuvi aɖe si ale si wole boblo dom atsyɔ̃ɖomiwo, elektrɔnik-nuwo kple atsyɔ̃ɖonuwo la ti kɔ na
A teenage girl overwhelmed with advertisements for cosmetics, electronics and fashion items
Bu nya sia ŋu: Ne ètsi dzi ɖe awudodo siwo le tsia dzi ŋu fũu akpa la, ame kawoe wòɖea vi na?
To think about: Who benefits most if you think way too much about the most popular designer labels in fashion?
Ame ka tututue wòɖea vi na ne èƒle asitelefon yeyetɔ kple susu be yeaxɔ ŋkɔ le ye tɔwo dome?
Who really profits if you must have that latest cell phone just to be popular among your peers?
Nu ka koŋue nɔa vevie na adzɔhawo wu, wò nyonyo loo alo woawo ŋutɔwo ƒe nyonyo?
What do marketers care more about​ your well-being or their own?
Nu si nàte ŋu awɔ
What you can do
Da nu siwo woɖena fiana le filmwo me la kpɔ.
Learn to question the stereotype you see promoted by the media.
Ne èle tsitsim la, ŋutete si akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàse nuwo gɔme ŋutɔŋutɔ ke menye ale si wole dzedzem le gota ko o la asu asiwò.
As you grow up, you acquire the ability to see more than what appears to the eye.
De ŋugble tso ŋusẽ si nu siwo woɖena fiana le filmwo me ate ŋu akpɔ ɖe dziwò la ŋu.
Use your perception to think about the effect that media stereotypes can have on you.

Alana si xɔ ƒe 14 gblɔ be: "Atsyɔ̃ɖomiwo sɔa gbɔ le nyɔnuvi siwo woɖena fiana le filmwo me la ŋu fũu wu woƒe awudodowo. Eye sɔhɛ geɖe menyae be ema wɔwɔ ana be yewomanya kpɔ o, eye be esia nana amewo bua wo boŋ be womele ta kpɔm na agbea o. "

"The media portrays a typical teenage girl as one who has more makeup on than clothes, " says 14-year-old Alana, "and many teens don’t realize that it doesn’t really make them look better​ it makes them look desperate. "
Dze agbagba nàtu nɔnɔme nyuiwo ɖo be nàzu ame si nèɖoe be yeazu.
Develop your goals as to the type of person you want to become.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, gabu nɔnɔme nyui siwo nètia le nyati sia ƒe gɔmedzedze ŋu kpɔ. Nɔnɔme nyui mawoe nèdi be amewo nanya na ye.
For example, think back to the qualities you identified at the beginning of this article​ the qualities for which you would like to be known.
Ðe manyo be nàdze agbagba fifia adze nɔnɔme nyui siawo tutu ɖo gɔme alo nàna be woaganyo ɖe edzi oa?
Why not start working now either to acquire them or to improve in them?
Biblia gblɔ be: "Mido amenyenye yeye la, si wɔm wole yeyee to sidzedze vavãtɔ me le Ame si wɔe la ƒe nɔnɔme nu, " menye nɔnɔme siwo boblodolawo doa bobloe nu o.

The Bible says: "Clothe yourselves with the new personality, which through accurate knowledge is being made new according to the image of the One who created it "​ not according to the image promoted by advertisers.​ Colossians 3:​10.
Kolosetɔwo 3:10.
Find positive role models.
Wo dometɔ aɖewo ate ŋu anye wò ƒometɔwo abe nɔwò alo tasiwò ene.
Some might be in your family, such as your mother or your aunt.
Bubuwo hã ate ŋu anye nyɔnu tsitsi siwo si nuteƒekpɔkpɔ su alo wò ame nyanyɛwo.
Others could be mature female friends or acquaintances.
Nyɔnu kpɔɖeŋu nyui ɖola geɖewo le Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe hamewo me, eye woƒe kpɔɖeŋu aɖe vi na wò.​ Titus 2:​3-5.
Jehovah’s Witnesses have the benefit of many exemplary women in the Christian congregation.​ Titus 2:​3-5.
Aɖaŋuɖoɖo: Zã agbalẽ si nye Srɔ̃ Woƒe Xɔse nàtsɔ asrɔ̃ nu tso bibliameme siwo ɖo kpɔɖeŋu nyui ɖi na nyɔnuwo la ŋu, wo dometɔ aɖewoe nye Rut, Hana, Abigail, Esta, Maria kple Marta.
Suggestion: Use the book Imitate Their Faith to learn about Bible examples of excellent role models for women, including Ruth, Hannah, Abigail, Esther, Mary, and Martha.
Yehowa Ðasefowo ta Srɔ̃ Woƒe Xɔse gbalẽa, ele www.jw.org/ee.
Imitate Their Faith is published by Jehovah’s Witnesses and is available at www.jw.org.

Edea bubu eɖokui ŋu.

Eye ne amewo ƒe susu va le edzi hã la, esia mezua dàda nɛ o. "​ Marissa.
And if the attention does focus on her, she doesn’t let it go to her head. "​ Marissa.
Ènyaa?
Did you know?
Le United States (États-Unis) la, nya "teenager " (sɔhɛ) va xɔ ŋkɔ le ƒe 1940 me esi boblodolawo va nɔ amewo mam ɖe hatsotsowo me le woƒe nuƒeƒle nu.
In the United States, the word "teenager " became popular in the 1940’s when marketers began grouping people according to their buying characteristics.

Esia wɔe be ele bɔbɔe be woadzra nu na wo. " The Rise and Fall of the American Teenager. Nyitsɔ laa la, Eŋlisigbe me nya "tween, " si wotsɔ ɖɔa ŋutsuvi kple nyɔnuvi siwo xɔ ƒe 10 va se ɖe 13 va xɔ ŋkɔ le asitsalawo dome ŋutɔ.
Teenagers "were largely in the same place​ high school​ sharing a common experience, and they were young and open to new things, " says the book The Rise and Fall of the American Teenager.
"Nya sia mebɔ nenema gbegbe tsã o va se ɖe esime nudzralawo va na wòzu ha le nu na ame geɖewo.
"They were, in short, easy to sell to. "
Asitsalawo de ŋugble tso nu siwo alé dzi na sɔhɛwo ƒe hatsotso sia koŋ la ŋu eye woto nu yeyewo vɛ. "
The English word "tween, " which describes boys and girls between the ages of 10 and 13, recently came into vogue in marketing circles.
Talk to Me First. "
"There had been no such thing as a ‘tween identity’ until marketers made it up, " says the book Talk to Me First.

Nu ka tae wòdzɔa dzi na amewo?
What is the attraction?
Ðekakpui si woyɔna be Ryan gblɔ be: "Ewɔna nam be nutata nyakpɔ aɖe ŋutɔe nu siwo wotana ɖe ŋuti la dometɔ aɖewo nyena. "
"I think some tattoos are beautiful works of art, " says a young man named Ryan.
Susu si tae nèdi be yeata nu ɖe ŋuti ɖo la ate ŋu akpɔ ŋusẽ ɖe ale si nèsena le ɖokuiwò me tso nutata ɖe ŋuti ŋu la dzi.
The motive for getting a tattoo might affect how you feel about getting one.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, ɖetugbui si ŋkɔe nye Jillian gblɔ be: "Esime míaƒe sukuvi nyɔnuvi aɖe le ɖevime la, nɔa ku.
For example, a teenager named Jillian says: "When a girl I went to school with was little, her mom died.
Eya ta esi wòzu ɖetugbui la, ena wota nɔa ŋkɔ ɖe eƒe ʋuɖome.
So when she became a teenager, the girl got her mom’s name tattooed on the back of her neck.
Ewɔ nam be nutata ɖe ŋuti ma tɔgbi ya nyo ŋutɔ. "
I think a tattoo like that can be very sweet. "
Eɖanye susu ka tae nàdi be yeata nu ɖe ŋuti ɖo o, ele be nàbu eŋuti nyuie hafi ata nu ɖe ŋuti, elabena wometea ŋu ɖenɛ bɔbɔe o!
Regardless of the motive, you should think long and hard before deciding to have anything permanently inked into your skin!
Nya kawoe wòle be nàbia ɖokuiwò ne èle nutata ɖe ŋuti ŋu bum?
What questions should you consider if you are thinking about getting a tattoo?
Eye Biblia me mɔfiame kawoe ate ŋu akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàtso nya me le mɔ nyuitɔ nu?
And what Bible principles can help you make the best decision?
Nya kawoe wòle be nàbia ɖokuiwò?
What questions should you ask?
Lãmesẽkuxi kawoe ate ŋu atso eme?
What are the health risks?
Mayo Clinic gblɔ le eƒe nyatakakadzraɖoƒea be, "Nutata ɖe ŋuti dea abi ŋutilã ŋu, esia ate ŋu ana ŋutigbalẽmedɔ kple lãmesẽkuxi bubuwo.
"Tattoos breach the skin, which means that skin infections and other complications are possible, " says the website of the Mayo Clinic.
Nutsetse nogonogoe aɖewo ƒona ɖe afi si wota nua ɖo.
"Sometimes bumps called granulomas form around tattoo ink.
Ɣeaɖewoɣi la, ne abia ku le afi si wota nua ɖo la, abikpaa teƒe fɔa kpo. "
Tattooing also can lead to keloids​ raised areas caused by an overgrowth of scar tissue. "
Nyatakakadzraɖoƒea gagblɔ be: "Ne dɔlékui siwo woxɔna tso ame bubu ƒe ʋu me dometɔ aɖe le nu si wotsɔ ta nu le ŋutiwò ŋu la, àte ŋu axɔ dɔléle ƒomevi vovovowo. "
Furthermore, the website notes: "If the equipment used to create your tattoo is contaminated with infected blood, you can contract various bloodborne diseases. "
Aleke wòana amewo nabu wòe?
How would it affect your reputation?
Aleke ke wòɖale o, amewo anɔ te ɖe wò dzedzeme dzi aƒo nya ta le ŋuwò.
Like it or not, your appearance sends a message.
Woate ŋu abu wò be ètsi le susu me loo alo ègakpɔtɔ nye ɖevi, ènye ame si ŋu woate ŋu aɖo ŋu ɖo loo alo ame si ŋu womate ŋu aɖo ŋu ɖo o.
It identifies you as either adultlike or immature, as either trustworthy or irresponsible.
Nyɔnuvi si ŋkɔe nye Samantha gblɔ be: "Ne mekpɔ ame aɖe ta nu ɖe ŋuti la, mebunɛ enumake dea agbe bliba nɔlawo dome. "
"Whenever I see someone with a tattoo, I automatically put him in the drinking-and-partying category, " says a teenager named Samantha.
Melanie si xɔ ƒe 18 la hã kpɔ nu bubu aɖe tso nuwɔna sia ŋu.
Melanie, 18, sees another aspect to it.
Egblɔ be: "Mesusu be nutata ɖe ŋuti nana be ame ƒe nyonyo megadzena o.
"To me, " she says, "tattoos hide your natural beauty.
Ðeko wòwɔ abe ame siwo taa nu ɖe ŋuti la medina be woakpɔ yewo adze sii o ene, eya ta wotsɔa nu mawo ɣlaa wo ɖokuiwo. "
It’s as if those who wear them don’t want you to see who they really are, so they hide themselves underneath tattoos. "
Adzɔ dzi na wò ɣesiaɣia?
Will you always like it?
Le ɣeyiɣi aɖe megbe la, lãmekpɔkpɔ alo tsitsi gɔ̃ hã ate ŋu ana be nu siwo nèta ɖe ŋuti la me nahe eye womaganya kpɔ wo.
Over time, weight gain or even simple aging can stretch and distort a tattoo.
Ðekakpui si ŋkɔe nye Joseph gblɔ be: "Mekpɔ ale si nu siwo amewo ta ɖe ŋuti va nɔna le ƒe geɖe megbe, womenya kpɔna kura o. "
"I’ve seen what tattoos look like on a person decades later, and it’s not pretty, " says a young man named Joseph.
Ðekakpui si ŋkɔe nye Allen si xɔ ƒe 21 gblɔ be: "Zi geɖe la, mexɔa ɣeyiɣi boo hafi nu siwo wota ɖe ŋuti megava nɔa vevie o.
"Tattoos often become outdated, " says 21-year-old Allen.
Nane si le vevie na amea wòta ɖe ŋuti fifia magava nɔ vevie nɛ le ƒe aɖewo megbe o. "
"What was once significant to the wearer might not be important just a few years later. "
Nyateƒee Allen to.
Allen makes a good point.
Nyateƒe lae nye be ne amewo le tsitsim la, nu siwo doa dzidzɔ na wo kple nu siwo wolɔ̃na va trɔna, gake gbedeasi si le nu si wota ɖe ŋuti si ya metrɔna o.
The fact is, as people age, their views change, their tastes change, and their affections change​ but their tattoos do not.
Ðetugbui aɖe si ŋkɔe nye Teresa gblɔ be: "Nyemedi be magatsɔ nutata ɖe ŋuti si ava nɔ ŋku ɖom nye bometsitsi dzi nam hã akpe ɖe nu siwo mewɔ le agbe me siwo ava vem emegbe la ŋu o. "
"Having got a tattoo that only reminds me of foolish feelings is something I wouldn’t want to add to the list of things I regret years later, " says a young woman named Teresa.
Biblia me mɔfiame kawo ŋutie nàbu?
What Bible principles apply?
Ame si tsi le susu me daa nuwo kpɔ nyuie hafi tsoa nya me.
A mature person takes time to weigh all factors before making a decision.
(Lododowo 21:5; Hebritɔwo 5:14) Eya ta Biblia me mɔfiame siwo gbɔna ate ŋu akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàtso nya me wòasɔ nyuie le nutata ɖe ŋuti gome.
(Proverbs 21:5; Hebrews 5:​14) So consider the following Bible principles that have a bearing on the subject of tattoos.
Kolosetɔwo 3:20: "Mi ɖeviwo, miɖo to mia dzilawo le nu sia nu me, elabena esia dzea Aƒetɔ la ŋu nyuie. "
Colossians 3:​20: "You children, be obedient to your parents in everything, for this is well-pleasing to the Lord. "
Nu kae ate ŋu ado tso eme na wò nenye be èle dziwòlawo gbɔ le aƒe me gake gbe woƒe sededewo dzi wɔwɔ?
What consequences might you experience if you live at home with your parents but fail to respect their direction?

1 Petro 3:​3, 4: "Migana miaƒe atsyɔ̃ɖoɖo nanye gota gome tɔ, to ɖaƒoƒo kple sikanuwo dodo alo awu xɔasiwo dodo me o, ke boŋ mina wòanye dzi me ƒe ame ɣaɣla si nye gbɔgbɔ fatu si nɔa anyi kpoo la ƒe atsyɔ̃ɖoɖo si megblẽna o, si xɔ asi ŋutɔ le Mawu ŋkume. "

1 Peter 3:​3, 4: "Do not let your adornment be external​ the braiding of hair and the wearing of gold ornaments or fine clothing​ but let it be the secret person of the heart in the incorruptible adornment of the quiet and mild spirit. "

Why, do you think, does the Bible put such emphasis on "the secret person of the heart "?
1 Timoteo 2:9: "Nyɔnuwo hã nado awu ɖe nɔnɔme nyui me, le ŋukpekpe kple ŋuɖɔɖo me. "
1 Timothy 2:9: "Women should adorn themselves . . . with modesty and soundness of mind. "

What is the meaning of the word "modesty "?

In the long term, why is modesty more attractive than body art?
Romatɔwo 12:1: "Miatsɔ miaƒe ŋutilãwo ana wòanye vɔsa gbagbe, si le kɔkɔe, si dzea Mawu ŋu, wòanye subɔsubɔdɔ kɔkɔe si me miazã miaƒe tamebubuŋutete le. "
Romans 12:1: "Present your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and acceptable to God, a sacred service with your power of reason. "
Nu ka tae ale si nèléa be na wò ŋutilã le vevie na Mawu?
Why does the way you treat your body matter to God?
Le susu siawo ta la, ame geɖe tso nya me be yewomata nu ɖe ŋuti o.
In view of these factors, many people have decided against getting a tattoo.
Le nyateƒe me la, wova ke ɖe nane si nyo wu nutata ɖe ŋuti ŋu.
In fact, they have found something better than tattoos.

Teresa, si ƒe nya míegblɔ va yi la gblɔ be: "Ne nyagbe alo nyagbɔgblɔ aɖe doa dzidzɔ na wò vevie alo ame aɖe le vevie na wò ŋutɔ la, ke wɔ ɖe nyagbe ma me nyawo dzi alo gblɔe na amea be ame vevie aɖe ŋutɔe wònye na ye.
Teresa, quoted earlier, says: "If there is a phrase or slogan that you truly love or a person who is important to you, then live by that phrase or tell that person how much he or she means to you.
Le esi nàta nu ɖe ŋuti teƒe la, nɔ agbe ɖe nu si dzi nèxɔ se la nu boŋ. "
Instead of getting a tattoo, live what you believe. "
Nu Ka Tae Megblɔa Nya Siwo Mesɔ O Ɣesiaɣi?
Why Do I Always Say the Wrong Thing?
"Ɣeaɖewoɣi la, metea ŋu ɖua nye aɖe dzi, gake ɣebubuɣiwo la, edzena abe nyemebua nyawo ŋu hafi ƒoa nu o ene! " James.
"Sometimes I can control my tongue, but other times it seems as if my mouth goes on without any help from my brain! "​ James.
"Ne metsi dzodzodzoe la, meƒoa nu nuwo ŋu mabumabui, eye ne meɖe dzi ɖi la, meƒoa nu fũu akpa.
"When I’m nervous I speak without thinking, and when I’m relaxed I say more than I should.
Eya ta ne míagblɔe la, nya siwo mesɔ o koe megblɔna zi geɖe. " Marie.
So, basically, I mess up all the time. "​ Marie.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Aɖe la, . . . dzoe wònye " eye wògagblɔ hã be, "Dzo sue aɖe ko tea ŋu tɔa dzo ave gã! "
The Bible says: "The tongue is . . . a fire " and, "How small a fire it takes to set a great forest ablaze! "
(Yakobo 3:5, 6) Ðe wò nuƒoƒo nana nèkpɔa nya zi geɖea?
(James 3:​5, 6) Do your words often get you into trouble?
Ne nenemae la, ke nyati sia ate ŋu akpe ɖe ŋuwò.
If so, this article can help you.
Nu ka tae megblɔa nya siwo mesɔ o?

Nu ka tae megblɔa nya siwo mesɔ o?
Why do I say the wrong thing?
Blibomademade.
Imperfection.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Mí katã míedaa vo zi geɖe.
The Bible says: "We all stumble many times.
Ne ame aɖe meda vo le nuƒoƒo me o la, enye ame deblibo. "
If anyone does not stumble in word, he is a perfect man. "
(Yakobo 3:2) Abe ale si ko blibomademade wɔnɛ be míetea ŋu klia nu ne míele zɔzɔm ene la, nenema kee wòtea ŋu nana míedaa vo le nuƒoƒo me hã.
(James 3:2) Human weakness makes us prone not only to stumble when we walk but also to say the wrong thing when we talk.
"Esi nye susu kple nye aɖe siaa mede blibo o ta la, susu manɔ eme o be magblɔ be mate ŋu aɖu wo dzi bliboe o. " Anna.
"Since I have an imperfect brain and an imperfect tongue, it’s delusional for me to say I have perfect control of them. "​ Anna.
Nuƒoƒo fũu akpa.
Talking too much.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Dadaƒu megbea nuƒoƒo vivivo me o. "
The Bible says: "When words are many, transgression cannot be avoided. "
(Lododowo 10:19) Ne ame aɖe ƒoa nu fũu akpa evɔ meɖoa to nyuie o la, enɔa bɔbɔe be wòagblɔ nya siwo ana wòadze agɔ le ame bubuwo dzi.
(Proverbs 10:19) People who talk too much​ and listen too little​ raise their odds of offending others by saying the wrong thing.
"Menye ame siwo ƒoa nu wu le amewo dome lae nye ame siwo dze aɖaŋu wu kokoko o.
"The smartest people in a room aren’t always the ones speaking.
Le ame siwo katã nɔ anyigba dzi kpɔ dome la, Yesu ye dze aɖaŋu wu, gake ɣeaɖewoɣi la, ezia ɖoɖoe. "
Jesus is the smartest person ever to walk this earth, and yet at times he kept quiet. "​ Julia.
Julia.
Sarcasm.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Nuƒoƒo eŋumabumabui le abe yitɔame ene. "
The Bible says: "Thoughtless speech is like the stabs of a sword. "
(Lododowo 12:18) Nuƒoƒo eŋumabumabui ƒe kpɔɖeŋu ɖekae nye gbɔɖiamenyawo gbɔgblɔ si fia be woagblɔ nya veame ɖe ame aɖe ŋu be woatsɔ adae ɖe anyi.
(Proverbs 12:18) One example of thoughtless speech is sarcasm​ stinging words meant to belittle others.
