But the people of Israel walked on dry ground through the midst of the sea.”
20 Eye nyɔnunyagblɔɖila Miriam, si nye Aron nɔvi, tsɔ axatsɛ ɖe asi, eye nyɔnuawo katã tsɔ axatsɛwo ɖe asi le ɣe ɖum kplɔe ɖo.
20 Then Miriam the prophetess, Aaron’s sister, took a tambourine in her hand, and all the women followed her with tambourines and with dances.
21 Eye Miriam xe ha na ŋutsuawo be:
21 Miriam sang in response to the men:
“Midzi ha na Yehowa, elabena eƒe ŋutikɔkɔe de dzi bobobo.
“Sing to Jehovah, for he has become highly exalted.
Etsɔ sɔ kple edola ƒu gbe ɖe atsiaƒu la me.”
The horse and its rider he has hurled into the sea.”
22 Emegbe Mose kplɔ Israel-viwo dzo le Ƒudzĩ la nu, eye woyi Sur gbedzi. Eye wozɔ gbea dzi ŋkeke etɔ̃, ke womekpɔ tsi o.
22 Moses later led Israel away from the Red Sea, and they went out to the wilderness of Shur and marched on for three days in the wilderness, but they did not find water.
23 Wova ɖo Mara, ke womete ŋu no tsi si le Mara o, elabena tsia le vevem.
23 They came to MArah, but they were not able to drink the water from MArah because it was bitter.
Esia tae wòna ŋkɔ teƒe ma be Mara.
That is why he named it MArah.
24 Eya ta dukɔ la lĩ liʋiliʋĩ le Mose ŋu hebia be: “Nu kae míano?” 25 Mose do ɣli na Yehowa, eye Yehowa fia ati aɖee.
24 So the people began to murmur against Moses, saying: “What are we to drink?” 25 He cried out to Jehovah, and Jehovah directed him to a tree.
Esi wòtsɔe da ɖe tsia me la, tsia zu tsi vivi.
When he threw it into the water, the water became sweet.
Afi ma Mawu na se kple ʋɔnudrɔ̃ɖoɖo wo le, eye afi mae wòdo wo kpɔ le.
There He established for them a regulation and a case for judgment, and there He put them to the test.

26 Eye wògblɔ be: “Ne èɖo to Yehowa wò Mawu ƒe gbe bliboe hewɔ nu si le dzɔdzɔe le eŋkume, eye nèƒu to anyi ɖe eƒe sededeawo ŋu hewɔ eƒe ɖoɖowo katã dzi la, ekema nyemahe dɔvɔ̃ siwo katã mehe va Egiptetɔwo dzi la dometɔ aɖeke ava dziwò o; elabena nye Yehowae le gbe dam le ŋuwò.”

26 He said: “If you will strictly listen to the voice of Jehovah your God and will do what is right in his eyes and will pay attention to his commandments and keep all his regulations, I will not bring upon you any of the diseases that I brought upon the Egyptians, for I, Jehovah, am healing you.”
27 Emegbe wova Elim, afi si tsidzɔƒe wuieve kple deti blaadre le.
27 After that they came to elim, where there were 12 springs of water and 70 palm trees.
Eye woƒu asaɖa anyi ɖe afi ma le tsia gbɔ.
So they camped there by the water.
Dukɔ la kpɔ be Mose mele gbɔgbɔm tso toa dzi o.
Meanwhile, the people saw that Moses was taking a long time coming down from the mountain.

Eya ta dukɔ la lɔ hoo va Aron gbɔ va gblɔ nɛ be: “Tso nàwɔ mawu na mí ne wòanɔ ŋgɔ na mí, elabena míenya nu si tututu dzɔ ɖe Mose sia si kplɔ mí tso Egipte-nyigba dzi la dzi o.” 2 Ale Aron gblɔ na wo be: “Miɖe sikatogɛ siwo le mia srɔ̃wo, mia viŋutsuwo kple mia vinyɔnuwo ƒe towo, miatsɔ wo vɛ nam.” 3 Eye ameawo katã ɖe sikatogɛ siwo le woƒe towo, eye wotsɔ wo vɛ na Aron.

So the people gathered around Aaron and said to him: “Get up, make for us a god who will go ahead of us, because we do not know what has happened to this Moses, the man who led us up out of the land of Egypt.” 2 At this Aaron said to them: “Take the gold earrings from the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters and bring them to me.” 3 So all the people began taking off the gold earrings that were in their ears and bringing them to Aaron.
4 Eye wòxɔ sika la le wo si, lóloe eye wòtsɔ pɛ wɔ dɔ le eŋu hetsɔe wɔ nyivii.
4 Then he took the gold from them, and he formed it with an engraving tool and made it into a statue of a calf.
Eye wogblɔ be: “Oo Israel, esiae nye wò Mawu, si kplɔ wò tso Egipte-nyigba dzi.”
They began to say: “This is your God, O Israel, who led you up out of the land of Egypt.”
5 Esi Aron kpɔ esia la, eɖi vɔsamlekpui ɖe eŋgɔ.
5 When Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it.
Eye Aron ɖe gbeƒã be: “Míaɖu azã na Yehowa etsɔ.” 6 Eya ta esi ŋu ke la, wofɔ kaba, eye wosa numevɔwo kple ŋutifafavɔwo.
Then Aaron called out: “There is a festival to Jehovah tomorrow.” 6 So they got up early on the next day and began offering up burnt offerings and presenting communion sacrifices.
Emegbe dukɔ la bɔbɔ nɔ anyi ɖu nu no nu.
After that the people sat down to eat and drink.
Eye wotso hedo dzidzɔ na wo ɖokuiwo.
Then they got up to have a good time.
7 Azɔ Yehowa gblɔ na Mose be: “Ði, nàyi, elabena wò dukɔ, si nèkplɔ tso Egipte-nyigba dzi la wɔ nu gbegblẽ.
7 Jehovah now said to Moses: “Go, descend, because your people, whom you led up out of the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves.
8 Wotrɔ ɖa kaba tso mɔ si dzi mede se na wo be woazɔ la dzi.
8 They have quickly deviated from the way I commanded them to go.

Wowɔ nyivi na wo ɖokui, eye wole ta dem agu nɛ hele vɔ sam nɛ le gbɔgblɔm be, ‘Oo Israel, esiae nye wò Mawu, si kplɔ wò tso Egipte-nyigba dzi.’” 9 Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose be: “Mekpɔ bena, dzimesesẽtɔwoe dukɔ sia nye.

They have made for themselves a statue of a calf, and they keep bowing down to it and sacrificing to it and saying, ‘This is your God, O Israel, who led you up out of the land of Egypt.’” 9 Jehovah went on to say to Moses: “I have seen that this is an obstinate people.
10 Eya ta na nye dɔmedzoe nabi ɖe wo ŋu, ne matsrɔ̃ wo katã, eye mawɔ wò nàzu dukɔ gã aɖe.”
10 So now let me be, and I will exterminate them in my burning anger, and let me make a great nation from you instead.”

11 Ke Mose ɖe kuku na Yehowa, eƒe Mawu la be: “Oo Yehowa, nu ka tae wò dɔmedzoe nabi ɖe wò dukɔ si nètsɔ ŋusẽ gã kple alɔ sesẽ kplɔ tso Egipte-nyigba dzi la ŋu? 12 Nu ka ŋuti Egiptetɔwo agblɔ be, ‘Tame vɔ̃e wòɖo, eya tae wòkplɔ wo dzoe, be yeawu wo le tonutowo me, eye yeatsrɔ̃ wo katã ɖa le anyigba la dzi’?

11 Then Moses appealed to Jehovah his God and said: “Why, O Jehovah, should you turn your burning anger against your people after bringing them out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand? 12 Why should the Egyptians say, ‘He had evil intentions when he led them out.
Na wò dɔmedzoe nu nafa, eye nàɖe asi le vɔ̃ si nèɖo be yeahe va wò dukɔ dzi la ŋu.
He wanted to kill them in the mountains and exterminate them from the surface of the earth’?

13 Ðo ŋku wò subɔla Abraham, Isak kple Israel dzi, ame siwo nètsɔ ɖokuiwò ka atam na esi nègblɔ na wo be: ‘Mana miaƒe dzidzimeviwo nasɔ gbɔ abe dziƒoɣletiviwo ene, eye matsɔ anyigba blibo sia si metia la ana miaƒe dzidzimeviwo wòazu wo tɔ tegbee.’”

13 Remember your servants Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, to whom you swore by yourself and said: ‘I will multiply your offspring like the stars of the heavens, and I will give all this land that I have designated to your offspring, so that they may take it as a permanent possession.’”
14 Eye Yehowa ɖe asi le vɔ̃ si wòɖo be yeahe va yeƒe dukɔa dzi la ŋu.
14 So Jehovah began to reconsider the calamity that he had spoken of bringing on his people.
15 Emegbe Mose ɖi tso to la dzi, eye Ðaseɖiɖikpe gbadzɛ eveawo le esi.
15 Moses then turned and went down from the mountain with the two tablets of the Testimony in his hand.
Woŋlɔ nu ɖe kpe gbadzɛawo ƒe axa eveawo; ŋgɔ kple megbe siaa.
The tablets were inscribed on both sides; they were written on the front and on the back.
16 Mawu ŋutɔe kpa kpe gbadzɛawo, eye Mawu ŋutɔe ɖe nuŋɔŋlɔawo ɖe kpeawo dzi.
16 The tablets were the workmanship of God, and the writing was the writing of God engraved on the tablets.
17 Esi dukɔ la ƒe ɣli nɔ ɖiɖim Yosua se la, egblɔ na Mose be: “Aʋaɣli le ɖiɖim le asaɖa la me.” 18 Gake Mose gblɔ nɛ be:
17 When Joshua began to hear the noise of the people because of their shouting, he said to Moses: “There is the sound of battle in the camp.” 18 But Moses said:
“Menye aʋadziɖuɣlie le ɖiɖim o,
“It is not the sound of singing over a victory,
Eye menye aʋasiɣli hãe o,
And it is not the sound of wailing over a defeat;
Hadzidzi bubu aɖe sem mele.”
I hear the sound of another kind of singing.”
19 Esi Mose gogo asaɖa la eye wòkpɔ nyivi la kple ale si wole ɣe ɖumee la, dzi kui vevie, eye wòtsɔ kpe gbadzɛ siwo le esi la xlã ɖe anyi wògbã ɖe to la te.
19 As soon as Moses got near the camp and saw the calf and the dances, his anger began to blaze, and he threw the tablets from his hands and shattered them at the foot of the mountain.
20 Azɔ etsɔ nyivi si wowɔ la de dzo me, emegbe etui memie; eye wòhlẽe ɖe tsia ŋgɔ, eye wòna Israel-viwo noe.
20 He took the calf that they had made and he burned it with fire and crushed it into powder; then he scattered it on the water and made the Israelites drink it.
21 Eye Mose bia Aron be: “Nu kae dukɔ sia wɔ wò, be nèhe nu vɔ̃ gã sia va wo dzi?” 22 Aron ɖo eŋu be: “Nye aƒetɔ, mègabi dzi o.
21 And Moses said to Aaron: “What did this people do to you that you have brought a great sin upon them?” 22 Aaron replied: “Do not be enraged, my lord.
Wò ŋutɔ ènya dukɔ la nyuie be vɔ̃wɔwɔ le dzi me na wo.
You well know that the people are inclined to do evil.

23 Ale wogblɔ nam be, ‘Wɔ mawu na mí, ne wòanɔ ŋgɔ na mí, elabena míenya nu si tututu dzɔ ɖe Mose sia si kplɔ mí tso Egipte-nyigba dzi la dzi o.’ 24 Eya ta megblɔ na wo be, ‘Ame si si sika le la netsɔe nam.’

23 So they said to me, ‘Make for us a god who will go ahead of us, for we do not know what has happened to this Moses, the man who led us up out of the land of Egypt.’ 24 So I said to them, ‘Whoever has any gold must take it off and give it to me.’
Ale metsɔe de dzo me, eye nyivi sia do tso eme.”
Then I threw it into the fire and out came this calf.”
25 Mose kpɔ be dukɔ la wɔ nu wògbɔ eme, elabena Aron ɖe mɔ na wo wowɔ nu wògbɔ eme, be wòazu ŋukpe na wo le woƒe futɔwo ŋkume.
25 Moses saw that the people were unrestrained, for Aaron had let them go unrestrained, so that they were a disgrace before their opposers.
26 Eye Mose va tɔ ɖe asaɖa la ƒe mɔnu gblɔ be: “Ame kae le Yehowa ƒe akpa dzi?
26 Then Moses took his position in the gate of the camp and said: “Who is on Jehovah’s side?
Neva gbɔnye!”
Come to me!”
Eye Lewi viwo katã va ƒo ƒu ɖe eŋu.
And all the Levites gathered around him.

27 Eye wògblɔ na wo be: “Ale Yehowa Israel ƒe Mawu la gblɔe nye esi: ‘Mia dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe neta eƒe yi. Mitsa le asaɖa la me, miayi tso agbo nu yi agbo nu, eye mia dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe newu nɔvia, ehavi kple exɔlɔ̃.’” 28 Lewi viwo wɔ abe ale si Mose gblɔe ene, ale be ame siwo ade akpe etɔ̃ tsrɔ̃ le dukɔ la dome gbe ma gbe.

27 He now said to them: “This is what Jehovah the God of Israel has said, ‘Each of you must fasten on his sword and pass through all the camp from gate to gate, killing his brother, his neighbor, and his close companion.’” 28 The Levites did what Moses said. So about 3,000 men were killed on that day.
29 Eye Mose gagblɔ be: “Mitsɔ mia ɖokuiwo na Yehowa egbea, elabena mia dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe tso ɖe eya ŋutɔ via kple nɔvia ŋu, eya ta ayra mi egbea.”
29 Then Moses said: “Set yourselves apart for Jehovah today, for each of you has gone against his own son and his own brother; today he will give you a blessing.”

30 Le ŋufɔke la, Mose gblɔ na dukɔ la be: “Miewɔ nu vɔ̃ gã aɖe ŋutɔ; eya ta matrɔ ayi Yehowa gbɔ le to la dzi; ɖewohĩ mate ŋu alé avu ɖe miaƒe nu vɔ̃ la ta.” 31 Ale Mose trɔ yi Yehowa gbɔ gblɔ be: “Ao! Dukɔ sia wɔ nu vɔ̃ gã aɖe ŋutɔ!

30 On the very next day, Moses said to the people: “You committed a very great sin, and now I will go up to Jehovah to see if I can make amends for your sin.” 31 So Moses returned to Jehovah and said: “What a great sin this people has committed!

Wotsɔ sika wɔ mawu na wo ɖokui! 32 Ke azɔ meɖe kuku, ne èlɔ̃ la, tsɔ woƒe nu vɔ̃ la ke; ne menye nenema o la, ekema tutu nye ŋkɔ ɖa le wò agbalẽ me.” 33 Ke Yehowa gblɔ na Mose be: “Ame si wɔ nu vɔ̃ ɖe ŋunye la, eya ƒe ŋkɔe matutu ɖa le nye agbalẽ me.

They made themselves a god of gold! 32 But now if you are willing, pardon their sin; if not, please wipe me out from your book that you have written.” 33 However, Jehovah said to Moses: “Whoever has sinned against me, I will wipe him out of my book.
34 Azɔ yi ɖakplɔ dukɔ la miayi afi si megblɔ na wò la.
34 Go now, lead the people to the place about which I have spoken to you.
Kpɔ ɖa!
Look!
Nye dɔla adze ŋgɔwò, eye ne ɣeyiɣi de be mabia akɔnta wo la, mahe to na wo ɖe woƒe nu vɔ̃ la ta.” 35 Eye Yehowa he fuwɔame va dukɔ la dzi, elabena wona Aron wɔ nyivi na wo.

My angel will go ahead of you, and on the day when I make an accounting, I will bring punishment on them for their sin.” 35 Then Jehovah began plaguing the people because they had made the calf, the one that Aaron had made.
“Ne ame aɖe fi nyi alo alẽ, eye wòwui alo dzrae la, ekema wòatsɔ nyi atɔ̃ aɖo nyi la teƒe, kple alẽ ene aɖo alẽ la teƒe.
“If a man steals a bull or a sheep and he slaughters or sells it, he is to compensate with five bulls for the bull and four sheep for the sheep.
2 (Ne fiafitɔ aɖe dze kpɔ va fifi ge le ame aɖe ƒe me eye wòlée heƒoe wòku la, amea meɖi ʋufɔ o.
2 (“If a thief is found in the act of breaking in and he gets struck and dies, there is no bloodguilt for him.
3 Ne nya sia dzɔ le ŋkeke me la, ekema amea ɖi ʋufɔ.)
3 But if it happens after sunrise, there is bloodguilt for him.)
“Ele na fiafitɔ la be wòaɖo eteƒe.
“He must make compensation.
Ne naneke mele esi o la, ekema woadzrae ɖe nu siwo wòfi la teƒe.
If he has nothing, then he must be sold for the things he stole.
4 Ne wokpɔ lã si wòfi la le esi agbagbee la, eɖanye nyi, tedzi, alo alẽ o, ele be wòaɖo eteƒe zi gbɔ zi eve.
4 If what he stole is found alive in his possession, whether it is a bull or a donkey or a sheep, he is to make double compensation.

5 “Ne ame aɖe kplɔ eƒe lãwo yi gbeɖuƒe le agble me alo waingble me, eye wòɖe asi le wo ŋu wogblẽ nu le ame bubu ƒe agble me la, ele be wòatsɔ eƒe agblemenuku nyuitɔwo alo eƒe waingblemenuku nyuitɔwo aɖo eteƒe.

5 “If anyone puts his animals out to graze in a field or a vineyard and lets them graze in someone else’s field, he is to make compensation with the best of his own field or with the best of his own vineyard.
6 “Ne dzo dze gbe, eye wòlé aŋɔkawo, eye nuku bablawo alo esiwo le bo dzi fiã, alo agble bliboa fiã la, ele be ame si tɔ dzo gbea la naɖo nu si fiã la teƒe.
6 “If a fire starts and spreads to thornbushes and it causes sheaves or standing grain or a field to be consumed, the one who started the fire must make compensation for what was burned.
7 “Ne ame aɖe tsɔ ga alo eƒe nanewo na ehavi be wòadzra ɖo na ye, eye wofii le amea ƒe me la, ne wolé fiafitɔa la, ekema wòaɖo eteƒe zi eve.
7 “If a man gives his fellow man money or articles to keep and these are stolen from the fellow man’s house, if the thief is found, he must make double compensation.
8 Ne womelé fiafitɔa o la, ekema woakplɔ aƒea tɔ ava Mawu vavã la ŋkume, ne woakpɔe ɖa be, eya ŋutɔe ɖo asi ehavi ƒe nuawo dzi hã.
8 If the thief is not found, the owner of the house must be brought before the true God in order to determine whether he put his hand on the goods of his fellow man.
9 Ne nya ku ɖe nyi, tedzi, alẽ, awu, alo nane si bu ŋu, eye ame ɖeka gblɔ le eŋu be, ‘Tɔnyee!’ la, woatsɔ wo ame evea ƒe nya la ava Mawu vavã la ŋkume.

9 In all cases of illegal possession of goods, concerning a bull, a donkey, a sheep, a garment, or anything lost of which he may say, ‘This is mine!’ both parties will present their case before the true God.
Eye ame si Mawu abu fɔe la aɖo eteƒe na ehavi zi eve.
The one whom God pronounces guilty is to make double compensation to his fellow man.

10 “Ne ame aɖe tsɔ tedzi alo nyi alo alẽ alo aƒemelã bubu aɖe na ehavi be wòakpɔ edzi, eye wòku alo nane wɔe, alo woda adzoe, eye ame bubu aɖeke mekpɔ eteƒe o la, 11 ekema wòaka atam na nɔvia le Yehowa ŋkume be yemeɖo asi ye havi ƒe nu la dzi o; eye nua tɔ nalɔ̃ ɖe edzi nɛ.

10 “If a man gives his fellow man a donkey or a bull or a sheep or any domestic animal to keep and it dies or gets maimed or gets led away while nobody is looking, 11 there should be an oath made between them before Jehovah, that he did not lay his hand on the goods of his fellow man; and the owner must accept it.
Amea maɖo eteƒe o.
The other man is not to make compensation.
12 Gake ne ɖe wofi lãa le egbɔ la, ekema wòaɖo eteƒe na nua tɔ.
12 But if the animal has been stolen from him, he is to make compensation to its owner.
13 Ne lã wɔadã aɖee vuvui la, ekema wòatsɔ eƒe kukua vɛ wòanye kpeɖodzi.
13 If it was torn by a wild animal, he is to bring it as evidence.
Maɖo nu si lã wɔadã aɖe vuvu la teƒe o.
He is not to make compensation for something torn by a wild animal.
14 “Gake ne ame aɖe ɣe lã le ehavi si, eye nane wɔe alo wòku evɔ ame si tɔ lãa nye la mele eteƒe o la, ekema ame si ɣe lã la naɖo eteƒe.
14 “But if anybody asks to borrow an animal from his fellow man and it gets maimed or it dies while its owner is not with it, the man who borrowed it must make compensation.
15 Ne nua tɔ le eteƒe la, ekema maɖo eteƒe o.
15 If its owner is with it, he is not to make compensation.
Ne ɖe wòhayae la, ho si wòhayae lae nye teƒeɖoɖoa.
If it was hired, the money paid for the hire is the compensation.
16 “Azɔ ne ŋutsu aɖe ble ɖetugbui leaƒe, si ame aɖeke medo ŋugbe na o nu hedɔ kplii la, ele be wòana tabianu ɖe eta wòazu srɔ̃a.
16 “Now if a man seduces a virgin who is not engaged and he lies down with her, he must pay the bride-price for her to become his wife.
17 Ne fofoa gbe gbidigbidi be yematsɔe anae wòaɖe o gɔ̃ hã la, ele be ŋutsua naxe fe si asɔ ɖe tabianu la nu.
17 If her father absolutely refuses to give her to him, he is to pay the money at the rate of the bride-price.
18 “Mègana nyɔnu dzotɔ aɖeke nanɔ agbe o.
18 “You must not allow a sorceress to live.
19 “Ame sia ame si dɔ lã aɖe gbɔ la, ele be woawui godoo.
19 “Anyone lying down with an animal must surely be put to death.
20 “Ame si sa vɔ na mawu bubu aɖe, eye menye na Yehowa ɖeɖe ko o la, ele be woatsrɔ̃e.
20 “Whoever sacrifices to any gods but Jehovah alone is to be devoted to destruction.
21 “Mègasẽ ŋuta le amedzro ŋu alo atee ɖe anyi o, elabena miawo hã mienye amedzrowo kpɔ le Egipte-nyigba dzi.
21 “You must not mistreat a foreign resident or oppress him, for you were foreign residents in the land of Egypt.
22 “Migawɔ fu ahosi alo tsyɔ̃evi aɖeke o.
22 “You must not afflict any widow or fatherless child.
23 Ne èwɔ fui, eye wòdo ɣli nam la, mase eƒe ɣlidodo la godoo; 24 nye dziku afla, eye mawu mi kple yi, mia srɔ̃wo azu ahosiwo, eye mia viwo azu tsyɔ̃eviwo.

23 If you afflict him at all, so that he cries out to me, I will unfailingly hear his outcry; 24 and my anger will blaze, and I will kill you with the sword, and your wives will become widows, and your children will be fatherless.
25 “Ne èdo ga na nye dukɔ la me tɔ dahe aɖe si le gbɔwò la, mègawɔ nu abe gasitsala ene o.
25 “If you lend money to anyone poor of my people, someone who is dwelling with you, you must not become like a moneylender to him.
Mègabia deme tso esi o.
You must not charge him interest.
26 “Ne èxɔ hawòvi ƒe avɔ abe awɔbanu ene la, gbugbɔe yi nɛ le ɣeɖoto.
26 “If you seize the garment of your fellow man as security for a loan, you are to return it to him by sunset.
27 Elabena eya koe nye avɔ si le esi wòatsyɔ; eye nu ka tsyɔ ge wòala amlɔ anyi?
27 For it is his only covering, his clothing to cover his body; in what will he lie down to sleep?
Ne edo ɣli nam la, masee, elabena amenuvelae menye.
When he cries out to me, I will certainly hear, for I am compassionate.
28 “Mègado ɖiŋu na Mawu, alo aƒo fi ade wò dukɔ la ƒe dumegã aɖeke o.
28 “You must not curse God nor curse a chieftain among your people.
29 “Mègahe ɖe megbe le wò agblemenuku, siwo do agbogbo, kple nu siwo gbagba ɖe wò nukufiãƒewo la nana me o.
29 “You must not hesitate to make offerings from your abundant produce and the overflow of your presses.
Eye nàtsɔ wò ŋgɔgbeviŋutsu nam.
The firstborn of your sons you are to give to me.
30 Ale nàwɔ wò nyi kple wò alẽe nye esi: Ŋkeke adre wòanɔ dadaa gbɔ.
30 This is what you should do with your bull and your sheep: Seven days it will continue with its mother.
Le ŋkeke enyia gbe la, nàtsɔe anam.
On the eighth day, you are to give it to me.
31 “Ame kɔkɔewo mianye nam, eye migaɖu gbemelã aɖeke si lã wɔadã aɖe vuvu la o.
31 “You should prove yourselves holy people to me, and you must not eat the flesh of anything in the field that has been torn by a wild animal.
Mitsɔe ƒu gbe na avuwo.
You should throw it to the dogs.
Eye Mawu gblɔ nya siawo katã be:
Then God spoke all these words:
2 “Nyee nye Yehowa wò Mawu, ame si kplɔ wò tso Egipte-nyigba dzi, afi si nye kluviƒe me.
2 “I am Jehovah your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
3 Mawu bubu aɖeke meganɔ asiwò kpe ɖe ŋunye o.
3 You must not have any other gods besides me.
4 “Mègawɔ legba alo nu siwo le dziƒo, alo anyigba dzi, alo nu siwo le tsi me le anyigba dzi la ƒe nɔnɔme na ɖokuiwò o.
4 “You must not make for yourself a carved image or a form like anything that is in the heavens above or on the earth below or in the waters under the earth.

5 Mègade ta agu na wo o, eye mègasubɔ wo o, elabena nye Yehowa wò Mawu la, Mawu si biaa ɖokuitsɔtsɔna blibo ye menye, eye mehea fofo siwo léa fum la ƒe vodada ŋuti tohehe vaa viwo dzi, vaa dzidzime etɔ̃lia kple enelia dzi, 6 ke mevea ame siwo lɔ̃am heléa nye sededewo me ɖe asi la ƒe dzidzime akpe nanewo nu.

5 You must not bow down to them nor be enticed to serve them, for I, Jehovah your God, am a God who requires exclusive devotion, bringing punishment for the error of fathers upon sons, upon the third generation and upon the fourth generation of those who hate me, 6 but showing loyal love to the thousandth generation of those who love me and keep my commandments.
7 “Mègayɔ Yehowa wò Mawu la ŋkɔ dzodzro o, elabena Yehowa magbe tohehe na ame si yɔa eŋkɔ dzodzro la o.
7 “You must not take up the name of Jehovah your God in a worthless way, for Jehovah will not leave unpunished the one who takes up His name in a worthless way.
8 “Ðo ŋku Sabat ŋkeke la dzi, ne nàwɔe kɔkɔe.
8 “Remember the Sabbath day to keep it sacred.
9 Ŋkeke ade nàwɔ dɔ, eye nàwɔ wò dɔwo katã, 10 ke ŋkeke adrelia nye sabat na Yehowa wò Mawu.
9 You are to labor and do all your work for six days, 10 but the seventh day is a sabbath to Jehovah your God.
Mègawɔ dɔ aɖeke o, eɖanye wò ŋutɔ alo viwòŋutsu alo viwònyɔnu, wò kluvi alo wò kosi alo wò lã alo wò amedzro si le mia nɔƒewo o.
You must not do any work, neither you nor your son nor your daughter nor your slave man nor your slave girl nor your domestic animal nor your foreign resident who is inside your settlements.
11 Elabena ŋkeke ade mee Yehowa wɔ dziƒowo kple anyigba, atsiaƒu kple wo me nuwo katã, eye wòte ɖiɖi ɖe eme le ŋkeke adrelia dzi.
11 For in six days Jehovah made the heavens and the earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and he began to rest on the seventh day.
Esia tae Yehowa yra Sabat ŋkeke la, eye wòwɔe kɔkɔe ɖo.
That is why Jehovah blessed the Sabbath day and made it sacred.
12 “Bu fofowò kple dawò, be nànɔ agbe didi le anyigba si Yehowa wò Mawu le na wò ge la dzi.
12 “Honor your father and your mother, so that you may live a long time in the land that Jehovah your God is giving you.
13 “Mègawu ame o.
13 “You must not murder.
14 “Mègawɔ ahasi o.
14 “You must not commit adultery.
15 “Mègafi fi o.
15 “You must not steal.
16 “Mègaɖi aʋatsoɖase ɖe hawòvi ŋu o.
16 “You must not testify falsely when you are a witness against your fellow man.
17 “Mègabiã ŋu hawòvi ƒe aƒe o.
17 “You must not desire your fellow man’s house.
Mègabiã ŋu hawòvi srɔ̃, eƒe kluvi alo eƒe kosi, eƒe nyi, eƒe tedzi alo nu siwo katã nye hawòvi tɔ la o.”
You must not desire your fellow man’s wife nor his slave man nor his slave girl nor his bull nor his donkey nor anything that belongs to your fellow man.”
18 Dukɔ blibo la katã le dzikedzoa kple to la ƒe dzudzɔtutu kpɔm, wole dziɖegbea kple kpẽa ƒe ɖiɖi sem; eye wonɔ dzodzom nyanyanya hetɔ ɖe adzɔge.
18 Now all the people were witnessing the thunder and lightning, the sound of the horn, and the mountain smoking; and seeing this made them tremble and stand at a distance.

19 Eye wogblɔ na Mose be: “Wò boŋ ƒo nu kpli mí, eye míaɖo to asee, gake mègana Mawu naƒo nu kpli mí o, be míagaku o.” 20 Eya ta Mose gblɔ na dukɔ la be: “Migavɔ̃ o, elabena ɖe Mawu vavã la va mia do ge kpɔ, ale be miavɔ̃e ne miagawɔ nu vɔ̃ o.” 21 Dukɔ la kpɔtɔ le tsitre ɖe adzɔge, ke Mose te ɖe alilikpo dodo si me Mawu vavã la le ŋu.

19 So they said to Moses: “You speak with us, and we will listen, but do not let God speak with us, for fear that we will die.” 20 So Moses said to the people: “Do not be afraid, for the true God has come to put you to the test, in order that the fear of him may continue with you so that you may not sin.” 21 So the people kept standing at a distance, but Moses went near to the dark cloud where the true God was.
22 Eye Yehowa gblɔ na Mose be: “Ale nàgblɔ na Israel-viwoe nye esi: ‘Miawo ŋutɔwo miekpɔe be dziƒoe meƒo nu kpli mi tsoe.
22 Then Jehovah said to Moses: “This is what you are to say to the Israelites, ‘You have seen for yourselves that I spoke with you from heaven.
23 Migawɔ klosalomawuwo kpe ɖe ŋunye o, eye migawɔ sikamawuwo na mia ɖokuiwo o.
23 You must not make gods of silver alongside me, and you must not make gods of gold for yourselves.
24 Tsɔ anyi ɖi vɔsamlekpui nam, eya dzi nàsa wò numevɔwo kple wò ŋutifafavɔwo le, eye nàlé lã le wò alẽhawo kple wò nyihawo dome asa vɔ le edzi.
24 An altar of earth you are to make for me, and you will sacrifice on it your burnt offerings, your communion sacrifices, your flock, and your herd.
Eye le teƒe sia teƒe si mana woaɖo ŋku nye ŋkɔ dzi le la, mava gbɔwò eye mayra wò.
In every place where I cause my name to be remembered I will come to you and I will bless you.
25 Eye ne èbe yeatsɔ kpe aɖi vɔsamlekpui nam la, mègatsɔ kpe si wotsɔ dɔwɔnu aɖe kpa la aɖii o.
25 If you make an altar of stones for me, you must not build it using stones cut with tools.
Ne ètsɔ pɛ fui la, ekema ègblẽ kɔ ɖo nɛ.
For if you do use your chisel on it, you will profane it.
26 Eye mègaflɔ atrakpui ayi nye vɔsamlekpui la dzi o, ne wò ama nagadze le edzi o.’
26 And you must not go up by steps to my altar, that your private parts may not be exposed upon it.’
Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose be: 2 Kpɔ ɖa, metia Bezalel, si nye Uri vi, Hur vi, si tso Yuda-to la me.
Jehovah continued to speak to Moses, saying: 2 “See, I have chosen Bezalel the son of uri the son of Hur of the tribe of Judah.

3 Mana nye gbɔgbɔ nayɔe fũu le nunya, gɔmesese, sidzedze kple aɖaŋudɔwo katã ƒomevi wɔwɔ me, 4 ne wòanya ale si wowɔa aɖaŋunu vovovowo, ale si wowɔa sika, klosalo kple akɔbli ŋu dɔe, 5 ale si woakpa kpe atsɔ ado atsyã na nuwo kple ale si woakpa atinu ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi.

3 I will fill him with the spirit of God, giving him wisdom, understanding, and knowledge of every kind of craftsmanship, 4 for making artistic designs, for working with gold, silver, and copper, 5 for cutting and setting stones, and for making every kind of wood product.

6 Azɔ hã, metia Oholiab, si nye Ahisamak vi tso Dan-to la me, be wòakpe ɖe eŋu, eye mede nunya ame siwo katã aɖaŋu le tagbɔ na la ƒe dzi me be woawɔ nu siwo katã meɖo na wò la: 7 takpegbadɔ la, Ðaseɖiɖiɖaka la kple eƒe nutunu, agbadɔ la ŋu nuwo katã, 8 kplɔ̃ la kple eŋu nuwo, sikakaɖiti la kple eŋu nuwo katã, dzudzɔdomlekpui la, 9 numevɔsamlekpui la kple eŋu nuwo katã, ze la kple eƒe zɔ, 10 awu siwo woalɔ̃ nyuie, nunɔla Aron ƒe awu kɔkɔeawo kple viaŋutsuwo ƒe awu siwo woado awɔ nunɔladɔwo, 11 ami kɔkɔe kple atike ʋeʋĩ hena kɔkɔeƒe la.

6 Moreover, to assist him I have appointed OhOliab the son of AhisAmach of the tribe of Dan, and I am putting wisdom into the heart of all those who are skillful, so that they may make everything I have commanded you: 7 the tent of meeting, the ark of the Testimony and the cover that is on it, all the equipment of the tent, 8 the table and its utensils, the lampstand of pure gold and all its utensils, the altar of incense, 9 the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, the basin and its stand, 10 the finely woven garments, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, the garments of his sons to serve as priests, 11 the anointing oil, and the perfumed incense for the sanctuary.
Woawɔ nu siwo katã meɖo na wò la.
They will do everything I have commanded you.”

12 Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose be: 13 “Gblɔ na Israel-viwo be, ‘Ele vevie be mialé nye sabatwo me ɖe asi, elabena dzesi wònye le nye kpli mi dome le miaƒe dzidzimewo katã me, ne miadze sii be nye, Yehowa, ye kɔ mia ŋu.

12 Jehovah said further to Moses: 13 “Speak to the Israelites and tell them, ‘Especially, you are to keep my sabbaths, for it is a sign between me and you during your generations in order that you may know that I, Jehovah, am sanctifying you.
14 Milé Sabat ƒe se la me ɖe asi, elabena nu kɔkɔe wònye na mi.
14 You must keep the Sabbath, for it is something holy to you.
Ame si made bubu eŋu o la, woawui.
Whoever profanes it must be put to death.
Ne edzɔ be ame aɖe wɔ dɔ le edzi la, woatsrɔ̃ ame ma ɖa le eƒe dukɔ la dome.
If anyone does any work on it, then that person must be cut off from among his people.
15 Ŋkeke ade miawɔ dɔ, ke ŋkeke adrelia anye dzudzɔ blibo ƒe sabat.
15 Six days work may be done, but on the seventh day is a sabbath of complete rest.
Anɔ kɔkɔe na Yehowa.
It is something holy to Jehovah.
Ame sia ame si wɔ dɔ le Sabat ŋkeke dzi la, woawui.
Anyone doing work on the Sabbath day must be put to death.
16 Israel-viwo nalé Sabat ƒe se la me ɖe asi; woawɔ Sabat ƒe se la dzi le woƒe dzidzimewo katã me.
16 The Israelites must keep the Sabbath; they must observe the Sabbath during all their generations.
Nubabla mavɔ wònye.
It is a lasting covenant.
17 Dzesi wònye le nye kple Israel-viwo dome ɖaa, elabena ŋkeke ade Yehowa wɔ dziƒo kple anyigba, eye wòdzudzɔ le ŋkeke adrea gbe hele ɖiɖim ɖe eme.’”
17 It is an enduring sign between me and the people of Israel, for in six days Jehovah made the heavens and the earth and on the seventh day he rested and refreshed himself.’”
18 Ke esi wòƒo nu kple Mose le Sinai To la dzi vɔ teti ko la, etsɔ Ðaseɖiɖikpe gbadzɛ eveawo nɛ; woawoe nye kpe gbadzɛ siwo dzi Mawu tsɔ eƒe asibidɛ ŋlɔ nu ɖo.
18 Now as soon as he had finished speaking with him on Mount Sinai, he gave Moses two tablets of the Testimony, tablets of stone written on by God’s finger.

Emegbe Mose yɔ Israel ƒe ha blibo la katã ƒo ƒu eye wògblɔ na wo be: “Se siwo Yehowa de be miawɔ wo dzi lae nye esi: 2 Ŋkeke ade miawɔ dɔ, ke ŋkeke adrelia nanɔ kɔkɔe na mi, dzudzɔ blibo ƒe sabat wònye na Yehowa.

Moses later gathered the entire assembly of the Israelites together and said to them: “These are the things that Jehovah has commanded to be done: 2 Work may be done for six days, but the seventh day will become something holy to you, a sabbath of complete rest to Jehovah.
Ame sia ame si awɔ dɔ le edzi la, woawui.
Anybody doing work on it will be put to death.
3 Migado dzo le mia nɔƒewo le Sabat ŋkeke la dzi o.”
3 You must not light a fire in any of your dwelling places on the Sabbath day.”
4 Mose gagblɔ na Israel ƒe ha blibo la be: “Se si Yehowa de lae nye esi: 5 ‘Midzɔ nu na Yehowa.
4 Moses then said to the entire assembly of the Israelites: “This is what Jehovah has commanded, 5 ‘Take up a contribution for Jehovah from among yourselves.

Ame sia ame si ƒe dzi ʋãe la, nadzɔ nu siawo na Yehowa: sika, klosalo, akɔbli, 6 ka blɔtɔ, alẽfuka si wode ama aɖabɛ dzĩtɔe, ka dzĩ, ɖeti ɣi biɖibiɖi, gbɔ̃fu, 7 agbogbalẽ si wode ama dzĩi, nyogbalẽ kple akasiati, 8 ami si woade akaɖigbɛ la me, balsam-mi si woatsɔ awɔ ami kɔkɔe la kple atike ʋeʋĩ la, 9 oniks-kpe kple kpe xɔasi bubu siwo woaɖo ɖe kɔmewu la kple akɔtaɖonu la ŋu.

Let everyone with a willing heart bring a contribution for Jehovah: gold, silver, copper, 6 blue thread, purple wool, scarlet material, fine linen, goat hair, 7 ram skins dyed red, sealskins, acacia wood, 8 oil for the lamps, balsam for the anointing oil and for the perfumed incense, 9 onyx stones, and other stones for setting in the ephod and the breastpiece.

10 “Ame siwo katã aɖaŋu le tagbɔ na le mia dome la, nava wɔ dɔ siwo katã Yehowa ɖo la; 11 woawoe nye: avɔgbadɔ la kple eƒe agbadɔvɔ kpakple etamegbavɔ la, eƒe gaviwo, eƒe ʋuƒowo, eƒe xɔblatiwo, eƒe sɔtiwo kple eƒe anyinɔwo; 12 Aɖaka la kple eŋu kpowo, nutunu la kple xɔmetsovɔ la; 13 kplɔ̃ la, eŋu kpowo kple eŋu nuwo katã, kple ŋkumeɖobolo la; 14 akaɖiti la kple eŋu nuwo kpakple eƒe akaɖigbɛwo, kple akaɖigbɛmemi la; 15 dzudzɔdomlekpui la kple eŋu kpowo; ami kɔkɔe la kple atike ʋeʋĩ la; avɔgbadɔ la ƒe mɔnuvɔ; 16 numevɔsamlekpui la kple eŋu akɔbligaɖɔ la, eŋu kpowo kple eŋu nuwo katã; ze la kple eƒe zɔ; 17 avɔ si woatsɔ atɔ kpɔ ɖe xɔxɔnu la ŋu, eƒe kpɔtiwo kple eƒe anyinɔwo; xɔxɔnu la ƒe mɔnuvɔ la; 18 avɔgbadɔ la ƒe tsyotiwo kple xɔxɔnu la ƒe tsyotiwo kple wo ŋu kawo; 19 awu siwo woalɔ̃ nyuie be woatsɔ awɔ subɔsubɔdɔ le kɔkɔeƒe la, awu kɔkɔeawo na nunɔla Aron, kple viaŋutsuwo ƒe awu siwo woado awɔ nunɔladɔwo.’”

10 “‘Let all who are skilled among you come and make everything that Jehovah has commanded, 11 namely, the tabernacle with its tent and its covering, its clasps and its panel frames, its bars, its pillars, and its socket pedestals; 12 the Ark and its poles, the cover, and the curtain for the screen; 13 the table and its poles and all its utensils and the showbread; 14 the lampstand for light and its utensils and its lamps and the oil for lighting; 15 the altar of incense and its poles; the anointing oil and the perfumed incense; the screen for the tabernacle’s entrance; 16 the altar of burnt offering and its copper grating, its poles and all its utensils; the basin and its stand; 17 the hanging curtains of the courtyard, its pillars and its socket pedestals; the screen of the entrance to the courtyard; 18 the tent pins of the tabernacle and the tent pins of the courtyard and their cords; 19 the finely woven garments for ministering in the sanctuary, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons for serving as priests.’”
20 Azɔ Israel ƒe ha blibo la dzo le Mose ŋkume.
20 So all the assembly of the Israelites went out from before Moses.
21 Azɔ ame sia ame si ƒe dzi kple eƒe gbɔgbɔ ʋãe la, va dzɔ nu na Yehowa, be woatsɔ awɔ takpegbadɔ la ƒe dɔ kple eŋu nuwo katã kpakple awu kɔkɔeawo.

21 Then everyone whose heart impelled him and everyone whose spirit incited him came and brought their contribution for Jehovah to be used for the tent of meeting, for all its service, and for the holy garments.
22 Eye ŋutsuwo kple nyɔnuwo, ame sia ame si lɔ̃ tso dzi me faa la va. Wotsɔ atsyɔ̃ɖogɛwo, togɛwo, asigɛwo, nyɔnuwo ƒe atsyɔ̃ɖonuwo kple sikanuwo katã ƒomevi vɛ.
22 They kept coming, the men along with the women, each with a willing heart, bringing brooches, earrings, rings, and other jewelry, as well as all sorts of articles of gold.
Ɛ̃, ame sia ame dzɔ sika na Yehowa.
They all presented their offerings of gold to Jehovah.
23 Eye ame siwo katã si ka blɔtɔ, alẽfuka si wode ama aɖabɛ dzĩtɔe, ka dzĩ, ɖeti ɣi biɖibiɖi, gbɔ̃fu, agbogbalẽ siwo wode ama dzĩi kple nyogbalẽ le la, tsɔ wo vɛ.
23 And all who had blue thread, purple wool, scarlet material, fine linen, goat hair, ram skins dyed red, and sealskins brought them.
24 Ame siwo katã di be yewoadzɔ klosalo kple akɔbli la, dzɔ wo na Yehowa, eye ame siwo katã si akasiati le la tsɔe vɛ be woatsɔ awɔ nuawo ŋuti dɔ la.
24 All those contributing silver and copper brought Jehovah’s contribution, and all who had acacia wood for any part of the work brought it.
25 Eye nyɔnu siwo katã aɖaŋu le tagbɔ na la tsɔ woƒe asiwo tre ɖeti, ka blɔtɔ, alẽfuka si wode ama aɖabɛ dzĩtɔe, ka dzĩ kple ɖeti ɣi eye wotsɔ wo vɛ.
25 All the skilled women spun with their hands, and they brought what they had spun: blue thread, purple wool, scarlet material, and fine linen.
26 Eye nyɔnu siwo katã nya gbɔ̃fu tetre nyuie eye woƒe dzi ʋã wo la, tre gbɔ̃fu.
26 And all the skilled women whose hearts impelled them spun the goat hair.
27 Eye tatɔwo tsɔ oniks-kpewo kple kpe xɔasi siwo woaɖo ɖe kɔmewua kple akɔtaɖonu la ŋu vɛ, 28 hekpe ɖe balsam-mi, akaɖigbɛmemi, ami si woatsɔ awɔ ami kɔkɔe la kple atike ʋeʋĩ la ŋu.

27 And the chieftains brought onyx stones and other stones to be set in the ephod and the breastpiece, 28 and the balsam and the oil for lighting and for the anointing oil and for the perfumed incense.
29 Ŋutsu kple nyɔnu siwo katã ƒe dzi ʋã wo be woatsɔ nane avɛ hena dɔ blibo si Yehowa ɖo be woawɔ to Mose dzi la, tsɔ wo vɛ; Israel-viwo va na lɔlɔ̃nu faa nunanawo Yehowa.
29 All the men and women whose hearts incited them brought something for the work that Jehovah, through Moses, had commanded to be done; the Israelites brought it as a voluntary offering to Jehovah.
30 Eye Mose gblɔ na Israel-viwo be: “Kpɔ ɖa, Yehowa tia Bezalel, si nye Uri vi, Hur vi, tso Yuda-to la me.
30 Then Moses said to the Israelites: “See, Jehovah has chosen Bezalel the son of uri the son of Hur of the tribe of Judah.

31 Mawu tsɔ eƒe gbɔgbɔ yɔe fũu eye wòna nunya, gɔmesese, sidzedze kple aɖaŋudɔwo katã ƒomevi wɔwɔ ƒe ŋutetee, 32 ne wòanya ale si wowɔa aɖaŋudɔ vovovowo, ale si wowɔa sika, klosalo kple akɔbli ŋu dɔe, 33 ale si woakpa kpe atsɔ ado atsyã na nuwo, kple ale si woakpa ati hena aɖaŋunu ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi wɔwɔ.

31 He has filled him with the spirit of God, giving him wisdom, understanding, and knowledge of every sort of craftsmanship 32 for making artistic designs, for working with gold, silver, and copper, 33 for cutting and setting stones, and for making all kinds of artistic wood products.
34 Eye wòdee dzi me na eya kple Oholiab, si nye Ahisamak si tso Dan-to la me ƒe vi, be woafia nu.
34 And he has put it into his heart to teach, he and OhOliab the son of AhisAmach of the tribe of Dan.
35 Ede nunya woƒe dzi me fũu, be woanya aɖaŋudɔwo wɔwɔ, aɖaŋuvɔlɔlɔ̃, be woanya ale si woatsɔ ka blɔtɔ, alẽfuka si wode ama aɖabɛ dzĩtɔe, ka dzĩ kple ɖeti ɣi biɖibiɖi alɔ̃ nui.
35 He has filled them with skill to do all the work of a craftsman, an embroiderer, and a weaver using blue thread, purple wool, scarlet material, and fine linen, and of a loom worker.
Ŋutsu siawo awɔ dɔ ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi, eye woawɔ aɖaŋudɔwɔnu vovovoawo.
These men will do every sort of work and prepare every sort of design.
“Esiawoe nye ʋɔnudrɔ̃ɖoɖo siwo nàgblɔ na wo:
“These are the judicial decisions that you are to convey to them:
2 “Ne èƒle Hebri ŋutsu aɖe kluvii la, anye kluvi na wò ƒe ade, ke le ƒe adrelia me la, nàna ablɔɖee wòadzo fe aɖeke maxemaxee.
2 “If you buy a Hebrew slave, he will serve as a slave for six years, but in the seventh year, he will be set free without paying anything.
3 Ne eya ɖekae va la, ekema eya ɖekae adzo.
3 If he came by himself, he will go out by himself.
Ne ekplɔ srɔ̃a ɖe asi vɛ la, ekema srɔ̃a hã nadzo kplii.
If he is the husband of a wife, then his wife must go out with him.
4 Ne eƒe aƒetɔ tsɔ nyɔnu nɛ wòɖe, eye wòdzi ŋutsuviwo kple nyɔnuviwo nɛ la, ekema nyɔnu la kple viawo azu eƒe aƒetɔ tɔ, ke eya ɖeka nadzo.
4 If his master gives him a wife and she bears him sons or daughters, the wife and her children will become her master’s, and he will go out by himself.
5 Gake ne kluvi la gbe be yemadzo o hegblɔ be: ‘Melɔ̃ nye aƒetɔ, srɔ̃nye, kple vinyewo; nyemedi be woana ablɔɖem o’ la, 6 ekema eƒe aƒetɔ la nakplɔe ava Mawu vavã la ŋkume.
5 But if the slave should insist and say, ‘I love my master, my wife, and my sons; I do not want to be set free,’ 6 his master must bring him before the true God.
Emegbe wòakplɔe ayi ʋɔtru alo ʋɔtruti la ŋu, eye eƒe aƒetɔ natsɔ nuŋɔnui aŋɔ to nɛ, ale wòazu eƒe kluvi le eƒe agbemeŋkekewo katã me.
Then he will bring him up against the door or the doorpost, and his master will pierce his ear through with an awl, and he will be his slave for life.
7 “Ne ŋutsu aɖe dzra vianyɔnu wòzu kosi la, womana ablɔɖee wòadzo abe ale si kluvi dzona ene o.
7 “If a man sells his daughter as a slave, she will not go free the same way that a slave man does.
8 Ne kosi la ƒe nu menyo eƒe aƒetɔ ŋu o, eye aƒetɔ la megadi be wòanye yeƒe ahiã o, gake wòdi be yeadzrae na ame aɖe la, mekpɔ mɔ adzrae na dukɔ bubu me tɔ o, elabena mewɔ nuteƒe na kosi la o.

8 If her master is not pleased with her and he does not designate her as a concubine but causes her to be purchased by someone else, he will not be entitled to sell her to foreigners, for he has betrayed her.
9 Eye ne viaŋutsue wòtsɔe na wòɖe la, ekema wòana vinyɔnuwo ƒe gomee.
9 If he selects her for his son, he is to grant her the rights of a daughter.
10 Mele be viaŋutsu la naɖe srɔ̃a ƒe nuɖuɖu, eƒe nudodo kple nu si wòdze na la dzi kpɔtɔ ne eɖe nyɔnu bubu o.
10 If he takes another wife for himself, the sustenance, the clothing, and the marriage due of the first wife are not to be diminished.
11 Ne mawɔ nu etɔ̃ siawo nɛ o la, ekema nyɔnua nadzo faa, fe aɖeke maxemaxee.
11 If he will not render these three things to her, then she is to go free without paying any money.
12 “Ne ame aɖe ƒo ame wòku la, woawu eya hã.
12 “Anyone who strikes a man so that he dies must be put to death.
13 Ke ne ame aɖe meɖoe hafi wu ame o, gake Mawu vavã la ɖe mɔ wòdzɔ la, ekema maɖo teƒe aɖe na wò, afi si wòasi ayi.
13 But if he does it unintentionally and the true God lets it happen, I will designate for you a place where he can flee.
14 Eye ne ame aɖe do dziku ɖe ehavi ŋu helĩhelĩ, eye wòɖoe wui la, ele be woawu ame ma, ne nye vɔsamlekpui la gbɔe wòle be miahee tsoe gɔ̃ hã.
14 If a man becomes very angry with his fellow man and he deliberately kills him, the man must die even if you have to take him from my altar.
15 Ame si ke ƒo fofoa alo dadaa la, woawui.
15 One who strikes his father or his mother must be put to death.
16 “Ne ame aɖe fi ame, eye wòdzrae, alo wokpɔe le esi la, woawui.
16 “If anyone kidnaps a man and sells him or is caught holding him, he must be put to death.
17 “Ame si do ɖiŋu na fofoa alo dadaa la, woawui.
17 “Anyone who curses his father or his mother must be put to death.

18 “Nu si woawɔ ne ŋutsuwo le dzre wɔm, eye ɖeka tsɔ kpe xlã ɖe ehavi alo tu kɔe gake meku o, ke wòtsi aba dzi lae nye esi: 19 Ne ete ŋu fɔ do go le tɔtɔm ɖe ati ŋu la, ekema womahe to na ame si tsɔ nu xlã ɖee la o.

18 “This is what should happen if men quarrel and one strikes his fellow man with a stone or a fist and he does not die but is confined to his bed: 19 If he is able to get up and walk around outdoors with the aid of a staff, then the one who struck him must be free from punishment.
Ðeko wòaxe fe ɖe ɣeyiɣi si ehavi la mete ŋu gawɔ dɔ o la ta, va se ɖe esime wòhaya keŋkeŋ.
He will only make compensation for the time the injured man lost from his work until he is completely healed.
20 “Ne ame aɖe tsɔ ati ƒo eƒe kluvi alo kosi wòku ɖe esi me la, woabia hlɔ̃e.
20 “If a man strikes his slave man or his slave girl with a stick and that one dies by his hand, that one must be avenged.
21 Gake ne eganɔ agbe ŋkeke ɖeka alo ŋkeke eve hafi ku la, ekema womabia hlɔ̃e o, elabena enye ame si eƒe aƒetɔ tsɔ ga ƒle.
21 However, if he survives for one or two days, he is not to be avenged, because he is someone bought with his owner’s money.

22 “Ne ŋutsuwo le avu wɔm, eye wowɔ nu vevi nyɔnu funɔ aɖe, eye wòdzi vi evɔ eƒe ŋkeke mekpɔ de hafi o, gake afɔku aɖeke medzɔ si he ku vɛ o la, ele be agɔdzelaa naxe fe si nyɔnua srɔ̃ abla nɛ; eye wòaxee to ʋɔnudrɔ̃lawo dzi.

22 “If men should struggle with each other and they hurt a pregnant woman and she gives birth prematurely but no fatality results, the offender must pay the damages imposed on him by the husband of the woman; and he must pay it through the judges.

23 Ke ne afɔku aɖe dzɔ, si he ku vɛ la, ekema woabia agbe ɖe agbe teƒe, 24 ŋku ɖe ŋku teƒe, aɖu ɖe aɖu teƒe, asi ɖe asi teƒe, afɔ ɖe afɔ teƒe, 25 dzobi ɖe dzobi teƒe, abi ɖe abi teƒe, ƒoƒo ɖe ƒoƒo teƒe.
23 But if a fatality does occur, then you must give life for life, 24 eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot, 25 burn for burn, wound for wound, blow for blow.
26 “Ne ŋutsu aɖe ƒo ŋku na eƒe kluvi alo eƒe kosi wògbã la, ekema wòana ablɔɖe kluvi la wòadzo atsɔ aɖo eƒe ŋku la teƒe nɛ.
26 “If a man strikes the eye of his slave man or the eye of his slave girl and he destroys it, he is to let the slave go free in compensation for his eye.
27 Eye ne eŋe eƒe kluvi alo eƒe kosi ƒe aɖu la, wòana ablɔɖee wòadzo atsɔ aɖo eƒe aɖu la teƒe nɛ.
27 And if he knocks out the tooth of his slave man or of his slave girl, he is to let the slave go free in compensation for his tooth.
28 “Ne nyi aɖe tu dzo ŋutsu alo nyɔnu aɖe wòku la, ekema woaƒu kpe nyi la wòaku, eye womaɖu eƒe lã o, ke womahe to na nyia tɔ o.
28 “If a bull gores a man or a woman and that one dies, the bull must be stoned to death and its meat is not to be eaten; but the owner of the bull is free from punishment.
29 Ke ne nyia lɔ̃a dzotutu ame, eye woxlɔ̃ nu nyia tɔ, gake mekpɔ edzi o, eye wòwu ŋutsu alo nyɔnu aɖe la, ekema woaƒu kpe nyi la, eye woawu nyia tɔ hã.

29 But if a bull was in the habit of goring and its owner had been warned but he would not keep it under guard and it killed a man or a woman, the bull is to be stoned and its owner is also to be put to death.
30 Gake ne wodo hlɔ̃fe nɛ la, ekema wòaxee abe ale si tututu woɖoe nɛ ene ɖe eƒe agbe ta.
30 If a ransom is imposed on him, he must give as the redemption price for his life all that may be imposed on him.
31 Ne etu dzo ŋutsuvi alo nyɔnuvi aɖe la, woawɔ nyia tɔ abe ale si wòle le ʋɔnudrɔ̃ɖoɖo sia me la ene.
31 Whether it gored a son or a daughter, it is to be done to the bull’s owner according to this judicial decision.
32 Ne kluvi alo kosi ye nyi la tu dzoe la, axe sekel blaetɔ̃ na eƒe aƒetɔ, eye woaƒu kpe nyi la wòaku.
32 If the bull gored a slave man or a slave girl, he will give the price of 30 shekels to that one’s master, and the bull will be stoned to death.
33 “Ne ame aɖe ʋu do aɖe nu da ɖi, alo ɖe do metu nu ɖe enu o, eye nyi alo tedzi aɖe ge dze eme la, 34 ekema doa tɔ naɖo eteƒe.
33 “If a man uncovers or digs a pit and does not cover it and a bull or a donkey falls into it, 34 the owner of the pit is to make compensation.
Ele be agɔdzelaa naxe fe na lãa tɔ, eye lã kukua nazu etɔ.
He is to pay the price to its owner, and the dead animal will become his.
35 Ne ame aɖe ƒe nyi wɔ nu vevi ame bubu ƒe nyi wòku la, ekema woadzra nyi gbagbe la, eye woama eƒlega la; woama lã kukua hã.
35 If a man’s bull hurts another’s bull and it dies, then they must sell the live bull and divide the price paid for it; they should also divide the dead animal.
36 Alo ne wonyae be nyi aɖe lɔ̃a dzotutu nyi bubuwo, gake nyia tɔ mekpɔ edzi o la, ke wòaɖo eteƒe, nyi ɖe nyi teƒe, eye kukua nazu etɔ.
36 Or if it was known that a bull had been in the habit of goring but its owner would not keep it under guard, he must make compensation with bull for bull, and the dead one will become his own.
“Eye nàtsɔ agbadɔvɔ ewo, siwo wolɔ̃ kple ɖeti ɣi biɖibiɖi dada, ka blɔtɔ, alẽfuka si wode ama aɖabɛ dzĩtɔe kple ka dzĩ la, awɔ avɔgbadɔ la.
“You are to make the tabernacle with ten tent cloths of fine twisted linen, blue thread, purple wool, and scarlet material.
Aɖaŋuvɔlɔ̃la nalɔ̃ kerubiwo ɖe wo me.
You are to make them with embroidered cherub designs.
2 Agbadɔvɔ ɖe sia ɖe nadidi abɔklugui blaeve vɔ enyi, eye wòakeke abɔklugui ene.
2 Each tent cloth will be 28 cubits long and 4 cubits wide.
Dzidze ɖeka nanɔe na agbadɔvɔawo katã.
All the tent cloths are to be the same size.
3 Woatɔ agbadɔvɔ atɔ̃ atsiã ɖe wo nɔewo nu, eye woatɔ agbadɔvɔ atɔ̃ bubu atsiã ɖe wo nɔewo nu.
3 Five tent cloths are to be joined one to another to form a series, and the other five tent cloths will be joined in a series.
4 Tsɔ ka blɔtɔ wɔ ka kotoewo ɖe agbadɔvɔ gbãtɔ si wotɔ tsiã la ƒe go ɖeka, nàwɔe alea ke ɖe agbadɔvɔ evelia si wotɔ tsiã la hã ƒe go kemɛ, le afi si woakpe wo le.
4 You will make loops of blue thread on the edge of the one tent cloth at the end of the series, and you are to do the same on the outermost edge of the other set where it will join.
5 Ka kotoeawo nanye blaatɔ̃ le agbadɔvɔ gbãtɔa ƒe go ɖeka, eye woanye blaatɔ̃ le agbadɔvɔ evelia hã ƒe go kemɛa, eye woasɔ ɖe wo nɔewo nu le afi si woakpe wo le.
5 You will make 50 loops on the one tent cloth and 50 loops on the edge of the other tent cloth so that they will be opposite each other where they join.
6 Tsɔ sika tu gavi blaatɔ̃, eye nàtsɔ gaviawo aku agbadɔvɔ eveawo ne woakpe azu agbadɔvɔ ɖeka na avɔgbadɔ la.
6 You are to make 50 gold clasps and join the tent cloths together with the clasps, and the tabernacle will form one unit.
7 “Eye nàtsɔ gbɔ̃fu alɔ̃ avɔ wuiɖekɛ be woatsɔ agba avɔgbadɔ la.
7 “You will also make cloths of goat hair for the tent over the tabernacle.
8 Agbadɔgbavɔ ɖe sia ɖe nadidi abɔklugui blaetɔ̃, eye wòakeke abɔklugui ene.
You will make 11 tent cloths. 8 Each tent cloth will be 30 cubits long and 4 cubits wide.
Dzidze ɖeka nanɔe na agbadɔgbavɔ wuiɖekɛawo.
All 11 tent cloths are to be the same size.
9 Tɔ agbadɔgbavɔ atɔ̃ tsiã ɖe vovo, eye nàgatɔ ade mamlɛawo hã atsiã ɖe vovo, eye nàŋe agbadɔgbavɔ adelia si akɔ ɖe agbadɔa ŋgɔ la me ɖe eve.
9 You are to join five of the tent cloths together and join the other six tent cloths together, and you are to fold over the sixth tent cloth at the front of the tent.
10 Wɔ ka kotoe blaatɔ̃ ɖe agbadɔgbavɔ si wotɔ tsiã ɖekae la ƒe nugbɔ le go ɖeka dzi, kple ka kotoe blaatɔ̃ ɖe agbadɔgbavɔ evelia si wotɔ tsiã ɖekae la ƒe nugbɔ le go kemɛa dzi le afi si woakpe wo le.
10 And you are to make 50 loops on the edge of the one tent cloth, the outermost one in the series, and 50 loops on the edge of the tent cloth at the other place where they join.
11 Tsɔ akɔbli wɔ gavi blaatɔ̃, eye nàtsɔ gaviawo aku ka kotoeawo, be agbadɔgbavɔ la nakpe azu ɖeka.
11 You are to make 50 copper clasps and put the clasps in the loops and join the tent together, and it will become one unit.
12 Agbadɔgbavɔ la ƒe akpa si tsi edzi la naɖiɖi va anyime.
12 The remaining part of the tent cloths will serve as an overhanging.
Esi tsi edzi ƒe afã naɖiɖi ɖe anyime le avɔgbadɔ la megbe.
Half of the tent cloth that remains will hang over the back of the tabernacle.
13 Eye agbadɔgbavɔ siwo agbɔ edzi le avɔgbadɔa ƒe didimekpa eveawo dzi la naɖiɖi ava anyime abɔklugui ɖeka be wòabu avɔgbadɔa ŋu le axa si kple axa kemɛ.
13 The remaining length of the cloths of the tent will serve as an overhanging for the tabernacle by one cubit on each side, in order to cover it.
14 “Azɔ gatsɔ agbogbalẽ si wode ama dzĩi la gba agbadɔ la, eyome nàgatsɔ nyogbalẽ hã agba edzi.
14 “You will also make a covering for the tent of ram skins dyed red and over that a covering of sealskins.
15 “Eye nàtsɔ akasiati akpa ʋuƒo siwo woatu na avɔgbadɔ la.
15 “You will make the panel frames for the tabernacle out of acacia wood standing upright.
16 Ʋuƒo ɖe sia ɖe nakɔ abɔklugui ewo, eye wòakeke abɔklugui ɖeka kple afã.
16 Each panel frame is to be ten cubits high and a cubit and a half wide.
17 Kpa ʋuƒo ɖe sia ɖe ale be zɔvi eve nanɔ eƒe nugbɔ eye woanɔ akasa nu.
17 Each panel frame has two tenons joined to each other.
Alea nàwɔ avɔgbadɔ la ƒe ʋuƒoawo katãe.
That is how you should make all the panel frames of the tabernacle.
18 Kpa ʋuƒoawo na avɔgbadɔ la ale be ʋuƒo blaeve nanɔ eƒe axa si trɔ ɖe anyiehe.
18 You are to make 20 panel frames for the south side of the tabernacle, facing south.

19 “Tsɔ klosalo wɔ anyinɔ blaene ɖe ʋuƒo blaeveawo te: anyinɔ eve nanɔ ʋuƒo ɖe sia ɖe si ƒe nugbɔ zɔvi eveawo le la te, eye anyinɔ eve nanɔ ʋuƒo siwo kplɔe ɖo la hã dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe te hena zɔvi eveveawo.

19 “You will make 40 silver socket pedestals under the 20 panel frames: two socket pedestals under the one panel frame for its two tenons and two socket pedestals under each following panel frame for its two tenons.

20 Eye nàkpa ʋuƒo blaeve ɖe avɔgbadɔ la ƒe axa evelia, si nye dziehekpa dzi 21 kple woƒe anyinɔ blaene siwo wotsɔ klosalo wɔ la. Anyinɔ eve nanɔ ʋuƒo ɖeka te, eye anyinɔ eve nanɔ ʋuƒo siwo kplɔe ɖo la hã dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe te.

20 For the other side of the tabernacle, the northern side, make 20 panel frames 21 and their 40 silver socket pedestals, two socket pedestals under one panel frame and two socket pedestals under each following panel frame.
22 Eyome nàkpa ʋuƒo ade siwo woatu na avɔgbadɔa ƒe megbe le ɣetoɖoƒekpa dzi.
22 For the rear section of the tabernacle to the west, you will make six panel frames.
23 Kpa ʋuƒo eve woanye avɔgbadɔ la ƒe dzogoedzitiwo le eƒe megbekpa eveawo dzi.
23 You will make two panel frames to serve as the two rear corner posts of the tabernacle.
24 Woanye ʋuƒo eve ƒokpli tso gɔme va se ɖe tame le gavi gbãtɔa gbɔ.
24 They should be doubled from the bottom to the top, up to the first ring.
Aleae dzogoedziti eveawo anɔ.
This should be done for both of them, and they will form the two corner posts.
25 Woanɔ ʋuƒo enyi, siwo te woawɔ klosalo ƒe anyinɔ wuiade ɖo; anyinɔ eve nanɔ ʋuƒo ɖeka te, eye anyinɔ eve nanɔ ʋuƒo siwo kplɔe ɖo la hã dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe te.
25 And there will be eight panel frames and their 16 silver socket pedestals, two socket pedestals under the one panel frame and two socket pedestals under each following panel frame.

26 “Tsɔ akasiati kpa xɔblati atɔ̃ na ʋuƒo siwo le avɔgbadɔ la ƒe axa ɖeka, 27 kple xɔblati atɔ̃ na ʋuƒo siwo le avɔgbadɔ la ƒe axa evelia, kpakple xɔblati atɔ̃ na ʋuƒo siwo le avɔgbadɔ la ƒe megbekpa dzi, si le ɣetoɖoƒe gome.

26 “You will make bars of acacia wood, five for the panel frames of the one side of the tabernacle, 27 and five bars for the panel frames of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the panel frames of the side of the tabernacle to the west, for the rear section.
28 Xɔblati domedometɔ si le ʋuƒoawo titina la nadidi tso go si dzi va se ɖe go kemɛ dzi.
28 The middle bar that runs along the center of the panel frames should extend from end to end.
29 “Fa sika ɖe ʋuƒoawo ŋu, eye nàtsɔ sika awɔ gaviwo ɖe wo ŋu be woalé xɔblatiawo, eye nàfa sika ɖe xɔblatiawo ŋu.
29 “You will overlay the panel frames with gold, and you will make their rings of gold as holders for the bars, and you will overlay the bars with gold.
30 Tu avɔgbadɔ la ɖe eƒe nɔnɔme si woɖe fia wò le toa dzi la nu.
30 You must set up the tabernacle according to its plan that you were shown in the mountain.
31 “Tsɔ ka blɔtɔ, alẽfuka si wode ama aɖabɛ dzĩtɔe, ka dzĩ kple ɖeti ɣi biɖibiɖi dada lɔ̃ xɔmetsovɔ, eye aɖaŋuvɔlɔ̃la nalɔ̃ kerubiwo ɖe wo me.
31 “You are to make a curtain of blue thread, purple wool, scarlet material, and fine twisted linen. It will be made with cherubs embroidered on it.
32 Eye nàtsii ɖe sɔti ene siwo wotsɔ akasiati kpa hefa sika ɖe wo ŋu la ŋuti.
32 You will hang it on four pillars of acacia overlaid with gold.
Tsɔ sika wɔ wo ŋuti nulénuawo, eye nàtsɔ klosalo awɔ anyinɔ ene na sɔtiawo.
Their hooks are to be of gold. The pillars are set on four socket pedestals of silver.
33 Nàtsi xɔmetsovɔ la ɖe gaviawo te, eye nàtsɔ Ðaseɖiɖiɖaka la ada ɖe afi ma le xɔmetsovɔ la godo.
33 You will hang the curtain under the clasps and bring the ark of the Testimony there within the curtain.
Xɔmetsovɔ lae anye dometsotso si anɔ Kɔkɔeƒe la kple Kɔkɔeƒewo Ƒe Kɔkɔeƒe la dome na mi.
The curtain will make a division for you between the Holy and the Most Holy.
34 Eye nàtsɔ nutunu la aɖo Ðaseɖiɖiɖaka la nu, le Kɔkɔeƒewo Ƒe Kɔkɔeƒe la.
34 You must put the cover on the ark of the Testimony in the Most Holy.
35 “Eyome nàtsɔ kplɔ̃ la ada ɖe xɔmetsovɔ la ŋgɔ, eye akaɖiti la nanɔ avɔgbadɔ la ƒe anyiehekpa dzi adze ŋgɔ kplɔ̃ la; ke kplɔ̃ la nanɔ dziehekpa dzi.
35 “You will place the table outside the curtain, with the lampstand opposite the table on the south side of the tabernacle; and the table you will put on the north side.
36 Eye nàtsɔ ka blɔtɔ, alẽfuka si wode ama aɖabɛ dzĩtɔe, ka dzĩ kple ɖeti ɣi biɖibiɖi dada alɔ̃ mɔnuvɔ na agbadɔ la.
36 You will make a screen for the entrance of the tent out of blue thread, purple wool, scarlet material, and fine twisted linen woven together.
37 Tsɔ akasiati kpa sɔti atɔ̃ eye nàfa sika ɖe wo ŋuti ne woatsi mɔnuvɔ la ɖe wo ŋu.
37 You will make five pillars of acacia for the screen and overlay them with gold.
Tsɔ sika wɔ wo ŋuti nulégaviwo, eye nàtsɔ akɔbli awɔ anyinɔ atɔ̃ na sɔtiawo.
Their hooks are to be of gold, and you will cast five socket pedestals of copper for them.
Eye Yehowa gblɔ na Mose be: “Yi Farao gbɔ, nàgblɔ nɛ be: ‘Ale Yehowa gblɔe nye esi: “Ðe asi le nye dukɔ la ŋu ne woayi aɖasubɔm.
Then Jehovah said to Moses: “Go in to Pharaoh and say to him, ‘This is what Jehovah says: “Send my people away so that they may serve me.
2 Ne ègbe be yemaɖe asi le wo ŋu woadzo o la, matsɔ akpɔkplɔwo awɔ fu wò anyigba blibo la katã.
2 If you keep refusing to send them away, I will plague all your territory with frogs.

3 Akpɔkplɔwo ayɔ Nil-tɔsisi la me taŋtaŋ, eye woado age ɖe wò aƒe me kple wò xɔgã me, woanɔ wò aba dzi kple wò subɔviwo ƒe xɔwo me, woava ƒo ɖe wò dukɔ la me tɔwo dzi, woage ɖe wò abolokpowo me, eye woanɔ wò amɔwɔbluzewo me.

3 And the Nile River will swarm with frogs, and they will come up and enter into your house, into your bedroom, on your bed, into the houses of your servants and on your people, into your ovens, and into your kneading troughs.
4 Akpɔkplɔawo ava ƒo ɖe wò ŋutɔ kple wò dukɔ la me tɔwo kpakple wò subɔviwo katã dzi.”’”
4 On you, on your people, and on all your servants, the frogs will come up.”’”

5 Emegbe Yehowa gblɔ na Mose be: “Gblɔ na Aron be: ‘Do atikplɔ si le asiwò la ɖe tɔsisiwo, Nil-tɔʋuwo kple tsiteƒewo dzi, ne akpɔkplɔwo naxɔ Egipte-nyigba la dzi.’” 6 Ale Aron do eƒe asi ɖe Egipte tsiwo dzi, eye akpɔkplɔwo do va, eye woxɔ Egipte-nyigba la dzi keŋ.

5 Jehovah later said to Moses: “Say to Aaron, ‘Stretch out your hand with your rod over the rivers, the Nile canals, and the marshes, and make the frogs come up over the land of Egypt.’” 6 So Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt, and the frogs began to come up and to cover the land of Egypt.
7 Ke akunyawɔlawo tsɔ woƒe ayemeɖaŋuwo wɔ nenema ke, eye woawo hã wona akpɔkplɔwo do va Egipte-nyigba la dzi.
7 However, the magic-practicing priests did the same thing by their secret arts, and they too made the frogs come up over the land of Egypt.

8 Eye Farao yɔ Mose kple Aron gblɔ be: “Miɖe kuku na Yehowa, ne wòaɖe akpɔkplɔawo ɖa le nye kple nye dukɔ la dome, elabena medi be maɖe asi le dukɔ la ŋu woayi aɖasa vɔ na Yehowa.” 9 Eye Mose gblɔ na Farao be: “Megblẽe ɖe asiwò me be nàgblɔ ɣeyiɣi si me maɖe kuku woaɖe akpɔkplɔawo ɖa le wò kple wò subɔviwo kpakple wò dukɔ la ŋu, kple wò aƒewo me la nam.

8 Pharaoh then called Moses and Aaron and said: “Plead with Jehovah to remove the frogs from me and my people, as I want to send the people away so that they may sacrifice to Jehovah.” 9 Then Moses said to Pharaoh: “I leave to you the honor of telling me when I should plead to have the frogs removed from you, your servants, your people, and your houses.
Negbe Nil-tɔsisia me koe woasusɔ ɖo.” 10 Eɖo eŋu be: “Etsɔ.”
Only in the Nile River will they be left.” 10 To this he said: “Tomorrow.”
Eye wògblɔ be: “Ava eme abe ale si nègblɔe ene, ne nàdze sii be ame aɖeke mede Yehowa mía Mawu la nu o.
So he said: “It will be according to your word so that you may know that there is no one else like Jehovah our God.
11 Akpɔkplɔawo adzo le wò ŋutɔ kple wò subɔviwo kpakple wò dukɔ la ŋu, kple wò aƒewo me siaa.
11 The frogs will depart from you, your houses, your servants, and your people.
Negbe Nil-tɔsisia me koe woasusɔ ɖo.”
They will be left only in the Nile.”
12 Ale Mose kple Aron dzo le Farao gbɔ, eye Mose ƒo koko na Yehowa le akpɔkplɔ siwo wòkplɔ ƒu Farao la ŋuti.
12 So Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh, and Moses pleaded with Jehovah about the frogs that He had brought upon Pharaoh.
13 Eya ta Yehowa wɔ abe ale si Mose gblɔe ene, eye akpɔkplɔawo ku le aƒewo me, le xɔxɔnuwo kple afi sia afi.
13 Then Jehovah did as Moses asked, and the frogs began to die in the houses, the courtyards, and the fields.
14 Eye woli kɔ wo ɖi gleglegle, eye anyigba la dzi de asi ʋeʋẽ me kũu.
14 They were piling them up in countless heaps, and the land began to stink.
15 Ke esi Farao kpɔ be gbɔdzɔe va aƒe la, egasẽ dzi me; egbe toɖoɖo wo, abe ale si tututu Yehowa gblɔe ene.
15 When Pharaoh saw that there was relief, he hardened his heart and he refused to listen to them, just as Jehovah had said.
16 Eye Yehowa gblɔ na Mose be: “Gblɔ na Aron be: ‘Do wò atikplɔ la ɖa, eye nàƒo ke si le anyigba dzi, eye atrɔ azu muwo ɖe Egipte-nyigba blibo la katã dzi.’” 17 Eye wowɔe nenema.
16 Jehovah now said to Moses: “Say to Aaron, ‘Stretch out your rod and strike the dust of the earth, and it must become gnats in all the land of Egypt.’” 17 And they did this.
Ale Aron do eƒe asi kple eƒe atikplɔ la ɖa, eye wòƒo ke si le anyigba dzi, eye muwo va ƒo ɖe amegbetɔwo kple lãwo dzi.
Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod and struck the dust of the earth, and the gnats came on man and beast.
Eye ke siwo katã le anyigba la zu muwo le Egipte-nyigba blibo la katã dzi.
All the dust of the earth became gnats in all the land of Egypt.
18 Eye akunyawɔlawo hã dze agbagba be yewoatsɔ yewoƒe ayemeɖaŋuwo ana muwo nava nenema ke, gake womete ŋui o.
18 The magic-practicing priests tried to do the same and produce gnats by their secret arts, but they could not.
Eye muwo va ƒo ɖe amegbetɔwo kple lãwo dzi.
And the gnats came on man and beast.
19 Eya ta akunyawɔlaawo gblɔ na Farao be: “Esia la Mawu ƒe asibidɛ ye!”
19 So the magic-practicing priests said to Pharaoh: “It is the finger of God!”
Ke Farao gasẽ dzi me kokoko, eye meɖo to wo o, abe ale si tututu Yehowa gblɔe ene.
But Pharaoh’s heart continued to be obstinate, and he did not listen to them, just as Jehovah had said.
20 Eye Yehowa gblɔ na Mose be: “Fɔ ŋdi kanya nàyi aɖatɔ ɖe Farao ŋkume.
20 Then Jehovah said to Moses: “Get up early in the morning and station yourself in front of Pharaoh. Look!
Kpɔ ɖa, egbɔna tɔ la nu!
He is coming out to the water!
Eye nàgblɔ nɛ be: ‘Ale Yehowa gblɔe nye esi: “Ðe asi le nye dukɔ la ŋu woayi aɖasubɔm.
And you must say to him, ‘This is what Jehovah has said: “Send my people away so that they may serve me.

21 Ke ne mèɖe asi le nye dukɔ la ŋu o la, madɔ togbatowo woava ƒo ɖe wò ŋutɔ, wò subɔviwo kple wò dukɔ la dzi, eye woayɔ wò aƒewo me fũu; togbatowo ayɔ Egiptetɔwo ƒe aƒewo me kple anyigba si dzi wole la dzi fũu.

21 But if you do not send my people away, I will send on you, your servants, and your people and into your houses the gadfly; and the houses of Egypt will be full of gadflies, and they will even cover the ground they stand on.
22 Gbe ma gbe maɖe Gosen-nyigba si dzi nye dukɔ le la ɖe vovo.
22 On that day I will certainly set apart the land of GOshen, where my people are dwelling.
Togbato aɖeke manɔ afi ma o, eye esia mee nàdze sii le be, nye Yehowa mele anyigba sia dzi.
No gadflies will exist there, and by this you will know that I, Jehovah, am here in the land.
23 Made vovototo nye dukɔ kple wò dukɔ la dome.
23 And I will make a distinction between my people and your people.
Etsɔe dzesi sia ava eme.”’”
Tomorrow this sign will take place.”’”
24 Eye Yehowa wɔe nenema, eye togbatowo ƒe ha gã aɖe va ƒo ɖe Farao ƒe aƒe kple eƒe subɔviwo ƒe aƒewo kple Egipte-nyigba blibo la katã dzi.
24 And Jehovah did so, and heavy swarms of gadflies began to invade the house of Pharaoh and the houses of his servants and all the land of Egypt.
Togbatoawo gblẽ anyigba la keŋkeŋ.
The land was ruined by the gadflies.

25 Mlɔeba Farao yɔ Mose kple Aron vɛ hegblɔ na wo be: “Miyi ɖasa vɔ na mia Mawu la le anyigba la dzi.” 26 Ke Mose gblɔ be: “Mesɔ be míawɔe nenema o, elabena nu si nyɔa ŋu na Egiptetɔwo la tsɔ ge míala asa vɔ na Yehowa mía Mawu la.

25 Finally, Pharaoh called Moses and Aaron and said: “Go, sacrifice to your God in the land.” 26 But Moses said: “It is not proper to do so, because what we would sacrifice to Jehovah our God would be detestable to the Egyptians.
Ne míetsɔ nu si nyɔa ŋu na Egiptetɔwo sa vɔ le wo ŋkume la, ɖe womaƒu kpe mí oa? 27 Míazɔ mɔ ŋkeke etɔ̃ ayi gbedzi, eye míasa vɔ na Yehowa mía Mawu la, abe ale si tututu wòde se na mí ene.”

If we would make a sacrifice that was detestable to the Egyptians right before their eyes, would they not stone us? 27 We will make a three-day journey into the wilderness, and there we will sacrifice to Jehovah our God, just as he has said to us.”
28 Farao gblɔ azɔ be: “Maɖe asi le mia ŋu miayi aɖasa vɔ na Yehowa mia Mawu la le gbedzi.
28 Pharaoh now said: “I will send you away to sacrifice to Jehovah your God in the wilderness.
Negbe ɖeko migayi didiƒe akpa o.
Only, you must not go so far away.
Miɖe kuku ɖe tanye.” 29 Eye Mose gblɔ be: “Ne menya dzo le gbɔwò ko la, maɖe kuku na Yehowa ɖe tawò, eye togbatoawo adzo le Farao, eƒe subɔviwo kple eƒe dukɔ la dome etsɔ.
Plead in my behalf.” 29 Then Moses said: “Now I am going away from you, and I will plead with Jehovah, and the gadflies will depart from Pharaoh, his servants, and his people tomorrow.
Ðeko Farao megable mí ake ahagbe asiɖeɖe le dukɔ la ŋu be woayi aɖasa vɔ na Yehowa o.” 30 Emegbe Mose dzo le Farao gbɔ, eye wòɖe kuku na Yehowa.
But Pharaoh must stop trifling with us by refusing to send the people away to sacrifice to Jehovah.” 30 Moses then went out from Pharaoh and pleaded with Jehovah.
31 Eye Yehowa wɔ abe ale si Mose gblɔ ene, eye togbatoawo dzo le Farao, eƒe subɔviwo, kple eƒe dukɔ la dome.
31 So Jehovah did according to Moses’ word, and the gadflies departed from Pharaoh, his servants, and his people.
Ðeka pɛ hã mesusɔ o.
Not one was left.
32 Ke Farao gasẽ dzi me kokoko, eye meɖe asi le dukɔ la ŋu woyi o.
32 However, Pharaoh again hardened his heart and did not send the people away.
Yehowa gblɔ na Mose be: 2 “Le ɣleti gbãtɔ ƒe ŋkeke gbãtɔ dzi la, nàtu avɔgbadɔ si nye takpegbadɔ la.
Then Jehovah said to Moses: 2 “On the first day of the first month, you are to set up the tabernacle, the tent of meeting.
3 Tsɔ Ðaseɖiɖiɖaka la da ɖe eme, eye nàtsi xɔmetsovɔ la atsɔ axe Aɖaka la ŋkume.
3 Place the ark of the Testimony in it, and screen off the Ark with the curtain.
4 Tsɔ kplɔ̃ la da ɖe eme eye nàɖo edzi nuwo ɖe edzi, eye nàtsɔ akaɖiti la ada ɖe eme ahasi eƒe akaɖigbɛawo.
4 You are to bring the table in and arrange the things that belong on it and bring in the lampstand and light its lamps.
5 Eyome nàtsɔ dzudzɔdomlekpui si wotsɔ sika wɔ la ada ɖe Ðaseɖiɖiɖaka la ŋgɔ, eye nàtsi avɔgbadɔ la ƒe mɔnuvɔ la.
5 Then put the golden altar for incense before the ark of the Testimony and put the screen for the entrance of the tabernacle in place.
6 “Tsɔ numevɔsamlekpui la da ɖe avɔgbadɔ si nye takpegbadɔ la ƒe mɔnu ŋgɔdze, 7 eye nàtsɔ ze la ada ɖe takpegbadɔ la kple vɔsamlekpui la dome, eye nàkɔ tsi ɖe eme.
6 “You are to put the altar of burnt offering before the entrance of the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, 7 and place the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar and put water in it.
8 Eyome nàtɔ kpɔ ɖe avɔgbadɔ la ŋu godoo atsɔ aɖe xɔxɔnu la ɖi, eye nàtsi kpɔnuvɔ la.
8 Then set up the courtyard around it and put up the screen for the entrance of the courtyard.
9 Eye nàtsɔ ami kɔkɔe la asi na avɔgbadɔ la kple eme nuwo katã atsɔ akɔ agbadɔ la kple eŋu nuwo katã ŋu, ne wòazu nu kɔkɔe.
9 Next you are to take the anointing oil and anoint the tabernacle and all that is in it, and sanctify it and all its utensils, so that it will become something holy.
10 Nàsi ami na numevɔsamlekpui la kple eŋu nuwo katã atsɔ akɔ vɔsamlekpui la ŋu, ne wòazu vɔsamlekpui kɔkɔetɔ.
10 You are to anoint the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils and sanctify the altar, so that it will become a most holy altar.
11 Nàsi ami na ze la kple eƒe zɔ la atsɔ akɔ eŋu.
11 And anoint the basin and its stand and sanctify it.
12 “Azɔ nàkplɔ Aron kple viaŋutsuwo ate ɖe takpegbadɔ la nu, eye nàle tsi na wo.
12 “Then bring Aaron and his sons near to the entrance of the tent of meeting, and wash them with water.
13 Do awu kɔkɔeawo na Aron, eye nàsi ami nɛ ahakɔ eŋu, ne wòazu nunɔla asubɔm.
13 And you are to clothe Aaron with the holy garments and anoint him and sanctify him, and he will serve as priest to me.
14 Emegbe na viaŋutsuwo nate va, eye nàdo awu ʋlayaawo na wo.
14 After that bring his sons near, and clothe them with robes.
15 Si ami na wo abe ale si tututu nèsi ami na wo fofo ene, be woazu nunɔlawo asubɔm; ami sia sisi na wo ana nunɔlanyenye la nazu wo tɔ le woƒe dzidzimewo katã me.”

15 You are to anoint them just as you anointed their father, so that they will serve as priests to me, and their anointing will serve continually for them as a lasting priesthood during their generations.”
16 Mose wɔ se siwo katã Yehowa de nɛ la dzi.
16 Moses did according to all that Jehovah had commanded him.
Ewɔe nenema pɛpɛpɛ.
He did just so.
17 Le ƒe evelia ƒe ɣleti gbãtɔ ƒe ŋkeke gbãtɔ dzi la, wotu avɔgbadɔ la.
17 In the first month, in the second year, on the first day of the month, the tabernacle was set up.
18 Esi Mose de asi avɔgbadɔ la tutu me la, etsɔ eƒe anyinɔwo ɖo anyi, etsɔ eƒe ʋuƒoawo de wo me, eye wòtsɔ xɔblatiawo de wo ŋu hetu eƒe sɔtiawo.
18 When Moses set up the tabernacle, he put its socket pedestals down, set up the panel frames, put its bars in, and set up its pillars.
19 Ekeke agbadɔvɔ la ɖe avɔgbadɔ la dzi, eye wògba agbadɔ la tame abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
19 He spread out the tent over the tabernacle and placed the covering of the tent over it, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
20 Etsɔ Ðaseɖinu la de Aɖaka la me, eye wòtsɔ kpoawo de Aɖaka la ŋu hetsɔ nutunu la ɖo Aɖaka la nu.
20 After that he took the Testimony and put it into the Ark and placed the poles on the Ark and put the cover on the Ark.
21 Ekɔ Aɖaka la va da ɖe avɔgbadɔ la me, eye wòtsi xɔmetsovɔ la tsɔ xe Ðaseɖiɖiɖaka la ŋkume, abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
21 He brought the Ark into the tabernacle and put the curtain of the screen in place and screened off the ark of the Testimony, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
22 Emegbe eda kplɔ̃ la ɖe takpegbadɔ la me le avɔgbadɔ la ƒe dziehekpa dzi, le xɔmetsovɔ la ŋgɔ, 23 eye wòɖo aboloawo ɖe edzi le Yehowa ŋkume, abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
22 Next he put the table in the tent of meeting on the north side of the tabernacle outside the curtain, 23 and he arranged the row of bread on it before Jehovah, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
24 Etsɔ akaɖiti la da ɖe takpegbadɔ la me le kplɔ̃ la ŋgɔ, le avɔgbadɔ la ƒe anyiehekpa dzi.
24 He placed the lampstand in the tent of meeting in front of the table, on the south side of the tabernacle.
25 Eye wòsi akaɖigbɛawo le Yehowa ŋkume, abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
25 He lit the lamps before Jehovah, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
26 Eyome etsɔ sikavɔsamlekpui la da ɖe takpegbadɔ la me le xɔmetsovɔ la ŋgɔ, 27 ne wòatsɔ atike ʋeʋĩ ado dzudzɔ ɖe edzi, abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
26 He next placed the golden altar in the tent of meeting before the curtain, 27 in order to make perfumed incense smoke on it, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
28 Eye wòtsi avɔgbadɔ la ƒe mɔnuvɔ la.
28 Then he put the screen for the entrance of the tabernacle in place.
29 Etsɔ numevɔsamlekpui la da ɖe avɔgbadɔ si nye takpegbadɔ la ŋgɔdze, be wòasa numevɔ kple nuɖuvɔ le edzi, abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.

29 He placed the altar of burnt offering at the entrance of the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, so that he might offer up the burnt offering and the grain offering on it, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
30 Eyome etsɔ ze la da ɖe takpegbadɔ la kple vɔsamlekpui la dome, eye wòkɔ tsi ɖe eme hena ŋuti kɔklɔ.
30 He then placed the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar and put water in it for washing.
31 Afi mae Mose kple Aron kpakple Aron viŋutsuwo klɔa asi kple afɔ le.
31 Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their feet at it.
32 Ɣesiaɣi si woayi takpegbadɔa me alo ate ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ŋu la, woklɔa ŋuti, abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
32 Whenever they went into the tent of meeting or approached the altar, they would wash, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
33 Mlɔeba etɔ kpɔ ɖe avɔgbadɔ la kple vɔsamlekpui la ŋu godoo va kpe tsɔ ɖe xɔxɔnu la ɖi, eye wòtsi kpɔnuvɔ la.
33 Finally he set up the courtyard around the tabernacle and the altar and put up the screen for the entrance of the courtyard.
Ale Mose wu dɔ la nu.
So Moses finished the work.
34 Eye alilikpo va tsyɔ takpegbadɔ la dzi, eye Yehowa ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe yɔ avɔgbadɔ la taŋ.
34 And the cloud began to cover the tent of meeting, and Jehovah’s glory filled the tabernacle.
35 Mose mete ŋu ge ɖe eme o, elabena alilikpo tsyɔ takpegbadɔ la dzi, eye Yehowa ƒe ŋutikɔkɔe yɔ avɔgbadɔ la taŋ.
35 Moses was not able to go into the tent of meeting because the cloud remained over it, and Jehovah’s glory filled the tabernacle.
36 Le Israel-viwo ƒe mɔzɔzɔ bliboa katã me la, ne alilikpo la ho le avɔgbadɔa dzi la, woawo hã wohona.
36 And when the cloud lifted from the tabernacle, the Israelites would break camp during all stages of their journey.
37 Gake ne alilikpo la meho o la, ekema woawo hã womehona o, va se ɖe gbe si gbe wòho hafi.
37 However, if the cloud did not lift up, then they would not break camp until the day it lifted.
38 Elabena Yehowa ƒe alilikpo la nɔa avɔgbadɔ la tame le ŋkeke me, eye wòdzena na Israel ƒe aƒe blibo la katã le zã me abe dzo ene le woƒe mɔzɔzɔa katã me.
38 For Jehovah’s cloud was over the tabernacle by day, and a fire remained over it by night in the sight of all the house of Israel during all stages of their journey.
Wotsɔ ka blɔtɔ, alẽfuka si wode ama aɖabɛ dzĩtɔe, kple ka dzĩ lɔ̃ awuwo nyuie be woatsɔ awɔ subɔsubɔdɔ le kɔkɔeƒe la.
From the blue thread, the purple wool, and the scarlet material, they made finely woven garments for ministering in the holy place.
Wolɔ̃ Aron ƒe awu kɔkɔeawo abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
They made the holy garments that were for Aaron, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
2 Eye wòtsɔ sika, ka blɔtɔ, alẽfuka si wode ama aɖabɛ dzĩtɔe, ka dzĩ kple ɖeti ɣi biɖibiɖi dada lɔ̃ kɔmewu la.
2 He made the ephod of gold, blue thread, purple wool, scarlet material, and fine twisted linen.
3 Woƒo sika gbabɛ eye wodzee lɛlɛlɛ be aɖaŋuvɔlɔ̃lawo natsɔe akpe ɖe ka blɔtɔ, alẽfuka si wode ama aɖabɛ dzĩtɔe, ka dzĩ kple ɖeti ɣi biɖibiɖi ŋu alɔ̃e.
3 They hammered plates of gold into thin sheets, and he cut it into threads to work in with the blue thread, the purple wool, the scarlet material, and the fine linen, and it was embroidered.
4 Wowɔ abɔtaɖonuwo nɛ, eye wotɔe ɖe eƒe abɔta eveawo dzi.
4 They made shoulder pieces for it that were attached, and it was joined to them at its two edges.

5 Eye wotsɔ nu mawo ke, siwo nye sikaka, ka blɔtɔ, alẽfuka si wode ama aɖabɛ dzĩtɔe, ka dzĩ kple ɖeti ɣi biɖibiɖi dada lɔ̃ alidziblanu si le kɔmewu la ŋu be woatsɔ ablae; wowɔe abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.

5 And the woven belt, which was attached to the ephod for tying it securely in position, was made of the same material, of gold, blue thread, purple wool, scarlet material, and fine twisted linen, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
6 Eye wotsɔ sika ɖo to na oniks-kpe eveawo, eye woɖe Israel viwo ƒe ŋkɔwo ɖe wo dzi abe ale si woŋlɔa nu ɖe nutrenu dzi ene.
6 Then they mounted the onyx stones in gold settings, and they engraved them with the names of the sons of Israel, as they would engrave a seal.
7 Eye wòtsɔ wo ɖo kɔmewu la ƒe abɔtaɖonuawo dzi be woanye ŋkuɖodzikpewo na Israel-viwo, abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
7 He placed them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as memorial stones for the sons of Israel, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
8 Azɔ etsɔ ka siwo wotsɔ lɔ̃ kɔmewu la ke lɔ̃ akɔtaɖonu la aɖaŋutɔe; sika, ka blɔtɔ, alẽfuka si wode ama aɖabɛ dzĩtɔe, ka dzĩ kple ɖeti ɣi biɖibiɖi dada wòtsɔ lɔ̃e.
8 Then he made the breastpiece with the workmanship of an embroiderer, like the workmanship of the ephod, out of gold, blue thread, purple wool, scarlet material, and fine twisted linen.
9 Wowɔ akɔtaɖonu la ale be esi woŋe eme ɖe eve la, ele dzogoe ene me, edidi asi ɖeka, eye wòkeke asi ɖeka.
9 It was square when doubled. They made the breastpiece, which, when doubled, was as long and as wide as the span of the hand.
10 Eye wotsɔ kpe xɔasiwo ɖo eŋu le agbaka ene me.
10 They set four rows of stones in it.
Agbaka gbãtɔ nye rubi, topaz kple emerald.
The first row was ruby, topaz, and emerald.
11 Agbaka evelia nye nofek, safir kple yaspis.
11 The second row was turquoise, sapphire, and jasper.
12 Agbaka etɔ̃lia nye lesem, agat kple ametist.
12 The third row was leshem stone, agate, and amethyst.
13 Eye agbaka enelia nye krisolit, oniks kple yasifi.
13 And the fourth row was chrysOlite, onyx, and jade.
Wotsɔ sika ɖo to na wo.
They were mounted in settings of gold.
14 Kpeawo le Israel viŋutsu wuieveawo ƒe ŋkɔwo nu. Ŋkɔɖelawo ɖe ŋkɔawo ɖe wo dzi, ŋkɔ ɖe sia ɖe le tsitre ɖi na to wuieveawo dometɔ ɖeka.
14 The stones corresponded to the names of the 12 sons of Israel, and the names were engraved like a seal, each name representing one of the 12 tribes.
15 Eyome wotsɔ sika nyuitɔ gbi ka wòle abe kɔsɔkɔsɔ ene ɖe akɔtaɖonu la ŋu.
15 Then they made wreathed chains on the breastpiece, like cords of pure gold.
16 Wowɔ sikagɛ ɖe to si woɖo na kpe eveawo la ŋu, eye wogawɔ sikasigɛ eve hetsɔ ɖo akɔtaɖonu la ƒe dzogoe eveawo dzi.
16 And they made two settings of gold and two rings of gold and attached the two rings to the two corners of the breastpiece.
17 Emegbe wotsɔ sikaka eveawo to asigɛ eveawo me le akɔtaɖonu la ƒe dzogoewo dzi.
17 After that they put the two cords of gold through the two rings at the corners of the breastpiece.
18 Eye wotsɔ ka eveawo ƒe nugbɔ eveawo to asigɛ eveawo me hetsɔ wo ku kɔmewu la ƒe abɔtaɖonuawo le ŋgɔ.
18 Then they put the two ends of the two cords through the two settings and attached them to the shoulder pieces on the front of the ephod.
19 Emegbe wotu sikasigɛ eve bubu tsɔ de akɔtaɖonu la ƒe dzogoe eve mamlɛawo le eƒe akpa si le kɔmewua dzi, le eme gome.
19 Next they made two rings of gold and set them at the two ends on the inside edge of the breastpiece, facing the ephod.
20 Azɔ wogatu sikasigɛ eve bubu tsɔ de kɔmewu la ŋgɔ le eƒe abɔtaɖonu eveawo ƒe anyime, wògogo teƒe si wotɔe ɖe kɔmewu la dzi le, le alidziblanu la tame.
20 Then they made two more rings of gold and put them on the front of the ephod, below the two shoulder pieces, close to where it is joined, above the woven belt of the ephod.

21 Eyome wogbi ka blɔtɔ tsɔ to akɔtaɖonu la ƒe asigɛawo me hetsi ɖe kɔmewu la ƒe asigɛawo ŋu, be wòalé akɔtaɖonu la ɖe kɔmewu la dzi le alidziblanu la tame, ale be magaʋã o; wowɔe abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.

21 Finally, they tied the breastpiece with a blue cord from its rings to the rings of the ephod, in order to keep the breastpiece in its place on the ephod, above the woven belt, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
22 Emegbe etsɔ ka blɔtɔ ɖeɖe lɔ̃ awu ʋlaya si ŋu abɔ mele o la.
22 Then he made the sleeveless coat of the ephod, woven by a loom worker, all of blue thread.
23 Woɖe kɔme na awu ʋlaya si ŋu abɔ mele o la ɖe eƒe titina wòle abe gawu ƒe kɔme ene.
23 The opening of the sleeveless coat was in the middle of it, like the opening of a coat of mail.
Woƒo to na kɔmea va kpe, be wòagavuvu o.
Its opening had a border around it, so that it would not be torn.
24 Azɔ wotsɔ ka blɔtɔ, alẽfuka si wode ama aɖabɛ dzĩtɔe kple ka dzĩ, siwo wogbi ɖekae la, lɔ̃ yevuboɖawo ɖe awua toga le ete.
24 Next they made on the hem of the sleeveless coat pomegranates of blue thread, purple wool, and scarlet material, twisted together.

25 Wotsɔ sika nyuitɔ wɔ nyawowoewo hã, eye wotsi wo ɖe awu ʋlaya si ŋu abɔ mele o la toga le ete godoo va kpe, le yevuboɖaawo domee; 26 sikanyawowoe ɖeka yevuboɖa ɖeka, sikanyawowoe ɖeka yevuboɖa ɖeka le awu ʋlaya si ŋu abɔ mele o si woado asubɔ la toga, le ete godoo va kpe; wowɔe abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
