35 But if the infection clearly spreads on the skin after his purification, 36 the priest will examine him, and if the infection has spread on the skin, the priest does not need to look for yellow hair; that person is unclean.
37 Gake ne ekpɔe be dɔa mekeke ɖe enu o, eye fu yibɔ to ɖe teƒea la, ekema dɔa vɔ.
37 But if the examination shows that the infection has not spread and black hair has grown on it, the infection has been healed.
Eŋu kɔ, eya ta nunɔla la nagblɔ be eŋu kɔ.
He is clean, and the priest will declare him clean.
38 “Ne ŋutsu alo nyɔnu aɖe ƒe ŋutigbalẽ ɖe bo, eye teƒe si ɖe bo la le ɣie la, 39 nunɔla la nalé ŋku ɖe eŋu.
38 “If a man or a woman develops blotches on the skin and the blotches are white, 39 the priest will examine them.
Ne ŋutigbalẽ la ƒe teƒe si ɖe bo la lé akpɔ̃ hele ɣie la, ekema nane koe ƒo ɖe eŋu, menye dɔvɔ̃e o.
If the skin blotches are faded white, it is a harmless rash that has broken out on the skin.
Eŋu kɔ.
That person is clean.
40 “Ne ŋutsu aɖe ƒe ɖa be le eƒe dzodome la, ekema tabebe ye, eŋu kɔ.
40 “If a man loses the hair of his head and becomes bald, he is clean.
41 Ne ɖa be le ŋgonu nɛ la, ekema eƒe ŋgonue kpã; eŋu kɔ.
41 If he loses the hair on the front of his head and becomes bald there, he is clean.
42 Ke ne nane do ɖe eƒe dzodome alo ŋgonu si bebe la, eye wòfu hede biabiã ge la, ekema anyidɔe do ɖe eƒe dzodome alo eƒe ŋgonu.
42 But if a reddish-white sore develops on the bald part of his scalp or on his forehead, it is leprosy breaking out on his scalp or on his forehead.
43 Nunɔla la nalé ŋku ɖe amea ŋu. Ne dɔ si do ɖe eƒe dzodome alo eƒe ŋgonu, afi si bebe la, fu hede biabiã ge abe ale si anyidɔ dona ɖe ŋutigbalẽ ŋu ene la, 44 ekema anyidɔlélae.
43 The priest will examine him, and if the swelling from the infection is reddish-white on the bald spot on top of his head or on his forehead and it looks like leprosy on his skin, 44 he is a leper.
Eŋu mekɔ o. Nunɔla la nagblɔ be eŋu mekɔ o le dɔ si do ɖe eƒe tame la ta.
He is unclean, and the priest should declare him unclean because of the disease on his head.
45 Ame si ŋu anyidɔa le la nadze eƒe awuwo, eye wòagblẽ eƒe tagbɔ ɖi atsyɔ nu eƒe nutage dzi anɔ ɣli dom be: ‘Ŋunye mekɔ o hee, ŋunye mekɔ o hee!’ 46 Ŋkeke ale si dɔa le eŋu la, eŋu mekɔ o.

45 As for the leper who has the disease, his garments should be torn and his head should be left ungroomed and he should cover over his mustache and call out, ‘Unclean, unclean!’ 46 He will be unclean the whole time that he has the disease.
Esi eŋu mekɔ o ta la, woaɖee ɖe aga wòayi aɖanɔ asaɖa la godo.
Since he is unclean, he should live in isolation.

47 “Ke ne anyidɔ ƒe dzesi dze le nudodo aɖe me, eɖanye lãfuwu alo aklalawu o, 48 alo avɔlɔ̃ka, alo nu si wotsɔ ɖeti alo lãfu lɔ̃, lãgbalẽ, alo nu sia nu si wotsɔ lãgbalẽ wɔ me, 49 eye dɔa do ɖe awu, lãgbalẽ, avɔlɔ̃ka, alo nu si wolɔ̃ ŋu, alo nu sia nu si wotsɔ lãgbalẽ wɔ la me, eye dzesia ƒe amadede nye aŋutiɖiɖi kple gbemu tsaka, alo wòbiã vie la, ekema anyidɔe, woatsɔe afia nunɔla la.

His dwelling place will be outside the camp. 47 “If the disease of leprosy contaminates a garment, whether a woolen or a linen garment, 48 either in the warp or in the woof of the linen or of the wool, or in a skin or in anything made of skin, 49 and the yellowish-green or reddish stain from the disease contaminates the garment, a skin, the warp, the woof, or any article of skin, it is a contamination from leprosy, and it should be shown to the priest.
50 Nunɔla la nalé ŋku ɖe teƒe si dɔa do ɖo ŋu, eye wòaɖe nu si ŋu dɔa le la ɖe aga ŋkeke adre.
50 The priest will examine the disease, and he must quarantine the disease for seven days.
51 Ne ekpɔ le ŋkeke adrea gbe be dɔa kaka ɖe awua, avɔlɔ̃ka la, nu si wolɔ̃, alo lãgbalẽa me la, eɖanye nu ka kee wozãa lãgbalẽa na o, dɔ vɔ̃ɖie do ɖe eme, eŋu mekɔ o.

51 When he examines the disease on the seventh day and sees that it has spread in the garment, in the warp, in the woof, or in the skin (regardless of what the skin is used for), the disease is malignant leprosy, and it is unclean.
52 Ele be wòatɔ dzo awu la, avɔlɔ̃ka la, nu si wotsɔ lãfu alo ɖeti lɔ̃, alo nu sia nu si wotsɔ lãgbalẽ wɔ si me dɔa do ɖo, elabena dɔ vɔ̃ɖie.
52 He should burn the garment or the warp or the woof in the wool or in the linen or any article of skin in which the disease has developed, for it is malignant leprosy.
Woatɔ dzo nu la.
It should be burned in the fire.

53 “Ke ne nunɔla la lé ŋku ɖe eŋu, eye wòkpɔ be nua mekeke ɖe enu le awua, avɔlɔ̃ka la, nu si wolɔ̃ alo nu sia nu si wotsɔ lãgbalẽ wɔ la me o la, 54 ekema nunɔla la nade se be woanya nu si me dɔa le la, eye wòagaɖee ɖe aga ŋkeke adre bubu.

53 “But if the priest examines it and the disease has not spread in the garment or in the warp or in the woof or in any article of skin, 54 the priest will then command that they should wash the contaminated item, and he will quarantine it for another seven days.
55 Nunɔla la nalé ŋku ɖe nu si ŋu dɔa le la ŋu le enyanya vɔ megbe.
55 The priest will then examine the contaminated item after it has been thoroughly washed.
Ne ekpɔ be teƒe si nua do ɖo la gale nenema ko, evɔ mekeke ɖe enu hã o la, ke eŋu mekɔ o.
If the appearance of the contamination has not changed, even if the disease has not spread, it is unclean.
Ele be woatɔ dzoe le esi dɔa ɖu teƒea le eƒe ŋkume alo megbe ta.
You should burn it in the fire because it has been eaten away, either from its underside or from its outside.
56 “Ke ne nunɔla la lé ŋku ɖe nu si ŋu dɔa do ɖo le enyanya vɔ megbe eye wòkpɔ be teƒea lé akpɔ̃ la, ekema wòalã teƒe si dɔa do ɖo la ɖa le awu, lãgbalẽ, avɔlɔ̃ka alo nu si wolɔ̃ la ŋu.
56 “But if the priest has examined it and the contaminated part is faded after it has been thoroughly washed, he will then tear it out of the garment or the skin or the warp or the woof.
57 Gake ne egado ɖe awu, avɔlɔ̃ka, nu si wolɔ̃, alo nu sia nu si wotsɔ lãgbalẽ wɔ la me ake la, ekema dɔa le kekem ɖe enu. Ele be woatɔ dzo nu sia nu si me dɔa le.
57 However, if it still appears in another part of the garment or in the warp or in the woof or in any article of skin, it is spreading, and you should burn any contaminated item in the fire.
58 Ke ne wonya awu la, avɔlɔ̃ka la, nu si wolɔ̃, alo nu sia nu si wotsɔ lãgbalẽ wɔ, eye dɔa bu le eme la, ekema woaganyae zi evelia be eŋu nakɔ.
58 But when the contamination disappears from the garment or the warp or the woof or any article of skin that you wash, it should then be washed a second time, and it will be clean.
59 “Esiae nye anyidɔ si le lãfuwu, aklalawu, avɔlɔ̃ka, nu si wolɔ̃, alo nu sia nu si wotsɔ lãgbalẽ wɔ me la ŋuti se, be woanya ne eŋu kɔ loo alo eŋu mekɔ o.”
59 “This is the law of the disease of leprosy in a garment of wool or of linen, or in the warp or in the woof, or in any article of skin, for declaring it clean or unclean.”
Eye le ŋkeke enyia gbe la, Mose yɔ Aron kple viaŋutsuwo kpakple Israel ƒe ametsitsiwo.
On the eighth day, Moses called Aaron and his sons and the elders of Israel.
2 Eye wògblɔ na Aron be: “Lé nyivi ɖeka ne woatsɔ asa nuvɔ̃vɔ kple agbo ɖeka ne woatsɔ asa numevɔ; woanye esiwo sɔ bliboe, eye nàtsɔ wo ava Yehowa ŋkume.
2 He said to Aaron: “Take for yourself a young calf for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering, sound ones, and present them before Jehovah.

3 Ke gblɔ na Israel-viwo be: ‘Milé gbɔ̃tsu ɖeka miatsɔ asa nuvɔ̃vɔe, eye milé nyivi ɖeka kple alẽtsui ɖeka, wo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe naxɔ ƒe ɖeka eye wòasɔ blibo, miatsɔ asa numevɔe. 4 Eye milé nyitsu ɖeka kple agbo ɖeka miatsɔ asa ŋutifafavɔ le Yehowa ŋkume, hekpe ɖe nuɖuvɔsa si wode amii ŋu, elabena egbea Yehowa aɖe eɖokui afia mi.’”

3 But you will say to the Israelites, ‘Take a male goat for a sin offering and a calf and a young ram, each a year old, sound ones, for a burnt offering, 4 and a bull and a ram for communion sacrifices, to sacrifice them before Jehovah, and a grain offering mixed with oil, for today Jehovah will appear to you.’”
5 Eye wotsɔ nu siwo Mose bia la va takpegbadɔa ŋgɔ.
5 So they took what Moses had commanded before the tent of meeting.
Azɔ ha blibo la katã te va hetsi tsitre ɖe Yehowa ŋkume.
Then the whole assembly came forward and stood before Jehovah.

6 Eye Mose gblɔ be: “Esiae nye nu si Yehowa de se be miawɔ, ne Yehowa naɖe eƒe ŋutikɔkɔe afia mi.” 7 Eye Mose gblɔ na Aron be: “Te ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ŋu nàsa wò nuvɔ̃vɔ kple wò numevɔ, eye nàlé avu ɖe wò ŋutɔ ɖokuiwò kple wò aƒe la ta; eyome nàtsɔ dukɔ la ƒe nunana la asa vɔ ahalé avu ɖe wo ta, abe ale si Yehowa de se ene.”

6 And Moses said: “This is what Jehovah has commanded you to do, so that the glory of Jehovah may appear to you.” 7 Then Moses said to Aaron: “Approach the altar and present your sin offering and your burnt offering, and make atonement in your own behalf and in behalf of your house; and present the offering of the people, and make atonement in their behalf, just as Jehovah has commanded.”
8 Enumake Aron te ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ŋu, eye wòwu nyivi si wòatsɔ asa nuvɔ̃vɔe ɖe eɖokui ta la.
8 Aaron immediately approached the altar and slaughtered the calf of the sin offering that was for him.
9 Azɔ Aron viŋutsuwo tsɔ ʋu la vɛ nɛ, eye wòde eƒe asibidɛ ʋua me ge ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ƒe dzowo ŋu, eye wòkɔ ʋu susɔea ɖe vɔsamlekpuia te.
9 Then Aaron’s sons presented the blood to him, and he dipped his finger in the blood and put it on the horns of the altar, and he poured the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
10 Eye wòtsɔ nuvɔ̃vɔsalã la ƒe ami kple ayikuawo kpakple ami siwo le aklãa ŋu la do dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpuia dzi, abe ale si Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
10 He made the fat and the kidneys and the appendage of the liver from the sin offering smoke on the altar, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
11 Eye wòtɔ dzo lã la kple eƒe agbalẽa le asaɖa la godo.
11 And he burned the flesh and the skin with fire outside the camp.
12 Emegbe ewu numevɔsalã la, eye Aron viŋutsuwo tsɔ ʋu la de esi, eye wòhlẽe ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ƒe axawo katã ŋu.
12 Then he slaughtered the burnt offering, and Aaron’s sons handed him the blood, and he sprinkled it on all sides of the altar.
13 Eye wotsɔ numevɔsalã la ƒe akpa vovovoawo kple ta la de esi, eye wòtsɔ wo do dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpuia dzi.
13 They handed him the pieces of the burnt offering along with the head, and he made them smoke on the altar.
14 Ekpala dɔkaviawo kple afɔawo hã tsɔ da ɖe numevɔsalã si le vɔsamlekpuia dzi la dzi hetsɔ wo do dzudzɔe.
14 Further, he washed the intestines and the shanks and made them smoke on the burnt offering on the altar.
15 Azɔ etsɔ dukɔ la ƒe nunana la sa vɔe. Elé gbɔ̃ si dukɔa tsɔ vɛ be woatsɔ asa nuvɔ̃vɔe na yewo la hewui, eye wòtsɔe sa nuvɔ̃vɔ abe gbãtɔa ke ene.
15 He then presented the offering of the people and took the goat of the sin offering that was for the people and slaughtered it and made a sin offering with it like the first one.
16 Eyome etsɔ numevɔsalã la vɛ, eye wòtsɔe sa vɔ ɖe ɖoɖo la nu.
16 And he presented the burnt offering and handled it according to the regular procedure.
17 Eyome etsɔ nuɖuvɔsa la vɛ heku asiʋlo ɖeka, eye wòtsɔe do dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpuia dzi hekpe ɖe ŋdinumevɔsa la ŋu.
17 He next presented the grain offering, filling his hand with some of it and making it smoke on the altar, in addition to the burnt offering of the morning.
18 Eyome ewu nyitsu kple agbo tsɔ sa ŋutifafavɔwo ɖe dukɔ la ta.
18 After that he slaughtered the bull and the ram of the communion sacrifice that was for the people.
Azɔ Aron viŋutsuwo tsɔ ʋu la de esi, eye wòhlẽe ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ƒe axawo katã ŋu.
Then Aaron’s sons handed him the blood, and he sprinkled it around on all sides of the altar.

19 Ke nyitsu la ƒe amiawo, agbo la ƒe asike dami la, ami siwo tsyɔ dɔmenuawo dzi, ayikuawo, kple ami siwo le aklãa ŋu la, 20 wotsɔ ami siawo katã da ɖe akɔawo dzi, eye Aron tsɔ amiawo do dzudzɔ le vɔsamlekpuia dzi.

19 As for the pieces of fat of the bull, the fat tail of the ram, the fat covering the internal organs, the kidneys, and the appendage of the liver, 20 they placed all those pieces of fat on the breasts, after which he made the pieces of fat smoke on the altar.
21 Ke Aron nyè akɔawo kple ɖusita la wònye vɔsa si wonyè le Yehowa ŋkume, abe ale si Mose de se ene.
21 But the breasts and the right leg Aaron waved back and forth as a wave offering before Jehovah, just as Moses had commanded.
22 Azɔ Aron wu eƒe asiwo dzi ɖo ɖe dukɔ la gbɔ heyra wo, eye esi wòsa nuvɔ̃vɔ kple numevɔ kpakple ŋutifafavɔwo vɔ la, eɖi.
22 Then Aaron raised his hands toward the people and blessed them and came down from making the sin offering and the burnt offering and the communion sacrifices.
23 Eye Mose kple Aron yi takpegbadɔa me, eye wodo go heyra dukɔ la.
23 Finally Moses and Aaron went into the tent of meeting and came out and blessed the people.
Eye Yehowa ɖe eƒe ŋutikɔkɔe fia dukɔ blibo la katã, 24 eye dzo tso Yehowa gbɔ va fiã numevɔsalã la kple ami siwo le vɔsamlekpuia dzi.
Jehovah’s glory now appeared to all the people, 24 and fire came out from Jehovah and began consuming the burnt offering and the pieces of fat on the altar.
Esi dukɔ blibo la kpɔe la, wodo ɣli eye wotsyɔ mo anyi.
When all the people saw it, they started shouting and they fell with their faces to the ground.
Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose be: 2 “Esiae anye se si dzi woazɔ ɖo le gbe si gbe woakplɔ anyidɔléla aɖe ava nunɔla la gbɔ be wòaɖo kpe edzi be eŋu kɔ.
Jehovah continued to speak to Moses, saying: 2 “This is to be the law of the leper on the day his purification is established, when he is to be brought to the priest.
3 Nunɔla la nayi asaɖa la godo aɖalé ŋku ɖe eŋu.
3 The priest will go outside the camp and examine him.
Ne anyidɔ la vɔ le anyidɔlélaa ŋu la, 4 ekema nunɔla la nana wòatsɔ xevi gbagbe eve siwo ŋu kɔ, sederti, ka dzĩ kple isop gbe avɛ be woatsɔ akɔ eŋu.
If the leper has been cured of the leprosy, 4 the priest will command him to bring two live clean birds, cedarwood, scarlet material, and hyssop for his cleansing.
5 Nunɔlaa nana woatso xeviawo dometɔ ɖeka ɖe tɔsisi me tsi si le ze me la ŋgɔ.
5 The priest will command that the one bird be killed in an earthenware vessel over running water.
6 Ke wòatsɔ xevi gbagbe la, sederti la, ka dzĩ la kple isop gbe la anyrɔ ɖe xeviʋu si woɖuɖu ɖe tɔsisi me tsia me la me.
6 But he should take the living bird along with the cedarwood, the scarlet material, and the hyssop, and dip them together in the blood of the bird that was killed over the running water.
7 Eye wòahlẽe ɖe ame si le eɖokui ŋu kɔm tso anyidɔ me la ŋu zi adre, eye wòagblɔ be eŋu kɔ, eye wòaɖe asi le xevi gbagbe la ŋu ɖo ɖe gbe me.
7 Then he will spatter it seven times on the one cleansing himself from the leprosy and declare him clean, and he will set the living bird free in the open field.
8 “Eyome ame si le eɖokui ŋu kɔm la nanya eƒe awuwo, alũ eŋuti fuwo katã ahale tsi be eŋu nakɔ.
8 “The one cleansing himself must wash his garments and shave off all his hair and bathe in water, and he will be clean.
Emegbe ekpɔ mɔ ava asaɖa la me, gake wòatsi eƒe agbadɔ godo ŋkeke adre.
Afterward, he may come into the camp, but he will dwell outside his tent for seven days.
9 Le ŋkeke adrea gbe la, wòalũ ta kple ge kpakple adzugo.
9 On the seventh day, he should shave off all the hair on his head and his chin and his eyebrows.
Ne elũ eŋuti fuwo katã vɔ la, wòanya eƒe awuwo ahale tsi be eŋu nakɔ.
After he shaves off all his hair, he will wash his garments and bathe himself in water, and he will be clean.

10 “Le ŋkeke enyia gbe la, wòatsɔ alẽtsui eve siwo sɔ blibo kple alẽnɔe ɖeka si xɔ ƒe ɖeka, si sɔ blibo kple wɔ memee efa me mama ɖe ewo ƒe akpa etɔ̃ si wotsɔ ami dzabae la avɛ wòanye nuɖuvɔsa, hekpe ɖe ami lɔg ɖeka ŋu. 11 Eye nunɔla si gblɔ be eŋu kɔ la nakplɔ ame si le eɖokui ŋu kɔm la ahatsɔ vɔsanuawo akpe ɖe eŋu ava Yehowa ŋkume le takpegbadɔ la nu.

10 “On the eighth day, he will take two sound young rams, one sound female lamb in its first year, three tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering, and one log measure of oil; 11 and the priest who declares him clean will present the man who is cleansing himself, along with the offerings, before Jehovah at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
12 Nunɔlaa natsɔ alẽtsuiawo dometɔ ɖeka asa fɔɖivɔ hekpe ɖe ami lɔg ɖeka la ŋu, eye wòanyè wo woazu nunyèvɔsa le Yehowa ŋkume.
12 The priest will take the one young ram and offer it as a guilt offering together with the log measure of oil, and he will wave them back and forth as a wave offering before Jehovah.
13 Eyome wòawu alẽtsui la le teƒe kɔkɔe, afi si wowua nuvɔ̃vɔsalã kple numevɔsalã la le, elabena nuvɔ̃vɔsalã la nye nunɔla la tɔ abe fɔɖivɔsalã la ke ene.

13 Then he will slaughter the young ram in the place where the sin offering and the burnt offering are usually slaughtered, in a holy place, because, like the sin offering, the guilt offering belongs to the priest.
Nu kɔkɔewo ƒe nu kɔkɔe wònye.
It is something most holy.
14 “Eye nunɔla la natsɔ fɔɖivɔsalã la ƒe ʋu la ƒe ɖe asisii ɖe ame si le eɖokui ŋu kɔm la ƒe ɖusitogboe, eƒe nuɖusidegblefetsu kple eƒe ɖusifɔdegblefetsu ŋu.

14 “Then the priest will take some of the blood of the guilt offering, and the priest will put it on the right earlobe of the one cleansing himself and on the thumb of his right hand and on the big toe of his right foot.
15 Nunɔla la nakɔ ami lɔg ɖeka la ƒe ɖe ɖe eya ŋutɔ ƒe miasiƒome.
15 And the priest will take some of the log measure of oil and pour it into his own left palm.
16 Eye nunɔla la nade eƒe nuɖusisibidɛ ami si le eƒe miasiƒome la me ahlẽe zi adre le Yehowa ŋkume.
16 The priest will then dip his right finger into the oil that is in his left palm and spatter some of the oil with his finger seven times before Jehovah.

17 Eyome nunɔla la nasisi ami si le eƒe asiƒome la ƒe ɖe ɖe ame si le eɖokui ŋu kɔm la ƒe ɖusitogboe, eƒe nuɖusidegblefetsu kple eƒe ɖusifɔdegblefetsu ŋu, ɖe teƒe siwo wòsisi fɔɖivɔsalã ƒe ʋua ɖo la dzi.

17 Then the priest will put some of the remaining oil in his palm on the right earlobe of the one cleansing himself and on the thumb of his right hand and on the big toe of his right foot over the blood of the guilt offering.
18 Nunɔla la natsɔ ami si susɔ ɖe eƒe asiƒome la asi ɖe ta na ame si le eɖokui ŋu kɔm la, be wòalé avu ɖe eta le Yehowa ŋkume.
18 The priest will put what is left over of the oil in his palm on the head of the one cleansing himself, and the priest will make atonement for him before Jehovah.
19 “Nunɔla la natsɔ nuvɔ̃vɔsalã la asa vɔe atsɔ alé avu ɖe ame si le eɖokui ŋu kɔm tso eƒe ɖiƒoƒo me la ta, eye wòawu numevɔsalã la.
19 “The priest will sacrifice the sin offering and make atonement for the one cleansing himself from his impurity, and afterward he will slaughter the burnt offering.
20 Eyome nunɔlaa nasa numevɔ kple nuɖuvɔ la le vɔsamlekpuia dzi atsɔ alé avu ɖe amea ta be eŋu nakɔ.
20 And the priest will offer up the burnt offering and the grain offering on the altar, and the priest will make atonement for him, and he will be clean.

21 “Ke ne amea da ahe, eye nu mede edzi boo o la, ekema wòatsɔ alẽtsui ɖeka vɛ be woatsɔ asa fɔɖivɔ, be wòanye nunyèvɔsa si woatsɔ alé avu ɖe eta, kple wɔ memee efa me mama ɖe ewo ƒe akpa ɖeka si wotsɔ ami dzabae be wòanye nuɖuvɔsa, kple ami lɔg ɖeka, 22 kpakple akpakpa eve alo ahɔnɛvi eve le eƒe ŋutete nu.

21 “However, if he is poor and does not have enough means, he will then take one young ram as a guilt offering for a wave offering, in order to make atonement for himself, along with one tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering, a log measure of oil, 22 and two turtledoves or two young pigeons, according to his means.
Woatsɔ ɖeka asa nuvɔ̃vɔ ahatsɔ evelia asa numevɔ.
The one will serve as a sin offering, and the other as a burnt offering.
23 Le ŋkeke enyia gbe la, wòatsɔ wo vɛ na nunɔlaa le takpegbadɔa nu le Yehowa ŋkume, be woaɖo kpe edzi be eŋu kɔ.
23 On the eighth day, he will bring them for establishing his purification to the priest at the entrance of the tent of meeting before Jehovah.
24 “Nunɔla la natsɔ alẽtsui si woatsɔ asa fɔɖivɔ kple ami lɔg ɖeka la, eye wòanyè wo woazu nunyèvɔsa le Yehowa ŋkume.
24 “The priest will take the young ram of the guilt offering and the log measure of oil, and the priest will wave them back and forth as a wave offering before Jehovah.
25 Nunɔla la nawu alẽtsui si woatsɔ asa fɔɖivɔ la, eye wòasisi fɔɖivɔsalã la ƒe ʋu la ƒe ɖe ɖe ame si le eɖokui ŋu kɔm la ƒe ɖusitogboe, eƒe nuɖusidegblefetsu kple eƒe ɖusifɔdegblefetsu ŋu.

25 He will then slaughter the young ram of the guilt offering, and the priest will take some of the blood of the guilt offering and put it on the right earlobe of the one cleansing himself and on the thumb of his right hand and on the big toe of his right foot.
26 Nunɔla la nakɔ ami la ƒe ɖe ɖe eya ŋutɔ ƒe miasiƒome, 27 eye wòatsɔ eƒe nuɖusisibidɛ ahlẽ ami si le eƒe miasiƒome la ƒe ɖe zi adre le Yehowa ŋkume.
26 The priest will pour some of the oil into his own left palm, 27 and he will then spatter with his right finger some of the oil that is in his left palm seven times before Jehovah.

28 Eye nunɔla la nasisi ami si le eƒe asiƒome la ƒe ɖe ɖe ame si le eɖokui ŋu kɔm la ƒe ɖusitogboe, eƒe nuɖusidegblefetsu kple eƒe ɖusifɔdegblefetsu ŋu, ɖe teƒe siwo wòsisi fɔɖivɔsalãa ƒe ʋua ɖo la dzi.

28 And the priest will put some of the oil that is in his palm on the right earlobe of the one cleansing himself and on the thumb of his right hand and on the big toe of his right foot on the same places that he put the blood of the guilt offering.
29 Eye nunɔla la nasi ami si susɔ ɖe eƒe asiƒome la ɖe ta na ame si le eɖokui ŋu kɔm la, be wòalé avu ɖe eta le Yehowa ŋkume.
29 The priest will then put what is left over of the oil in his palm on the head of the one cleansing himself, in order to make atonement for him before Jehovah.

30 “Atsɔ akpakpaawo loo alo ahɔnɛviawo dometɔ ɖeka, esi amea te ŋu na, 31 si nye esi nu eƒe ŋutete de la dometɔ ɖeka asa nuvɔ̃vɔ, eye wòatsɔ evelia asa numevɔ hekpe ɖe nuɖuvɔsa la ŋu, be nunɔla la nalé avu ɖe ame si le eɖokui ŋu kɔm la ta le Yehowa ŋkume.

30 “He will offer up one of the turtledoves or one of the young pigeons, according to his means, 31 the one he can afford, as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering along with the grain offering; and the priest will make atonement for the one cleansing himself before Jehovah.
32 “Esiae nye se si dzi ame si ŋu anyidɔ nɔ evɔ nu mede edzi o la awɔ ɖo le ɣeyiɣi si me wole eŋu kɔm.”
32 “This is the law for the one in whom the disease of leprosy was but who does not have the means when establishing his purification.”

33 Yehowa gblɔ na Mose kple Aron be: 34 “Ne mieva Kanaan-nyigba si metsɔ na mi be wòanye mia tɔ dzi, eye mena anyidɔ do ɖe xɔ aɖe ŋu le miaƒe anyigba dzi la, 35 ekema aƒea tɔ la nava gblɔ na nunɔla la be: ‘Nane do ɖe nye xɔ ŋu abe dɔvɔ̃ ene.’ 36 Nunɔla la nade se be woafɔ nu sia nu ado goe le xɔa me hafi wòava lé ŋku ɖe dɔa ŋu, ale be wòagava gblɔ be nu siwo katã le xɔa me la zu nu makɔmakɔwo o. Emegbe hafi nunɔla la nayi aɖalé ŋku ɖe xɔ la ŋu.

33 Then Jehovah said to Moses and Aaron: 34 “When you come into the land of Canaan, which I am giving you as a possession, and I contaminate a house in your land with the disease of leprosy, 35 the one to whom the house belongs should then come and tell the priest, ‘Some kind of contamination has appeared in my house.’ 36 The priest will give orders to clear out the house before he comes to examine the contamination, in order that he may not declare everything that is in the house unclean; and after that the priest will come in to inspect the house.

37 Ne eva kpɔ dɔa le xɔa ƒe gliwo ŋu eye wòkpɔ be glia ƒe akpa aɖewo nyé ɖe eme wu eƒe akpa bubuwo eye teƒea ƒe amadede nye aŋutiɖiɖi kple gbemu tsaka alo biã vie la, 38 ekema nunɔla la nado go le xɔa me ayi gota, eye wòatu ʋɔa ŋkeke adre.

37 He will examine the affected area, and if the walls of the house are contaminated with yellowish-green or reddish depressions and they appear to be deeper than the wall surface, 38 the priest will then go out of the house to the entryway of the house and quarantine the house for seven days.
39 “Nunɔla la natrɔ ava lé ŋku ɖe eŋu le ŋkeke adrea gbe.
39 “Then the priest will return on the seventh day and make an inspection.
Ne anyidɔ la keke ɖe enu le xɔa ƒe gliwo ŋu la, 40 ekema nunɔla la nade se be woaho kpe siwo ŋu dɔa le atsɔ aƒu gbe ɖe teƒe makɔmakɔ le dua godo.
If the contamination has spread in the walls of the house, 40 the priest will then give orders, and the contaminated stones must be torn out and thrown outside the city into an unclean place.
41 Eye wòana woaƒlɔ xɔa ƒe gli ŋu keŋ le eme eye woalɔ anyia ava kɔ ɖe teƒe makɔmakɔ le dua godo.
41 Then he is to have the inside of the house thoroughly scraped, and the plaster and mortar that is removed should be discarded outside the city in an unclean place.
42 Eyome wòana woaɖo kpe bubuwo ɖe esiwo woho la teƒe, eye woablu anyi bubu atsɔ azrɔ̃ xɔa ŋu.
42 They will then insert other stones in the place of the stones they removed, and he should use different mortar and have the house plastered.
43 “Ke ne woho kpeawo ɖa, eye wodza gli la ŋu hegbugbɔ zrɔ̃ eŋu hafi dɔa gado ɖe xɔa ŋu ake la, 44 ekema nunɔla la nava lé ŋku ɖe eŋu.
43 “If, though, the contamination returns and breaks out in the house after the stones were torn out and the house was scraped and replastered, 44 the priest will then go in and inspect it.
Ne dɔa kaka ɖe xɔa ŋu la, ekema anyidɔ vɔ̃ɖie wònye le xɔa ŋu.
If the contamination has spread in the house, it is malignant leprosy in the house.
Xɔa ŋu mekɔ o.
The house is unclean.
45 Nena woagbã xɔ la eye woalɔ kpeawo, ʋuƒoawo kple xɔa ƒe anyi la katã aɖakɔ ɖe teƒe makɔmakɔ le dua godo.
45 He will then have the house pulled down—its stones, its timbers, and all the plaster and mortar of the house—and carried outside the city to an unclean place.

46 Ke ne ame aɖe ge ɖe xɔa me le ŋkeke siwo me wòle be ʋɔa nanɔ tutu la, eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ; 47 ame sia ame si mlɔ xɔa me la nanya eƒe awuwo, eye ame sia ame si ɖu nu le xɔa me la nanya eƒe awuwo.

46 But whoever enters the house any of the days it is quarantined will be unclean until the evening; 47 and whoever lies down in the house should wash his garments, and whoever eats in the house should wash his garments.
48 “Ke ne wogbugbɔ zrɔ̃ xɔa ŋu vɔ, eye nunɔla la va lé ŋku ɖe eŋu, eye wòkpɔ be dɔa mekaka ɖe xɔa ŋu o la, ekema nunɔla la nagblɔ be xɔa ŋu kɔ, elabena dɔa vɔ le eŋu.

48 “However, if the priest comes and sees that the contamination has not spread in the house after the house was replastered, the priest will then declare the house clean, because the contamination has been healed.
49 Eye woatsɔ xevi eve, sederti, ka dzĩ kple isop gbe vɛ be woatsɔ akɔ xɔa ŋu.
49 In order to purify the house from uncleanness, he will take two birds, cedarwood, scarlet material, and hyssop.
50 Atso xeviawo dometɔ ɖeka ɖe tɔsisi me tsi si le ze me la ŋgɔ.
50 He is to kill the one bird in an earthenware vessel over running water.
51 Eye wòatsɔ sederti la, isop gbe la, ka dzĩ la kple xevi gbagbe la anyrɔ ɖe xeviʋu si woɖuɖu ɖe tɔsisi me tsi ŋgɔ la me ahlẽ ɖe xɔ la ŋu zi adre.

51 Then he will take the cedarwood, the hyssop, the scarlet material, and the live bird and dip them in the blood of the bird that was killed and in the running water, and he must spatter it toward the house seven times.
52 Eye wòatsɔ xevi la ƒe ʋu, tɔsisi me tsi la, xevi gbagbe la, sederti la, isop gbe la kple ka dzĩ la aɖe vɔ̃ ɖa le xɔa ŋu ahakɔ eŋu.
52 And he will purify the house from uncleanness with the blood of the bird, the running water, the live bird, the cedarwood, the hyssop, and the scarlet material.
53 Eyome wòaɖe asi le xevi gbagbe la ŋu le dua godo ɖo ɖe gbe me, ne wòalé avu ɖe xɔ la ta be eŋu nakɔ.
53 He will then set the live bird free outside the city in the open field and make atonement for the house, and it will be clean.

54 “Esiawoe nye se siwo ku ɖe anyidɔ ɖe sia ɖe, dɔ si do ɖe ɖa alo ge me, 55 anyidɔ si do ɖe nudodo aɖe me alo xɔ aɖe ŋu, 56 nane si do ɖe ame ŋu, dzi si do ɖe ŋutigbalẽ ŋu, alo ŋutigbalẽ si ɖe bo la ŋuti. 57 Esiawoe nye mɔfiame siwo ana woanya be nane ŋu kɔ loo alo eŋu mekɔ o.

54 “This is the law respecting any case of leprosy, infection of the scalp or the beard, 55 leprosy of the garment or the house, 56 and respecting swellings, scabs, and blotches, 57 in order to determine when something is unclean and when something is clean.
Esiae nye anyidɔ ŋuti se.”
This is the law about leprosy.”
Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose kple Aron be: 2 “Migblɔ na Israel-viwo be, ‘Ne ŋutsu aɖe le afu ɖɔm la, ekema tsi si le dodom le eƒe ŋutsu me la na eŋu mekɔ o.
Jehovah continued to speak to Moses and Aaron, saying: 2 “Speak to the Israelites and tell them, ‘If a man has a discharge from his genital organ, this discharge makes him unclean.
3 Eŋu mekɔ o, eɖanye be tsia kpɔtɔ le dodom le eŋu loo alo ena eƒe ŋutsu me xe o, eŋu mekɔ o.
3 He is unclean from the discharge, whether the discharge continues to flow from his genitals or is obstructed, he is still unclean.
4 “‘Aba sia aba si dzi ŋutsu si le afu ɖɔm amlɔ la ŋu mekɔ o, eye nu sia nu si dzi wòanɔ anyi ɖo la ŋu mekɔ o.
4 “‘Any bed that the one with the discharge lies on will be unclean, and anything he sits on will be unclean.
5 Ame si ka asi eƒe aba ŋu la nanya eƒe awuwo ahale tsi, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
5 A man who touches his bed must wash his garments, and he should bathe in water and be unclean until the evening.
6 Ame sia ame si nɔ anyi ɖe nu si dzi afuɖɔla nɔ la nanya eƒe awuwo ahale tsi, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
6 Anyone who sits on an article that the one having a discharge sat on should wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until the evening.
7 Ame sia ame si ka asi afuɖɔla ŋu la nanya eƒe awuwo ahale tsi, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
7 Whoever touches the flesh of the one having a discharge should wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until the evening.
8 Ne afuɖɔla aɖe ɖe ta ɖe ame aɖe si ŋu kɔ ŋuti la, ekema amea nanya eƒe awuwo ahale tsi, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
8 If the one who has a discharge spits on someone clean, that person must wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until the evening.
9 Sɔkpa ɖe sia ɖe si dzi ŋutsu si le afu ɖɔm anɔ la ŋu mekɔ o.
9 Any saddle that the one with the discharge rides on will be unclean.
10 Eye ame sia ame si aka asi nu bubu ɖe sia ɖe si dzi wònɔ ŋu la, ŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ, ame si fɔ nu siawo la nanya eƒe awuwo ahale tsi, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
10 Anyone touching anything that was under him will be unclean until the evening, and anyone who carries those items will wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until the evening.
11 Ne afuɖɔla meklɔ asi hafi ka asi ame aɖe ŋu o la, ekema amea nanya eƒe awuwo ahale tsi, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
11 If the one with the discharge has not washed his hands in water and he touches someone, that person must then wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until the evening.
12 Woagbã anyinu si ŋu afuɖɔla ka asii la, eye ne atinu ŋue wòka asii la, ekema woaklɔe kple tsi.
12 An earthenware vessel that the one having a discharge touches should be smashed, and any wooden vessel should be washed with water.
13 “‘Ne tsi si le dodom le ŋutsua ŋu nu tso la, ekema wòaxlẽ ŋkeke adre hena eŋukɔkɔ, eye wòanya eƒe awuwo ahale tɔsisi me tsi be eŋu nakɔ.

13 “‘When the discharge stops and the person becomes clean from it, he will then count seven days for his purification, and he must wash his garments, bathe himself in running water, and he will be clean.
14 Le ŋkeke enyia gbe la, wòatsɔ akpakpa eve alo ahɔnɛvi eve ɖe asi ava Yehowa ŋkume le takpegbadɔa nu, eye wòatsɔ wo ana nunɔla la.
14 On the eighth day, he should take two turtledoves or two young pigeons and come before Jehovah at the entrance of the tent of meeting and give them to the priest.
15 Nunɔlaa natsɔ ɖeka asa nuvɔ̃vɔ, eye wòatsɔ evelia asa numevɔ, eye nunɔla la nalé avu ɖe eta le Yehowa ŋkume le tsi si do le eŋu la ta.
15 And the priest will offer them, the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, and the priest will make atonement for him before Jehovah concerning his discharge.
16 “‘Ne ŋutsu aɖe nyè tsi la, ekema wòale tsi, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
16 “‘Now if a man has an emission of semen, he should bathe his whole body in water and be unclean until the evening.
17 Wòanya awu sia awu kple lãgbalẽ sia lãgbalẽ si ŋu eƒe tsinyènye kɔ ɖo la, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
17 He must wash with water any garment and any skin with semen on it, and it will be unclean until the evening.
18 “‘Ne ŋutsu aɖe dɔ nyɔnu gbɔ eye wònyè tsi la, ekema woale tsi, eye wo ŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
18 “‘When a man lies with a woman and has an emission of semen, they should bathe in water and be unclean until the evening.
19 “‘Ne nyɔnu aɖe ɖo asi anyi eye ʋu le dodom le eŋu la, ekema eŋu mekɔ o ŋkeke adre.
19 “‘If a woman has a discharge of blood from her body, she will continue in her menstrual impurity for seven days.
Ame sia ame si ka asi eŋu la ŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
Anyone touching her will be unclean until the evening.
20 Nu sia nu si dzi wòamlɔ le eƒe asiɖoanyiɣia ŋu mekɔ o, eye nu sia nu si dzi wòanɔ la hã ŋu mekɔ o.
20 Anything she lies down on in her menstrual impurity will be unclean, and everything she sits on will be unclean.
21 Ame sia ame si ka asi eƒe aba ŋu la nanya eƒe awuwo ahale tsi, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
21 Anyone touching her bed should wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until the evening.
22 Ame sia ame si ka asi nu sia nu si dzi wònɔ anyi ɖo ŋu la nanya eƒe awuwo ahale tsi, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
22 Anyone touching any article she sat on should wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until the evening.
23 Eɖanye aba alo nu bubu aɖe dzie nyɔnua nɔ anyi ɖo o, ame si ka asi nua ŋu la ŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
23 If she sat on the bed or on another article, his touching it will make him unclean until the evening.
24 Ne ŋutsu dɔ egbɔ le eƒe asiɖoanyiɣi esi eŋu mekɔ o eye ʋua ɖe ɖe ŋutsua ŋu la, ekema ŋutsua ŋu mekɔ o ŋkeke adre, eye aba sia aba si dzi ŋutsua mlɔ la ŋu mekɔ o.
24 And if a man lies down with her and her menstrual impurity comes on him, he will then be unclean for seven days, and any bed on which he lies down will be unclean.

25 “‘Ne ʋu do le nyɔnu aɖe ŋu ŋkeke geɖe evɔ eƒe asiɖoanyiɣi meɖo o, alo ʋu do le eŋu wòdidi wu ɣeyiɣi si eƒe asiɖoanyi xɔna la, ekema ŋkeke siwo katã me ʋua le eŋu la, eŋu mekɔ o abe ale si wònɔna le eƒe asiɖoanyiɣia ke ene.

25 “‘When a woman’s discharge of blood flows for many days when it is not the regular time of her menstruation, or if she should have a flow longer than her usual menstruation, she will be unclean during all the days of her discharge, as in the days of her menstrual impurity.

26 Aba sia aba si dzi wòamlɔ le ŋkeke siwo me ʋua le dodom le eŋu la ŋu mekɔ o, abe eƒe asiɖoanyiɣi ƒe aba la ke ene, eye nu sia nu si dzi wòanɔ anyi ɖo la ŋu mekɔ o abe ale si wòle le eƒe asiɖoanyiɣia ke ene.

26 Any bed she lies on during the days of her discharge will become like the bed of her menstrual impurity, and any article she sits on will become unclean like the uncleanness of her menstrual impurity.
27 Ame sia ame si ka asi nuawo ŋu la ŋu mekɔ o, eye wòanya eƒe awuwo ahale tsi, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
27 Anyone touching them will be unclean, and he must wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until the evening.
28 “‘Ke ne ʋu si le dodom le eŋu nu tso la, ekema wòaxlẽ ŋkeke adre, eye emegbe eŋu akɔ.
28 “‘However, when she is clean from her discharge, she will count for herself seven days, and afterward she will be clean.
29 Le ŋkeke enyia gbe la, wòatsɔ akpakpa eve alo ahɔnɛvi eve avɛ na nunɔla la le takpegbadɔa nu.
29 On the eighth day, she should take two turtledoves or two young pigeons, and she will bring them to the priest at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
30 Nunɔla la natsɔ ɖeka asa nuvɔ̃vɔ, eye wòatsɔ evelia asa numevɔ, eye nunɔlaa nalé avu ɖe eta le Yehowa ŋkume le ʋu si do le eŋu si na eŋu mekɔ o la ta.
30 The priest will make the one a sin offering and the other a burnt offering, and the priest will make atonement for her before Jehovah concerning her unclean discharge.
31 “‘Mina Israel-viwo naɖe wo ɖokuiwo ɖa tso nu siwo ana wo ŋu makɔ o la gbɔ, ne woagagblẽ kɔ ɖo na nye avɔgbadɔ si le wo dome le esi wo ŋu mekɔ o ta ne woaku o.
31 “‘Thus you must keep the Israelites separate from their uncleanness, so that they do not die in their uncleanness by defiling my tabernacle, which is in their midst.

32 “‘Esiae nye ŋutsu si le afu ɖɔm kple ŋutsu si nyè tsi, si na eŋu mekɔ o la ŋuti se; 33 kple nyɔnu si ɖo asi anyi, si na eŋu mekɔ o, kpakple ame sia ame si ŋu nane le dodom le, eɖanye ŋutsu alo nyɔnu o, alo ŋutsu si dɔ nyɔnu si ŋu mekɔ o gbɔ la, ŋuti se.’”

32 “‘This is the law about the man having a discharge, the man who is unclean because of an emission of semen, 33 the woman during her menstrual impurity, any male or female who has a discharge flowing from the body, and a man who lies down with an unclean woman.’”
Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose be: 2 “Gblɔ na Aron kple viaŋutsuwo be woakpɔ wo ɖokuiwo dzi nyuie le ale si woawɔ Israel-viwo ƒe nu kɔkɔe siwo woatsɔ asa vɔ nam ŋu dɔe la ŋu, ne woagaƒo ɖi nye ŋkɔ kɔkɔe la o.

Jehovah spoke further to Moses, saying: 2 “Tell Aaron and his sons that they should be careful how they handle the holy things of the Israelites and not profane my holy name regarding the things they are sanctifying to me.
Nyee nye Yehowa.
I am Jehovah.
3 Gblɔ na wo be: ‘Le miaƒe dzidzimewo katã me la, ne miaƒe dzidzimevi aɖe si ŋu mekɔ o te ɖe nu kɔkɔe siwo ŋu Israel-viwo akɔ na Yehowa ŋu la, ekema woatsrɔ̃ ame ma ɖa le nye ŋkuta.

3 Say to them, ‘Throughout your generations, any of your offspring who, while he is unclean, comes near to the holy things that the Israelites sanctify to Jehovah, that person will be cut off from before me.
Nyee nye Yehowa.
I am Jehovah.

4 Aron ƒe dzidzimeviwo dometɔ si le anyidɔ lém alo tsi aɖe le dodom le eŋu la mekpɔ mɔ aɖu nu kɔkɔeawo o, va se ɖe esime eŋu kɔ hafi. Nenema kee nye wo dometɔ si ka asi ame si ŋu mekɔ o le esi wòƒo ɖi eɖokui le ame kuku aɖe ta ŋu, alo ka asi ŋutsu si nyè tsi ŋu, 5 alo wo dometɔ si ka asi lã suesue siwo nɔa ha me siwo ŋu mekɔ o ŋu, alo ka asi ame si nu bubu aɖe na eŋu mekɔ o la hã ŋu.

4 No man of Aaron’s offspring who has leprosy or a discharge may eat of the holy things until he becomes clean, neither the man who touches someone who became unclean by a dead person, nor a man who has a seminal emission, 5 nor a man who touches an unclean swarming creature or who touches a man who is unclean for any reason and who can make him unclean.
6 Ame si ka asi nu siawo dometɔ aɖe ŋu la ŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ, eye maɖu nu kɔkɔeawo ƒe ɖeke o, negbe ɖeko wòale tsi hafi.
6 The person who touches any of these will be unclean until the evening and may not eat any of the holy things, but he should bathe himself in water.
7 Ne ɣe ɖo to la, ekema eŋu kɔ, eye emegbe ate ŋu aɖu nu kɔkɔeawo ƒe ɖe, elabena eƒe nuɖuɖue.
7 When the sun has set, he will be clean, and afterward he may eat some of the holy things because it is his food.
8 Maɖu lã si ku le eɖokui si alo lã si gbemelã aɖe vuvu atsɔ agblẽ kɔ ɖo na eɖokui o.
8 Also, he should not eat any animal found dead or anything torn by wild animals and become unclean by it.
Nyee nye Yehowa.
I am Jehovah.
9 “‘Woawɔ nu siwo meɖo na wo la dzi ale be woagada vo ahaku le esi wogblẽ kɔ ɖo na nu kɔkɔewo ta o.
9 “‘They must keep their obligation to me, so that they may not incur sin because of it and have to die for it because they were profaning it.
Nyee nye Yehowa, ame si kɔ wo ŋu.
I am Jehovah, who is sanctifying them.
10 “‘Ame si womeɖe mɔ na o mekpɔ mɔ aɖu nu kɔkɔea ƒe ɖeke o.
10 “‘No unauthorized person may eat anything holy.
Nunɔla ƒe amedzro alo eƒe apadɔwɔla hã mekpɔ mɔ aɖu nu kɔkɔea ƒe ɖeke o.
No foreign guest of a priest or hired worker may eat anything holy.
11 Ke ne nunɔla aɖe tsɔ eƒe ga ƒle ame aɖe la, ekema amea ate ŋu aɖui.
11 But if a priest should purchase someone with his own money, that person may share in eating it.
Kluvi siwo wodzi ɖe eƒe aƒe me hã ate ŋu aɖu nuɖuɖu la.
Slaves born in his house may also share in eating his food.
12 Ne nunɔla aɖe ƒe vinyɔnu ɖe ame si metso nunɔlawo ƒe ƒomea me o la, ekema nyɔnu la mate ŋu aɖu nu kɔkɔe siwo wodzɔ la o.
12 If the daughter of a priest should marry someone who is not a priest, she may not eat of the contribution of the holy things.

13 Ke ne nunɔla aɖe ƒe vinyɔnu zu ahosi alo wogbee eye vi aɖeke hã mele esi o, eye wòhiã be wòatrɔ ayi fofoa ƒe aƒe me abe ale si wònɔe le eƒe ɖetugbuime ene la, ekema ate ŋu aɖu fofoa ƒe nuɖuɖu la ƒe ɖe; ame si womeɖe mɔ na o mekpɔ mɔ aɖui o.

13 But if the daughter of a priest should become a widow or is divorced and she has no offspring and she returns to her father’s house as in her youth, she may eat some of her father’s food; but no unauthorized person may eat it.
14 “‘Ke ne ame aɖe ɖu nu kɔkɔea ƒe ɖe le manyamanya me la, ekema wòaɖo nu kɔkɔe la teƒe na nunɔla la, eye wòagatsɔ nua me mama atɔ̃ ƒe ɖeka ƒe home akpee.
14 “‘Now if a man eats a holy thing by mistake, he must add a fifth of its value and give the holy offering to the priest.
15 Ale woagagblẽ kɔ ɖo na Israel-viwo ƒe nu kɔkɔe siwo wodzɔ na Yehowa, 16 be woagahe to na wo le esi woɖu nu kɔkɔeawo heɖi fɔ ta o. Nyee nye Yehowa, ame si kɔ wo ŋu.’”

15 So they should not profane the holy things of the Israelites that they contribute to Jehovah 16 and cause themselves to incur punishment for their guilt because of eating their holy things; for I am Jehovah, who is sanctifying them.’”

17 Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose be: 18 “Gblɔ na Aron kple viaŋutsuwo kpakple Israel-viwo katã be, ‘Ne Israel-vi alo amedzrovi aɖe si le Israel tsɔ eƒe adzɔgbeɖenunana alo tsɔ eƒe lɔlɔ̃nu faa nunana aɖe vɛ be woatsɔ asa numevɔ na Yehowa la, 19 ele be wòanye lãtsui si sɔ blibo, eɖanye nyi, alẽ alo gbɔ̃ o, be miaƒe nu nadze eŋu.

17 Jehovah continued speaking to Moses, saying: 18 “Speak to Aaron and his sons and all the Israelites and say to them, ‘When an Israelite man or a foreign resident in Israel presents a burnt offering to Jehovah to fulfill his vows or to make a voluntary offering, 19 he should present a sound male from the herd, the young rams, or the goats, in order to gain approval.
20 Migatsɔ lã nuwɔe aɖeke vɛ o, elabena miaƒe nu madze eŋu o.
20 You must not present anything with a defect, for it will not serve to gain approval for you.

21 “‘Ne ame aɖe be yeasa ŋutifafavɔ na Yehowa atsɔ axe eƒe adzɔgbeɖefe alo be wòanye lɔlɔ̃nu faa nunana la, ekema wòanye nyi alo alẽ si sɔ blibo, si naneke mewɔ afi aɖeke na o, be wòaxɔe ne amea ƒe nu nadze eŋu.

21 “‘If a man presents a communion sacrifice to Jehovah to pay a vow or as a voluntary offering, it should be a sound animal from the herd or the flock, in order to gain approval. No defect at all should be in it.
22 Migatsɔ lã si ƒe ŋku gbã, esi ŋe, esi xɔ abi, esi nu tè alo esi dze akpa alo esi ŋu zɔlĩ le la dometɔ aɖeke vɛ na Yehowa o, eye migatsɔ wo dometɔ aɖeke sa vɔe na Yehowa le vɔsamlekpui la dzi o.
22 No offering should be blind, have a fracture, a cut, a wart, scabbiness, or ringworm; you must not present any of these to Jehovah or make such an offering on the altar for Jehovah.
23 Ke àte ŋu atsɔ nyi alo alẽ si ƒe ŋutinu aɖe didi wu kemɛa alo to ɖe eme la ana abe lɔlɔ̃nu faa nunana ene, ke ne adzɔgbeɖenunanae la, womakpɔ ŋudzedze ɖe eŋu axɔe na mi o.
23 You may present a bull or a sheep with a limb that is too long or too short as a voluntary offering, but it will not be accepted with approval as a vow offering.
24 Migatsɔ lã si ƒe voku woto alo wogbã, esi woha vo le gɔme na alo esi wota la vɛ na Yehowa o, eye migatsɔ lã mawo sa vɔe le miaƒe anyigba dzi o.
24 You must not present to Jehovah one having the testicles damaged or crushed or pulled off or cut off, and you should not offer such animals in your land.
25 Migaxɔ nu siawo dometɔ aɖeke tso amedzrovi aɖeke si ana wòanye mia Mawu ƒe nuɖuvɔ o, elabena nu gblẽ le wo ŋu eye wozu lã nuwɔewo.
25 And you must not present any of these from the hand of a foreigner as the bread of your God, for they are corrupted and defective.
Womakpɔ ŋudzedze ɖe eŋu axɔe na mi o.’”
They will not be accepted with approval for you.’”

26 Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose be: 27 “Ne wodzi nyi alo alẽ alo gbɔ̃ la, woana wòanɔ dadaa ŋu ŋkeke adre, ke ne exɔ ŋkeke enyi alo wu nenema, eye wotsɔe sa dzovɔ na Yehowa la, woaxɔe ahakpɔ ŋudzedze ɖe eŋu.

26 Jehovah spoke further to Moses, saying: 27 “When a bull or a young ram or a goat is born, it will continue with its mother for seven days, but from the eighth day forward it will be accepted with approval as an offering, an offering made by fire to Jehovah.
28 Ke migawu nyi alo alẽ kple via siaa gbe ɖeka o.
28 As for a bull or a sheep, you must not slaughter it and its young on the same day.
29 “Ne miele akpedavɔ sam na Yehowa la, miwɔe le mɔ si ana miaƒe nu nadze eŋu la nu.
29 “If you sacrifice a thanksgiving sacrifice to Jehovah, you should sacrifice it to gain approval for yourselves.
30 Gbe ma gbe kee woaɖui.
30 It should be eaten on that day.
Migagblẽ ɖeke ɖi ŋu nake ɖe edzi o.
You must not leave any of it until morning.
Nyee nye Yehowa.
I am Jehovah.
31 “Milé nye seawo me ɖe asi, eye miawɔ wo dzi.
31 “You must keep my commandments and carry them out.
Nyee nye Yehowa.
I am Jehovah.
32 Migaƒo ɖi nye ŋkɔ kɔkɔe la o, ke boŋ mikɔ ŋunye le Israel-viwo dome.
32 You must not profane my holy name, and I must be sanctified in the midst of the Israelites.
Nyee nye Yehowa, ame si kɔ mia ŋu. 33 Nyee kplɔ mi tso Egipte-nyigba dzi, be manye miaƒe Mawu.
I am Jehovah, who is sanctifying you, 33 the one bringing you out of the land of Egypt to prove myself God to you.
Nyee nye Yehowa.”
I am Jehovah.”
Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose be: 2 “Gblɔ na Israel-viwo be, ‘Ne Israel-vi aɖe alo amedzrovi aɖe si le Israel tsɔ via sa vɔe na Molek la, edze na ku.

Jehovah went on speaking to Moses, saying: 2 “You are to say to the Israelites, ‘Any man of Israel and any foreigner who resides in Israel who gives any of his offspring to MOlech should be put to death without fail.
Dukɔ la naƒu kpee wòaku.
The people of the land should stone him to death.
3 Maɖe ŋku atɔ ame ma, eye matsrɔ̃e ɖa le eƒe dukɔ la dome, le esi wòtsɔ via sa vɔe na Molek tsɔ gblẽ kɔ ɖo na nye kɔkɔeƒe la, eye wòdo vlo nye ŋkɔ kɔkɔe la ta.

3 I myself will set my face against that man, and I will cut him off from among his people, because he has given some of his offspring to MOlech and has defiled my holy place and has profaned my holy name.
4 Ne dukɔ la ɖoe koŋ ŋe aɖaba ƒu ame ma ƒe nuwɔna dzi, eye womewui o, evɔ wònye etsɔ via sa vɔe na Molek hafi la, 5 ekema nye ŋutɔ maɖe ŋku atɔ ame ma kple eƒe ƒomea.

4 If the people of the land should deliberately close their eyes to what that man does when he gives his offspring to MOlech and they do not put him to death, 5 then I myself will certainly set my face against that man and his family.
Matsrɔ̃ eya kple ame siwo katã wɔ ɖeka kplii le ahasiwɔwɔ kple Molek me.
I will cut off that man from his people along with all who join him in prostituting themselves to MOlech.
6 “‘Ke ame si yia ŋɔliyɔlawo alo nukalawo gbɔ la, ewɔ gbɔgbɔmehasi, eya ta maɖe ŋku atɔ ame ma atsrɔ̃e ɖa le eƒe dukɔ la dome.

6 “‘As for the person who turns to the spirit mediums and the fortune-tellers so as to commit spiritual prostitution with them, I will certainly turn against that person and cut him off from his people.
7 “‘Mikɔ mia ɖokuiwo ŋu ne mianɔ kɔkɔe, elabena nyee nye Yehowa mia Mawu.
7 “‘You must sanctify yourselves and become holy, because I am Jehovah your God.
8 Milé nye sewo me ɖe asi ne miawɔ wo dzi.
8 And you must keep my statutes and carry them out.
Nyee nye Yehowa, ame si kɔ mia ŋu.
I am Jehovah, who is sanctifying you.
9 “‘Ne ame aɖe ƒo fi de fofoa alo dadaa la, ele be woawui godoo.
9 “‘If there is any man who curses his father or his mother, he should be put to death without fail.
Esi wòƒo fi de fofoa kple dadaa ta la, eƒe ʋu anɔ eya ŋutɔ ƒe ta dzi.
Since he has cursed his father or his mother, his own blood is upon him.
10 “‘Ne ŋutsu aɖe wɔ ahasi kple ame bubu srɔ̃ la, ele be woawu ame si wɔ ahasi kple ehavi srɔ̃ la godoo, woawu ŋutsu ahasiwɔla la kple nyɔnu ahasiwɔla la siaa.

10 “‘Now regarding a man who commits adultery with another man’s wife: The one who commits adultery with the wife of his fellow man should be put to death without fail, the adulterer and the adulteress.
11 Ŋutsu si dɔ fofoa srɔ̃ gbɔ la, edo ŋukpe fofoa.
11 A man who lies down with his father’s wife has exposed his father to shame.
Ele be woawu wo ame evea siaa.
Both of them should be put to death without fail.
Woƒe ʋu anɔ woawo ŋutɔwo ƒe ta dzi.
Their own blood is upon them.
12 Ne ŋutsu aɖe dɔ toyɔvia gbɔ la, ele be woawu wo ame evea siaa.
12 If a man lies down with his daughter-in-law, both of them should be put to death without fail.
Wowɔ nu si mesɔ le dzɔdzɔme nu o.
They have violated what is natural.
Woƒe ʋu anɔ woawo ŋutɔwo ƒe ta dzi.
Their own blood is upon them.
13 “‘Ne ŋutsu aɖe dɔ ŋutsu gbɔ abe nyɔnu gbɔ ene la, wo ame evea siaa wɔ ŋunyɔnu.
13 “‘If a man lies down with a male the same as one lies down with a woman, both of them have done a detestable thing.
Woawu wo godoo.
They should be put to death without fail.
Woƒe ʋu anɔ woawo ŋutɔwo ƒe ta dzi.
Their own blood is upon them.
14 “‘Ne ŋutsu aɖe de nyɔnu kple dadaa siaa gbɔ la, nuwɔna nyɔŋue wònye.
14 “‘If a man takes a woman and her mother, it is an obscene act.
Woawu ŋutsua kple nyɔnuawo eye woatɔ dzo wo, ne nuwɔna nyɔŋu sia tɔgbi nagayi edzi le mia dome o.
They should burn him and them in the fire, so that obscene conduct may not continue among you.
15 “‘Ne ŋutsu aɖe dɔ lã aɖe gbɔ la, ele be woawu ŋutsua kple lã la siaa.
15 “‘If a man has intercourse with a beast, he should be put to death without fail, and you should kill the beast.
16 Ne nyɔnu aɖe tsɔ eɖokui na lã aɖe wòyɔ asii la, nyɔnua kple lã la siaa dze na ku.
16 If a woman approaches any beast to have intercourse with it, you must kill the woman and the beast.
Ele be woawu wo godoo.
They should be put to death without fail.
Woƒe ʋu anɔ woawo ŋutɔwo ƒe ta dzi.
Their own blood is upon them.
17 “‘Ne ŋutsu de asi nɔvianyɔnu ŋu, eɖanye fofoa vinyɔnu alo dadaa vinyɔnu o hekpɔ eƒe ama, eye nyɔnua hã kpɔ ŋutsua ƒe ama la, ŋukpenanu wònye.
17 “‘If a man has sexual relations with his sister, the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother, and he sees her nakedness and she sees his nakedness, it is a disgrace.
Eya ta woawu wo le woƒe dukɔ la ŋkume.
They must be cut off before the eyes of the sons of their people.
Edo ŋukpe nɔvianyɔnu, eya ta eƒe fɔɖiɖi anɔ eƒe ta dzi.
He has exposed his sister to shame. He should answer for his error.
18 “‘Ne ŋutsu aɖe dɔ nyɔnu aɖe gbɔ le eƒe asiɖoanyiɣi la, ekema ŋutsua kple nyɔnua siaa klo nu le nyɔnua ƒe ʋusisi dzi.
18 “‘If a man lies down with a menstruating woman and has sexual relations with her, both he and she have exposed her flow of blood.
Woatsrɔ̃ wo ame evea ɖa le woƒe dukɔ la dome.
Both of them must be cut off from among their people.
19 “‘Mègade asi dawò nɔvinyɔnu alo fofowò nɔvinyɔnu ŋu o, elabena enye ŋukpedodo wò ƒometɔ kpamkpam.
19 “‘You must not have sexual relations with your mother’s sister or your father’s sister, because that would be exposing a blood relative to shame.
Ame siwo wɔ nu sia ƒe fɔɖiɖi anɔ woƒe ta dzi.
They should answer for their error.
20 Ame si dɔ fofoa nɔviŋutsu srɔ̃ gbɔ la do ŋukpe fofoa nɔviŋutsu.
20 A man who lies down with his uncle’s wife has exposed his uncle to shame.
Ame siwo wɔ nu sia ƒe fɔɖiɖi anɔ woƒe ta dzi.
They should answer for their sin.
Woaku vimadzimadzii.
They should die childless.
21 Ne ŋutsu aɖe xɔ nɔviaŋutsu srɔ̃ la, ŋunyɔnu wònye.
21 If a man takes his brother’s wife, it is something abhorrent.
Edo ŋukpe nɔviaŋutsu, eya ta ele be woatsi ko.
He has exposed his brother to shame. They should become childless.
22 “‘Milé nye sewo kple nye ʋɔnudrɔ̃ɖoɖowo katã me ɖe asi ne miawɔ wo dzi, ne anyigba si dzi mekplɔ mi yinae be mianɔ edzi la nagatu mi aƒu gbe o.
22 “‘You must keep all my statutes and all my judicial decisions and carry them out, so that the land where I am bringing you to dwell will not vomit you out.
23 Migazɔ ɖe dukɔ siwo nyam mele ɖa le mia ŋgɔ la ƒe ɖoɖowo nu o; elabena nu siawo katãe wowɔ, eya ta wonyɔ ŋu nam.
23 You must not walk in the statutes of the nations that I am driving out from before you; for they have done all these things and I abhor them.
24 Eya tae megblɔ na mi be: “Miaxɔ woƒe anyigba wòanye mia tɔ, eye matsɔ anyigba sia si dzi notsi kple anyitsi le sisim le la, ana mi wòazu mia tɔ.
24 That is why I said to you: “You will take possession of their land, and I will give it to you as your possession, a land flowing with milk and honey.

Nyee nye Yehowa mia Mawu, ame si ɖe mi ɖe vovo tso dukɔ bubuwo gbɔ.” 25 Miade vovototo lã si ŋu kɔ kple esi ŋu mekɔ o dome kpakple xe si ŋu kɔ kple esi ŋu mekɔ o dome. Migatsɔ lã kple xe kpakple nu siwo katã ʋãna le anyigba dzi, si meɖe ɖe vovo be wo ŋu mekɔ o la, do ŋunyɔ mia ɖokuiwo o.

Jehovah your God I am, who has set you apart from the peoples.” 25 You must make a distinction between the clean animal and the unclean and between the unclean bird and the clean; you must not make yourselves loathsome by means of an animal or a bird or anything that creeps on the ground that I set apart for you to regard as unclean.
26 Minɔ kɔkɔe nam, elabena nye, Yehowa, mele kɔkɔe, eye meɖe mi ɖe vovo tso dukɔ bubuwo gbɔ be mianye tɔnye koŋ.
26 You must be holy to me, because I, Jehovah, am holy, and I am setting you apart from the peoples to become mine.
27 “Ŋutsu alo nyɔnu si nye ŋɔliyɔla alo afakala la dze na ku.
27 “‘Any man or woman who acts as a spirit medium or is a fortune-teller should be put to death without fail.
Woaƒu kpe wo woaku.
The people should stone them to death.
Woƒe ʋu anɔ woawo ŋutɔwo ƒe ta dzi.’”
Their own blood is upon them.’”
Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose be: “Gblɔ na nunɔla siwo nye Aron viwo be, ‘Mia dometɔ aɖeke megaka asi ame kuku aɖeke ŋu atsɔ aƒo ɖi eɖokui le eƒe dukɔ la dome o.
Jehovah went on to say to Moses: “Talk to the priests, Aaron’s sons, and say to them, ‘No one should defile himself for a dead person among his people.
2 Ke eƒe ƒometɔ kplikplikpli si nye dadaa, fofoa, viaŋutsu, vianyɔnu, nɔviaŋutsu 3 kple nɔvianyɔnu, si nye ɖetugbui si meɖe srɔ̃ o la ta koe wòate ŋu aƒo ɖi eɖokui ɖo.

2 But he may do so for a close blood relative, for his mother, his father, his son, his daughter, his brother, 3 and he may defile himself for his sister if she is a virgin who is near to him and has not yet married.
4 Nunɔla megaƒo ɖi eɖokui le eƒe dukɔmevi aɖeke srɔ̃nyɔnu ta atsɔ agblẽ kɔ ɖo na eɖokui o.
4 He may not defile himself and make himself profane for a woman who belongs to a husband of his people.
5 Woagaƒlɔ ta kokoe o, woagafɔ woƒe ge dzi o, eye woagasi wo ɖokuiwo ŋuti o.
5 They should not make their heads bald or shave off the fringe of their beard or make cuts on their body.
6 Woanɔ kɔkɔe na woƒe Mawu, eye woagado vlo woƒe Mawu la ƒe ŋkɔ o, elabena woawoe saa dzovɔwo na Yehowa, si nye woƒe Mawu ƒe abolo, eya ta woanɔ kɔkɔe.
6 They should be holy to their God, and they should not profane the name of their God, for they are presenting Jehovah’s offerings made by fire, the bread of their God, and they must be holy.
7 Womaɖe gbolo alo nyɔnu si wogblẽ alo nyɔnu si srɔ̃a gbe o, elabena ame kɔkɔe ye nunɔla nye na eƒe Mawu.
7 They should not marry a prostitute, a woman who has been defiled, or a woman divorced from her husband, because the priest is holy to his God.
8 Eya ta nàkɔ eŋu, elabena eyae saa wò Mawu ƒe nuɖuvɔ.
8 You must sanctify him, because he is one presenting the bread of your God.
Ame kɔkɔe wòanye na wò, elabena nye, Yehowa, ame si kɔ mia ŋu la, mele kɔkɔe.
He should be holy to you, because I, Jehovah, the one sanctifying you, am holy.
9 “‘Ke ne nunɔla aɖe ƒe vinyɔnu zu gbolo heƒo ɖi eɖokui la, ekema eƒo ɖi fofoa.
9 “‘Now if the daughter of a priest should profane herself by committing prostitution, she is profaning her father.
Woawui ahatɔ dzoe.
She should be burned in the fire.
10 “‘Ke ame si woatia le nɔviawo dome ahakɔ ami kɔkɔe la ɖe eƒe tame atsɔ aɖoe nunɔlagãe be wòado awuawo la nagakaka ɖa ɖe ta alo adze eƒe awuwo o.
10 “‘The high priest of his brothers, on whose head the anointing oil is poured and who has been installed to wear the priestly garments, should not let his head go ungroomed or tear his garments.
11 Mate ɖe ame kuku aɖeke ŋu o. Maƒo ɖi eɖokui le fofoa alo dadaa gɔ̃ hã ta o.
11 He should not approach any dead person; he may not defile himself even for his father or his mother.
12 Megado go le kɔkɔeƒe la ɖe esia ta o, eye megagblẽ kɔ ɖo na eƒe Mawu ƒe kɔkɔeƒe la hã o, elabena eƒe Mawu ƒe ami kɔkɔe la, si nye adzɔgbeɖeɖe ƒe dzesi la, le eŋu.
12 He should not go out from the sanctuary and should not profane the sanctuary of his God, for the sign of dedication, the anointing oil of his God, is upon him.
Nyee nye Yehowa.
I am Jehovah.
13 “‘Ele be wòaɖe ɖetugbui leaƒe.
13 “‘He must take as a wife a woman who is a virgin.
14 Maɖe ahosi, nyɔnu si srɔ̃a gbe, nyɔnu si wogblẽ, alo gbolo o; ke boŋ wòaɖe eƒe dukɔmevi si nye ɖetugbui leaƒe.
14 He may not marry a widow, a divorced woman, one who has been defiled, or a prostitute; but he should take a virgin from his people as a wife.
15 Mele be wòahe vlododo ava viawo dzi le eƒe dukɔ la me o, elabena nyee nye Yehowa, ame si kɔ eŋu.’”
15 He should not profane his offspring among his people, for I am Jehovah, who is sanctifying him.’”
16 Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose be: 17 “Gblɔ na Aron be, ‘Ne viaŋutsuwo alo woƒe dzidzimeviwo dometɔ aɖe nye nuwɔametɔ la, mekpɔ mɔ ate va be yeatsɔ yeƒe Mawu ƒe abolo asa vɔe o.
16 Jehovah continued to speak to Moses, saying: 17 “Tell Aaron, ‘No man of your offspring throughout their generations who has a defect may approach to present the bread of his God.

18 Nuwɔametɔ aɖeke mekpɔ mɔ ate va o: ŋkuagbãtɔ, bunɔ, ame si ƒe ŋkume dɔléle aɖe gblẽ, ame si ƒe abɔ alo afɔ ɖeka didi wu nɔvia, 19 alo ataŋeŋetɔ, abɔŋeŋetɔ, 20 alo ame si ɖo kpo, ame kpui zegede, ame si nu wɔ ŋku na, ame si dze akpa, ame si ŋu zɔlĩ le alo ame si ƒe voku to.

18 If there is any man who has a defect, he may not approach: a man who is blind or lame or has a disfigured face or one limb too long, 19 a man with a fractured foot or a fractured hand, 20 a hunchback or a dwarf, or a man with an eye defect or eczema or ringworm or damaged testicles.
21 Nunɔla Aron ƒe dzidzimeviwo dometɔ si nye nuwɔametɔ la mekpɔ mɔ ava sa dzovɔ na Yehowa o.
21 No man of the offspring of Aaron the priest who has a defect may approach to present Jehovah’s offerings made by fire.
Mekpɔ mɔ ava be yeatsɔ yeƒe Mawu ƒe nuɖuɖu la asa vɔe o, elabena nuwɔametɔ wònye.
Because he has a defect, he may not approach to present the bread of his God.
22 Ate ŋu aɖu eƒe Mawu la ƒe nuɖuɖu kɔkɔetɔ kekeake kple nuɖuɖu kɔkɔe la ƒe ɖe.
22 He may eat the bread of his God from the most holy things and from the holy things.
23 Gake mekpɔ mɔ agogo xɔmetsovɔ la o, eye mate ɖe vɔsamlekpui la ŋu o, elabena nuwɔametɔ wònye. Megagblẽ kɔ ɖo na nye kɔkɔeƒe la o, elabena nyee nye Yehowa, ame si kɔ wo ŋu.’”
23 However, he may not come near the curtain, and he may not approach the altar, because there is a defect in him; and he should not profane my sanctuary, for I am Jehovah, who is sanctifying them.’”
24 Eye Mose gblɔ nya siawo na Aron kple viaŋutsuwo kpakple Israel-viwo katã.
24 So Moses spoke to Aaron and his sons and all the Israelites.
“‘Migawɔ mawu maɖinuwo na mia ɖokui o, migawɔ nu kpakpɛ alo atu trɔ̃sɔti aɖeke na mia ɖokui o, eye migawɔ kpetata aɖeke aɖo miaƒe anyigba dzi be miade ta agu nɛ o; elabena nyee nye Yehowa, mia Mawu.

“‘You must not make worthless gods for yourselves, and you must not set up a carved image or a sacred pillar for yourselves, and you must not put a stone figure in your land in order to bow down toward it; for I am Jehovah your God.
2 Milé nye sabat ƒe sewo me ɖe asi, eye mide bubu deto nye kɔkɔeƒe la ŋu.
2 You should keep my sabbaths and show reverence for my sanctuary.
Nyee nye Yehowa.
I am Jehovah.
3 “‘Ne mieyi edzi zɔ ɖe nye ɖoɖowo nu, eye mielé nye sewo me ɖe asi hewɔ wo dzi la, 4 ekema nye hã mana tsi nadza na mi le edzaɣi, anyigba la awɔ nu, eye ati siwo le edzi la atse nyuie.

3 “‘If you continue walking in my statutes and keeping my commandments and you carry them out, 4 I will give you showers of rain at their proper time, and the land will yield its produce, and the trees of the field will give their fruit.
5 Miaƒe nukuƒoɣi adidi aɖo wainxaɣi, eye wainxaɣi adidi aɖo nuƒãɣi. Miaɖu nu aɖi ƒo, eye mianɔ miaƒe anyigba dzi le dedienɔnɔ me.

5 Your threshing season will extend until your grape harvest, and the grape harvest will extend until the sowing season; and you will eat your bread to satisfaction and dwell in security in your land.
6 Mana ŋutifafa naxɔ anyigba la dzi, miamlɔ anyi eye ame aɖeke mado voɖi na mi o. Manya lã wɔadãwo ɖa le anyigba la dzi, eye aʋawɔwɔ ƒe yi aɖeke mato miaƒe anyigba dzi ayi o.
6 I will put peace in the land, and you will lie down with no one making you afraid; and I will rid the land of vicious wild animals, and a sword of war will not pass through your land.
7 Mianya miaƒe futɔwo ɖe nu, eye woatsi yi nu le mia ŋgɔ.
7 You will certainly pursue your enemies, and they will fall before you by the sword.
8 Mia dometɔ atɔ̃ anya ame alafa ɖeka ɖe nu, eye mia dometɔ alafa ɖeka anya ame akpe ewo ɖe nu, eye miaƒe futɔwo atsi miaƒe yi nu.
8 Five of you will pursue 100, and 100 of you will pursue 10,000, and your enemies will fall before you by the sword.
9 “‘Mave mia nu, mana miadzi asɔ gbɔ, eye mawɔ nubabla si le nye kpli mi dome la dzi.
9 “‘I will direct my favor to you and make you fruitful and multiply you, and I will keep my covenant with you.
10 Mianɔ ƒe si do ŋgɔ la ƒe nuŋeŋewo ɖum, eye ne yeyea do la, ɖeko miaɖe xoxoawo ɖa be miakpɔ teƒe na yeyea.
10 While you are still eating the old produce of the preceding year, you will need to clear out the old to make way for the new.
11 Mana nye avɔgbadɔ nanɔ mia dome, eye nyemagbe mi o.
11 And I will place my tabernacle in your midst, and I will not reject you.
12 Mazɔ kpli mi, manye miaƒe Mawu, eye miawo mianye nye dukɔ.
12 I will walk among you and be your God, and you for your part will be my people.
13 Nyee nye Yehowa, mia Mawu, ame si kplɔ mi tso Egipte-nyigba dzi be miaganye kluvi na wo o. Nyee ŋe kɔkuti ɖa le kɔ na mi be miete ŋu fɔ ta dzi le zɔzɔm.
13 I am Jehovah your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be their slaves no longer, and I broke the bars of your yoke and made you walk with heads held high.

14 “‘Ke ne mieɖo tom o, eye miewɔ nye sedede siawo katã dzi o, 15 miegbe nye sewo, eye nye ʋɔnudrɔ̃ɖoɖowo nyɔ ŋu na mi, ale be miewɔ nye sededewo katã dzi o, eye mietu nye nubabla la, 16 ekema nye hã matsɔ nu siwo gbɔna ahe to na mi: Matsɔ yɔmekpe kple asrã sesẽ awɔ fu mi, si ana miaƒe ŋkuwo natsi, eye nu ate miaƒe agbe ŋu.

14 “‘However, if you will not listen to me or keep all these commandments, 15 and if you reject my statutes, and if you abhor my judicial decisions so that you do not keep all my commandments, and you violate my covenant, 16 I, for my part, will do the following to you: I will punish you with distress, with tuberculosis and burning fever, making your eyes fail and your life waste away.
Dzodzroe miaƒã nukuwo, elabena miaƒe futɔwo aɖu wo keŋkeŋ.
You will sow your seed simply for nothing, for your enemies will eat it.
17 Maɖe ŋku atɔ mi, eye ne miekpe aʋa kple miaƒe futɔwo la, woaɖu mia dzi; miaƒe ketɔwo ate mi ɖe to, eye ne ame aɖeke menya mi ɖe nu o hã, miade afɔ du me.
17 I will set my face against you, and you will be defeated by your enemies; and those who hate you will tread on you, and you will flee when no one is pursuing you.
18 “‘Ke ne nu siawo katã tu mi gake mieɖo tom o la, ekema mahe to na mi ɖe edzi zi gbɔ zi adre ɖe miaƒe nu vɔ̃wo nu.
18 “‘If even this does not make you listen to me, I will have to chastise you seven times as much for your sins.
19 Matsi miaƒe dada vivivo la nu, eye mana dziƒo nanɔ na mi abe gayibɔ ene, eye anyigba nanɔ na mi abe akɔbli ene.
19 I will break your stubborn pride and make your heavens like iron and your earth like copper.
20 Miazã miaƒe ŋusẽ ɖe yame, elabena miaƒe anyigba mawɔ nu o, eye ati siwo le edzi la matse ku o.
20 You will exhaust your strength for nothing, as your land will not yield its produce, and the trees of the land will not produce fruit.
21 “‘Ke ne miegatrɔ megbe dem kokoko, eye miegbe toɖoɖom la, ekema magahe to na mi ɖe edzi zi gbɔ zi adre, ɖe miaƒe nu vɔ̃wo nu.
21 “‘But if you keep walking in opposition to me and refuse to listen to me, I will then have to strike you seven times as much, according to your sins.
22 Madɔ lã wɔadãwo ɖe mia dome, eye woawu mia viwo, woavuvu miaƒe aƒemelãwo, woana miaƒe xexlẽme dzi naɖe akpɔtɔ, eye miaƒe mɔwo dzi aɖi gbɔlo.
22 I will send the wild animals of the field among you, and they will bereave you of children and annihilate your domestic animals and reduce your numbers, and your roads will be deserted.
23 “‘Le nu siawo katã megbe ne miegbe toɖoɖo, eye miegatrɔ megbe dem kokoko la, 24 ekema nye hã magblẽ mi ɖi, eye magahe to na mi zi gbɔ zi adre ɖe miaƒe nu vɔ̃wo nu.

23 “‘If in spite of these things you do not accept my correction and you insist on walking in opposition to me, 24 then I too will walk in opposition to you, and I myself will strike you seven times for your sins.
25 Maɖo yi ɖe mia dome, ne wòabia hlɔ̃ ɖe nubabla si mietu la ta.
25 I will bring an avenging sword upon you for breaking the covenant.
Ne miesi yi ɖabe ɖe miaƒe duwo me la, maɖo dɔvɔ̃ ɖe mia dome eye matsɔ mi ade asi na miaƒe futɔ.
If you gather yourselves into your cities, I will send disease into your midst, and you will be given into the hand of an enemy.
26 Ne megblẽ miaƒe abolotsoƒe dome la, ekema nyɔnu ewo amè abolo le kpo ɖeka pɛ me, eye woada miaƒe abolo hafi atsɔ ana mi; miaɖu nu gake miaɖi ƒo o.
26 When I destroy your supply of bread, ten women will be able to bake your bread in only one oven and then ration your bread by weight; and you will eat but you will not be satisfied.
27 “‘Ke ne nu siawo katã tu mi gake mieɖo tom o, eye miegatrɔ megbe dem kokoko la, 28 ekema nye hã mado dɔmedzoe ɖe mia ŋu vevie, eye mahe to na mi zi gbɔ zi adre ɖe miaƒe nu vɔ̃wo nu.

27 “‘If in spite of this you will not listen to me and you insist on walking in opposition to me, 28 I will intensify my opposition to you, and I myself will have to chastise you seven times for your sins.
29 Ale miaɖu mia viŋutsuwo kple mia vinyɔnuwo ƒe lã.
29 So you will have to eat the flesh of your sons, and you will eat the flesh of your daughters.
30 Makaka miaƒe nuxeƒewo, magbã nu siwo dzi miedoa dzudzɔ ʋeʋĩ ɖo, mana miaƒe kukuawo naɖo baba ɖe miaƒe legba nyɔŋu gbagbãwo dzi; eye mianyɔ ŋu nam.
30 I will annihilate your sacred high places and cut down your incense stands and pile your carcasses on the carcasses of your disgusting idols, and I will turn away from you in disgust.
31 Matsɔ miaƒe duwo ade asi na yi, makaka miaƒe kɔkɔeƒe la, eye miaƒe vɔsawo magaʋẽ ɖem lilili o.
31 I will give your cities to the sword and make your sanctuaries desolate, and I will not smell the pleasing aromas of your sacrifices.
32 Mana anyigba la nazu gbegbe, eye esia awɔ moya na miaƒe futɔ siwo le edzi.
32 I myself will make the land desolate, and your enemies who are dwelling in it will stare in amazement over it.
33 Maka mi ahlẽ ɖe dukɔwo dome, eye maɖe yi le aku me akplɔ mi ɖo. Miaƒe anyigba aɖi gbɔlo, eye miaƒe duwo azu glikpo.
33 And I will scatter you among the nations, and I will unsheathe a sword after you; and your land will be made desolate, and your cities will be devastated.
34 “‘Ɣemaɣi la, anyigba la agbɔ ɖe eme le ɣeyiɣi siwo katã me wòzu gbegbe, esime miawo miele miaƒe futɔwo ƒe anyigba dzi.
34 “‘At that time the land will pay off its sabbaths all the days it lies desolate, while you are in the land of your enemies.
Ɣemaɣi la, anyigba la agbɔ ɖe eme ɖe sabat siwo tsi eŋu la nu.
At that time the land will rest, as it must repay its sabbaths.
35 Anyigba la agbɔ ɖe eme le ŋkeke siwo katã me wòzu gbegbe, elabena megbɔ ɖe eme le miaƒe sabatwo ɖuɣi esime mienɔ edzi la o.
35 All the days it lies desolate it will rest, because it did not rest during your sabbaths when you were dwelling on it.

36 “‘Ke ame siwo atsi agbe le mia dome la, made vɔvɔ̃ woƒe dziwo me le futɔwo ƒe anyigba dzi; ne aŋgba ʋu ya la, eƒe ɖiɖi ana woasi aɖabe, abe yie nya wo ɖe nu ene, eye woadze anyi evɔ ame aɖeke menya wo ɖe nu hafi o.

36 “‘As for those who survive, I will fill their hearts with despair in the lands of their enemies; and the sound of a blowing leaf will cause them to flee, and they will flee like someone running from the sword and fall without anyone pursuing them.
37 Togbɔ be ame aɖeke meɖe wo ɖe nu o hã la, woanɔ wo nɔewo lɔm ƒu anyi abe yi nue wole sisim le ene.
37 They will stumble over one another like those running from a sword, though no one is pursuing them.
Eye miate ŋu anɔ te ɖe miaƒe futɔwo nu o.
You will not be able to resist your enemies.
38 Mia nu ayi le dukɔwo dome, eye miaƒe futɔwo ƒe anyigba la ami mi keŋkeŋ.
38 You will perish among the nations, and the land of your enemies will consume you.
39 Ke mia dometɔ siwo susɔ la, miaƒaƒã ɖe miaƒe futɔwo ƒe anyigbawo dzi le miaƒe vodadawo ta.
39 Those of you who remain will be left to rot in the lands of your enemies because of your error.
Ɛ̃, miaƒaƒã abe ale si mia fofowo ƒaƒã le woƒe vodadawo ta ene.
Yes, they will rot away because of the errors of their fathers.
40 Eye woaʋu woawo ŋutɔwo ƒe vo si woda ɖe ŋunye kple wo fofowo ƒe nuteƒemawɔmawɔ me, eye woalɔ̃ ɖe edzi be yewomewɔ nuteƒe nam esime yewotrɔ megbe dem o.
40 Then they will confess their own error and the error and unfaithfulness of their fathers and admit that they behaved unfaithfully by walking in opposition to me.
41 Eya ta nye hã metrɔ megbe de wo heɖo wo ɖe woƒe futɔwo ƒe anyigba dzi.
41 Then I also walked in opposition to them by bringing them into the land of their enemies.
“‘Ðewohĩ ɣemaɣi la, woana woƒe dzi si ku atri la nabɔbɔ, eye woaxe woƒe vodada ŋuti fe.
“‘Perhaps then their uncircumcised heart will be humbled, and then they will pay off their error.
42 Eye maɖo ŋku nu, si mebla kple Yakob la dzi; maɖo ŋku nu, si mebla kple Isak kple nu, si mebla kple Abraham la dzi, eye maɖo ŋku anyigba la dzi.
42 And I will remember my covenant with Jacob, and my covenant with Isaac, and I will remember my covenant with Abraham, and I will remember the land.

43 Le ɣeyiɣi siwo katã me woakplɔ wo adzoe le anyigbaa dzi la, anyigba la anɔ gbɔgbɔm ɖe eme ɖe sabat siwo to eŋu la nu, esime wòzu gbegbe, eye ame mele edzi o. Ɣemaɣi woawo ŋutɔwo hã anɔ woƒe vodada ŋuti fe xem, elabena wogbe nye ʋɔnudrɔ̃ɖoɖowo, eye wodo vlo nye sewo.

43 While the land was abandoned by them, it was paying off its sabbaths and lying desolate without them, and they were paying for their error, because they rejected my judicial decisions and they abhorred my statutes.

44 Ke ne wole woƒe futɔwo ƒe anyigba dzi, eye nu siawo katã dzɔ hã la, nyemagbe nu le wo gbɔ keŋkeŋ alo anyɔ ŋu wo, ale be matsrɔ̃ wo gbidigbidi, ne matu nubabla si le nye kpli wo dome la o; elabena nyee nye Yehowa, woƒe Mawu.

44 But despite all of this, while they are in the land of their enemies, I will never completely reject them nor cast them away to the point of exterminating them, which would violate my covenant with them, for I am Jehovah their God.
45 Le woawo ta maɖo ŋku nu, si mebla kple wo tɔgbui siwo mekplɔ tso Egipte-nyigba dzi le dukɔwo ŋkume la dzi, ne manye woƒe Mawu.
45 For their sakes I will remember the covenant with their ancestors whom I brought out of the land of Egypt under the eyes of the nations, in order to prove myself their God.
Nyee nye Yehowa.’”
I am Jehovah.’”
46 Esiawoe nye ɖoɖo kple ʋɔnudrɔ̃ɖoɖo kpakple se siwo Yehowa ɖo anyi le eya kple Israel-viwo dome le Sinai To la dzi to Mose dzi.
46 These are the regulations, the judicial decisions, and the laws that Jehovah established between himself and the Israelites on Mount Sinai through Moses.

Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose be: 2 “Kplɔ Aron kple viaŋutsuwo, eye nàtsɔ awuawo, ami kɔkɔe la, nuvɔ̃vɔsa ƒe nyitsu la, agbo eveawo kple kusi si me amɔwɔ maʋamaʋã bolo le la, 3 eye nàna ha blibo la katã naƒo ƒu ɖe takpegbadɔa ƒe mɔnu.”

Jehovah continued to speak to Moses, saying: 2 “Take Aaron and his sons with him, the garments, the anointing oil, the bull of the sin offering, the two rams, and the basket of unleavened bread, 3 and make all the assembly gather together at the entrance of the tent of meeting.”
4 Eye Mose wɔ abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se nɛ ene, eye ha la ƒo ƒu ɖe takpegbadɔa ƒe mɔnu.
4 Then Moses did just as Jehovah had commanded him, and the assembly gathered together at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
5 Eye Mose gblɔ na ha la be: “Nu siae Yehowa de se be míawɔ.” 6 Eye Mose na Aron kple viaŋutsuwo te va, eye wòle tsi na wo.
5 Moses now said to the assembly: “This is what Jehovah has commanded us to do.” 6 So Moses brought Aaron and his sons near and washed them with water.
7 Emegbe edo awu ʋlaya la na Aron, eye wòtsɔ alidziblanu la bla ali dzi nɛ, edo awu ʋlaya si ŋu abɔ mele o la nɛ, eye wòdo kɔmewu nɛ, etsɔ kɔmewudziblanu la bla edzi hesae sesĩe.

7 After that he put the robe on him, wrapped him with the sash, clothed him with the sleeveless coat, and put the ephod on him and tied it with the woven belt of the ephod, binding it securely on him.
8 Eye wòtsɔ akɔtaɖonu la ɖo eŋu hetsɔ Urim kple Tumim la de akɔtaɖonu la me.
8 Next he placed the breastpiece on him and put the urim and the Thummim in the breastpiece.
9 Azɔ etsɔ tablanu la ɖɔ ɖe ta nɛ hetsɔ sikaga falɛ keklẽ si nye adzɔgbeɖeɖe ƒe dzesi kɔkɔe la ɖo tablanu la dzi le eƒe ŋgonu, abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
9 Then he placed the turban on his head, and he put on the front of the turban the shining plate of gold, the holy sign of dedication, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
10 Azɔ Mose tsɔ ami kɔkɔe la eye wòsi ami na avɔgbadɔ la kple eme nuwo katã, eye wòkɔ wo ŋu.
10 Moses then took the anointing oil and anointed the tabernacle and all that was in it and sanctified them.
11 Emegbe ehlẽ eƒe ɖe ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ŋu zi adre tsɔ si ami na vɔsamlekpuia kple eŋu nuwo katã kpakple ze la kple eƒe zɔ la tsɔ kɔ wo ŋu.
11 After that he spattered some of it seven times on the altar and anointed the altar and all its utensils and the basin and its stand in order to sanctify them.
12 Ekɔ ami kɔkɔe la ƒe ɖe ɖe Aron ƒe tame hesi ami nɛ tsɔ kɔ eŋu.
12 Finally he poured some of the anointing oil on Aaron’s head and anointed him in order to sanctify him.
13 Azɔ Mose na Aron viŋutsuwo te va, eye wòdo awu ʋlayawo na wo, etsɔ alidziblanuwo bla ali dzi na wo, eye wòtsɔ tablavɔ bla ta na wo, abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
13 Moses then brought Aaron’s sons near and clothed them with robes and wrapped them with sashes and put headgear on them, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
14 Azɔ ekplɔ nuvɔ̃vɔsa ƒe nyitsu la vɛ, eye Aron kple viaŋutsuwo tsɔ woƒe asiwo ɖo nuvɔ̃vɔsa ƒe nyitsu la ƒe tame.
14 Then he brought the bull of the sin offering, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the bull of the sin offering.
15 Eye Mose wui hede eƒe asibidɛ ʋu la me ge ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ƒe dzo ɖe sia ɖe ŋu, eye wòkɔ vɔsamlekpuia ŋu tso nu vɔ̃ me, ke ekɔ ʋu susɔea ɖe vɔsamlekpuia te tsɔ kɔ eŋu be woalé avu le edzi.

15 Moses slaughtered it and took the blood with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar on all sides, and he purified the altar from sin, but the rest of the blood he poured at the base of the altar, in order to sanctify it to make atonement on it.
16 Emegbe Mose ɖe ami siwo katã le dɔkaviawo ŋu kple ami siwo le aklãa ŋu kpakple ayiku eveawo kple ami siwo le wo ŋu tsɔ do dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpuia dzi.
16 After that he took all the fat that was on the intestines, the appendage of the liver, and the two kidneys and their fat, and Moses made them smoke on the altar.
17 Eye wòna wotɔ dzo nyitsu la, eƒe agbalẽ, eƒe lã kple eƒe mĩ le asaɖa la godo, abe ale si Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
17 Then he had the rest of the bull, its skin, its flesh, and its dung, burned with fire outside the camp, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
18 Ekplɔ numevɔsa ƒe agbo la vɛ, eye Aron kple viaŋutsuwo tsɔ woƒe asiwo ɖo agbo la ƒe tame.
18 He now brought the ram of the burnt offering near, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the ram.
19 Emegbe Mose wui, eye wòhlẽ ʋu la ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ƒe axawo katã ŋu.
19 Moses then slaughtered it and sprinkled the blood on all sides of the altar.
20 Eyome Mose fli agbo la, eye wòtɔ dzo ta la, lãkɔawo kple amiawo.
20 He cut the ram into its pieces, and Moses made the head, the pieces, and the suet smoke.
21 Etsɔ tsi kpala eƒe dɔkaviawo kple afɔawo, eye Mose tsɔ agbo bliboa do dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpuia dzi.
21 He washed the intestines and the shanks with water, and Moses made the entire ram smoke on the altar.
Numevɔsa si ʋẽna lilili lae wònye.
It was a burnt offering as a pleasing aroma.
Dzovɔsa wònye na Yehowa, abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
It was an offering made by fire to Jehovah, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
22 Azɔ ekplɔ agbo evelia, si nye ameɖoɖo ƒe agbo la vɛ, eye Aron kple viaŋutsuwo tsɔ woƒe asiwo ɖo agbo la ƒe tame.
22 Then he brought the second ram, the ram of the installation, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the ram’s head.
23 Mose wui, eye wòtsɔ eƒe ʋu la ƒe ɖe sisi ɖe Aron ƒe ɖusitogboe, eƒe ɖusidegblefetsu kple eƒe ɖusifɔdegblefetsu ŋu.
23 Moses slaughtered it and took some of its blood and put it on Aaron’s right earlobe and on the thumb of his right hand and on the big toe of his right foot.
24 Emegbe Mose na Aron viŋutsuwo te va, eye wòsisi ʋu la ƒe ɖe ɖe woƒe ɖusitogboe, woƒe ɖusidegblefetsu kple woƒe ɖusifɔdegblefetsu ŋu; ke Mose hlẽ ʋu susɔea ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ƒe axawo katã ŋu.

24 Next Moses brought Aaron’s sons forward and put some of the blood on their right earlobe and on the thumb of their right hand and on the big toe of their right foot; but Moses sprinkled the rest of the blood on all sides of the altar.
25 Azɔ eɖe ami la, asike dami la, ami siwo katã le dɔkaviawo ŋu, ami siwo le aklãa ŋu, ayiku eveawo kple ami siwo le wo ŋu kpakple ɖusita la.
25 Then he took the fat, the fat tail, all the fat that was on the intestines, the appendage of the liver, the two kidneys and their fat, and the right leg.
26 Eye wòtsɔ amɔwɔ maʋamaʋã bolo kotoe ɖeka, abolo kotoe siwo wode amii la ɖeka kple akpɔnɔ ɖeka le kusi si me amɔwɔ maʋamaʋã bolowo le le Yehowa ŋkume la me.
26 He took out of the basket of unleavened bread that was before Jehovah one unleavened ring-shaped loaf, one ring-shaped loaf of oiled bread, and one wafer.
Eye wòtsɔ wo da ɖe amiawo kple ɖusita la dzi.
He then placed them on the pieces of fat and the right leg.
27 Emegbe etsɔ wo katã de Aron kple viaŋutsuwo ƒe asi me, eye wònyè wo abe vɔsa si wonyè le Yehowa ŋkume ene.
27 After that he put all of them on the palms of Aaron and the palms of his sons and began to wave them back and forth as a wave offering before Jehovah.
28 Eye Mose xɔ wo le wo si tsɔ da ɖe numevɔsalã la dzi, eye wòtsɔ wo do dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpuia dzi.
28 Then Moses took them from their hands and made them smoke on the altar on top of the burnt offering.
Ameɖovɔsa si ʋẽna lilili lae wònye.
They were an installation sacrifice as a pleasing aroma.
Dzovɔsa wònye na Yehowa.
