It was an offering made by fire to Jehovah.
29 Eye Mose nyè ameɖoɖo ƒe agboa ƒe akɔ la wònye vɔsa si wonyè le Yehowa ŋkume, eye wòzu Mose tɔ, abe ale si Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
29 Moses then took the breast and waved it back and forth as a wave offering before Jehovah. From the installation ram it became the portion for Moses, just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
30 Eye Mose tsɔ ami kɔkɔe la ƒe ɖe kple ʋu si le vɔsamlekpuia dzi la ƒe ɖe hlẽ ɖe Aron kple viaŋutsuawo kpakple woƒe awuwo ŋu.
30 And Moses took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood that was on the altar and spattered it on Aaron and his garments and on his sons and the garments of his sons who were with him.
Ale wòkɔ Aron kple eƒe awuwo kpakple viaŋutsu siwo kpe ɖe eŋu la ƒe awuwo ŋu.
Thus he sanctified Aaron and his garments and his sons and their garments.

31 Azɔ Mose gblɔ na Aron kple viaŋutsuwo be: “Miɖa lã la le takpegbadɔa ƒe mɔnu, eye miɖui le afi ma hekpe ɖe abolo siwo le ameɖokusia me ŋu, abe ale si tututu wode se nam be, ‘Aron kple viaŋutsuwo neɖui’ la ene. 32 Ke ne lã la kple abolo aɖe susɔ la, mitɔ dzoe.

31 Then Moses said to Aaron and his sons: “Boil the flesh at the entrance of the tent of meeting, and you will eat it there with the bread that is in the installation basket, just as I was commanded, ‘Aaron and his sons will eat it.’ 32 What is left over of the flesh and the bread you will burn with fire.
33 Migadzo le takpegbadɔa ƒe mɔnu o ŋkeke adre, va se ɖe gbe si gbe mia ɖoɖo ŋkekeawo nade, elabena ŋkeke adree woatsɔ aɖo mi miazu nunɔlawo.
33 You must not go out from the entrance of the tent of meeting for seven days, until the days for completing your installation are over, because it will take seven days to install you as priests.
34 Yehowa de se be míawɔ nu si míewɔ egbea ne woalé avu ɖe mia ta.
34 Jehovah commanded that we do what we have done today in order to make atonement for you.
35 Minɔ takpegbadɔa ƒe mɔnu zã kple keli ŋkeke adre, eye milé Yehowa ƒe ɖoɖoawo me ɖe asi, be miagaku o; elabena nenemae wode se nam.”
35 You will stay at the entrance of the tent of meeting day and night for seven days and carry out your obligation to Jehovah, so that you may not die; for so I have been commanded.”
36 Eye Aron kple viaŋutsuwo wɔ nu siwo katã ƒe se Yehowa de to Mose dzi la.
36 And Aaron and his sons did all the things that Jehovah had commanded by means of Moses.
Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose be: 2 “Ƒo nu kple Aron kple viaŋutsuwo kpakple Israel-viwo katã nàgblɔ na wo be, ‘Se si Yehowa dee nye esi:
Jehovah went on to say to Moses: 2 “Speak to Aaron and his sons and all the Israelites and say to them, ‘This is what Jehovah has commanded:

3 “‘“Ne Israel ƒe aƒe la me tɔ aɖe wu nyi, alẽ alo gbɔ̃ le asaɖa la me, alo le asaɖa la godo, 4 le esi wòatsɔe ava takpegbadɔ la nu, be wòatsɔe asa vɔ na Yehowa le avɔgbadɔa nu teƒe la, ke ame ma ɖi ʋufɔ.

3 “‘“If any man of the house of Israel slaughters a bull or a young ram or a goat in the camp or if he slaughters it outside the camp, 4 instead of bringing it to the entrance of the tent of meeting to present it as an offering to Jehovah before the tabernacle of Jehovah, bloodguilt will be counted to that man.
Ekɔ ʋu ɖi, eya ta woatsrɔ̃ ame ma ɖa le eƒe dukɔ la dome.
He has shed blood, and that man must be cut off from among his people.
5 Ale be Israel-viwo natsɔ woƒe lã siwo woatsɔ asa vɔ le gbe me la avɛ na Yehowa le takpegbadɔa nu, eye woatsɔe ana nunɔla la, be wòatsɔ asa ŋutifafavɔ na Yehowa.
5 This is so that the Israelites will bring the sacrifices, which they now sacrifice in the open field, to Jehovah, to the entrance of the tent of meeting, to the priest.
6 Nunɔla la nahlẽ ʋu la ɖe Yehowa ƒe vɔsamlekpuia ŋu le takpegbadɔa nu, eye wòatsɔ ami la ado dzudzɔ wòanye ʋeʋẽ lilili na Yehowa.
6 And the priest will sprinkle the blood on Jehovah’s altar at the entrance of the tent of meeting and make the fat smoke as a pleasing aroma to Jehovah.
7 Womagasa vɔwo na gbɔgbɔ vɔ̃ siwo ɖi gbɔ̃wo, siwo wosubɔna la azɔ o.
7 So they should no longer offer sacrifices to the goatlike demons, with which they are prostituting themselves.
Esia anye se na mi ɖaa le miaƒe dzidzimewo katã me.”’
This will serve as a lasting statute for you throughout your generations.”’

8 “Gblɔ na wo be, ‘Ne Israel ƒe aƒe la me tɔ aɖe alo amedzrovi si le mia dome sa numevɔ alo vɔ bubu aɖe, 9 eye metsɔe va takpegbadɔa nu be wòatsɔ asa vɔ na Yehowa o la, woaɖe ame ma ƒe agbe ɖa le eƒe dukɔ la dome.

8 “You should say to them, ‘Any man of the house of Israel or any foreigner who is residing in your midst who offers up a burnt offering or a sacrifice 9 and does not bring it to the entrance of the tent of meeting to offer it to Jehovah must be cut off from his people.
10 “‘Ne Israel ƒe aƒe la me tɔ aɖe alo amedzrovi si le mia dome ɖu ʋu aɖe la, maɖe ŋku atɔ ame si ɖu ʋua, eye matsrɔ̃e ɖa le eƒe dukɔ la dome.

10 “‘If any man of the house of Israel or any foreigner who is residing in your midst eats any sort of blood, I will certainly set my face against the one who is eating the blood, and I will cut him off from among his people.
11 Elabena ŋutilã ɖe sia ɖe ƒe agbe le ʋu la me, eya ta metsɔe na be miatsɔ alé avu le vɔsamlekpui la dzi ɖe mia ɖokuiwo ta, elabena ʋu wotsɔ léa avu, le agbe si le eme la ta.

11 For the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I myself have given it on the altar for you to make atonement for yourselves, because it is the blood that makes atonement by means of the life in it.
12 Esia tae megblɔ na Israel-viwo be: “Mia dometɔ aɖeke megaɖu ʋu o, eye amedzrovi siwo le mia dome la hã dometɔ aɖeke megaɖu ʋu o.”
12 That is why I have said to the Israelites: “None of you should eat blood, and no foreigner who is residing in your midst should eat blood.”
13 “‘Ne Israel-vi aɖe alo amedzrovi aɖe si le mia dome da ade lé gbemelã alo xe si woɖuna la, ekema wòaɖuɖu eƒe ʋu ɖi, eye wòaxe ke ɖe edzi.
13 “‘If one of the Israelites or some foreigner who is residing in your midst is hunting and catches a wild animal or a bird that may be eaten, he must pour its blood out and cover it with dust.
14 Elabena ŋutilã ɖe sia ɖe ƒe agbee nye eƒe ʋu, le agbe si le eme la ta.
14 For the life of every sort of flesh is its blood, because the life is in it.
Esia tae megblɔ na Israel-viwo be: “Migaɖu ŋutilã aɖeke ƒomevi ƒe ʋu o, elabena ŋutilã ɖe sia ɖe ƒe agbee nye eƒe ʋu.
Consequently, I said to the Israelites: “You must not eat the blood of any sort of flesh because the life of every sort of flesh is its blood.

Ame sia ame si ɖui la, woatsrɔ̃e ɖa.” 15 Ne ame aɖe ɖu lã si ku le eɖokui si alo lã si gbemelã aɖe vuvu la, ekema eɖanye dumevi alo amedzrovi o, ele be wòanya eƒe awuwo, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ; emegbe eŋu akɔ.

Anyone eating it will be cut off.” 15 If anyone, whether a native or a foreigner, eats an animal found dead or one torn by a wild animal, he must then wash his garments and bathe in water and be unclean until the evening; then he will be clean.
16 Ke ne menya eƒe awuwo o, eye mele tsi hã o la, ekema woabia eƒe vodada la ŋuti kɔntae.’”
16 But if he does not wash them and does not bathe himself, he will answer for his error.’”

Eye Yehowa yɔ Mose heƒo nu kplii tso takpegbadɔ la me be: 2 “Ƒo nu kple Israel-viwo, eye nàgblɔ na wo be: ‘Ne mia dometɔ aɖe be yeatsɔ aƒemelã aɖe asa vɔ na Yehowa la, ekema netsɔ nyi, alẽ alo gbɔ̃ sa vɔ lae.

And Jehovah called Moses and spoke to him from the tent of meeting, saying: 2 “Speak to the Israelites and tell them, ‘If any one of you would present an offering to Jehovah from the domestic animals, you should present your offering from the herd or from the flock.
3 “Ne nyie wòbe yeatsɔ asa numevɔe la, netsɔ atsu si sɔ blibo vɛ.
3 “‘If his offering is a burnt offering from the herd, he should present a sound male animal.
Eya ŋutɔ natso eƒe dzi me faa atsɔe ava Yehowa ŋkume le takpegbadɔ la ƒe mɔnu.
He should present it of his own free will before Jehovah at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
4 Eye wòatsɔ eƒe asi aɖo numevɔsalã la tame, eye woaxɔe nɛ ahalé avu ɖe eta.
4 He is to lay his hand on the head of the burnt offering, and it will be accepted in his behalf to make atonement for him.
5 “‘Eye woawu nyitsui la le Yehowa ŋkume, eye Aron viŋutsu siwo nye nunɔlawo natsɔ ʋu la vɛ, eye woahlẽ ʋu la ɖe vɔsamlekpui si le takpegbadɔa ƒe mɔnu la ƒe axawo katã ŋu.

5 “‘Then the young bull must be slaughtered before Jehovah, and the sons of Aaron, the priests, will present the blood and sprinkle the blood on all sides of the altar, which is at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
6 Eye woaɖe agbalẽ le numevɔsalã la ŋu ahaflii.
6 The burnt offering should be skinned and cut into pieces.
7 Aron viŋutsu siwo nye nunɔlawo nado dzo ɖe vɔsamlekpui la dzi, eye woafɔ nake aɖo dzo la dzi.
7 The sons of Aaron, the priests, are to put fire on the altar and arrange wood on the fire.
8 Eye Aron viŋutsu siwo nye nunɔlawo naɖo vɔsalã si wofli la, ta la kple amiawo ɖe vɔsamlekpuia dzi, ɖe nake siwo le dzo si le vɔsamlekpuia me la dzi.
8 The sons of Aaron, the priests, will arrange the pieces of the offering with the head and the suet over the wood that is on the fire on the altar.
9 Eye woatsɔ tsi aklɔ eƒe dɔkaviwo kple eƒe afɔwo, eye nunɔla la natsɔ wo katã ado dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpui la dzi wòanye numevɔsa, dzovɔsa si nye ʋeʋẽ lilili na Yehowa.
9 Its intestines and its shanks will be washed with water, and the priest is to make all of it smoke on the altar as a burnt offering, an offering made by fire of a pleasing aroma to Jehovah.
10 “‘Eye ne alẽ alo gbɔ̃e wòbe yeatsɔ asa numevɔe la, ekema wòatsɔ atsu si sɔ blibo asa vɔ lae.
10 “‘If his offering for a burnt offering is from the flock, from the young rams or the goats, he should present a sound male.
11 Woawui le vɔsamlekpui la ƒe dziehekpa dzi le Yehowa ŋkume, eye Aron viŋutsu siwo nye nunɔlawo nahlẽ eƒe ʋu la ɖe vɔsamlekpui la ƒe axawo katã ŋu.
11 It is to be slaughtered at the north side of the altar before Jehovah, and the sons of Aaron, the priests, will sprinkle its blood on all sides of the altar.
12 Eye wòaflii atsɔ akpe ɖe eƒe ta kple amiawo ŋu, eye nunɔla la naɖo wo ɖe vɔsamlekpuia dzi, ɖe nake siwo le dzo si le vɔsamlekpuia me la dzi.
12 He will cut it up into pieces, and with its head and its suet, the priest will arrange them over the wood on the fire on the altar.
13 Eye wòatsɔ tsi aklɔ dɔkaviawo kple afɔawo, eye nunɔla la natsɔ wo katã asa vɔe ahado dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpui la dzi.
13 He will wash the intestines and the shanks with water, and the priest will present all of it and make it smoke on the altar.
Numevɔsa wònye, eye wònye dzovɔsa si nye ʋeʋẽ lilili na Yehowa.
It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire of a pleasing aroma to Jehovah.
14 “‘Ke ne xewoe wòbe yeatsɔ asa numevɔ na Yehowa la, ekema wòatsɔ akpakpa alo ahɔnɛvi asa vɔ lae.
14 “‘However, if he offers birds as a burnt offering to Jehovah, he will present his offering from the turtledoves or the young pigeons.
15 Eye nunɔla la natsɔe ava vɔsamlekpuia gbɔ ahatso veme nɛ, eye wòatsɔe ado dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpui la dzi, ke woaɖuɖu eƒe ʋu ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ƒe axawo ŋu.
15 The priest will present it at the altar and nip off its head and make it smoke on the altar, but its blood should be drained out on the side of the altar.
16 Eye wòaɖe xe la ƒe avɔ ahanyɔ eƒe fuwo atsɔ aƒu gbe ɖe vɔsamlekpui la xa le ɣedzeƒe gome, le teƒe si dzofiwo nɔna.
16 He should remove its crop and its feathers and throw them beside the altar, to the east, to the place for the ashes.
17 Azɔ wòalé xe la ƒe aʋalawo, eye wòafe xe la. Megafee wòaɖe le enu o.
17 He will split it at its wings without dividing it into two parts.
Azɔ nunɔla la natsɔe ado dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpui la dzi, ɖe nake si le dzoa me la dzi.
Then the priest will make it smoke on the altar over the wood that is on the fire.
Numevɔsa wònye, eye wònye dzovɔsa si nye ʋeʋẽ lilili na Yehowa.
It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire of a pleasing aroma to Jehovah.
Eye Yehowa gblɔ na Mose kple Aron be: 2 “Migblɔ na Israel-viwo be: ‘Anyigbadzinu gbagbe siwo miate ŋu aɖu la woe nye esi: 3 Miate ŋu aɖu lã siwo ƒe afɔkli me fe keŋkeŋ, eye wodzɔa nu gaɖuna la.

Then Jehovah said to Moses and Aaron: 2 “Tell the Israelites, ‘These are the living creatures of the earth that you may eat: 3 Every animal that has a split hoof and a cleft in its hooves and that chews the cud may be eaten.
4 “‘Lã siwo dzɔa nu gaɖuna alo esiwo ƒe afɔkli me fe siwo miaɖu o la woe nye: kposɔ, elabena edzɔa nu gaɖuna, ke eƒe afɔkli me mefe o.
4 “‘But you must not eat these animals that chew the cud or have a split hoof: the camel, which chews the cud but does not have a split hoof.
Nu makɔmakɔ wònye na mi.
It is unclean for you.
5 Hotoklolo, elabena edzɔa nu gaɖuna, ke eƒe afɔkli me mefe o.
5 Also the rock badger, because it chews the cud but does not have a split hoof.
Nu makɔmakɔ wònye na mi.
It is unclean for you.
6 Fɔmizi, elabena edzɔa nu gaɖuna, ke eƒe afɔkli me mefe o.
6 Also the hare, because it chews the cud but does not have a split hoof.
Nu makɔmakɔ wònye na mi.
It is unclean for you.
7 Ha, elabena eƒe afɔkli me fe keŋkeŋ, ke medzɔa nu gaɖuna o.
7 Also the pig, because it has a split hoof and a cleft in the hoof but does not chew the cud.
Nu makɔmakɔ wònye na mi.
It is unclean for you.
8 Migaɖu woƒe lã o, eye migaka asi woƒe kukua ŋu o.
8 You must not eat any of their flesh or touch their dead body.
Wo ŋu mekɔ na mi o.
They are unclean for you.
9 “‘Tɔmelã siwo katã miate ŋu aɖu la woe nye tɔmelã siwo katã ŋu adza kple tsro le le atsiaƒuwo kple tɔsisiwo me.
9 “‘This is what you may eat of everything in the waters: Anything in the waters that has fins and scales, whether in the seas or in the rivers, it you may eat.
10 Ke nu siwo katã nɔa ha me kple nu gbagbe siwo katã le tsi me, siwo katã ŋu adza kple tsro mele o le atsiaƒuwo kple tɔsisiwo me la, ŋunyɔnu wonye na mi.
10 But anything in the seas and in the rivers that has no fins and scales, among all the swarming creatures and of every other living creature that is in the waters, it is a loathsome thing for you.
11 Ɛ̃, woanye ŋunyɔnu na mi. Migaɖu woƒe lã o, eye minyɔ ŋu woƒe kukuawo hã.
11 Yes, they should be loathsome to you, and you must not eat any of their flesh and you must loathe their carcasses.
12 Nu siwo katã ŋu adza kple tsro mele o le tsi me la, ŋunyɔnu wonye na mi.
12 Everything in the waters that has no fins and scales is a loathsome thing to you.

13 “‘Xe dzodzoe siwo mianyɔ ŋui, eye miaɖu wo o le esi wonye ŋunyɔnu ta la woe nye esi: hɔ̃, akpo kple gbagblaxetsu, 14 Doɖi kple aʋako ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi, 15 akpaviã ƒomeviwo katã, 16 golo, favieʋuto, tsalɛ̃ kple xe ƒonu ɖe sia ɖe ƒomevi, 17 ʋlukuku, tsimese, favieʋuto ƒomeviwo, 18 tɔkpakpaxe, aluge kple akaga, 19 damixe, aŋɔɣi ƒomeviwo, agudzixe kple agutɔ.

13 “‘These are the flying creatures that you are to loathe; they should not be eaten, for they are loathsome: the eagle, the osprey, the black vulture, 14 the red kite and every kind of black kite, 15 every kind of raven, 16 the ostrich, the owl, the gull, every kind of falcon, 17 the little owl, the cormorant, the long-eared owl, 18 the swan, the pelican, the vulture, 19 the stork, every kind of heron, the hoopoe, and the bat.
20 Nu dzodzoe siwo katã nɔa ha me hezɔa afɔ ene dzi la, ŋunyɔnu wonye na mi.
20 Every winged swarming creature that goes on all fours is something loathsome to you.
21 “‘Nu dzodzoe siwo nɔa ha me hezɔa afɔ ene dzi la dometɔ siwo ko miate ŋu aɖu la woe nye: esiwo tsɔa megbetatiwo tia kpoe.
21 “‘Of the winged swarming creatures that move on all fours, you may eat only those that have jointed legs above their feet for leaping on the ground.
22 Wo dometɔ siwo miate ŋu aɖu la woe nye esiawo: ʋetsuvi ƒomeviwo katã, abɔwo, ʋetrawo kple gbagblamewo.
22 Of these you may eat: various kinds of migratory locusts, other edible locusts, crickets, and grasshoppers.
23 Ke nu dzodzoe bubu siwo nɔa ha me, siwo si afɔ ene le la, katã nye ŋunyɔnu na mi.
23 All other winged swarming creatures with four legs are something loathsome to you.
24 Nu siawo ana miazu ame makɔmakɔwo.
24 By these you would make yourselves unclean.
Ame sia ame si aka asi woƒe kukua ŋu la, eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
Everyone touching their dead bodies will be unclean until the evening.
25 Eye ame sia ame si atsɔ woƒe kukua la nanya eƒe awuwo, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
25 Anyone carrying any of their dead bodies should wash his garments; he will be unclean until the evening.
26 “‘Lã siwo katã ƒe afɔkli me fe, gake meʋu keŋ o, eye womedzɔa nu gaɖuna o la, nu makɔmakɔ wonye na mi.
26 “‘Any animal that has a split hoof but does not have a cleft and does not chew its cud is unclean to you.
Ame sia ame si ka asi wo ŋu la azu ame makɔmakɔ.
Everyone touching them will be unclean.
27 Ke nu gbagbe siwo katã fe li na, le nuwɔwɔ siwo katã zɔa afɔ ene dzi dome la, nu makɔmakɔ wonye na mi.
27 Every living creature that walks on paws among the creatures that walk on all fours is unclean to you.
Ame sia ame si aka asi woƒe kukua ŋu la azu ame makɔmakɔ va se ɖe fiẽ.
Everyone touching their dead bodies will be unclean until the evening.
28 Ame si tsɔ woƒe kukua la nanya eƒe awuwo, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
28 The one who carries their dead bodies should wash his garments, and he will be unclean until the evening.
Nu makɔmakɔwo wonye na mi.
They are unclean to you.
29 “‘Lã siwo nɔa ha me le anyigba dzi dometɔ siwo nye nu makɔmakɔ na mi lae nye esi: alegeli, afi, adoglo ƒomeviwo katã, 30 xɔmenyatri, ana, ve, adoglo si nɔa ke me kple agama.

29 “‘These are the swarming creatures of the earth that are unclean to you: the mole rat, the mouse, every kind of lizard, 30 the gecko, the large lizard, the newt, the sand lizard, and the chameleon.
31 Lã siawo siwo nɔa ha me la nye nu makɔmakɔwo na mi.
31 These swarming creatures are unclean to you.
Ame sia ame si ka asi woƒe kukua ŋu la ŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
Everyone touching their dead bodies will be unclean until the evening.
32 “‘Nu sia nu si dzi wo dometɔ aɖe ƒe kukua age dze la azu nu makɔmakɔ, eɖanye atinu alo awu, lãgbalẽ alo kotoku o.
32 “‘Now anything they fall on when they die will be unclean, whether a wooden utensil, a garment, a skin, or a piece of sackcloth.
Woade agba ɖe sia ɖe si ŋu dɔ wowɔna la tsi me, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ, emegbe hafi eŋu akɔ.
Any utensil that is used should be immersed in water, and it will be unclean until the evening; then it will be clean.
33 Ke ne wo dometɔ aɖe ge dze anyinu aɖe me la, ekema nu siwo katã le eme la ŋu mekɔ o, eye miagbã nu la.
33 If they fall into an earthenware vessel, you are to smash it, and anything that was in it will be unclean.
34 Nuɖuɖu sia nuɖuɖu, si dzi anyinu ma me tsi kɔ ɖo la ŋu mekɔ o, eye nunono sia nunono si atso nu ma me la ŋu mekɔ o.
34 Any kind of food that comes in contact with water from such a vessel will be unclean, and any drinkable liquid in such a vessel will be unclean.
35 Nu sia nu si dzi woƒe kukuawo ge dze la ŋu mekɔ o, eɖanye abolokpo alo mlekpui o, woagbãe.
35 Anything their dead bodies fall on will be unclean. Whether oven or small stove, it should be broken into pieces.
Wo ŋu mekɔ o, eye woanye nu makɔmakɔwo na mi.
They are unclean, and they will remain unclean to you.
36 Negbe tsidzɔƒe kple tsido siwo me tsi nɔna koe anye nu siwo ŋu kɔ, ke ame sia ame si aka asi woƒe kukua ŋu la azu ame makɔmakɔ.
36 Only a spring and a cistern for storing water will continue clean, but anyone touching their dead bodies will be unclean.
37 Ne woƒe kukuawo ge dze nuku aɖe si ƒã ge wole dzi la, eŋu kɔ.
37 If their dead bodies fall on a plant seed that is to be sown, it is clean.
38 Ke ne wode nuku aɖe tsi, eye woƒe kukua ƒe akpa aɖe ge dze eme la, nukua ŋu mekɔ na mi o.
38 But if water is put on a seed and part of their dead body falls on it, the seed is unclean to you.
39 “‘Ke ne lã siwo mieɖuna la dometɔ aɖe ku la, ame sia ame si ka asi eƒe kukua ŋu la azu ame makɔmakɔ va se ɖe fiẽ.
39 “‘Now if an animal that you use for food dies, whoever touches its dead body will be unclean until the evening.
40 Ame si ɖu eƒe kukua ƒe ɖe la nanya eƒe awuwo, eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
40 Whoever eats any of its dead body should wash his garments, and he will be unclean until the evening.
Ame si kɔ eƒe kukua la nanya eƒe awuwo eye eŋu mekɔ o va se ɖe fiẽ.
Whoever carries off its dead body should wash his garments, and he will be unclean until the evening.
41 Anyigbadzilã suesue siwo nɔa ha me la katã nye ŋunyɔnu na mi.
41 Every swarming creature of the earth is something loathsome.
Migaɖu wo o.
It must not be eaten.
42 Migaɖu lã siwo katã zɔa ƒodo dzi, lã siwo katã zɔa afɔ ene dzi, alo anyigbadzilã suesue siwo nɔa ha me, eye afɔ wuwlui geɖe le wo si la o, elabena ŋunyɔnu wonye.
42 You must not eat any creature that crawls on its belly, any creature that goes on all fours, or any of earth’s swarming creatures with a great number of legs, for they are something loathsome.
43 Migatsɔ lã siwo nɔa ha me la dometɔ aɖeke do ŋunyɔ mia ɖokuiwo o, eye migatsɔ wo ƒo ɖi mia ɖokuiwo ahazu ame makɔmakɔwo o.
43 Do not make yourselves loathsome by means of any swarming creature, and do not defile yourselves and become unclean by them.
44 Elabena nyee nye Yehowa mia Mawu, mikɔ mia ɖokuiwo ŋu, eye minɔ kɔkɔe, elabena mele kɔkɔe.
44 For I am Jehovah your God, and you must sanctify yourselves and become holy, because I am holy.
Eya ta migatsɔ lã siwo nɔa ha me, siwo ʋãna le anyigba dzi la, dometɔ aɖeke ƒo ɖi mia ɖokuiwo o.
So you must not make yourselves unclean by any swarming creature that moves on the earth.
45 Elabena nyee nye Yehowa, ame si kplɔ mi tso Egipte-nyigba dzi be manye miaƒe Mawu; minɔ kɔkɔe, elabena mele kɔkɔe.
45 For I am Jehovah, who is leading you up out of the land of Egypt to prove myself God to you, and you must be holy, because I am holy.

46 “‘Esiae nye se le lã fɔenewo, nuwɔwɔ siwo dzona, nu gbagbe siwo katã ʋãna le tɔ me kple lã siwo nɔa ha me le anyigba dzi la katã ŋuti, 47 ne woade vovo nu makɔmakɔ kple nu kɔkɔe dome, nu gbagbe siwo woate ŋu aɖu kple nu gbagbe siwo womaɖu o dome.’”

46 “‘This is the law about the animals, the flying creatures, every living creature that moves through the waters, and concerning every creature that swarms on the earth, 47 in order to make a distinction between the unclean and the clean and between the living creatures that may be eaten and those that may not be eaten.’”
Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose le Sinai To la dzi be: 2 “Gblɔ na Israel-viwo be, ‘Ne mieva ɖo anyigba si metsɔ le mia na ge dzi la, mina anyigba la nagbɔ ɖe eme wòanye sabat na Yehowa.

Jehovah spoke further to Moses on Mount Sinai, saying: 2 “Speak to the Israelites and tell them, ‘When you eventually come into the land that I am giving you, then the land will observe a sabbath to Jehovah.
3 Ƒe ade nàƒã nu ɖe wò agble me, ƒe ade nàɖe wò wainkawo ŋu, eye nàƒo agblemenuwo nu ƒu.
3 Six years you should sow your field with seed, and six years you should prune your vineyard, and you will gather the land’s produce.
4 Ke anyigba la nagbɔ ɖe eme le ƒe adrelia me, wòanye dzudzɔ blibo ƒe sabat na Yehowa.
4 But in the seventh year, there should be a sabbath of complete rest for the land, a sabbath to Jehovah.
Mègade agble alo aɖe wò wainkawo ŋu o.
You should not sow your field with seed or prune your vineyard.
5 Mègaxa nuku siwo mie ɖe flu me la o, eye mègaxa wò wainka si ŋu womeɖe o la ƒe tsetsewo o.
5 You must not reap what grows on its own from the grain left after the harvest, and the grapes of your unpruned vine you must not gather.
Anyigba la nagbɔ ɖe eme ƒe blibo ɖeka.
There should be a year of complete rest for the land.
6 Ke anyigba la ana nuɖuɖu mi le eƒe sabat dzi, wò ŋutɔ, wò kluvi, wò kosi, wò dɔwɔla kple amedzrovi si le gbɔwò, 7 wò aƒemelã kple gbemelã siwo le wò anyigba dzi.

6 However, you may eat the food that grows in the land during its sabbath; you, your male and female slaves, your hired worker, and the foreign settlers who are residing with you may eat it, 7 as well as the domestic and the wild animals in your land.
Nu siwo katã anyigba la awɔ la nanye nuɖuɖu na mi.
Everything the land produces may be eaten.
8 “‘Xlẽ sabat-ƒe adre, ƒe adre teƒe adre, eye sabat-ƒe adreawo nanye ƒe blaene vɔ asieke.
8 “‘You will count off seven sabbath years, seven times seven years, and the days of the seven sabbath years will amount to 49 years.
9 Eye nàku lãdzo sesĩe le ɣleti adrelia ƒe ŋkeke ewolia dzi. Enye Avuléŋkeke, si dzi miaku lãdzo le miaƒe duwo katã me.
9 You will then sound the horn loudly in the seventh month, on the tenth of the month; on the Day of Atonement, you should cause the sound of the horn to be heard in all your land.
10 Miakɔ ƒe blaatɔ̃lia ŋu ahaɖe gbeƒã ablɔɖe le anyigba la dzi na edzinɔlawo katã.
10 You must sanctify the 50th year and proclaim liberty in the land to all its inhabitants.
Azu Ablɔɖeƒe na mi, ale be mia dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe nagaxɔ eƒe nunɔamesi, eye mia dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe nagatrɔ ayi eƒe ƒometɔwo gbɔ.
It will become a Jubilee for you, and each of you will return to his property and each of you should return to his family.
11 Ablɔɖeƒee ƒe blaatɔ̃lia ma anye na mi.
11 A Jubilee is what that 50th year will become for you.
Migaƒã nu alo axa nuku siwo mie ɖe flu me alo axa wainka si ŋu womeɖe o la ƒe tsetsewo o.
You will not sow seed or reap what grew on its own from leftover grain nor gather the grapes of unpruned vines.
12 Elabena Ablɔɖeƒe wònye.
12 For it is a Jubilee.
Nenɔ kɔkɔe na mi.
It is to be holy to you.
Miate ŋu aɖu nuku siwo anyigba la ŋutɔ wɔ.
You may eat only what the land produces by itself.
13 “‘Mia dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe nagaxɔ eƒe nunɔamesi le Ablɔɖeƒe la me.
13 “‘In this year of the Jubilee, each of you should return to his property.
14 Ne miele nu dzram na mia havi alo miele nu ƒlem le mia havi si la, migatafa mia nɔewo o.
14 If you sell anything to your fellow man or if you buy from him, do not exploit one another.
15 Ne èbe yeaƒle anyigba le hawòvi si la, woabui ɖe ƒe ale si nu va yi tso Ablɔɖeƒea dzi la nu; eye woabu anyigba si wòadzra na wò la ɖe ƒe ale si nu nàŋe agblemenukuawoe la nu.
15 You should buy from your fellow man, taking into account the number of the years after the Jubilee, and he should sell to you according to the remaining years for crops.
16 Ne anyigba la anɔ asiwòme ƒe geɖe la, eƒe asi ayi dzi, eye ne ƒe ʋɛ aɖewo koe la, ke eƒe asi abɔbɔ, elabena nuŋeɣiwo nue woadzrae na wò ɖo.

16 If there are many years remaining, he may increase its purchase price, and when there are few years left, he should reduce its purchase price, because he is selling you the number of crops to be produced.
17 Mia dometɔ aɖeke megatafa ehavi o, ke boŋ mivɔ̃ mia Mawu la, elabena nyee nye Yehowa, mia Mawu.
17 No one among you should exploit his fellow man, and you must be in fear of your God, for I am Jehovah your God.
18 Ne miewɔ nye sewo dzi eye mielé nye ʋɔnudrɔ̃ɖoɖowo me ɖe asi la, mianɔ dedie le anyigba la dzi.
18 By your carrying out my statutes and keeping my judicial decisions, you will dwell in security in the land.
19 Anyigba la awɔ nu na mi, eye miaɖu nu aɖi ƒo ahanɔ dedie le edzi.
19 The land will give its fruitage, and you will eat to satisfaction and dwell there in security.

20 “‘Ke ne miabia be, “Nu ka ɖu ge míala le ƒe adrelia me esi wònye be míate ŋu aƒã nu loo alo axa míaƒe agblemenukuwo o?” la, 21 ekema minyae be, mayra mi le ƒe adelia me, eye anyigba la awɔ nu wòade ƒe etɔ̃ nu.

20 “‘But if you should say: “What will we eat in the seventh year if we may not sow seed or gather our crops?” 21 I will command my blessing for you in the sixth year, and the land will yield a crop sufficient for three years.
22 Miaƒã nu le ƒe enyilia me, eye mianɔ agblemenuku xoxoawo ɖum va se ɖe ƒe asiekelia me.
22 Then you will sow seed in the eighth year and eat from the old crop until the ninth year.
Mianɔ xoxoa ɖum va se ɖe esime nuku yeyeawo nado.
Until its crop arrives, you will eat from the old.
23 “‘Womadzra anyigba la ɖikaa o, elabena tɔnyee anyigba la nye.
23 “‘The land should not be sold on a permanent basis, because the land is mine.
Elabena amedzroviwo kple anyigba la dzi nɔlawo koe mienye le ŋkunyeme.
For you are foreign residents and settlers from my standpoint.
24 Le miaƒe nutowo katã me la, ele be woaʋu mɔnukpɔkpɔ ɖi be ame si dzra anyigba la nagate ŋu agbugbɔe aƒle.
24 Throughout the land of your possession, you should grant the right of buying back the land.
25 “‘Ne hiã tu nɔviwò, eye wòdzra eƒe nunɔamesi ƒe ɖe la, eƒe ƒometɔ kplikplikpli ate ŋu agaxɔ nu si nɔvia tsɔ dzra la aƒle.
25 “‘If your brother becomes poor and has to sell some of his property, a repurchaser who is closely related to him must come and buy back what his brother sold.

26 Ke ne ame aɖeke meli si agaxɔ eƒe nuwo aƒle o, eye nane va su eya ŋutɔ si wòbe yeagbugbɔe aƒle la, 27 ekema wòabu ƒe siwo va yi tso esime wòdzrae, eye wòagbugbɔ ƒe siwo susɔ la ƒe ga ana ame si wòdzrae na, eye wòagaxɔ eƒe nunɔamesi la.

26 If anyone has no repurchaser but he becomes prosperous and finds the means to repurchase it, 27 he should calculate its value for the years since he sold it and refund the difference to the man whom he sold it to. Then he may return to his property.
28 “‘Ke ne nu mesu esi wòatsɔ axe fea na amea o la, ekema nu si wòdzra la nanɔ eƒlela si me va se ɖe Ablɔɖeƒe la dzi.

28 “‘But if he does not find the means to get it back from him, what he sold will remain with the purchaser until the Jubilee year; and it will revert to him in the Jubilee, and he will return to his property.
Le Ablɔɖeƒea me la, nunɔamesia agatrɔ azu nutɔa tɔ, eye wòagaxɔ eƒe nu. 29 “‘Ne ame aɖe dzra aƒe le du si ŋu woɖo gli ɖo me la, ekpɔ mɔ agaxɔe aƒle le ƒe ɖeka me.

29 “‘Now if a man should sell a home in a walled city, his right of repurchase will also continue until the end of the year from the time of his completing the sale; his right of repurchase will be valid a whole year.
Gome le esi be wòagbugbɔe aƒle le ƒe blibo ɖeka me. 30 Ke ne womegbugbɔ aƒe si le du si ŋu woɖo gli ɖo la me ƒle hafi ƒe bliboa wu enu o la, ekema azu eƒlela tɔ ɖikaa na eƒe dzidzimeviwo.
30 But if it is not bought back by the end of one full year, the house within the walled city will become the permanent property of its purchaser throughout his generations.
Mado le esi me le Ablɔɖeƒe la me o.
It should not be released in the Jubilee.
31 Ke woabu aƒe siwo le du siwo ŋu womeɖo gli ɖo o me la abe agbledenyigba ke ene.
31 However, the houses of settlements with no surrounding wall should be considered to be part of the field of the countryside.
Wokpɔ mɔ agaxɔe aƒle, eye woaɖe asi le eŋu le Ablɔɖeƒe la me.
The right of repurchase should continue for it, and it should be released in the Jubilee.
32 “‘Ke aƒe siwo le Lewi viwo ƒe duwo me ya la, Lewi viwo kpɔ mɔ agaxɔe aƒle ɣesiaɣi.
32 “‘As for the houses of the Levites within their cities, the Levites will have the permanent right to repurchase them.

33 Ne womegbugbɔ Lewi vi aɖe ƒe aƒe si wòdzra le eƒe dua me la ƒle o la, ekema woaɖe asi le aƒea ŋu le Ablɔɖeƒe la me, elabena aƒe siwo le Lewi viwo ƒe duwo me la nye woƒe nunɔamesi le Israel-viwo dome.

33 When the property of the Levites is not bought back, the house sold in the city belonging to them will also be released in the Jubilee, because the houses of the cities of the Levites are their property among the Israelites.
34 Azɔ hã, womadzra lãnyiƒe si le woƒe duwo ŋu la o, elabena nunɔamesi wònye na wo ɖaa.
34 Moreover, the field of pasture ground surrounding their cities may not be sold, for it is their permanent possession.
35 “‘Ne hiã tu nɔviwò ale be megate ŋu le eƒe nuhiahiãwo gbɔ kpɔm o la, ekema kpe ɖe eŋu abe ale si nàwɔ na amedzrovi kple ame si ʋu va tsi mia gbɔ la ene, be nàxɔe ɖe agbe.
35 “‘If your brother who is nearby becomes poor and cannot support himself, you must sustain him as you would a foreign resident and a settler, so that he may keep alive with you.
36 Mègaxɔ deme le nɔviwò si loo alo adi viɖe le eŋu o, ke boŋ vɔ̃ wò Mawu la; eye nàxɔ nɔviwò si le gbɔwò la ɖe agbe.
36 Do not take interest or make a profit from him. You must be in fear of your God, and your brother will keep alive with you.
37 Mègado ga nɛ abia deme o, eye ne ètsɔ nuɖuɖu nɛ la, mègaxɔ ɖeke ɖe edzi o.
37 You must not lend him your money on interest or give out your food for profit.
38 Nyee nye Yehowa, mia Mawu, ame si kplɔ mi tso Egipte-nyigba dzi, be matsɔ Kanaan-nyigba la ana mi, ne mianyae be nyee nye mia Mawu.
38 I am Jehovah your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan, to prove myself your God.
39 “‘Ne hiã tu nɔviwò, eye wòhiã be wòadzra eɖokui na wò la, mègazãe abe kluvi ene o.
39 “‘If your brother who lives nearby becomes poor and he has to sell himself to you, you must not force him to do slave labor.
40 Nenɔ gbɔwò abe apadɔwɔla ene, abe ame si ʋu va tsi gbɔwò ene.
40 He should be treated like a hired worker, like a settler.
Nesubɔ wò va se ɖe Ablɔɖeƒe la dzi.
He should serve with you until the Jubilee year.
41 Emegbe nàɖe asi le eya kple viawo ŋu ne wòatrɔ ayi eƒe ƒometɔwo kple fofoawo ƒe domenyinu gbɔ.
41 Then he will leave you, he and his children with him, and return to his family. He should return to the property of his forefathers.
42 Elabena nye kluvi siwo mekplɔ tso Egipte-nyigba dzi lae wonye.
42 For they are my slaves whom I brought out of the land of Egypt.
Woagadzra wo ɖokuiwo azu kluviwo na amewo o.
They should not sell themselves the way a slave is sold.
43 Mègasẽ ŋuta le eŋu o; vɔ̃ wò Mawu la.
43 You must not treat him cruelly, and you must be in fear of your God.
44 Miate ŋu aƒle kluvi kple kosiwo tso dukɔ siwo ƒo xlã mi la me woazu mia tɔ.
44 Your male and female slaves are to come from the nations around you, from them you may buy a male or a female slave.
45 Miate ŋu aƒle amedzro siwo le mia gbɔ la ƒe viwo kple wo viwo ƒe vi siwo wodzi le miaƒe anyigba dzi la hã, eye woazu mia tɔ.
45 Also from the sons of the foreign settlers who are residing with you, from them and from their families that are born to them in your land you may buy slaves, and they will become your possession.
46 Miagblẽ wo ɖi na mia megbeviwo woazu wo tɔ tegbee. Miate ŋu ana woawɔ dɔ na mi.
46 You may pass them on as an inheritance to your sons after you to inherit as a permanent possession.
Ke migasẽ ŋuta le mia nɔvi Israel-viwo ŋu ate wo ɖe to o.
You may use them as workers, but you must not subject your Israelite brothers to cruel treatment.

47 “‘Ke ne alɔme va le amedzrovi alo ame si ʋu va tsi mia gbɔ la si, eye hiã tu nɔviwò ale be wòva hiã be wòadzra eɖokui na amedzrovi ma alo ame si ʋu va tsi mia gbɔ, alo amedzroa ƒe ƒometɔ aɖe la, 48 gome le ame si dzra eɖokui la si ɣesiaɣi be woagbugbɔ axɔe aƒle. Nɔviawo dometɔ ɖeka ate ŋu axe fea axɔe.

47 “‘But if a foreign resident or a settler among you becomes wealthy and your brother has become poor alongside him and must sell himself to the foreign resident or the settler who lives among you, or to a member of the family of the foreign resident, 48 he will continue to have the right of repurchase after he has sold himself.
49 Fofoa nɔviŋutsu alo fofoa nɔviŋutsu ƒe vi ate ŋu axe fea axɔe, alo eƒe ƒometɔ kplikplikpli ɖe sia ɖe ate ŋu axe fea axɔe.
One of his brothers may buy him back, 49 or his uncle or the son of his uncle may buy him back, or any close relative, one of his family, may buy him back.
“‘Alo ne alɔme va le esi la, ekema eya ŋutɔ naxe fea agbugbɔ eɖokui aƒle.
“‘Or if he himself has become wealthy, he may also buy himself back.
50 Eya kple eƒlela woaxlẽ ƒeawo tso ƒe si me wòdzra eɖokui nɛ va se ɖe Ablɔɖeƒe la dzi, eye ƒeawo ƒe xexlẽme nue woabu eƒlega la ɖo.
50 He should calculate with his purchaser the time from the year he sold himself to him until the Jubilee year, and the money of his sale will correspond to the number of years.
Ale si wobua apadɔwɔla ƒe dɔwɔŋkekewoe la, nenemae woabui.
His workdays during that time will be assessed at the rate of a hired worker.
51 Ne ƒe geɖe gasusɔ la, ekema woabu fe si wòaxe na eƒlela atsɔ axɔ eɖokui la ɖe ƒe siwo susɔ la nu.
51 If there are many years remaining, he should pay his repurchase price in proportion to the years that are left.
52 Ke ne ƒe ʋɛ aɖewo koe susɔ ne Ablɔɖeƒea naɖo la, ekema woabui ɖe ƒe siwo susɔ la nu, ne wòaxee atsɔ axɔ eɖokui.
52 But if only a few years remain until the Jubilee year, he should then calculate for himself and pay his repurchase price in proportion to the years remaining.
53 Le ƒe siwo katã me wòanɔ egbɔ la, nenɔ kplii abe apadɔwɔla ene; mègazi kpi wòasẽ ŋuta le eŋu o.
53 He should continue to serve him year by year as a hired worker; and you should see to it that he does not treat him cruelly.
54 Ke ne mate ŋu agbugbɔ eɖokui aƒle le ɖoɖo siawo nu o la, ekema woaɖe asi le eŋu wòadzo le Ablɔɖeƒe la me, eya kple viawo siaa.
54 However, if he cannot buy himself back on these terms, he will then go free in the year of Jubilee, he and his children with him.
55 “‘Elabena nye ŋutɔ nye kluviwoe Israel-viwo nye.
55 “‘For the Israelites are my own slaves.
Nye kluvi siwo mekplɔ tso Egipte-nyigba dzie wonye.
They are my slaves whom I brought out of the land of Egypt.
Nyee nye Yehowa, mia Mawu.
I am Jehovah your God.
Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose be: 2 “Gblɔ na Israel-viwo be, ‘Nyee nye Yehowa mia Mawu.
Jehovah continued to speak to Moses, saying: 2 “Speak to the Israelites and say to them, ‘I am Jehovah your God.
3 Migawɔ nu abe Egipte-nyigba si dzi mienɔ la dzi nɔlawo ene o, eye migawɔ nu abe Kanaan-nyigba si dzi mekplɔ mi yinae la dzi nɔlawo ene o.
3 You must not behave as they do in the land of Egypt, where you were dwelling, and you must not do what they do in the land of Canaan, where I am bringing you.
Eye migazɔ ɖe woƒe ɖoɖowo nu o.
And you must not walk in their statutes.
4 Miwɔ nye ʋɔnudrɔ̃ɖoɖowo dzi, eye milé nye sewo me ɖe asi, ne miazɔ ɖe wo dzi.
4 You should carry out my judicial decisions, and you should keep my statutes and walk in them.
Nyee nye Yehowa mia Mawu.
I am Jehovah your God.
5 Milé nye sewo kple nye ʋɔnudrɔ̃ɖoɖowo me ɖe asi; elabena ame sia ame si léa wo me ɖe asi la anɔ agbe.
5 You must keep my statutes and my judicial decisions; anyone who does so will live by means of them.
Nyee nye Yehowa.
I am Jehovah.
6 “‘Mia dometɔ aɖeke megadɔ eƒe ƒometɔ kpamkpam aɖeke gbɔ o.
6 “‘No man among you should approach any of his close relatives to have sexual relations.
Nyee nye Yehowa.
I am Jehovah.
7 Mègadɔ fofowò gbɔ o, eye mègadɔ dawò gbɔ o.
7 You must not have sexual relations with your father, and you must not have sexual relations with your mother.
Dawòe, eya ta mègadɔ egbɔ o.
She is your mother, and you must not have sexual relations with her.
8 “‘Mègadɔ fofowò srɔ̃ gbɔ o, elabena enye ŋukpedodo fofowò.
8 “‘You must not have sexual relations with your father’s wife.
9 “‘Mègadɔ nɔviwònyɔnu gbɔ o, eɖanye fofowò vinyɔnu alo dawò vinyɔnu o, woɖadzii ɖe aƒe alo wodzii ɖe gbe o.

It is exposing your father to shame. 9 “‘You must not have sexual relations with your sister, either the daughter of your father or the daughter of your mother, whether she is born in the same household or born outside of it.
10 “‘Mègadɔ viwòŋutsu ƒe vinyɔnu alo viwònyɔnu ƒe vinyɔnu gbɔ o, elabena wò ŋutɔ wò amae.
10 “‘You must not have sexual relations with the daughter of your son or the daughter of your daughter, because they are your own nakedness.
11 “‘Mègadɔ fofowò srɔ̃ vinyɔnu, si nye fofowò ƒe vi gbɔ o, elabena nɔviwònyɔnue.
11 “‘You must not have sexual relations with the daughter of your father’s wife, the offspring of your father, because she is your sister.
12 “‘Mègadɔ fofowò nɔvinyɔnu gbɔ o.
12 “‘You must not have sexual relations with your father’s sister.
Ʋu ɖeka mee eya kple fofowò tso.
She is your father’s blood relative.
13 “‘Mègadɔ dawò nɔvinyɔnu gbɔ o, elabena ʋu ɖeka mee eya kple dawò tso.
13 “‘You must not have sexual relations with your mother’s sister, because she is your mother’s blood relative.
14 “‘Mègado ŋukpe fofowò nɔviŋutsu to srɔ̃a gbɔ dɔdɔ me o, elabena miedo ƒome.
14 “‘You must not expose your father’s brother to shame by having sexual relations with his wife. She is your aunt.
15 “‘Mègadɔ toyɔviwò gbɔ o.
15 “‘You must not have sexual relations with your daughter-in-law.
Viwòŋutsu srɔ̃e, eya ta mègadɔ egbɔ o.
She is your son’s wife, and you must not have relations with her.
16 “‘Mègadɔ nɔviwòŋutsu srɔ̃ gbɔ o, elabena enye ŋukpedodo nɔviwòŋutsu.
16 “‘You must not have sexual relations with your brother’s wife, because it is exposing your brother to shame.
17 “‘Mègadɔ nyɔnu kple vianyɔnu siaa gbɔ o.
17 “‘You must not have sexual relations with a woman and her daughter.
Mègadɔ viaŋutsu ƒe vinyɔnu alo vianyɔnu ƒe vinyɔnu gbɔ o.
You must not take the daughter of her son and the daughter of her daughter in order to have relations.
Ʋu ɖeka mee wotso, nuwɔna nyɔŋue wònye.
They are her close relatives; it is an obscene act.
18 “‘Ne srɔ̃wò le agbe la, mègaɖe nɔvianyɔnu kpe ɖe eŋu be wòanye eƒe atsusi o, mègadɔ egbɔ o.
18 “‘You must not take a woman in addition to her sister as a rival wife and have sexual relations with her while her sister is alive.
19 “‘Ne nyɔnu ɖo asi anyi la, mègadɔ egbɔ o, elabena eŋu mekɔ o.
19 “‘You must not approach a woman during her menstrual impurity to have sexual relations with her.
20 “‘Mègadɔ hawòvi srɔ̃ gbɔ atsɔ aƒo ɖi ɖokuiwò o.
20 “‘You must not have sexual intercourse with the wife of your fellow man, making yourself unclean.
21 “‘Mègatsɔ viwò sa vɔe na Molek o.
21 “‘You must not allow any of your offspring to be offered to MOlech.
Mègawɔ esia be nàƒo ɖi wò Mawu ƒe ŋkɔ o.
You must not profane the name of your God in that way.
Nyee nye Yehowa.
I am Jehovah.
22 “‘Mègadɔ ŋutsu gbɔ abe nyɔnu gbɔ ene o.
22 “‘You must not lie down with a male in the same way that you lie down with a woman.
Ŋunyɔnu wònye.
It is a detestable act.
23 “‘Ŋutsu aɖeke megadɔ kple lã aɖeke atsɔ aƒo ɖi eɖokui o, eye nyɔnu aɖeke megatsɔ eɖokui na lã aɖeke wòayɔ asii o.
23 “‘A man must not have sexual intercourse with an animal to become unclean by it; nor should a woman offer herself to an animal to have intercourse with it.
Mesɔ le dzɔdzɔme nu o.
It is a violation of what is natural.
24 “‘Migatsɔ nuwɔna siawo dometɔ aɖeke ƒo ɖi mia ɖokuiwo o, elabena nu siawo katãe dukɔ siwo nyam mele ɖa le mia ŋgɔ la tsɔ ƒo ɖi wo ɖokuiwoe.
24 “‘Do not make yourselves unclean by any of these things, for it is by all these things that the nations that I am driving out from before you have made themselves unclean.
25 Ale woƒe anyigba la ƒo ɖi, eya ta maɖo woƒe vodada teƒe na wo, eye anyigba la atu edzinɔlawo aƒu gbe.
25 Therefore, the land is unclean, and I will bring punishment on it for its error, and the land will vomit its inhabitants out.
26 Ke miawo la, milé nye sewo kple nye ʋɔnudrɔ̃ɖoɖowo me ɖe asi. Migawɔ ŋunyɔnu siawo ƒe ɖeke o, eɖanye dumevi alo amedzrovi si le mia dome o.
26 But you yourselves must keep my statutes and my judicial decisions, and you must not do any of these detestable things, whether a native or a foreigner who is residing among you.
27 Elabena ŋunyɔnu siawo katãe anyigba si dzi yim miele la dzi nɔlawo wɔna, ale be anyigba la gblẽ.
27 For all these detestable things were done by the men who lived in the land before you, and now the land is unclean.
28 Migagblẽ kɔ ɖo na anyigba la ne wòatu mi aƒu gbe abe ale si tututu wòle dukɔ siwo le mia ŋgɔ la tu ge aƒu gbe ene o.
28 Then the land will not have to vomit you out for defiling it in the same way that it will vomit out the nations that were before you.
29 Ne ame aɖe wɔ ŋunyɔnu siawo dometɔ aɖe la, woatsrɔ̃ ame ma ɖa le eƒe dukɔ la dome.
29 If anyone does any of these detestable things, all those doing them must be cut off from among their people.
30 Miwɔ nu siwo meɖo na mi la, eye migawɔ kɔnu nyɔŋu siwo wowɔ le mia ŋgɔ la dometɔ aɖeke atsɔ aƒo ɖi mia ɖokuiwo o.
30 You must keep your obligation to me by not practicing any of the detestable customs that were carried on before you, so that you do not make yourselves unclean by them.
Nyee nye Yehowa mia Mawu.’”
I am Jehovah your God.’”
Yehowa gblɔ na Mose be: 2 “Gblɔ na Israel-viwo be woatsɔ amititsetse ƒe ami nyuitɔ vɛ be woatsɔ ade akaɖi la me, ne akaɖigbɛ la nanɔ sisi ɖaa.
Jehovah continued to speak to Moses, saying: 2 “Command the Israelites to bring to you pure, beaten olive oil for the lights, to keep the lamps lit constantly.
3 Aron nakpɔ akaɖi la gbɔ le takpegbadɔa me le xɔmetsovɔ si xe Ðaseɖinu la ŋkume la ŋgɔ, be wòanɔ bibim tso fiẽ va se ɖe ŋdi le Yehowa ŋkume ɖaa.
3 Outside the curtain of the Testimony in the tent of meeting, Aaron should arrange to keep the lamps lit from evening to morning before Jehovah constantly.
Se wònye na mi ɖaa le miaƒe dzidzimewo katã me.
It is a permanent statute for all your generations.
4 Nekpɔ akaɖigbɛawo ŋuti dɔwo gbɔ le sikakaɖiti la dzi le Yehowa ŋkume ɖaa.
4 He should set the lamps in order on the lampstand of pure gold before Jehovah constantly.
5 “Tsɔ wɔ memee mè abolo kotoe wuieve.
5 “You will take fine flour and bake it into 12 ring-shaped loaves.
Tsɔ wɔ efa me mama ɖe ewo ƒe akpa eve ƒo aboloawo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe.
Two tenths of an ephah should go into each loaf.
6 Nàɖo wo ɖe wo nɔewo dzi le agbaka eve me ɖe sikakplɔ̃ la dzi le Yehowa ŋkume; ade nanɔ agbaka ɖeka me.
6 You will place them in two sets of layers, six to the layer set, on the table of pure gold before Jehovah.
7 Eye nàtsɔ lifi ɣi nyuitɔ ada ɖe agbaka eveawo dzi, be esia nanye kpɔɖeŋudzovɔsa ƒe abolo na Yehowa.
7 You should put pure frankincense on each layer set, and it will serve as the bread for a token offering made by fire to Jehovah.
8 Na wòaɖo aboloa ɖe ɖoɖo nu le sabat sia sabat dzi le Yehowa ŋkume ɖaa.
8 On each Sabbath day, he should regularly arrange it before Jehovah.
Nubabla wònye le nye kple Israel-viwo dome ɖaa.
It is a lasting covenant with the Israelites.
9 Woanye Aron kple viaŋutsuwo tɔ, eye woaɖui le teƒe kɔkɔe, elabena nu kɔkɔewo ƒe nu kɔkɔe wònye nɛ tso Yehowa ƒe dzovɔsawo me; ɖoɖo mavɔ wòanye.”
9 It will become Aaron’s and his sons’, and they will eat it in a holy place, because it is something most holy for him from Jehovah’s offerings made by fire, as a lasting regulation.”
10 Ke gbe ɖeka la, dzre dzɔ ɖe Israel nyɔnu aɖe ƒe viŋutsu si wòdzi na Egipte ŋutsu aɖe kpakple Israel ŋutsu aɖe dome le asaɖa la me.
10 Now among the Israelites was a son of an Israelite woman and an Egyptian man, and a fight broke out between him and an Israelite man in the camp.
11 Eye Israel nyɔnua ƒe via gblɔ busunya ɖe Mawu ƒe ŋkɔ la ŋu hedo ɖiŋu nɛ.
11 The son of the Israelite woman began to abuse the Name and to curse it.
Eya ta wokplɔe va Mose gbɔ.
So they brought him to Moses.
Dadaa ŋkɔe nye Selomit, eye wònye Dibri si tso Dan-to la me ƒe vinyɔnu.
Incidentally, his mother was ShelOmith, the daughter of Dibri of the tribe of Dan.
12 Eye wosikae ɖi, va se ɖe esime woase nya aɖe tso Yehowa nu.
12 They placed him in custody until Jehovah’s decision was made clear to them.
13 Eye Yehowa gblɔ na Mose be: 14 “Kplɔ ɖiŋudola la yi asaɖa la godo, eye ame siwo katã se nya si wògblɔ la natsɔ woƒe asiwo aɖo eƒe ta dzi, eye ha blibo la katã naƒu kpee.
13 Then Jehovah said to Moses: 14 “Bring the one who cursed to the outside of the camp, and all those who heard him must lay their hands on his head, and then the entire assembly must stone him.
15 Eye nàgblɔ na Israel-viwo be, ‘Ne ame aɖe do ɖiŋu na eƒe Mawu la, eƒe nu vɔ̃ anɔ eƒe ta dzi.
15 And you should tell the Israelites, ‘If any man curses his God, he will answer for his sin.
16 Ne ame aɖe gblɔ busunya ɖe Yehowa ƒe ŋkɔ ŋu la, ku kee wòaku.
16 So the abuser of Jehovah’s name should be put to death without fail.
Ha blibo la katã naƒu kpee.
The entire assembly should stone him without fail.
Woawu amedzrovi alo dumevi si agblɔ busunya ɖe Ŋkɔ la ŋu.
The foreign resident should be put to death the same as the native for his abusing the Name.
17 “‘Ne ame aɖe wu ame la, ele be woawu eya hã.
17 “‘If a man takes a human life, he should be put to death without fail.
18 Ame si wu aƒemelã aɖe la naɖo eteƒe, agbe ɖe agbe teƒe.
18 Anyone who strikes and kills a domestic animal should make compensation for it, life for life.
19 Ne ame aɖe wɔ nu vevi ehavi la, woawɔ nu vevi ma ke eya hã.
19 If a man injures his fellow man, then what he has done should be done to him.
20 Ŋeŋe ɖe ŋeŋe teƒe, ŋku ɖe ŋku teƒe, aɖu ɖe aɖu teƒe, nu si wòwɔ amea la, nu ma kee woawɔ eya hã.
20 Fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, the same sort of injury he inflicted should be inflicted on him.
21 Ame si ƒo lã aɖe wòku la naɖo eteƒe, ke ame si ƒo ame wòku la, woawu eya hã.
21 The man who strikes and kills an animal should make compensation for it, but the one who strikes and kills a man should be put to death.
22 “‘Se ɖekae akplɔ amedzrovi kple dumevi siaa, elabena nyee nye Yehowa mia Mawu.’”
22 “‘One judicial decision will apply for you, whether a foreign resident or a native, because I am Jehovah your God.’”
23 Eye Mose ƒo nu kple Israel-viwo, eye wokplɔ ɖiŋudola la yi asaɖa la godo heƒu kpee.
23 Moses then spoke to the Israelites, and they brought the one who uttered the curse to the outside of the camp, and they stoned him.
Ale Israel-viwo wɔe abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
Thus the Israelites did just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.

Eye Yehowa gagblɔ na Mose be: 2 “Gblɔ na Israel-viwo be, ‘Ne ame aɖe wɔ nu vɔ̃ le manyamanya me, ale be wòwɔ nu siwo katã ŋu Yehowa de se le be woagawɔ o la dometɔ aɖe la, ekema nu si wòle be woawɔe nye esi:
Jehovah went on to say to Moses: 2 “Tell the Israelites, ‘If someone sins unintentionally by doing any of the things that Jehovah commanded should not be done:
3 “‘Ne nunɔla si wosi ami na la wɔ nu vɔ̃ hena dukɔ la ɖi fɔ la, ekema wòatsɔ nyitsui si sɔ blibo vɛ na Yehowa be woatsɔ asa nuvɔ̃vɔ ɖe eƒe nu vɔ̃ si wòwɔ la ta.
3 “‘If the anointed priest sins and brings guilt on the people, then he must present a sound young bull to Jehovah as a sin offering for the sin he committed.
4 Netsɔ nyi la va takpegbadɔa ƒe mɔnu le Yehowa ŋkume, eye wòatsɔ eƒe asi aɖo nyi la ƒe tame, eye wòawu nyi la le Yehowa ŋkume.
4 He will bring the bull to the entrance of the tent of meeting before Jehovah and lay his hand on the bull’s head, and he is to slaughter the bull before Jehovah.
5 Eyome nunɔla si wosi ami na la natsɔ nyi la ƒe ʋu la ƒe ɖe ava takpegbadɔa me; 6 eye nunɔla la nade eƒe asibidɛ ʋua me eye wòahlẽ ʋua ƒe ɖe zi adre ɖe kɔkɔeƒe la ƒe xɔmetsovɔa ŋgɔ le Yehowa ŋkume.

5 Then the anointed priest will take some of the bull’s blood and bring it into the tent of meeting; 6 and the priest will dip his finger in the blood and spatter some of the blood seven times before Jehovah in front of the curtain of the holy place.
7 Eye nunɔla la nage ʋu la ƒe ɖe ɖe dzudzɔdomlekpui si le Yehowa ŋkume le takpegbadɔa me la ƒe dzoawo dzi, eye wòatsɔ nyi la ƒe ʋu susɔea katã akɔ ɖe numevɔsamlekpui si le takpegbadɔa ƒe mɔnu la te.

7 The priest will also put some of the blood on the horns of the altar of perfumed incense, which is before Jehovah in the tent of meeting; and he will pour all the rest of the bull’s blood at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
8 “‘Eyome wòaɖe nyi si wotsɔ sa nuvɔ̃vɔe la ƒe amiawo katã, hekpe ɖe ami si tsyɔ dɔkaviawo dzi la ŋu kple ami siwo katã le dɔkaviawo ŋu, 9 ayiku eveawo kple ami siwo le wo ŋu le alia gbɔ lɔƒo.

8 “‘He will then remove all the fat of the bull of the sin offering, including the fat that covers the intestines and the fat that surrounds the intestines, 9 and the two kidneys with the fat on them that is near the loins.
Eye wòaɖe aklã ŋu mi la kpe ɖe ayikuawo ŋu.
And he will remove the appendage of the liver along with the kidneys.
10 Nu siwo woɖe le nyi si wotsɔ sa ŋutifafavɔe la ŋu la kee wòaɖe le esia hã ŋu.
10 It will be the same as what is removed from a bull of the communion sacrifice.
Eye nunɔla la natsɔ wo ado dzudzɔ ɖe numevɔsamlekpui la dzi.
And the priest will make them smoke on the altar of burnt offering.

11 “‘Ke nyi la ƒe agbalẽ, eƒe lã la katã, eƒe ta, eƒe afɔwo, eƒe dɔkaviwo kple eƒe mĩwo, 12 siwo nye nyi la ƒe lã mamlɛa katã ya la, wòana woatsɔ wo ado goe ayi asaɖa la godo le teƒe dzadzɛ, afi si wokɔa dzofiwo ɖo, eye wòatɔ dzoe le nakedzo dzi.

11 “‘But as for the skin of the bull and all its flesh along with its head, its shanks, its intestines, and its dung — 12 all the rest of the bull—he will have it taken to the outskirts of the camp to a clean place where the ashes are discarded, and he will burn it on wood in the fire.
Afi si wokɔa dzofiwo ɖo lae wòatɔ dzoe le.
It should be burned where the ashes are discarded.

13 “‘Ke ne Israel-viwo ƒe ha blibo la ɖi fɔ le nu vɔ̃ aɖe si womeɖo hafi wɔ o ta, evɔ womenya be yewowɔ nane si ŋu Yehowa de se le be woagawɔ o, 14 eye emegbe wova dze si nu vɔ̃ si wowɔ la, ekema ha la natsɔ nyitsui ava takpegbadɔ la ŋgɔ be woatsɔ asa nuvɔ̃vɔe.

13 “‘Now if the entire assembly of Israel has become guilty by committing a sin unintentionally, but the congregation was unaware that they had done something that Jehovah commanded them not to do, 14 and then the sin becomes known, the congregation must present a young bull for a sin offering and bring it before the tent of meeting.
15 Eye ha la ƒe ametsitsiwo natsɔ woƒe asiwo aɖo nyi la ƒe tame le Yehowa ŋkume, eye woawu nyi la le Yehowa ŋkume.
15 The elders of the assembly will lay their hands on the bull’s head before Jehovah, and the bull will be slaughtered before Jehovah.
16 “‘Azɔ nunɔla si wosi ami na la natsɔ nyi la ƒe ʋu la ƒe ɖe ava takpegbadɔa me.
16 “‘Then the anointed priest will bring some of the bull’s blood into the tent of meeting.
17 Eye nunɔla la nade eƒe asibidɛ ʋua me ahlẽ zi adre ɖe xɔmetsovɔ la ŋgɔ le Yehowa ŋkume.
17 The priest is to dip his finger into the blood and spatter some of it seven times before Jehovah in front of the curtain.
18 Eye wòage ʋua ƒe ɖe ɖe vɔsamlekpui si le Yehowa ŋkume le takpegbadɔa me la ƒe dzoawo dzi; eye wòatsɔ ʋu susɔea katã akɔ ɖe numevɔsamlekpui si le takpegbadɔa ƒe mɔnu la te.

18 He will then put some of the blood on the horns of the altar that is before Jehovah, which is in the tent of meeting; and he will pour all the rest of the blood at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
19 Eye wòaɖe ami siwo katã le nyia ŋu atsɔ ado dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpui la dzi.
19 He will remove all its fat and make it smoke on the altar.
20 Eye wòawɔ nyi la abe ale si ko wòwɔ nyi gbãtɔ si wotsɔ sa nuvɔ̃vɔe la ene.
20 He is to do to the bull just as he did to the other bull of the sin offering.
Nenemae wòawɔe, eye nunɔla la nalé avu ɖe dukɔ la ta ale be woatsɔe ake wo.
That is how he will do it, and the priest will make atonement for them, and they will be forgiven.
21 Emegbe wòana woatsɔ nyi la ado goe ayi asaɖa la godo ahatɔ dzoe, abe ale si ko wòtɔ dzo nyi gbãtɔa ene.
21 He will have the bull taken to the outskirts of the camp and will burn it, just as he burned the first bull.
Ha la ƒe nuvɔ̃vɔsa wònye.
It is a sin offering for the congregation.

22 “‘Ne amegã aɖe wɔ nu vɔ̃, eye wòwɔ nu siwo katã ŋu Yehowa eƒe Mawu de se le be woagawɔ o la dometɔ aɖe heɖi fɔ, 23 alo ne wòva dze si se si dzi wòda la, ekema wòatsɔ gbɔ̃tsui si sɔ blibo avɛ woatsɔ asa vɔe.

22 “‘When a chieftain unintentionally sins by doing one of all the things that Jehovah his God commands should not be done and has become guilty, 23 or if he becomes aware of a sin that he has committed against the commandment, then he must bring a sound young male goat as his offering.
24 Eye wòatsɔ eƒe asi aɖo gbɔ̃tsui la ƒe tame, eye wòawui le afi si wowua numevɔsalã la le, le Yehowa ŋkume.
24 He will lay his hand on the head of the young goat and slaughter it in the place where the burnt offering is slaughtered before Jehovah.
Nuvɔ̃vɔsa wònye.
It is a sin offering.
25 Eye nunɔla la nade eƒe asibidɛ nuvɔ̃vɔsalã la ƒe ʋua me age ɖe numevɔsamlekpui la ƒe dzoawo ŋu, eye wòatsɔ eƒe ʋu susɔea akɔ ɖe numevɔsamlekpui la te.

25 The priest will take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and he will pour the rest of its blood at the base of the altar of burnt offering.
26 Eye wòatsɔ ami siwo katã le eŋu ado dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpuia dzi abe ale si wowɔ ŋutifafavɔsalã la ƒe ami la ene; eye nunɔla la nalé avu nɛ ɖe eƒe nu vɔ̃ la ta, ale be woatsɔe akee.
26 He will make all its fat smoke on the altar like the fat of the communion sacrifice; and the priest will make atonement for him for his sin, and it will be forgiven him.

27 “‘Ke ne ame aɖe wɔ nu vɔ̃ le dukɔa me, evɔ meɖoe hafi o, eye wòwɔ nu siwo ŋu Yehowa de se le be woagawɔ o la dometɔ aɖe heɖi fɔ, 28 alo wòva dze si nu vɔ̃ si wòwɔ la, ekema wòatsɔ gbɔ̃nɔe si sɔ blibo ava sa vɔ ɖe eƒe nu vɔ̃ si wòwɔ la ta.

27 “‘If any one of the people of the land sins unintentionally and becomes guilty by doing one of the things that Jehovah commands should not be done, 28 or if he becomes aware of a sin that he has committed, then he should bring a sound young female goat as his offering for the sin he has committed.
29 Eye wòatsɔ eƒe asi aɖo nuvɔ̃vɔsalã la ƒe tame, eye wòawu nuvɔ̃vɔsalã la le teƒe ma ke si wowua numevɔsalã le.
29 He will lay his hand on the head of the sin offering and slaughter the sin offering in the same place as the burnt offering.
30 Eye nunɔla la nade eƒe asibidɛ vɔsalã la ƒe ʋua me age ɖe numevɔsamlekpui la ƒe dzoawo ŋu, eye wòatsɔ eƒe ʋu susɔea katã akɔ ɖe numevɔsamlekpuia te.
30 The priest will take some of its blood with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and he will pour all the rest of its blood at the base of the altar.

31 Eye wòaɖe ami siwo katã le eŋu, abe ale si ko woɖe ami le ŋutifafavɔsalã la ŋu ene, eye nunɔla la natsɔe ado dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpuia dzi wòanye ʋeʋẽ lilili na Yehowa; eye nunɔla la nalé avu ɖe eta, ale be woatsɔe akee.

31 He will remove all its fat, just as the fat is removed from the communion sacrifice, and the priest will make it smoke on the altar as a pleasing aroma to Jehovah; and the priest will make atonement for him, and it will be forgiven him.
32 “‘Ke ne alẽvi wòbe yeatsɔ asa nuvɔ̃vɔe la, ekema wòatsɔ alẽnɔe si sɔ blibo vɛ.
32 “‘But if he offers a lamb as his sin offering, he should bring a sound female lamb.
33 Eye wòatsɔ eƒe asi aɖo nuvɔ̃vɔsalã la ƒe tame, eye wòawui wòanye nuvɔ̃vɔsa le teƒe si wowua numevɔsalã le.
33 He will lay his hand on the head of the sin offering and slaughter it as a sin offering in the place where the burnt offering is slaughtered.
34 Eye nunɔla la nade eƒe asibidɛ nuvɔ̃vɔsalã la ƒe ʋua me age ɖe numevɔsamlekpui la ƒe dzoawo ŋu, eye wòatsɔ eƒe ʋu susɔea katã akɔ ɖe numevɔsamlekpuia te.

34 The priest will take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and he will pour all the rest of its blood at the base of the altar.

35 Eye wòaɖe ami siwo katã le eŋu la, abe ale si ko woɖea alẽtsui si wotsɔ sa ŋutifafavɔe la ƒe amiawo ene, eye nunɔla la natsɔ wo ada ɖe Yehowa ƒe dzovɔsawo dzi atsɔ ado dzudzɔ le vɔsamlekpui la dzi; eye nunɔla la nalé avu ɖe eta, le nu vɔ̃ si wòwɔ la ta, eye woatsɔe akee.

35 He will remove all its fat the same way that the fat of the young ram of the communion sacrifice is removed, and the priest will make them smoke on the altar on top of Jehovah’s offerings made by fire; and the priest will make atonement for him for the sin that he has committed, and it will be forgiven him.
Yehowa ƒo nu kple Mose le Aron viŋutsu eve siwo ku le esi wote va Yehowa ŋkume madzemadzee megbe.
Jehovah spoke to Moses after the death of Aaron’s two sons who died for approaching Jehovah.

2 Yehowa gblɔ na Mose be: “Gblɔ na nɔviwò Aron be wòagava kɔkɔeƒe la le xɔmetsovɔ la godo le nutunu si le Aɖakaa nu la ŋgɔ ɣesiaɣi ko o, ne wòagaku o, elabena maɖe ɖokuinye afia le alilikpo me le nutunu la tame.

2 Jehovah said to Moses: “Tell Aaron your brother that he may not come at just any time into the holy place inside the curtain, in front of the cover on the Ark, so that he may not die, for I will appear over the cover in a cloud.
3 “Nu siwo Aron atsɔ ɖe asi ne egbɔna kɔkɔeƒe lae nye esi: nyitsui ɖeka si woatsɔ asa nuvɔ̃vɔ kple agbo ɖeka si woatsɔ asa numevɔ.
3 “This is what Aaron should bring when he comes into the holy place: a young bull for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering.
4 Nedo aklalawu ʋlaya kɔkɔe la kple aklalatakpui eye wòatsɔ alidziblanu la abla ali dzi ahatsɔ aklalatablanu la aɖɔ ɖe ta.
4 He should put on the holy linen robe, and the linen shorts should cover his body, and he should wrap himself with the linen sash and his head with the linen turban.
Awu kɔkɔewoe wonye.
They are holy garments.
Wòale tsi hafi ado wo.
He will bathe himself in water and put them on.
5 “Eye wòaxɔ gbɔ̃tsui eve le Israel ƒe ha la si atsɔ asa nuvɔ̃vɔ kple agbo ɖeka atsɔ asa numevɔ.
5 “He should take from the assembly of the Israelites two young male goats for a sin offering and one ram for a burnt offering.
6 “Aron natsɔ eƒe nuvɔ̃vɔsa ƒe nyitsu la avɛ ne wòatsɔ alé avu ɖe eɖokui kple eƒe aƒe la ta.
6 “Aaron must then present the bull of the sin offering, which is for himself, and he will make atonement in behalf of himself and his house.
7 “Eyome wòakplɔ gbɔ̃ eveawo ava Yehowa ŋkume le takpegbadɔa nu.
7 “He will then take the two goats and make them stand before Jehovah at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
8 Eye Aron nadzidze nu ɖe gbɔ̃ eveawo dzi; ɖeka nanye Yehowa tɔ, eye evelia nanye Azazel tɔ.
8 Aaron will draw lots over the two goats, the one lot for Jehovah and the other lot for Azazel.
9 Aron natsɔ gbɔ̃ si dzi nudzidzea dze na Yehowa la asa nuvɔ̃vɔ.
9 Aaron will present the goat that was designated by lot for Jehovah and make it a sin offering.
10 Ke wòakplɔ gbɔ̃ si dzi nudzidzea dze na Azazel la ava Yehowa ŋkume agbagbee, ne woalé avu ɖe eta, ale be woaɖoe ɖe Azazel le gbedzi.
10 But the goat designated by lot for Azazel should be brought alive to stand before Jehovah in order to perform the atonement upon it, so that it may be sent away for Azazel into the wilderness.
11 “Eyome Aron natsɔ eƒe nuvɔ̃vɔsanyitsu si wòtsɔ vɛ la alé avu ɖe eya ŋutɔ kple eƒe aƒe la ta; eye wòawu nuvɔ̃vɔsanyitsu si nye eya ŋutɔ tɔ la.

11 “Aaron will present the bull of the sin offering, which is for himself, and make atonement in behalf of himself and his house; afterward he will slaughter the bull of the sin offering, which is for himself.
12 “Eye wòatsɔ dzudzɔdosonu aɖe dzoka xɔxɔwo le vɔsamlekpuia dzi le Yehowa ŋkume ɖe eme wòayɔ, eye wòaku dzudzɔdonu ʋeʋĩ si woto memie la asiʋlo eve atsɔ ava xɔmetsovɔ la godo.
12 “He will then take the fire holder full of burning coals from the altar before Jehovah and two handfuls of fine perfumed incense, and he will bring them inside the curtain.
13 Azɔ wòakɔ dzudzɔdonu ʋeʋĩ la ɖe dzoa me le Yehowa ŋkume, eye dzudzɔdonu ʋeʋĩ la ƒe dzudzɔ naxɔ Aɖaka la ƒe nutunu si le Ðaseɖinua dzi la dzi, ne wòagaku o.
13 He will also put the incense on the fire before Jehovah, and the cloud of the incense will envelop the Ark cover, which is on the Testimony, so that he may not die.
14 “Atsɔ eƒe asibidɛ ade nyitsua ƒe ʋu la ƒe ɖe me agee ɖe nutunu la ŋgɔ le ɣedzeƒekpa dzi, eye wòatsɔ eƒe asibidɛ age ʋu la ƒe ɖe ɖe nutunu la ŋgɔ zi adre.
14 “He will take some of the bull’s blood and spatter it with his finger in front of the cover on the east side, and he will spatter some of the blood with his finger seven times before the cover.
15 “Eyome wòawu nuvɔ̃vɔsagbɔ̃ si nye dukɔa tɔ la atsɔ eƒe ʋu la ava xɔmetsovɔ la godo, eye wòawɔ eƒe ʋu la abe ale si wòwɔ nyitsua ƒe ʋu ene; wòagee ɖe nutunu la ŋgɔ.

15 “He will then slaughter the goat of the sin offering, which is for the people, and bring its blood inside the curtain and do with its blood the same as he did with the bull’s blood; he is to spatter it toward the cover and before the cover.
16 “Eye wòalé avu ɖe kɔkɔeƒea ta le Israel-viwo ƒe nu makɔmakɔ wɔwɔwo kpakple woƒe vodadawo kple woƒe nu vɔ̃wo katã ta. Alea kee wòawɔ na takpegbadɔ si le wo dome la hã le woƒe nu makɔmakɔ wɔwɔwo ta.

16 “He must make atonement for the holy place concerning the acts of uncleanness of the Israelites and concerning their transgressions and their sins, and that is what he should do for the tent of meeting, which is located among them in the midst of their acts of uncleanness.
17 “Ne eyi takpegbadɔ la me be wòalé avu le kɔkɔeƒea la, ame bubu aɖeke megayi ɖe eme o va se ɖe esime wòado go.
17 “No other man should be in the tent of meeting from the time he goes in to make atonement in the holy place until he comes out.
Alé avu ɖe eya ŋutɔ ɖokui kple eƒe aƒe la kpakple Israel ƒe ha blibo la katã ta.
He will make atonement in behalf of himself and his house and in behalf of the entire congregation of Israel.
18 “Eye wòado go ava vɔsamlekpui si le Yehowa ŋkume la gbɔ ahalé avu ɖe eta, eye wòatsɔ nyitsua ƒe ʋua ƒe ɖe kple gbɔ̃ la ƒe ʋua ƒe ɖe asisi ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ƒe dzowo ŋu keŋ.

18 “He will then come out to the altar, which is before Jehovah, and make atonement for it, and he will take some of the bull’s blood and some of the goat’s blood and put it on the horns of the altar on all sides.
19 Azɔ hã wòatsɔ eƒe asibidɛ ahlẽ ʋu la ƒe ɖe zi adre, eye wòakɔ eŋu tso Israel-viwo ƒe nu makɔmakɔ wɔwɔwo me ahawɔe kɔkɔe.
19 He will also spatter some of the blood on it with his finger seven times and cleanse it and sanctify it from the acts of uncleanness of the Israelites.
20 “Ne elé avu ɖe kɔkɔeƒe la kple takpegbadɔ la kpakple vɔsamlekpui la ta vɔ la, ekema wòatsɔ gbɔ̃ gbagbe la hã avɛ.
20 “When he has finished making atonement for the holy place and the tent of meeting and the altar, he will also present the live goat.

21 Eye Aron natsɔ eƒe asi eveawo aɖo gbɔ̃ gbagbe la ƒe tame, eye wòaʋu Israel-viwo ƒe vodada, dzidada, kple nu vɔ̃wo katã me akɔ ɖe gbɔ̃ la ƒe ta dzi, eye wòana ŋutsu si wotia da ɖi la nakplɔe aɖo ɖe gbedzi.

21 Aaron will lay both his hands on the head of the live goat and confess over it all the errors of the Israelites and all their transgressions and all their sins, and he will put them on the head of the goat and send it away into the wilderness by the hand of a man designated to do this.
22 Eye wòaɖe asi le gbɔ̃ la ŋu ɖo ɖe gbedzi be wòatsɔ woƒe vodadawo katã ayi gbedadaƒo.
22 The goat will carry upon itself all their errors into a desert land, and he will send the goat away into the wilderness.
23 “Emegbe Aron nava takpegbadɔa me aɖe aklalawu siwo wòdo yi kɔkɔeƒea la ɖi, eye wòagblẽ wo ɖe afi ma.
23 “Aaron will then enter into the tent of meeting and take off the linen garments that he put on when he went into the holy place, and he will lay them down there.
24 Wòale tsi le teƒe kɔkɔe, eye wòado eƒe awuwo; eyome wòado go asa numevɔ ɖe eɖokui ta, eye wòasa numevɔ ɖe dukɔ la hã ta ahalé avu ɖe eya ŋutɔ kple dukɔ la ta.

24 He must bathe himself in water in a holy place and put on his garments; then he will come out and offer up his burnt offering and the people’s burnt offering and make atonement in his own behalf and in behalf of the people.
25 Eyome wòatsɔ nuvɔ̃vɔsalã la ƒe ami ado dzudzɔ le vɔsamlekpuia dzi.
25 He will make the fat of the sin offering smoke on the altar.
26 “Ke ame si kplɔ gbɔ̃ la ɖo ɖe Azazel la nanya eƒe awuwo ahale tsi; emegbe ate ŋu ava asaɖa la me.
26 “The man who sent away the goat for Azazel should wash his garments and bathe himself in water, and after that he may come into the camp.
27 “Atsɔ nuvɔ̃vɔsanyitsu kple nuvɔ̃vɔsagbɔ̃ siwo ƒe ʋu wotsɔ lé avu le kɔkɔeƒe la ayi asaɖa la godo, eye woatɔ dzo woƒe agbalẽ kple woƒe lã kpakple woƒe mĩ.

27 “And the bull of the sin offering and the goat of the sin offering, whose blood was brought into the holy place to make atonement, will be taken outside the camp, and their skins and their flesh and their dung will be burned in the fire.
28 Ame si tɔ dzo wo la nanya eƒe awuwo ahale tsi; emegbe ate ŋu ava asaɖa la me.
28 The one who burns them should wash his garments and bathe himself in water, and after that he may come into the camp.
29 “Esia anye se na mi ɖaa: Le ɣleti adrelia ƒe ŋkeke ewolia dzi la, miawɔ fu mia ɖokui, eɖanye dumevi alo amedzrovi si le mia dome o, migawɔ dɔ aɖeke o.

29 “It will serve as a lasting statute for you: In the seventh month, on the tenth of the month, you should afflict yourselves, and you must not do any work, whether a native or a foreigner who is residing among you.
30 Gbe ma gbe woalé avu ɖe mia ta ne mia ŋu nakɔ.
30 On this day atonement will be made for you, to declare you clean.
Mia ŋu akɔ le Yehowa ŋkume tso miaƒe nu vɔ̃wo katã me.
You will be clean from all your sins before Jehovah.
31 Dzudzɔ blibo ƒe sabat wònye na mi, eye miawɔ fu mia ɖokui.
31 It is a sabbath of complete rest for you, and you should afflict yourselves.
Se wònye na mi ɖaa.
It is a lasting statute.
32 “Ame si woasi ami na aɖoe nunɔlae be wòaxɔ ɖe fofoa teƒe la nasa avulévɔ, eye wòado aklalawu siwo nye awu kɔkɔeawo.
32 “The priest who is anointed and installed to serve as priest in place of his father will make atonement and put on the linen garments, the holy garments.
33 Alé avu ɖe kɔkɔeƒe la, takpegbadɔ la, kple vɔsamlekpui la ta, eye wòalé avu ɖe nunɔlawo kple ha blibo la katã ta.
33 He will make atonement for the holy sanctuary, the tent of meeting, and the altar; and he will make atonement for the priests and for all the people of the congregation.
34 Esia nanye se na mi ɖaa, ne woalé avu ɖe Israel-viwo katã ƒe nu vɔ̃wo ta zi ɖeka le ƒe me.”
34 This will serve as a lasting statute for you, to make atonement for the Israelites concerning all their sins once each year.”
Eye wòwɔ abe ale si tututu Yehowa de se na Mose ene.
So he did just as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
“‘Ne nyi wòbe yeatsɔ asa ŋutifafavɔe la, esi sɔ blibo ye wòatsɔ ava Yehowa ŋkume, eɖanye atsu alo nɔe o.
“‘If his offering is a communion sacrifice and if he is presenting it from the herd, whether a male or a female, he should present a sound animal before Jehovah.
2 Eye wòatsɔ eƒe asi aɖo eƒe nunana la ƒe tame, eye woawui le takpegbadɔa ƒe mɔnu; eye Aron viŋutsu siwo nye nunɔlawo nahlẽ ʋu la ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ƒe axawo katã ŋu.

2 He is to lay his hand on the head of his offering, and it will be slaughtered at the entrance of the tent of meeting; and Aaron’s sons, the priests, will sprinkle the blood on all sides of the altar.
3 Eye wòatsɔ ŋutifafavɔsalã la ƒe ɖe asa dzovɔ na Yehowa: ami si tsyɔ dɔkaviawo dzi, siwo katã le dɔkaviawo ŋu, 4 ayiku eveawo kple wo ŋu mi, siwo le alia gbɔ.

3 He will present part of the communion sacrifice as an offering made by fire to Jehovah: the fat that covers the intestines, all the fat that surrounds the intestines, 4 and the two kidneys with the fat on them that is near the loins.
Eye wòaɖe ami si le aklãa ŋu la kpe ɖe ayikuawo ŋu.
He will also remove the appendage of the liver along with the kidneys.
5 Eye Aron viŋutsuwo natsɔe ada ɖe numevɔsa si le nakea dzi le dzoa me atsɔ ado dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpuia dzi; dzovɔsa si nye ʋeʋẽ lilili na Yehowa ye wònye.
5 Aaron’s sons will make it smoke on the altar on top of the burnt offering that is placed on the wood that is over the fire; it is an offering made by fire as a pleasing aroma to Jehovah.
6 “‘Eye ne alẽ alo gbɔ̃ wòbe yeatsɔ asa ŋutifafavɔ na Yehowa la, ekema wòatsɔ lã si sɔ blibo asa vɔ lae, eɖanye atsu alo nɔe o.
6 “‘If his offering is from the flock for a communion sacrifice to Jehovah, he will present a sound male or a female animal.
7 Ne alẽtsui wòbe yeatsɔ asa vɔ lae la, ekema wòatsɔe ava Yehowa ŋkume.
7 If he is presenting a young ram as his offering, then he will present it before Jehovah.
8 Eye wòatsɔ eƒe asi aɖo eƒe vɔsalã la ƒe tame, eye woawui le takpegbadɔa ƒe mɔnu; eye Aron viŋutsuwo nahlẽ ʋu la ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ƒe axawo katã ŋu.
8 He will lay his hand on the head of his offering, and it will be slaughtered in front of the tent of meeting. Aaron’s sons will sprinkle its blood on all sides of the altar.
9 Neɖe ami si le ŋutifafavɔsalã la ŋu atsɔ asa dzovɔe na Yehowa.
9 He will present the fat from the communion sacrifice as an offering made by fire to Jehovah.
Neɖe asike dami la katã le eƒe dzimeƒua gbɔ lɔƒo kple ami si tsyɔ dɔkaviawo dzi, ami siwo katã le dɔkaviawo ŋu, 10 ayiku eveawo kple ami siwo le wo ŋu le alia gbɔ lɔƒo.

He will remove the entire fat tail near the backbone, the fat that covers the intestines, all the fat that surrounds the intestines, 10 and the two kidneys with the fat on them that is near the loins.
Eye wòaɖe ami si le aklãa ŋu la kpe ɖe ayikuawo ŋu.
He will also remove the appendage of the liver along with the kidneys.
11 Eye nunɔla la natsɔe ado dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpui la dzi abe dzovɔsanuɖuɖu ene na Yehowa.
11 And the priest will make it smoke on the altar as food, an offering made by fire to Jehovah.
12 “‘Ne gbɔ̃ wòbe yeatsɔ asa vɔ la, ekema wòatsɔe ava Yehowa ŋkume.
12 “‘If his offering is a goat, then he will present it before Jehovah.
13 Eye wòatsɔ eƒe asi aɖo eƒe tame, eye woawui le takpegbadɔa ƒe mɔnu, eye Aron viŋutsuwo nahlẽ eƒe ʋu ɖe vɔsamlekpuia ƒe axawo katã ŋu.
13 He will lay his hand on its head, and it will be slaughtered before the tent of meeting, and Aaron’s sons must sprinkle its blood on all sides of the altar.
14 Vɔsalã la ƒe akpa si wòatsɔ asa dzovɔ na Yehowa lae nye, ami si tsyɔ dɔkaviawo dzi, ami siwo katã le dɔkaviawo ŋu, 15 ayiku eveawo kple ami siwo le wo ŋu le alia gbɔ lɔƒo.

14 The part he will present as his offering made by fire to Jehovah is the fat that covers the intestines, all the fat that surrounds the intestines, 15 and the two kidneys with the fat on them that is near the loins.
Eye wòaɖe ami si le aklãa ŋu la kpe ɖe ayikuawo ŋu.
He will also remove the appendage of the liver along with the kidneys.
16 Eye nunɔla la natsɔe ado dzudzɔ ɖe vɔsamlekpui la dzi abe dzovɔsanuɖuɖu ene, wòanye ʋeʋẽ lilili.
16 The priest will make them smoke on the altar as food, an offering made by fire for a pleasing aroma.
Ami la katã nye Yehowa tɔ.
All the fat belongs to Jehovah.
17 “‘Migaɖu lã ƒe ami alo ʋu aɖeke o. Ðoɖo mavɔ wònye na mia kple miaƒe dzidzimeviwo le mia nɔƒewo katã.’”
17 “‘It is a lasting statute for your generations, in all your dwelling places: You must not eat any fat or any blood at all.’”
